fields.name: Weinschlössl Riede Stein Grüner Veltliner
fields.colour: Bright straw yellow with green tinges.
fields.aroma: Quite pungent flavours of apple, pear and lime. Also floral and a little mineral.
fields.taste: Crisp and fresh, lots of citrus flavours with real good acidity. Good persistent mineral finish.
fields.overall: Really enjoyable easy-drinking wine. Clean, refreshing​ and well-balanced I would recommend giving it a try.

fields.name: Finca Lallana Verdejo
fields.colour: Bright, light straw yellow with silvery highlights.
fields.aroma: Sweet aromas dominated by passionfruit but also ripe peach, pear, pineapple, apricot and lemon.
fields.taste: Fresh, subtle and well-rounded. Good acidity, ripe lemon, passionfruit and melon flavours with a decent finish.
fields.overall: Reminded me of a New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Too fruit forward for my liking but if this is a style you like then it is definitely worth a try. Not spectacular but crisp, refreshing and good value.

fields.name: Duo des Plages Cinsault - Grenache
fields.colour: Pale salmon pink with onion skin tinges.
fields.aroma: Lots going on, fairly intense ripe gooseberries, grapefruit, pineapple and melon with a mineral touch.
fields.taste: Refreshing acidity and lots of fruit flavours. Well-structured, smooth texture with a nice medium length finish.
fields.overall: Really nice for a warm summers evening. Enjoyed this on it’s own. Clean, refreshing and lots of flavour and aromas. Very good value and definitely worth a try.

fields.name: Treviso Prosecco Brut
fields.winery: Az. Vin La Riva Dei Frati
fields.colour: Bright, pale yellow with green tinges.
fields.aroma: Clean and fresh. Citrus aromas of lemon, grapefruit and quince with green apple, saline and pear.
fields.taste: Dry, light and refreshing, med+ acidity with fine uplifting bubbles and a mineral edge. Citrus and apple aromas are repeated on the palate followed by a medium slightly bitter nutty finish.
fields.overall: Not outstanding but will not disaappoint. Very easy-drinking, nice flavours, good value and I would buy this again.

fields.name: Sileni Estates Cellar Selection Syrah
fields.colour: Black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Savoury, smoke, bacon fat, cranberry and liquorice all underpinned by sweet vanilla.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, moderate tannin, good acidity. Plum and black fruit flavours with a medium length finish.
fields.overall: More of a European styled Syrah rather than New Zealand. A well made wine, nothing overwhelming or overstated. Lovely aroma and a steal at £9. Should not disappoint those who enjoy this style of wine.

fields.name: Corte Marcelo Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Bright garnet.
fields.aroma: Red fruits but dominated by more intense earthy, gamey and savoury aromas of gun smoke, tobacco and mushrooms.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, a little tannin with good acidity. Flavours of cherry and vanilla and nice touch of spice on a medium length finish.
fields.overall: Really nice Pinot, both savoury and fruity. Well-structured, easy-drinking, good on its own or with food. I thoroughly enjoyed and would highly recommend especially at the price.

fields.name: Maydie Tannat Vintage
fields.colour: Really dark, almost opaque inky black.
fields.aroma: Initially a strong hit of alcohol followed by a musky damp decaying forest floor aroma. Also savoury dried figs, ripe black fruits, fruit cake and lots of spice.
fields.taste: So rich, luscious and warming. Full-bodied, well rounded as the low tannin, sweetness and acidity almost nullify the high alcohol. Sticky sweet caramel and raisin flavour with a hot lingering after-taste.
fields.overall: My God, my first dessert wine and what a hit. Succulent and delicious, so much more pleasurable to taste than on the nose. Smooth and mouthfilling with a lovely touch of sweetness. Had as an aperitif but it would really pair well with choclate.

fields.name: Château de Pitray Castillon - Côtes de Bordeaux
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a ruby edge.
fields.aroma: Red fruits like plums, raspberries and cherries followed by faint menthol and spicy notes. Developed more savoury and earthy aromas after opening.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, good tannin and acidity, well-balanced. Spicy with subtle red fruit flavours flavours and a good length cherry finish.
fields.overall: Very nice Bordeaux, paired well with roast beef. No overwhelming aromas and tastes but well structured and good value. Needs to be opened​ an hour before drinking.

fields.name: Gallo Family Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Light straw yellow with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Tropical fruit aromas of passion fruit and kiwi followed by lesser notes of melon and grapefruit.
fields.taste: Light-bodied, fresh, crisp and acidic. This wine is lean, pungent and straightforward on the palate with lots of lemony flavours and a medium finish.
fields.overall: This is not bad at all. Crisp, refreshing with lots of flavour. A very good everyday wine and will suit anyone who likes zesty, tangy, light easy-drinking wines.

fields.name: Hardys Voyage Chardonnay - Pinot Grigio
fields.colour: Bright, pale golden yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Upfront, aromas of pineapple and mango. This is followed by more subdued citrus, melon and vanilla.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, rich but not heavy with a nice smooth texture. What flavour there is reflects the tropical, citrus aromas with a medium-short finish.
fields.overall: Just OK in my opinion. Fresh, easy drinking and smooth but lacks flavour and acidity. Good for the price but not memorable and don't expect too much.

fields.name: The Borders Shiraz
fields.colour: Very dark dense and inky turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of spice, sweet aromas of raspberries and cherries with a hint of smoke and vanilla.
fields.taste: Tannic, good acidity, full-bodied, hot and spicy with jammy flavours of blackcurrants, raspberries and plums. Velvety and quite well balanced but the finish is only of medium length.
fields.overall: This is a good everyday wine, easy-drinking, smooth and fruity. Good value for money and worth a try if rich dense reds is a style you like.

fields.name: Aura Cabernet Sauvignon Puglia
fields.colour: Bright, cherry red with little intensity.
fields.aroma: Savoury, smoke, raspberries, dried fruit aromas of prunes and figs.
fields.taste: The only noticeable features are the spicy sensation on the tongue and a subtle raspberry and plum flavour. Lacking in body, depth and complexity.
fields.overall: This is a cheap and poor quality Cabernet. This was a disappointing gift and I do not recommend it. Spend a few extra pounds and get something decent.

fields.name: Cirò Rosso Classico Gaglioppo
fields.colour: Deep garnet red fading to ruby at the rim.
fields.aroma: Floral and tobacco upfront followed by smoke, mushrooms and crunchy unripe red fruits.
fields.taste: Fleshy, medium-bodied, moderately tannic with fresh acidity. Flavours are tart; bitter cherries and redcurrants with a medium spicy somewhat drying finish.
fields.overall: Typical Italian sourness which may suit food rather than having it on its own. Nose and flavour are a little one dimensional but all in all not bad. Nice aromas, quite well-balanced and good value so worth a try.

fields.name: Kakhetian Dry White Mtsvane
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Tropical fruits like mango and pineapple plus lemon, sweet melon, pear and something metallic.
fields.taste: Medium-low acidity, weighty, with flavours of grapefruit, pear and apple with a bitter after-taste.
fields.overall: Not bad but the fruit just seems a little overripe. To me it lacks acidity and sharpness. Not very fruit forward but that is not necessarily a bad thing and I quite like the bitter finish. A love it or hate it type wine but maybe worth a try.

fields.name: D`or Feteasca Regalà Vin Sec alb
fields.colour: Spritzy and bright, very pale straw yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Floral and fresh with aromas of pineapple, pears and lime.
fields.taste: Silky smooth and slightly tingly on the tongue. Tangy, zesty and grassy with subtle flavours of lime and apricots.
fields.overall: A real surprise, makes a great change from the so called international grapes. Fresh, vibrant and aromatic but nothing about this wine is overwhelming and it has a wonderful mouth filling texture. Well worth trying especially at the price.

fields.name: Pepp Röschitz Blauer Zweigelt
fields.colour: Bright, light ruby red.
fields.aroma: Spicy and fruit forward, fresh raspberries, strawberries and cherries. Also, sweet liquorice and a vegetal savoury tone.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, tannic, good acidity, well balanced. The raspberry aromas are reflected on the palate with a nice grippy texture but a short finish.
fields.overall: A bargain and the Beaujolais comparison is spot on. Fresh, fruity, lively, spicy, so easy drinking. A great find and for those who enjoy light vibrant reds this is worth seeking out.

fields.name: Kamocsay Ákos
fields.colour: Fresh, bright pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Sweet pungent aromas of lychee, grapefruit, tangerines and rose water.
fields.taste: The strong aromas are reflected on the palate, almost like perfume or taking a bite of a Turkish Delight. Medium-bodied and the alcohol is noticeable.
fields.overall: Not for me but only because I am not a fan of fragrant, opulent wines. Packed with sweet aromas and flavours this is fresh and vibrant and very good value for money.

fields.name: Öküzgözü Vinkara Winehouse
fields.colour: Dark ruby red leading to purple rim.
fields.aroma: Initial hit of spiciness (nutmeg), jammy red fruits like raspberries and plums. Sweet wood if that exists, something savoury and a touch of smoke.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, medium tannin with loads of juicy acidity. Jammy red fruit aromas are repeated on the palate and the finish is of decent length.
fields.overall: Wonderful discovery, reminded me of a Chilean Carmenere/Merlot. Light, packed with succelent fruit and sooo easy drinking. A country and grape that is not on everybodies wine map but a great experiment, less than 10 and I would recommend giving it a try.

fields.name: Real Lavrador Alentejano Tinto
fields.colour: Dark and inky with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: The nose is dominated by red and black fruits but there is just a hint of smoke and spice.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied, good acidity but little tannin. Mild black fruit and liquorice flavours with a nice bitter but disappointingly short finish.
fields.overall: Lacks body and flavour, almost seems diluted. For the price this is a decent everyday wine but disappointing. I would not buy this again and I can't recommend.

fields.name: Egri Bulls Blood
fields.colour: Medium intense garnet.
fields.aroma: Medium intense garnet. Red fruits, raspberries, plums and cherries with lots of pepper. Medium-light in body with very little tannin. Very subdued raspberry and cherry flavour followed by a very short finish. Very disappointed by this wine. I loved the 2010 but this is just weak, lacking in depth and complexity. Expected so much more and find it hard to find any redeeming qualities. Even though it costs less than 10 I cannot recommend.
fields.taste: Medium-light in body with very little tannin. Very subdued raspberry and cherry flavour followed by a very short finish.
fields.overall: Very disappointed by this wine. I loved the 2010 but this is just weak, lacking in depth and complexity. Expected so much more and find it hard to find any redeeming qualities. Even though it costs less than 10 I cannot recommend.

fields.name: Cuvée de la Tour Sarrazine
fields.colour: Dark, medium intensity garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Pungent and strong aromas of smoke, spice, tar and liquorice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, subtle tannin with a long smoke flavoured finish.
fields.overall: Really good and still fresh and lively. Lovely aromas but the fruit flavours have been replaced with something more savoury and smoky which leaves me feeling I am missing something. I would like more fruit flavours and this is probably best served with food.

fields.name: Les Vergelesses Savigny-les-Beaune 1er Cru
fields.colour: Pale berry red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Earthy, undergrowth, farmyard, mushroom, game and sweet tobacco upfront but also red fruit aromas of cranberry, raspberries, cherry and strawberries.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, delicate, soft silky tannin, good acidity. Savoury, smoky flavours with good mid-palate length and after-taste.
fields.overall: A cracking Pinot, both savoury and fruity, well balanced and made a great partner for Christmas dinner. Well worth the money and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Georges Duboeuf Beaujolais-Villages Cuvee 3 Fleurs
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of red berry fruit, cherries, bubblegum and a nice hint of pepper.
fields.taste: Light in body, quite tannic with good acidity. Flavours of raspberries, strawberries and bubblegum but a short finish.
fields.overall: I was expecting more from this B-V and I was left a little disappointed. Easy drinking with nice grippy tannin that I really like but lacked that fresh punchy fruitiness of other Beaujolais's I have had. A midweek wine, don't think I would buy it again.

fields.name: Kirriemuir Chardonnay Reserve
fields.colour: Bright, pale like hay with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Fruity nose, lemon, melon, pear, apple, tropical fruit like pineapple and hazelnuts.
fields.taste: Very dry, medium-bodied, crisp with good acidity. A nice creamy texture but that's as good as it gets. Flavours are weak and bland with virtually no after-taste.
fields.overall: The nose promises a lot but the taste just doesn't deliver. Seems diluted and thin, expected better for the price. Much better out there and I cannot recommend.

fields.name: The Vineyard Collection Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Bright and lively, pale golden yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, fresh, sharp lemon and lime, ripe yellow apple and pear.
fields.taste: Hay-like, floral and citrus flavours with an impressive waxy, creamy texture. Medium-light bodied, zippy acidity with a good persistent drying finish.
fields.overall: Best SA Chenin Blanc I have had. Crisp, clean, refreshing, wonderful flavour and length. Good value for money and very nice on its own.

fields.name: Laurent Espinasse Galets Roules
fields.colour: Intense, glossy dark black cherry with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Concentrated, both red and black fruit aromas of raspberries, strawberries, blackberries and plums. There is also a good presence of something herbal like lavender or black tea.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, soft subtle tannin and good acidity. Cherry and raspberry flavours with a medium length finish.
fields.overall: Good but not memorable, I had it on its own and perhaps it may be better with food. Something just not quite likeable about this wine and at £13 there is better out there at this price range.

fields.name: Finca Los Principes La Cañada Rioja
fields.colour: Very dark garnet turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe black fruit aromas with notes of cherries, lavender and just a hint of smoke and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, very smooth tannin with subtle sour cherry, raspberry and dark fruit flavours. The finish is good but disappointingly​ short.
fields.overall: A nice Rioja but lacks body, depth ​and complexity. A nice wine if young fresh Rioja is a style you like but personally I prefer something with a bit more oomph. Needs decanting to open up.

fields.name: Famille Perrin Luberon
fields.colour: Bright pale yellow with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Floral, herbal tea, ripe stone fruits, asparagus with a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied but light, clean and refreshing. Smooth rounded texture with real good acidity. Flavours are citrusy but mild and lacks a punch.
fields.overall: Thoroughly enjoyed this wine, refreshing, crisp and smooth. Real good value and perfect for a warm summer evening. The smooth creamy texture is worth it alone and while not perfect this is definitely worth a try.

fields.name: Coonawarra Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Dark and inky with an attractive mahogany red rim.
fields.aroma: Lots going on. Mint, black pepper, red and black fruit, raspberries, black cherry, redcurrant, sugar plum, dark berries, mocha, vanilla and tobacco.
fields.taste: Rich and round yet elegant. Full-bodied with sweet silky smooth tannin. Mouth-filling red fruit flavours and a good finish that has a touch of oak.
fields.overall: Great Cab Sauv, complex, fruity but oak is evident, well-balanced. Texture and mid-palate are excellent. Well worth the money. Benefited from decanting for 2 hours. Have another to try but going to let it lie for a 3-4 years.

fields.name: The Black Pig Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Light straw yellow with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Gooseberry, green apple, tropical fruit aromas of passion fruit and kiwi followed by lesser notes of melon and grapefruit.
fields.taste: Light-bodied, fresh, crisp and acidic. This wine is lean, pungent and straightforward on the palate with lots of tree fruit and citrus flavours and a medium finish.
fields.overall: This is not bad at all. Crisp, refreshing with lots of flavour. A very good everyday wine and will suit anyone who likes zesty, tangy, light easy-drinking wines.

fields.name: Tierra del Corazon Reserva Malbec
fields.colour: Dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Plums, bramble fruits, choclatey vanilla and a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Fresh, medium-bodied, soft medium tannin, brisk acidity. Flavours are subtle but some sweet red fruit and blueberries followed by a lovely bitter-sweet finish.
fields.overall: Nothing overstated or profound about this wine. The body is a little thin, aroma and flavour are nice but lacking any depth you may get from other richer Malbecs. However, a perfectly good midweek wine, good with a burger but don't expect too much.

fields.name: Casillero del Diablo Reserva Carmenère
fields.colour: Rich cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of luscious red and black fruit aromas; blackberries, plums, raspberries and cherries. This is followed by chocolate and smoke with a good hit of spice.
fields.taste: Nose tingling spice, cherry, cranberry and chocolate flavours with a lovely smoky after-taste. Medium-bodied, subtle tannin with good acidity.
fields.overall: A really nice wine, not too heavy, lots of fruit aromas and flavours. Smooth, ripe and well structured. Good value and worth seeking out.

fields.name: Château le Piat Côtes de Bourg
fields.colour: Dense, dull, inky red with a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: Strong damp forest floor, smoke, cedar
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, mouth drying tannin and bitter.
fields.overall: This wine is well past its best. Colour, flavours and taste all suggest that this wine is oxidised and at 42 years old no surprise I suppose. Disappointing but wasn’t expecting much.

fields.name: Château Fombrauge Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
fields.colour: Dark reddish brown fading to a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: A wonderful muskiness, pine tar, cedar, strong coffee, leather, fig, fruit cake, mown grass/earth, dried red fruits with a hint of smoke and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, dry, moderate dry firm tannin with good acidity. Coffee, liquorice and wood dominate the flavour that leave a drying sensation on the palate. Finish is pleasant if a little short.
fields.overall: This wine has stood up to age very well. Elegance and finesse would probably do it justice. Has all the characteristics of an aged wine that I love i.e. musk, wood, earth etc... but it has retained a freshness, still juicy and a wine to sip and savour. Bought this as an anniversary wine but I will definitely go back to this chateau to try other vintages. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Le Verdier Cairanne Côtes du Rhône Villages
fields.colour: Medium intensity, dark cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Immediate hit of spice, this is followed by red berries, cherries and liquorice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, little tannin, spicy with lots of alcohol. Just enough acidity with delicate red fruit flavours but the finish is short.
fields.overall: This is quite disappointing, not as lush, fruity or complex as expected (don't believe the label). The alcohol is overwhelming and this is not a wine I would buy again.

fields.name: Chateau Vrai Canon Bouche
fields.colour: Dark mahogany brown with a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: Aged and musty yet something sweet. Still a little red fruit but mainly cedar, smoke, toast, liquorice, menthol and pepper.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, abundant firm tannin but good acidity adding balance. Concentrated tertiary flavours across the palate and the finish is long.
fields.overall: Lovely mature Bordeaux. Soft and elegant rather than big and bold. Has aged well, a great wine to sip and savour. Well worth a try if you can find it.

fields.name: Château Fontcaille Belleuve Bordeaux Cuvée Opulence
fields.colour: Intense garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Earthy, savoury aromas of cedar, leather and violets dominate. Faint fruit aromas of blackberries and cherries with lots of pepper.
fields.taste: Rich, dry, medium-full bodied and still lots of tannin and acidity. Balanced and well structured with flavours of cherries, dark berries and coffee with a good persistent finish.
fields.overall: Excellent Bordeaux, powerful, silky smooth and concentrated. This is a great example of one of my favourite​ wines. Highly recommend​.

fields.name: Angel's Selection Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark and inky with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Initially, a strong damp wood aroma followed by leather, tobacco, smoke and a hint of spice. Not a lot of fruit but get notes of baked raspberries and plums.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, smooth texture with subtle tannin. Flavours of plum or bramble jam and really toasted. Well balanced with a long finish.
fields.overall: Not sure if I love this or hate it. Initially, it seems over oaked but I don't mind that but I could see this being a negative point for others.

fields.name: Arabella Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Fresh and floral with fruit aromas of pineapple, melon, apple and pear that's not overpowering.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-light bodied, dominated by sharp apple and citrus flavours but the finish is disappointing.
fields.overall: A real 'Goldilocks' wine; not too full nor light, not too fruity nor bland, not too dry nor sweet, not excellent nor poor but just right in a lot of aspects. Great value, easy drinking and really worth a try as a midweek wine.

fields.name: Boy Meets Girl Central Victoira Pinot Grigio
fields.colour: Blush, pale salmon pink.
fields.aroma: Leafy, honey, ripe yellow apple and tropical fruits.
fields.taste: Light in body, moderate acidity with a nice texture. Apple flavours dominate but also some passion fruit and orange blossom. This is followed by a savoury mineral after-taste.
fields.overall: Light, refreshing with a nice zestiness but lacks body. Lots of floral, fruity aromas and flavours but the best part is the distinctive unusual but nice persistent finish. A nice everyday wine, great value and worth a try.

fields.name: Dominic Hentall Puglia Negroamaro Sangiovese
fields.colour: Very dark garnet leading to a carmine rim.
fields.aroma: Raspberries and cherries backed up by a nice savoury undertone, tobacco, vanilla, thyme and a touch of pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, nice supple tannin and medium acidity. Sour cherries and raspberries on the palate and a good persistent finish.
fields.overall: This cannot be called a fruity wine but a nice blend of fruit and savoury aromas and flavours. A bit thin but well balanced and good on its own. Good value, subtle, easy drinking, a really nice wine.

fields.name: Di Blasi Delle Venezie
fields.colour: Pale golden yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Floral, rich, sharp honeyed fruit aromas of lemon, passion fruit and guava.
fields.taste: Light in body, dry, crisp and fresh. Really good balance of citrus and acidity and a very pleasant mineral touch. Nice texture and a very good citrusy finish.
fields.overall: Very good wine for those who like light crisp whites. Nicely balanced, tangy and fresh with a nice finish but perhaps lacking in fruit flavours. Good value and exceeded expectations. Serve well chilled.

fields.name: The Wine Society Southern Spanish Red Jumilla Monastrell
fields.colour: Deep, dark intense garnet leading to a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Initially, lots of black pepper followed by dark fruit aromas of blackberries, blueberries and plums with a touch of tobacco and smoke.
fields.taste: Rich, full-bodied and packed with ripe, jammy black fruit flavours. Moderate tannin, dry with a good finish.
fields.overall: Super fruity, almost chewy but the lack of oak ageing makes this wine a bit rich and jammy for my taste. However, very easy drinking, enjoyable and great value at under £6.

fields.name: Château Vartely De Calitate Matur Rosu Sec Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Medium intensity, dark cherry red.
fields.aroma: Upfront, savoury aromas, dried herbs and peppers. This is followed by blackcurrants, cranberries, plums and a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, subtle tannin with delicate flavours of blackcurrants and cherries. A medium length tart finish.
fields.overall: Not perfect but for the price this is really nice. Lovely savoury aromas and although lacking in body and flavour it has a nice ​finish. Don't think I would buy it again but a good everyday wine, worth a try.

fields.name: Duo De Vignes Malbec - Cabernet Franc
fields.colour: Intense, dark inky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Red fruit aromas of strawberries, raspberries, cherries and plums. Also a good touch of pepper with an earthy/vegetal aroma I can't identify, perhaps asparagus.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, soft tannins, good acidity and lots of jammy fruit flavours.
fields.overall: My first Malbec - Cabernet Franc blend and this was really nice. Very easy drinking, lush and nicely balanced. I personally would prefer a little oak ageing but great value for money and worth a try.

fields.name: Lascar Carmenère
fields.colour: Dark crimson red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Raspberry, plum and fig fruit aromas, cedar with a slight smoky and tobacco undertone.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, lightly tannic, ripe and juicy black fruit flavours that is not too heavy. Nice silky smooth texture but the finish is short.
fields.overall: Needs to breath for a while but definitely worth doing. Not the best example of one of my favourite wines but it is easy drinking, juicy and flavoursome. For the price this is a must try and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Douglas Green Shiraz - Viognier
fields.colour: Medium dark garnet leading to a lighter purple rim.
fields.aroma: Fruit aromas of bramble, blackberries and cranberries with quite a bit of smoke, sweet tobacco and a touch of pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied with a smooth texture probably from the Viognier. Tobacco aroma is reflected on the palate but I detect a little bitter, tart after-taste.
fields.overall: A bit thin and the tobacco aroma and flavors are overdone. Nonetheless, still quite drinkable, a decent midweek wine, very good value but not memorable.

fields.name: Les Pierres Bordes Marsanne Viognier
fields.colour: Light golden yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Citrusy, mainly grapefruit but this is matched by honeyed tropical fruits. Also leaves a spicy tingling on the nose.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, mouthfilling creamy texture yet dry, acidic, fresh and vibrant. Lots of peach and apricot flavours with a good persistent finish.
fields.overall: A really enjoyable surprise, not what I expected. Although full-bodied this has a nice fresh, crispness is well balanced and full of flavour. For the price this is a must try.

fields.name: Château Labastide Gaillac
fields.colour: Clean light golden yellow with a shade of green.
fields.aroma: Ripe fruit aromas of apple, melon and a hint of lime backed up by a floral mineral note.
fields.taste: Light, fresh and elegant. Nice smooth texture but little acidity. The aromas are reflected on the palate and the floral notes enhance the pleasant finish.
fields.overall: I was a little disappointed with this wine as it lacked the uplifting spirtz as claimed on the label. A decent midweek wine, good value but forgettable and I don't think I would buy again.

fields.name: Araldica Cortese Piemonte
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow with flecks of silver.
fields.aroma: Citrus aromas of lemon and grapefruit paired with ripe tropical fruit and pear.
fields.taste: Crisp and light with good acidity. Flavours are all citrus fruits and the finish although short, has a nice bitter twist.
fields.overall: Just OK for me. A nice light refreshing wine but just seems to be lacking in flavour and body. Good value for money but not memorable and not a wine to impress.

fields.name: Sèvre Maine Loire Valley Muscadet
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Very citrusy, semi-sweet apple and pear with a touch of minerality.
fields.taste: Light in body, clean and zesty. The acidity dominates above all else, with citrus and tart apple flavours.
fields.overall: My favourite style of white wine, not overwhelmingly fruity, very dry, loads of mouth-watering acidity, such easy-drinking. Thoroughly enjoyable and great for a warm evening. Not the best I have had but good value and it will not disappoint if like me, you enjoy light crisp whites.

fields.name: Dona Paulina Chardonnay
fields.colour: Bright, light golden yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Sweet and aromatic, apple, touch of citrus and exotic fruit like pineapple and guava.
fields.taste: Noticeably dry, rich and creamy with a smooth texture. Full-bodied but still fresh with good acidity. Flavours reflect the aromas followed​ by a good finish.
fields.overall: Unoaked but still so buttery. Lots of fruit aromas and flavours, a well structured wine. Not my favourite style of wine but this was really enjoyable, great value and I recommend.

fields.name: Lascar Classic Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Light straw yellow with tinges of silver.
fields.aroma: Gooseberry upfront with citrus aromas of grapefruit and lemon and in addition pear, melon and pineapple.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied and dry. Lots of citrus and ripe tropical fruit flavours, a persistent finish but lacks acidity.
fields.overall: Not the best Sauvignon Blanc I have had. Although flavoursome and fruity it lacks the usual crisp freshness and zing that may be expected. Good for the price but I was left disappointed.

fields.name: Beyerskloof Reserve Pinotage
fields.colour: Deep carmine red turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Lots going on, initially, cedar, savoury herbs, sweet tobacco and smoke followed by dark berries, figs, prunes and a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, smooth and silky with nice ripe tannins and lots of acidity. Savoury, cherry and blackberry flavours with a super long barbecue smoke finish.
fields.overall: Lighter than I expected but a good combination of fruit and oak. Complex, well balanced and a great finish. Worth the money and I would recommend.

fields.name: Secret Cellar Pinot Grigio
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Delicate light aromas of ripe tropical fruit, crisp green apple and banana.
fields.taste: Dry, fresh and crisp. Good acidity with flavours of peach and melon. Nice and smooth but the finish is short.
fields.overall: Not very fruit forward in aroma or flavours but this is a very nice everyday wine. Not memorable but enjoyable and good value. Easy drinking with a nice zestiness but don’t expect too much.

fields.name: Devil's Rock Riesling
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Sweet, ripe, robust aromas of pineapple and baked apples. Citrus aroma of grapefruit and a floral note.
fields.taste: Clean and crisp with good length and just enough acidity. Off-dry with flavours of ripe pear, apricot, apple, grapefruit and lemon.
fields.overall: A lot fruitier than I was expecting. As aromatic as a New Zealand Sauv Blanc but lacking the zestiness. This wine will suit anyone who likes lots of sweet ripe fruity aromas and flavors.

fields.name: Te Tera Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Dark ruby with a crimson edge.
fields.aroma: Toasty, smoke, tobacco, clove, vanilla, cola, dried herbs, a mushroom/truffle earthiness with fruit aromas of raspberry, cranberry and a good hit of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, rich, ripe and full-flavoured, soft refined tannin giving a nice mildly gripping texture. Savoury flavours dominate, gun smoke, tobacco leaf, baking spice on a long persistent finish.
fields.overall: Nothing subtle about this wine, pronounced nose, full flavoured and none the worse for it. Like Burgundy on steroids, not with the same elegance or finesse but immensely enjoyable, worth the money, a good buy.

fields.name: Domaine Gonon, Mâcon La Roche Vineuse
fields.colour: Bright, pale gold.
fields.aroma: Full and rich, butter, mushroom, apricot and marmalade give way to lemon, peach and bruised apple.
fields.taste: Rich and fleshy, fresh tongue tingling acidity with a slightly drying texture. Aromas repeated on the palate but more subdued with a somewhat bitter/nutty persistent finish.
fields.overall: Aroma hit me as soon as I opened the bottle. Going by other reviews I would leave this wine to age. Has mellowed a bit after 3 years. Pleasant, standard Chardonnay, good QPR, worth a try.

fields.name: La Reine Blanche Sancerre
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Quite aromatic, lime cordial, gooseberry, nettles, green fruits and asparagus.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied with steely acidity. The nose is reflected on the palate with a creamy smooth texture and although the finish is long it is sharp and bitter.
fields.overall: I liked everything about this wine except the finish. More green and steely rather than fruit forward. Fleshy with a lovely texture. All in all, good quality, fairly priced but the finish is a killer.

fields.name: Château Pey La Tour Réserve, Bordeaux Supérieur
fields.winery: Château Pey La Tour, Vignobles Dourthe
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a dark cherry rim.
fields.aroma: Raspberry, blackcurrants, plum, dried herbs, violets, chocolate, leather and vanilla with a touch of spice and a savoury meatiness.
fields.taste: Med-full bodied, structured, robust chewy tannic backbone, grainy texture. Full flavoured, chocolate, tobacco and raspberry on the palate with a nice bitter-sweet liquorice aftertaste.
fields.overall: A nice typical cassis driven Bordeaux. Good balance of oak and fruit, ripe and flavoursome. Drinking well at 5 years, good QPR and worth a try.

fields.name: Côtes-du-Rhône Rouge
fields.colour: Intense and bright, deep ruby with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Complex, lots going on, smoky and herbal (lavender and fennel), earthy notes of cured meat, bacon fat, band-aid and leather all backed up by raspberry, blackberrry and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Dry, med body, rich, abundant acidity, lovely texture from the silky smooth tannin. Smoky crunchy red and black berries on the palate but the finish although hot and spicy is all too brief.
fields.overall: Excellent stuff, a wine with finesse. I did expect more flavour on the palate and a longer finish but the nose and texture more than made up for that. A good balance between fruit and oak, great value, recommend.

fields.name: Muga Reserva, Rioja
fields.colour: Medium garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Upfront tertiary aromas of tar, woodsmoke, dried flowers, black pepper and vanilla with lesser fruity notes of sour cherry, plum, dried figs and blackberries.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, fine-grained tannin, round and smooth. A blend of sweet fruit and oak on the palate ending with a good sustained finish. Immaculate balance.
fields.overall: Excellent stuff, a wine with finesse. I did expect more flavour on the palate and a longer finish but the nose and texture more than made up for that. A good balance between fruit and oak, great value, recommend.

fields.name: Anjou Premiere The Loire Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Very light pale yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Floral, sweet apple, apricot and lemon.
fields.taste: Light in body, off-dry but lots of acidity. Flavour is all apple with a crisp medium length finish.
fields.overall: I agree with other reviewers, not a lot going on, it is a lot of apple. However, it is light and easy drinking and good value albeit a little too sweet for my taste. The Loire Valley is one of my 'go to' regions but this was a little disappointing.

fields.name: Sauvignon Blanc Collection Cotes De Gascogne Colombard
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic, floral and perfumy. Citrus aromas of grapefruit and tangerines. Also notes of peach, pineapple and mango.
fields.taste: Fresh and vibrant with just enough acidity. Flavours of ripe peach and pineapple which is quite sweet almost off-dry and a long finish.
fields.overall: Very nice but lacks a little acidity. The addition of Colombard is very evident and has taken away from the tart and zesty Sauv Blanc. Nice wine for anyone who likes ripe, sweet, fruity flavours and aromas

fields.name: Chateau Labegorce
fields.colour: Aged dull orange brown.
fields.aroma: Mostly aged aromas but also something sweet and perfumy. Musty, pencil lead, incense, Sandalwood, vanilla, tobacco leaf and a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Dry with moderate firm tannin. No fruit flavours, just wood, vanilla and cola. Medium mouth-drying spicy finish.
fields.overall: Not bad for its age. A little past its best but still very drinkable. All tertiary and aged aromas and flavour, not a bad thing but will not appeal to everyone and only for those who like aged wines.

fields.name: Mount RozierMerlot
fields.colour: Dark garnet fading to ruby.
fields.aroma: Initially, black forest fruits, plum and spice but after sitting for a while this changed to more earthy, savoury notes.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, well balanced with flavours of cherry and smoke. The grippy tannic finish is nice but short. Lots of warming alcohol.
fields.overall: Not a memorableMerlotbut a good everyday wine that's good value for money. I would recommend opening this wine about an hour before drinking as the flavours and aromas seemed to improve greatly.

fields.name: Château le Beyan Haut-Médoc
fields.colour: Burnt orange with a brick red rim.
fields.aroma: Strong smoke, tobacco, aniseed, cedar and damp forest floor.
fields.taste: Subtle tannin, still good acidity, a well-balanced wine. Earthy flavours and a long persistent finish.
fields.overall: A real treat, brilliant vintage Bordeaux, one of the best wines I have ever had. Not much fruit, just all earth and oak aromas and flavours. Hard to come by but soooooo worth it and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Château Moulin de Launay Entre-Deux-Mers
fields.colour: Pale straw with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Ripe melon, citrus fruits including a hint of orange, mango, green apple and floral notes.
fields.taste: Fresh and crisp with rasping acidity. Smooth and well-rounded with flavours of melon and sour apple with a good long persistent finish.
fields.overall: What a treat, this style of wine was perfect for me. Loads of gum-licking mouthwatering acidity, fresh flavours, smooth texture and a good finish. A bargain and I would recommend for any one who likes crisp fresh whites.

fields.name: Trivento Reserve Chardonnay
fields.colour: Pale yellow green with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Banana, vanilla and sweet ripe tropical fruit.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied with a refreshing crisp acidity. Nice smooth creamy texture, flavours of vanilla and banana with a short but fruity finish.
fields.overall: This wine was more zesty than I was expecting and I was surprised by how sweet it was. Certainly different from other Chardonnays I have tried but it was really nice. Good value and will not disappoint.

fields.name: Creative Block 3
fields.colour: Very dark black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Rich black and red fruits, black olives, raspberries, cranberries, cherry, liquorice and dried fruit wonderfully blended with more earthy, meaty aromas and wood, smoke, vanilla and pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, fine tannin with moderate to high acidity. Red and black fruits are repeated on the palate with the addition of chocolate and sweet tobacco followed by a very good peppery finish.
fields.overall: Loved this, although high in alcohol it's well-balanced with fruit, oak and tannin. Rich but not at all heavy, mid-palate and finish are both delicious and lasting. I have laid this down for a while and it was well worth waiting for, highly recommend.

fields.name: Sangre de Toro
fields.colour: Intense, dark ruby red.
fields.aroma: Cherry, mocha and dark fruit but this is all overwhelmed by the spiciness.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied at best but good acidity. Some fruit flavours but they are hard to describe as again the spiciness takes over and the finish is very short.
fields.overall: Not impressed, in my opinion this wine is not well balanced and the spice overwhelms the aromas and flavours. It's OK as a simple weekday wine but I was disappointed.

fields.name: Most Wanted Albariño
fields.colour: Intense golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Really fruity, grapefruit, lemon and tropical fruits.
fields.taste: Crisp and zesty, mouthwatering. Grapefruit aromas are reflected on the palate.
fields.overall: Delightful; bright, fresh and mouthwatering, this wine is impossible to put down. I would recommend for any one who is looking for a fresh, fruity, zesty wine that would suit any occasion.

fields.name: Pure Malbec
fields.colour: Intense, dark inky red turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Bramble fruit, cranberry and plum with a touch of earthiness, chocolate and spice.
fields.taste: Rich, medium-bodied with tannin that is soft and gentle. Good acidity with flavours of plum, raspberries and cherries with a medium finish.
fields.overall: Un-oaked and not the better for it. This Malbec is very nice, vibrant, fruity and easy-drinking but the lack of oak just makes it all fruit and jammy. Good value and will suit anyone who likes fruit bombs but I just think it is missing the qualities a little oak ageing would bring.

fields.name: Baron de 'L' Ladoucette Pouilly Fume
fields.overall: Sadly the cork on this wine was damaged and the wine was tainted.

fields.name: Orvieto Classico
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Not a lot of aroma but orange is dominant with nutty and floral notes.
fields.taste: Quite smooth and silky with a refreshing orange flavour. This wine is dry, has good acidity and a nice bitter twist in an all too short after-taste.
fields.overall: I found this wine a little bland, lacking in both aroma and flavours. I enjoyed the orange flavour and the nice texture. I would recommend this wine for anyone who likes simple, fresh uncomplicated wines.

fields.name: Calvet Alsace Reserve Pinot Blanc
fields.colour: Golden yellow with highlights of silver.
fields.aroma: Floral and citrusy, like concentrated squash. Honeyed pear, peach and apple with a little mineral.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bod bodied but enough acidity to make it quite refreshing. Nutty, citrusy and ripe tree fruit flavours and a grippy texture with a medium finish.
fields.overall: Full, opulent wine yet still refreshing. This is not my favourite style of wine but if strong fruit flavours and aromas are your thing then this is worth a try.

fields.name: Villa Maria Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Bright and lively, pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: So pungent, gooseberry and passionfruit abound, guava, orange squash, herbaceous with hints of lychee and peach.
fields.taste: Clean and crisp with a steely acidity. Tart gooseberry, kiwi and passionfruit flavours on a good long finish.
fields.overall: Reminded me why I'm not a NZ Sauv Blanc fan. Too fruit forward on both the nose and palate for my liking but that's only a personal thing. Well-balanced, fresh and clean with a mineral backbone providing mouth-watering acidity. In addition, good value so if this style of wine suits you then I would definitely recommend.

fields.name: Boutinot Barolo
fields.colour: Silky pale ruby red with an orange rim.
fields.aroma: Floral, red fruit aromas of strawberries, raspberries and cranberries. Woody and earthy with just a hint of spice. Opened up after a while to more typical but odd tar petrol aromas.
fields.taste: Firm mouth drying tannin but this is not necessarily a bad thing. Medium-full bodied with flavours of vanilla and strawberry but lacking depth and the finish is disappointing.
fields.overall: Lovely colour, nice aromas and tannic. My only fault is that it tastes a little bland. My first Barolo so I have nothing to compare it against but this did improve after breathing for an hour and would definitely try it again.

fields.name: Yellow Tail Malbec
fields.colour: Very dark inky black turning violet at the rim.
fields.aroma: Initially, lots of pepper and spice followed by figs, cherries and sweet tobacco. Also an earthy note.
fields.taste: Full-bodied and rich, good acidity and nice silky tannin, a well-balanced wine. Dark fruits and cherries on the palate with a persistent finish.
fields.overall: Very surprised about how nice this wine was. A bold wine but so easy drinking, nice fruit flavours and a lovely texture. Excellent for the price and definitely worth a try.

fields.name: Les Jamelles Syrah
fields.colour: Intense, dark inky purple.
fields.aroma: Vanilla, black fruit aromas of blackcurrants and blackberries with pepper and spice.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, rich, round and jammy with ripe tannins and black fruit flavours. Nicely balanced, a velvety texture with a medium bitter finish.
fields.overall: This wine will suit anyone who likes very fruity, rich, jammy reds. This was a little over-ripe for my liking but I did like the finish. At £6 it is also good value.

fields.name: Beaujolais-villages Nouveau
fields.colour: Bright, carmine red.
fields.aroma: Sweet ripe banana and bubblegum.
fields.taste: Light in body, a little tannin with lots of acidity. Quite well balanced, smooth with flavours of bubblegum, bananas and cherries.
fields.overall: Lovely Beaujolais Nouveau, vibrant, fresh, fruity, easy drinking with flavours I have never tasted before in a wine, all banana and bubblegum. I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Mondo del Vino Barbaresco
fields.colour: Light garnet, like brick red.
fields.aroma: Earthy, savoury and smoky with a touch of lavender. Red fruit aromas of raspberries, cranberry and cherries with lots of white pepper.
fields.taste: Rich, medium-bodied, warm and astringent. Mouthwatering acidity with flavours of cherry and cranberry and a decent long finish.
fields.overall: A really nice wine, my first Nebbiolo, and I will definitely be trying more. Lovely aromas followed by lots of acidity and tannin with a good finish. Well worth the money.

fields.name: Alsace Gewürztraminer
fields.colour: Bright pale gold with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Perfumed and floral, orange blossom, tangerines and ripe luscious lychees.
fields.taste: Off-dry, rich and full-bodied. A smooth creamy texture with flavours of lychees and citrus zest but the alcohol is a bit overwhelming. Just enough acidity, balanced.
fields.overall: Not for me, too creamy, too sweet, too perfumy and lacks acidity I prefer in white wine. Not a write-off, if you are a fan of off-dry, aromatic, full-bodied, rich wines then this is for you.

fields.name: Douro White
fields.winery: Bottled by: Falua Sociedade De Vinhos S.A.
fields.colour: Light golden straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Floral, grassy and fresh.
fields.taste: Lemon and limes but not overpowering. Light-medium bodied, not very acidic with a nice fresh finish.
fields.overall: A really nice wine. Not as fruity or acidic as I was expecting but more herbal/grassy with a lovely after-taste. I would highly recommend this wine especially at the price and if you are looking for something a little different than the normal fruit forward supermarket wines this is worth trying.

fields.name: Villa Maria Private Bin Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Dark ruby.
fields.aroma: Spicy with aromas of cherries, red fruits but also a touch savoury.
fields.taste: Quite acidic, light in body with flavours of strawberries, cherries and spice with a nice soft smooth silky finish.
fields.overall: Mouthwatering and easy drinking, this is a really nice refreshing wine. A nice combination of fruit and savoury tastes. Good on its own or with food, this wine certainly does not disappoint.

fields.name: Rubicone SangioveseMerlot
fields.colour: Dark purple turning ruby at the rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of fruit, cherries, forest fruits but also an earthy undertone with a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, acidic with flavours of cherries and red berries. Not much tannin but a nice after-taste with a decent length.
fields.overall: Typical Italian red, lots of cherry flavours and aromas, acidic and very drinkable. At the price it is good value and if you are just looking for a fruity, easy-going wine this will hit the spot.

fields.name: Fruit Orchestra Chenin Blanc Viognier
fields.colour: Bright, straw yellow with tinges of silver.
fields.aroma: Sweet ripe aromas of pineapple, lemon, peach and mango.
fields.taste: Rich, round, oily and really fruity. Lacks acidity with a strong after-taste of over ripe tropical fruit.
fields.overall: Not impressed, wine seems to lack structure, a flabby dull wine that needs more zing for my taste. Needs to be well chilled. I drank it on its own so it may be better with food. I usually enjoy Chenin Blanc but this was disappointing.

fields.name: Château Brassac Bordeaux Supérieur
fields.colour: Deep Intense ruby red.
fields.aroma: Blackcurrants, blackberries and cherries with lots of pepper and oak.
fields.taste: Lacks body but lots of tannin and very acidic. Full of black fruit flavours with a sour twist at the end with a nice finish.
fields.overall: For the price a very nice Bordeaux. I thoroughly enjoyed and this wine will suit anyone looking for an easy drinking, mouthwatering fruity wine.

fields.name: Alma Mora Torrontes
fields.colour: Pale golden yellow with hints of green.
fields.aroma: Floral and spicy with fruit aromas of fig, melon, lemon and lychees.
fields.taste: Dry, fresh, zesty and spicy. Smooth and creamy with a lovely after-taste of lychees that lingers nicely.
fields.overall: My first Torrontes and what a nice surprise. A must for anyone who likes aromatic white wine. Not my favourite style of wine but this was packed with floral and fruit aromas and flavours with a nice texture and a good finish. Value for money and worth a try.

fields.name: Martini Prosecco
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Vibrant, green apple, lemon zest and honeysuckle with a hit of spice.
fields.taste: Light, fresh crisp citrus, ripe melon and pear flavours. Gentle bubbles, not too sweet, good acidity with a medium finish.
fields.overall: Lovely, simple but lively and bright with subtle aromas and flavours and oh so moreish. Had it on its own and I didn’t find it to be too sweet. At 10 it is reasonably priced and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Wolf Blass Red Label Chardonnay - Sémillon
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Dominated by citrus and stone fruits but also undertones of mineral, grass and leaf.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, citrus, apple and tropical fruits on the palate with good acidity and a very nice creamy, buttery, smooth finish.
fields.overall: A lot better than I was expecting, easy-drinking, fruity but the grassy/herbal touch made this quite enjoyable. At the price certainly worth a try.

fields.name: Foscara Extra Dry Prosecco Treviso
fields.colour: Bright, very pale straw yellow with green/silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Clean, with citrus,, ripe apple and pear.
fields.taste: Lively effervescence that dies quickly. Subtle, dry, crisp acidity with gentle flavours of green apple.
fields.overall: Simple, uncomplicated and perfect for a warm evening get together. For the price not bad but not memorable, just enjoy it for what it is. Needs to be very well chilled.

fields.name: Wolf Blass Winemaker's Selection Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Dark, inky garnet turning ruby at the rim.
fields.aroma: Leads off with spice, tobacco and smoke followed by blackcurrant and cherry.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, round and rich with lots of ripe fruit flavours and a silky smooth finish.
fields.overall: Fruity, easy-drinking and very pleasant on the nose. A very nice Cab Sauv, lacks body but at £4.75 I don't want to criticize and this is definitely worth trying.

fields.name: Château Guibot La Fourvieille Puisseguin-Saint-Émilion
fields.colour: Intense black cherry red fading to brick red at the rim.
fields.aroma: Red fruits, flowers, vanilla, cedar, smoke, leather and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Mouth drying tannin with good acidity. Same red fruit flavours but also smoky and liquorice.
fields.overall: This is wonderful, 13 years old but could last longer. Oak ageing is very evident and if I could find one fault it may be a little over-powering. Got online for a bargain price. Highly recommend and I will buy from this winery again.

fields.name: Verdicchio Dei Castelli Di Jesi Classico 2015
fields.colour: Pale golden colour with glints of silver.
fields.aroma: Nice aromas of lemon, pear, melon and figs and not overly sweet.
fields.taste: Bone dry smooth and buttery. Tastes of lemon with a pleasant bitter after-taste.
fields.overall: A really nice wine, crisp, fresh, dry and really smooth to drink. Better than a lot of other Italian whites and it was good value for money. Well worth a try.

fields.name: Piccini Chianti Riserva
fields.colour: Dark ruby red turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Dominated by the oak and spice but also has some red fruit aromas of red fruits like berries and cherries.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, nice soft velvety tannin with the cherry aroma reflected on the palate. Lots of acidity but the short finish is disappointing.
fields.overall: A little disappointed, I was expecting something fruitier and more robust. Lacks body, poor finish and I won't be buying it again but not bad for 6.

fields.name: Crozes-Hermitage Prestige Selection
fields.colour: Deep dark inky red turning brick red at the rim.
fields.aroma: :Cedar, damp forest floor, smoky and savoury.
fields.taste: Lacking flavour on the palate, some savoury tastes but no fruit and a little sour. Not much in the way of tannin or acidity.
fields.overall: This wine is past it's best and has aged. Should have been drunk years ago.

fields.name: Beaune du Château Premier Cru
fields.colour: Light ruby red.
fields.aroma: So much going on. Earthy, mushroom, forest floor, smoke and cranberry aromas with a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Light in body, lots of acidity and a little tannin, a well balanced wine. Tart cranberry and cherry flavours and quite spicy.
fields.overall: Wonderful, both savoury and fruity. Went really well with my turkey Christmas dinner. Highly recommend for any Pinot lover.

fields.name: Chenin Blanc Cuvee 845
fields.colour: Pale straw with silvery green tinges, clear, bright and light.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic, citrus fruits, pineapple and a touch of sweetness.
fields.taste: Crisp, dry and fresh with tangy apple and citrus flavours. Light with lots of acidity and a good finish.
fields.overall: Thoroughly enjoyable wine, great value and I would recommend for any one who likes light, crisp, fresh easy drinking wine.

fields.name: Freixenet Excelencia Rosada Vintage Brut Cava
fields.colour: Salmon pink
fields.aroma: Strawberries, raspberries and floral.
fields.taste: Light and crisp on the palate. Same fruity flavours as the nose but it lacks that refreshing texture as the bubbles are a little disappointing.
fields.overall: Not as crisp and refreshing as I was expecting, a bit disappointing. I cannot recommend this Cava, there is much better out there for just a few pound more.

fields.name: Wm Morrison Muscadet Sevre Et Maine Sur Lie
fields.colour: Bright, pale lemon yellow with tinges of green and silver.
fields.aroma: Citrus, crisp fresh apple and pineapple on the nose.
fields.taste: Bone dry, clean, crisp and sharp with flavours reflecting the nose. The finish is pleasant but a little short.
fields.overall: Bright, pale lemon yellow with tinges of green and silver. Citrus, crisp fresh apple and pineapple on the nose. Bone dry, clean, crisp and sharp with flavours reflecting the nose. The finish is pleasant but a little short. Overall:I thoroughly enjoyed this wine as this style is my favourite. Fresh, crisp, no overkill on the fruit flavours and wonderfully mouth-watering. For a supermarket wine I would recommend giving it a try.

fields.name: Alzar Malbec
fields.colour: Intense, dark inky red.
fields.aroma: Fruity, ripe blackcurrants and cherries. Hints of oak and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, dry, nice touch of tannin and good acidity. Black fruits on the palate but this is overwhelmed by a peculiar sour taste on the finish.
fields.overall: This wine was fine except for the after-taste. It was quite sour and not in a good way. At a discounted 5 it is worth a try but I don't think I will be buying it again.

fields.name: Passerina Terre di Chieti
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow
fields.aroma: Floral, herbaceous and notes of ripe citrus fruits.
fields.taste: Dry and fresh with a smooth rounded texture with some acidity and a short finish.
fields.overall: I didn't find this as fruity as other reviewers but was still quite enjoyable. Personally, I would like something with higher acidity and a longer finish but all in all a good value wine and easy drinking.

fields.name: Louis Raynald Châteauneuf-du-Pape
fields.colour: Dark garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Rich, dried jammy black fruits, plums, red liquorice, figs and leather with just a hint of pepper.
fields.taste: Mouth-watering acidity but smooth, voluptuous and round. Not at all heavy, full of ripe black fruit flavours that just seem to coat your whole mouth and a deent bitter-sweet finish.
fields.overall: Thoroughly enjoyed this, I don’t get to enjoy CDP too often but this was really good. Easy-drinking, full and rich but not over-powering. Very good supermarket wine plus I got it on sale for 10, so good value and I would thoroughly recommend.

fields.name: Root 1 Carmenérè
fields.colour: Dark cherry with a lighter ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Vanilla, smoke, leather, sweet tobacco, black fruit like plums blackberries and figs.
fields.taste: Medium to full-bodied, well-balanced with lots of tannin and acidity, Full of ripe jammy fruit flavours, lots of spice and a touch smoky with a decent length finish.
fields.overall: Carmenere is one of my favourite wines and as usual this does not disappoint. Easy drinking, fruit forward but also savoury undertones. Really good value for money and I would recommend.

fields.name: Le Prieuré des Augustins
fields.colour: Opaque, dark inky red fading to a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Lots going on, earthy, red and black fruits, almonds, tobacco, spice, liquorice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, tannic with a velvety texture. Sour but pleasant red fruit flavours with a good long finish.
fields.overall: Really good, packed with flavours and aromas, well-structured and lots of tannin which I like. Hard to find but well worth seeking out and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Château Vieille Tour La Roche Bordeaux
fields.colour: Black cherry turning ruby at the rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of ripe fruit like blackcurrant and raspberries. Also notes of smoke, vanilla and baking spices.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, with good acidity and nice tannin which is not overwhelming. Lots of fruit with a decent finish but lacking a little something, seems a bit flat.
fields.overall: A very nice Bordeaux, not spectacular or memorable but typically fruity and easy drinking. This wine is still very young and may need more time to mature but I enjoyed it.

fields.name: Cono Sur Reserva Especial Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Dark ruby red.
fields.aroma: So much to take in. Intense savoury aromas of game, earth, leather, smoke, ripe red fruits and a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Soft tannins, medium-bodied with good acidity. Ripe fruit, tobacco and smoke on the palate. Well balanced, smooth silky texture with a medium finish.
fields.overall: Loved this wine, another really good Chilean red. The aromas were wonderful and was really easy drinking. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Novísimo Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Dark brown turning rusty, brick red at the rim.
fields.aroma: Musty, woody, burnt marshmallow, prunes, figs and pepper.
fields.taste: A bit flat, no fruitiness with a sour twist on the finish.
fields.overall: This wine is past its best and is showing signs of age or oxidation (wrote in September 2016). The colour, smell and taste all suggest oxidation. I took a gamble in an online auction and lost.

fields.name: Masseria Pietrosa Verdeca
fields.colour: Golden straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Intense, some citrus fruits and pineapple but this is dominated by floral, mineral and vanilla aromas.
fields.taste: Rich, full-bodied with good acidity. A well balanced wine with a creamy texture and a long finish.
fields.overall: Not the typical fresh, crisp, light Italian white wine I was expecting. This is a full opulent wine, more floral and mineral tastes and aromas than fruit. Not a bad thing in my opinion. Very easy drinking and thoroughly enjoyable.

fields.name: Vinsobres Côtes Du Rhône Villages
fields.colour: Dark black cherry turning orangy red at the rim.
fields.aroma: Earthy, herb aromas dominate with fainter notes of black fruits, figs, leather, smoke and spice.
fields.taste: Very tannic with loads of acidity. Medium-bodied with savoury, spicy and earthy flavours. Not much in the way of fruit but leaves a wonderful after-taste.
fields.overall: Didn't know what to expect from a 20 year old. Southern Rhône blend but this was a joy. Lots of tannins, mouthwatering acidity, complex flavours and a lovely finish.

fields.name: La Paz Castilla Macabeo Verdejo
fields.colour: Bright straw yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Quite aromatic, citrus fruits, mango, pear and flowers.
fields.taste: The same fruit flavours on the palate, refreshingly crisp with good acidity. Medium-bodied with a creamy, oily texture but the finish is disappointing.
fields.overall: An enjoyable wine, crisp and refreshing and the agitated lees do add to the complexity of the wine but still not one to get excited about. Is had it on its own but would probably be better with food. Worth a try at 6.

fields.name: Le Grand Chapelain Bordeaux Red
fields.colour: Intense deep garnet.
fields.aroma: Plums, blackberries, cherries and chocolate with a hint of spice.
fields.taste: . Lots of tannin and acidity on the palate. The same black fruit flavours albeit a little bitter with a forgettable finish.
fields.overall: You get what you pay for and at 5.50 this cheap Bordeaux is a bit of a disappointment. On a positive note it is very easy drinking and it has nice fruity aromas. It is still very young so it may be better to leave this wine in the bottle to mature for a while.

fields.name: Banrock Station Reserve Tempranillo
fields.colour: Intense deep garnet turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe dark fruits, plums and chocolate on the nose. Also, some vanilla with a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, acidic but not much tannin. Quite fruity but the finish is very disappointing.
fields.overall: Not a top quality wine but really juicy, fruity and refreshing, very easy to drink. Not one to impress the guests but great for a nice summers evening. If you just want something cheap and cheerful then give this wine a go.

fields.name: Flor de Maio Alentejano Mayflower
fields.colour: Intense dark ruby, almost opaque.
fields.aroma: Savoury farmyard aroma at first followed by forest fruits, tobacco and cherry.
fields.taste: Rich and really juicy, firm texture with a good balance between the acid and sweet tannin. Ripe, jammy fruit flavours and a nice finish.
fields.overall: The lack of oak ageing is evident but does not take away from the wine. A nice find from Portugal, inexpensive and so delicious. Lots of juicy fruitiness but a nice savoury undertone. Worth looking for if you like rich, dense reds.

fields.name: Brancott Estate Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Light ruby red with little intensity.
fields.aroma: Savoury, smoky at first followed by ripe dried fruits and a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Not much body, a little thin. Although tannins are low what is present is smooth and velvety and there is a nice touch of acidity. Nice earthy flavours of smoke and sweet tobacco backed up by dried fruit, cherry and a touch of spice. The finish is a little disappointing.
fields.overall: A very enjoyable wine, lacks body and intensity and I was expecting more fruit flavours but the savoury aromas and flavours were a pleasant surprise.

fields.name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild Mouton Cadet Bordeaux
fields.colour: Bright, crimson red.
fields.aroma: Blackcurrants and blueberries but seems underripe with vegetal and herbaceous notes dominating.
fields.taste: Abundantly tannic, firm structure but the flavour and finish is harsh and almost bitter.
fields.overall: I am a fan of Bordeaux but this was disappointing. A supermarket knock-off that I would not recommend.

fields.name: Tiger Horse Chenin Blanc - Pinot Grigio
Vignerons des Monts d’Aubune Vacqueyras Cru des Côtes du Rhône
fields.colour: Looks powerful and rich, deep garnet red.
fields.aroma: Red and black fruits, leather, smoke, a gaminess and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, supple drying tannin with a smooth texture. Soft on the palate but the cherry, liquorice finish gives it a little lift.
fields.overall: A cheap Vacqueyras lacking in richness of depth and complexity. Not bad, a pleasant nose, nice finish and easy drinking.

fields.name: Wolf Blass Red Label Shiraz - Cabernet
Contrade Bellusa Nerello Mascalese
fields.colour: Bright ruby red with a medium intensity
fields.aroma: Lots of pepper, sour cherries and plums on the nose.
fields.taste: Medium bodied, tart and acidic with nice tannins and a smooth mouthfeel followed by that sour cherry finish.
fields.overall: I liked this wine, mouth-watering, tart and fruity. It might not be a very common grape variety and it wasn't perfect but would make a nice choice for pasta or pizza.

fields.name: Egri Bulls Blood
fields.colour: Intense dark orange turning to brick at the rim.
fields.aroma: Smoke, cedar, leather, earthy, savoury roasted meat, musky with a touch of pepper. Not much fruit .
fields.taste: Dry, medium bodied with low tannins and a good amount of acidity. Lovely savoury earthy flavours.
fields.overall: Loved this wine. Very little in the way of fruit but great savoury aromas an tastes. Highly recommend this wine for anyone who doesn't want a heavy New World fruit bomb but something more subtle and less intense .

fields.name: Senorio De Convey Priorat
fields.colour: Very opaque turning to purple at the rim
fields.aroma: Dark fruit aromas of cherries and blackberries but not as dominant as the cedar and tar .
fields.taste: Nice smooth texture, tannins are low and well-balanced acidity. Some fruit on the palate but wood is dominant.
fields.overall: Once again very impressed with a Priorat, my favourite Spanish red. Would definitely recommend and good value as it is only a supermarket wine.

fields.name: Calvet Alsace Reserve Pinot Blanc
fields.colour: Pale amber and bright with silver glints.
fields.aroma: Floral and citrusy with a touch of minerality.
fields.taste: Off-dry, rich, textural and well-rounded. Citrus and stone fruit flavours of peaches and nectarines with a nice crisp clean finish.
fields.overall: Absolutely delighted with this wine. Just what I like in a white wine; light, crisp, fresh and not overwhelmingly fruity but enough to balance the acidity. Would highly recommend for anyone who likes this style of wine.

fields.name: Cantina Valle Isarco Südtirol Alto Adige Müller Thurgau
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Quite aromatic, lemony and floral notes.
fields.taste: Off-dry, light in body, crisp apple flavours, lacks acidity.
fields.overall: Didn't enjoy this wine, lacks acidity and crisp freshness for a wine of this style. Wouldn't recommend but if you are going to try it make sure it is well chilled.

fields.name: Morrison Specially Selected Valpolicella Ripasso
fields.colour: Deep ruby red.
fields.aroma: Ripe red berries, cherry, dark chocolate, mocha and a touch of sweet tobacco and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, rich ripe fruit flavours of cherries and prunes, good acidity but lacking tannin. Finish is disappointingly flat.
fields.overall: My first Ripasso and it was just OK, it just seems to be lacking something. Good for the price and it was not bad but it might be better to try one from a different winemaker.

fields.name: Wairau Cove Chardonnay
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Lemon dominates the nose but also pineapple and peach.
fields.taste: Medium dry and unoaked with very nice creamy mouthfeel. Fruit and acidity are well-balanced with a lemony aftertaste.
fields.overall: For a mass produced, bottled in the UK wine this is a very nice wine. I think it is well structured and I especially liked the texture. I had it on its own and although it didn't blow me away I would recommend as a wine to enjoy at home after a hard days work.

fields.name: Morrisons Signature Pinot Gris
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Lush and scented aromas of peach, pineapple, melon, grapefruit and honey.
fields.taste: Sumptuous, almost off-dry, medium-bodied with a smooth well-rounded creamy texture. Good acidity with flavours of lemon and tropical fruits with a good finish.
fields.overall: A juicy aromatic fruity wine. A bit lush and sweet for my taste, probably better with food than on its own. Definitely worth a try at the price and should not leave any one disappointed.

fields.name: Isoletta Terre Siciliane Grillo
fields.colour: Pale straw with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Citrus fruits but not just lemon or lime but also a strong orange aroma.
fields.taste: Dry, acidic with a long finish with a flavour that's like orange peel, quite unusual.
fields.overall: Fresh, crisp and refreshing on a warm summers evening. The taste may not appeal to everyone as it is quite different but a good value wine and one to try if light bodied crisp whites are your thing.

fields.name: Heidsieck & Co Champagne Brut Blue Top
fields.colour: So different from any other Champagne I have tried, in a good way. Thoroughly enjoyed. Highly recommend.
fields.aroma: So different from any other Champagne I have tried, in a good way. Thoroughly enjoyed. Highly recommend.
fields.taste: So different from any other Champagne I have tried, in a good way. Thoroughly enjoyed. Highly recommend.
fields.overall: So different from any other Champagne I have tried, in a good way. Thoroughly enjoyed. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Bretzenheimer Kronenberg Qualitatswein Nahe
fields.colour: Burnt orangy brown
fields.aroma: Mild, bland, the fruit flavours have disappeared with age leaving a rather dull musty smell.
fields.taste: Rather flat and again dull.
fields.overall: Took a gamble in an online auction but this wine is past its sell by date .

fields.name: La Posta Estela Armando Vineyard Bonarda
fields.colour: Deep crimson.
fields.aroma: Fruit aromas of raspberries and prunes but this is not as dominant as the savoury, earthy tertiary aromas of sweet tobacco, leather and cedar with a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Tannic, medium-full bodied, good acidity and a nice silky texture. Lots of rich ripe fruit followed by smoky oak that lasts long into a good finish..
fields.overall: My first Bonarda and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Wonderful aromas and flavors, very easy drinking and good value for money. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Chapel Hill Winemaker's Collection Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Very pale straw with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Citrus, peach and mango aromas that are not overbearing.
fields.taste: Medium bodied and dry, but lacks acidity, needs more zing. Like the nose similar tropical, stone fruits on the palate.
fields.overall: I was a little disappointed. I am normally a big fan of old world Sauvignon Blanc but I feel this one is missing something, not well balanced. It is OK for the price but I will not be buying this brand again.

fields.name: Château Beaumont Haut-Médoc
fields.colour: Dark and inky fading to brick red at the rim.
fields.aroma: Fruit aromas of blackcurrants and figs. Cedar, leather, damp forest floor, vanilla and a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied and dry, a nice balance between the tannins and the acidity giving a silky soft texture. Flavours of smoke and tobacco with a good finish.
fields.overall: Showing signs of ageing and would not want to be left unopened any longer (September 2016). But all in all a fine Bordeaux, easy drinking, well structured and I recommend.

fields.name: Andean Vineyards Hereford Tempranillo - Malbec
fields.colour: Dark almost black inky red.
fields.aroma: Damson, blackberries, cherry, something savoury like leather or tobacco and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, firm gripping tannin, a bit coarse. Juicy fruit flavours with the addition liquorice, tobacco and coffee. Medium length finish.
fields.overall: Not bad, unusual blend that kind of works. The palate is the highlight. Good QPR, paired well with bbq ribs, worth a try, just not memorable.

fields.name: Wallflower Moscato Colombard Riesling
fields.colour: Very pale straw with a tint of green.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic and fresh, citrusy and peachy with floral aromas of honeysuckle
fields.taste: Juicy, luscious and sweet, full of fruit flavours but well balanced with the acidity and a clean fresh finish.
fields.overall: Complex wine, definitely an unusual blend but I think it is well balanced even if it is a bit sweet for my taste.

fields.name: The Unexpected
fields.colour: Nice nose and flavour but nothing stands out. A decent wine at a decent price. Probably caught by the catchy name and label. Wouldn't buy again but ok for the middle of the week.
fields.aroma: Nice nose and flavour but nothing stands out. A decent wine at a decent price. Probably caught by the catchy name and label. Wouldn't buy again but ok for the middle of the week.
fields.taste: Nice nose and flavour but nothing stands out. A decent wine at a decent price. Probably caught by the catchy name and label. Wouldn't buy again but ok for the middle of the week.
fields.overall: Nice nose and flavour but nothing stands out. A decent wine at a decent price. Probably caught by the catchy name and label. Wouldn't buy again but ok for the middle of the week.

fields.name: Louis Jadot Beaujolais-Villages Combe aux Jacques
fields.colour: Deep crimson turning ruby at the rim.
fields.aroma: Red and black berries like blackcurrants, raspberries and cherries. Also floral notes and a touch of pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, well-structured, acidic and quite tannic. Cherry flavour on the palate with a nice silky finish.
fields.overall: A nice Beaujolais, easy-drinking, juicy with a lovely finish. A lot more tannin than I was expecting but I personally like that. Needs a little chilling to bring out it's best. May need longer to mature but worth a try.

fields.name: Mm Morrison Godello
fields.colour: Light golden colour.
fields.aroma: Ripe tree fruit aromas like peaches and pears and a touch of melon.
fields.taste: Thirst quenching acidity, very refreshing, dry, not very fruit forward with crisp bite.
fields.overall: Serve well chilled, nice on its own. Good value for money and I would like certainly but this type of wine again.

fields.name: McGuigan Black Label Shiraz
fields.colour: Full-bodied, ripe black fruits that are almost sweet with a good lingering finish. A very typical Shiraz, nothing outstanding but at the price no complaints. A nice midweek wine, worth a try.
fields.aroma: Full-bodied, ripe black fruits that are almost sweet with a good lingering finish. A very typical Shiraz, nothing outstanding but at the price no complaints. A nice midweek wine, worth a try.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, ripe black fruits that are almost sweet with a good lingering finish. A very typical Shiraz, nothing outstanding but at the price no complaints. A nice midweek wine, worth a try.
fields.overall: Full-bodied, ripe black fruits that are almost sweet with a good lingering finish. A very typical Shiraz, nothing outstanding but at the price no complaints. A nice midweek wine, worth a try.

fields.name: Gavi Terre Da Vino
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with green highlights. Aromas: Very fruity, citrus, ripe pears and apples. Same intense fruity flavors, medium bodied with a long lasting finish. Fresh but lacks acidity. Not a bad Gavi but a little unbalanced for my liking, a bit flabby. I would like more acidity and less ripe fruit. It was good value for money but I have tried better versions of this style of wine.
fields.aroma: Pale straw yellow with green highlights. Aromas: Very fruity, citrus, ripe pears and apples. Same intense fruity flavors, medium bodied with a long lasting finish. Fresh but lacks acidity. Not a bad Gavi but a little unbalanced for my liking, a bit flabby. I would like more acidity and less ripe fruit. It was good value for money but I have tried better versions of this style of wine.
fields.taste: Same intense fruity flavors, medium bodied with a long lasting finish. Fresh but lacks acidity.
fields.overall: Not a bad Gavi but a little unbalanced for my liking, a bit flabby. I would like more acidity and less ripe fruit. It was good value for money but I have tried better versions of this style of wine.

fields.name: Grifon Prosecco Extra Dry
fields.colour: Very pale straw, almost translucent
fields.aroma: Nice fruity aromas mainly tree fruit to a little citrusy.
fields.taste: Very refreshing, very dry with a nice bite.
fields.overall: A nice easy drinking Prosecco, light refreshing and lacks in the bubbles department but part of this is probably due to the Charmat method of fermentation as opposed to the traditional method.

fields.name: Château Saint-Pierre Grand Cru Classé
fields.overall: This wine was past its best, dull, flat and oxidised.

fields.name: Recchia Bardolino
fields.colour: Ruby red turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Fruity, think red fruits and cherries.
fields.taste: A refreshing light bodied wine, like a Beaujolais. fruity with a nice balance between acidity and tannins.
fields.overall: A nice easy drinking wine, lacks a little depth but overall worth the money and would certainly try other Bardolinos.

fields.name: Kourtaki Retsina of Attica
fields.colour: Pale gold
