fields.aroma: Strong pine aroma and subtle tropical fruits
fields.taste: A refreshing light bodied wine, quite sharp and bitter with a long after-taste of pine.
fields.overall: I can understand why this wine divides opinion as pine is definitely quite a unique aroma and flavour. Might work better with food. I would give this a better rating but the pine seems a little strong and overpowers everything else.

fields.name: Dr. Loosen Riesling
fields.colour: Bright, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Fruity, citrus, melon, pineapple and a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Light body, good acidity and well-balanced. Zesty orange, apple and honeysuckle flavours. Nice creamy texture with a long sweet finish.
fields.overall: Even though I prefer white wine to be bone dry this off-dry Riesling was very nice. Refreshing, easy-drinking and the sweet finish was delightful. Good value and well worth a try but only for those who like something sweet.

fields.name: Kumala Winemakers Release Chenin Blanc - Colombard
Pieroth Volkacher Kirchberg Francken Silvaner Trocken
fields.colour: Brilliant pure gold
fields.aroma: Smoky lavender if there is such a thing, hay, ripe pear and apple.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, creamy buttery texture with just enough acidity. Simple, but the smoky savoury aroma is reflected on the palate.
fields.overall: Wasn’t expecting much but age has been good to this wine. Wonderful colour and rustic is the only word I can think of to describe the taste and aroma. Nothing about this wine is over-powering or overstated. A very good find and well worth picking up if you come across it.

fields.name: Campo Viejo Viura - Tempranillo Blanco
fields.colour: Pale green with a silvery tinge.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic (pears) and fruity.
fields.taste: Quite citrusy on the palate and just enough acidity.
fields.overall: First 'Viura - Tempranillo Blanco' I have had and it's ok but I would not be in a rush to have a second.

fields.name: Menestrello Prosecco
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Vibrant, green apple, lemon zest and honeysuckle with a hit of spice.
fields.taste: Light, fresh crisp citrus, ripe melon and pear flavours. Gentle bubbles, not too sweet, good acidity with a medium finish.
fields.overall: Lovely, simple but lively and bright with subtle aromas and flavours and oh so moreish. Had it on its own and I didn’t find it to be too sweet. At 10 it is reasonably priced and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Codorníu Clasico Cava Brut
fields.colour: Golden yellow with tinges of green.
fields.aroma: Lemon, pears and fresh ripe apples on the nose.
fields.taste: Acidic, nice bubbles that make it really refreshing on the palate and it has a nice Lemon finish.
fields.overall: Light, crisp and fresh, a really nice Cava and at a fraction on the price of Champagne.

fields.name: Cono Sur Bicicleta Viognier
fields.overall: Just not for me. Too much of everything for my liking i.e. body, ripe fruit, alcohol and not enough acidity to balance it out

fields.name: Ormarine Picpoul de Pinet
fields.colour: Bright pale straw turning silver at the rim.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic, lemon, pineapple and peach.
fields.taste: Fresh and crisp with lots of acidity. The citrus and tropical fruit aromas are reflected on the palate and it has a very pleasant long finish.
fields.overall: A lovely light crisp wine, mouthwatering, easy-drinking and full of flavour. My favourite style of white so I am a little bias but well worth a try, it did not disappoint.

fields.name: Villa Maria Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Pale golden straw with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Powerful aromas of passion fruit, grapefruit and limes with a touch of sage.
fields.taste: Dry, crisp and juicy. The same fruit flavours are reflected on the palate. Fleshy and well-balanced with a ripe texture and a long aromatic finish.
fields.overall: A must for New Zealand Sauv Blanc lovers. This wine is a bright, refreshing thirst quencher packed with ripe fruit flavours and aromas. Personally I prefer less fruity wines but this is worth the few extra pounds.

fields.name: Codorniu Rosada Cava Brut
fields.taste: Red berry flavours, crisp and refreshing.
fields.overall: Red berry flavours, crisp and refreshing. Perfect as an aperitif or a hot summer evening in the sun.

fields.name: Dal Nostro Meglio Falanghina
fields.colour: Pale gold in colour.
fields.aroma: Citrus aromas, especially orange.
fields.taste: Dry with a nice finish.
fields.overall: Pale gold in colour. Citrus aromas, especially orange. Dry with a nice finish. Very good value for money. Would recommend.

fields.name: Famille Bougrier Vouvray
fields.overall: Off dry but refreshing acidity. Pear and melon aromas. Enjoyed this very much.

fields.name: La Vida Tempranillo - Cabernet Sauvignon Gran Seleccion
Tohora Point Sauvignon Blanc
fields.overall: This is not bad at all. Crisp, refreshing with lots of flavour. A very good everyday wine and will suit anyone who likes zesty, tangy, light easy-drinking wines.

fields.name: Geyser Peak Sauvignon Blanc
fields.overall: This is not bad at all. Crisp, refreshing with lots of flavour. A very good everyday wine and will suit anyone who likes zesty, tangy, light easy-drinking wines.

fields.name: Paul Mas Vinus Clairette du Languedoc
Puglia Negroamaro Primitivo Nero di Troia
Kumala Western Cape Sauvignon Blanc Sémillon
Weingut Markus Huber Specially Selected Grüner Veltliner
Castillo de Albai Rioja Viura Blanco
Jacobs Creek Sparkling Shiraz
fields.colour: Very dense, dark opaque inky red.
fields.aroma: Rich and ripe black fruits, cherries with a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Semi-sweet, fresh lively bubbles, raspberry chocolate and black berry flavours with a hint of smokiness on the tongue.
fields.overall: A fun wine, big, bold and brash. Semi-sweet, rich, fruity, nice bubbles. I like how the bubbles make a big bold Shiraz so refreshing, light and easy drinking.

fields.name: Fortant La Grande Nuit Terroir Littoral Chardonnay
Frontera Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Light straw yellow with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Tropical fruit aromas of passion fruit and kiwi followed by lesser notes of melon and grapefruit.
fields.taste: Light-bodied, fresh, crisp and acidic. This wine is lean, pungent and straightforward on the palate with lots of lemony flavours and a medium finish.
fields.overall: This is not bad at all. Crisp, refreshing with lots of flavour. A very good everyday wine and will suit anyone who likes zesty, tangy, light easy-drinking wines.

fields.name: Cave de Tain Les 3 Lys Crozes Hermitage
Real Compania de Vinos Tempranillo Tradición
Bergerac Grande Reserve Sauvignon Blanc Sémillon
Les Costières de Pomerols Picpoul de Pinet
Sainsbury’s Soave Classico, Taste The Difference
fields.overall: Crisp and fresh. Very nice for the price and not bland like a lot of Soave.

fields.name: Verdicchio Dei Castelli Di Jesi Classico 2016
fields.colour: Pale golden colour with glints of silver.
fields.aroma: Nice aromas of lemon, pear, melon and figs and not overly sweet.
fields.taste: Bone dry smooth and buttery. Tastes of lemon with a pleasant bitter after-taste.
fields.overall: A really nice wine, crisp, fresh, dry and really smooth to drink. Better than a lot of other Italian whites and it was good value for money. Well worth a try.

fields.name: Bouchard Aîné & Fils Pinot Noir Réserve Du Conseiller
Morrisons Crux Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Light straw yellow with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Tropical fruit aromas of passion fruit and kiwi followed by lesser notes of melon and grapefruit..
fields.taste: Light-bodied, fresh, crisp and acidic. This wine is lean, pungent and straightforward on the palate with lots of lemony flavours and a medium finish.
fields.overall: This is not bad at all. Crisp, refreshing with lots of flavour. A very good everyday wine and will suit anyone who likes zesty, tangy, light easy-drinking wines.

fields.name: La Nina Roja Single Gran Reserva
Castillo De Covanegra Monastrell Reserva Aged 5 Years
fields.colour: Dark silky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of pepper with sage, lavender, vanilla and dark bramble fruits.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, mild tannin and acidic. Mild flavours of black fruits and pepper but lacking any depth or complexity and a weak finish.
fields.overall: This is just OK in my opinion. For the money it is decent and easy-drinking but just seems to be lacking in body, flavour and may benefit from a little less oak. No more than a mid-week wine and there is better out there in this price range.

fields.name: Maschio Called'oro Prosecco
fields.colour: Very pale lemon.
fields.aroma: Finesse and aromatic, floral with fruit aromas of apple, peach and pears.
fields.taste: Fruit flavours are well reflected on the palate. Good acidity, nice texture, quite well-balanced but the bubbles are short lived.
fields.overall: Very nice, full of rich flavours and aromas. Light and easy-drinking. Not perfect but at the price it is hard to find any faults and it is worth a try.

fields.name: Château La Cardonne
fields.colour: Dark brown with a burnt orange rim.
fields.aroma: Fruity aromas are gone but replaced by graphite, pencil lead, tar, earthy underbrush, cedar, a hint of smoke and something herbal like menthol or eucalyptus
fields.taste: Fruity aromas are gone but replaced by graphite, pencil lead, tar, earthy underbrush, cedar, a hint of smoke and something herbal like menthol or eucalyptus
fields.overall: My second bottle of this vintage and what a contrast. First bottle was oxidised but this was a much truer reflection of the wine. Wonderful aged aromas and although lacking in flavour and length this was very enjoyable. Needs to be drunk now (2017) but still holding its own and well worth trying if aged Bordeaux is a style you enjoy.

fields.name: The Interlude Sémillon
fields.colour: Pale golden yellow with a slight green tinge.
fields.aroma: Rich and ripe fruit aromas of apple, melon and pear. Also, notes of lemon and orange peel.
fields.taste: Medium to full bodied but enough acidity to retain a freshness and balance. Smooth creamy texture, citrus flavours with a lingering flinty acidity and a decent length finish.
fields.overall: Very good value. Aromatic, fruity and weighty yet remains fresh and easy drinking. At under 7 you cannot go wrong and I would recommend.

fields.name: Ginestet Haut-Medoc Fort
fields.colour: Deep dull garnet red with a burnt orange rim.
fields.aroma: Intense, toasted, graphite, cedar, sweet tobacco, leather and undergrowth with just a touch of baking spices.
fields.taste: Very mature with depth and concentration this wine is full-bodied with smooth mellow tannin. Aromas are reflected on the palate with notes of liquorice and menthol followed by a good long finish.
fields.overall: Very nice aged Bordeaux but lost its vibrancy and needs to be drunk now (2017). Fruit flavours and aromas have evolved to be more savoury, earthy and mushroomy which is something I really like. Probably best with food but definitely worth a try and I would recommend.

fields.name: Hilltop Premium Pinot Grigio Kiralyleanyka
fields.colour: Bright straw yellow with a good intensity.
fields.aroma: Floral, orange blossom followed by lemon, lime, ripe apple and peach.
fields.taste: Citrusy but not very sharp or zesty and the fruit flavours are quite subtle and underwhelming with a short finish.
fields.overall: Light, somewhat refreshing and going down well on a warm summers evening. Lacking a little in acidity and flavour but for the price this is good value and enjoyable. Needs to be well chilled.

fields.name: Percheron Chenin Blanc - Viognier
fields.colour: Bright, pale lemon yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Very generous, tangerines, passion-fruit, ripe melon and tropical fruit with a touch of white pepper.
fields.taste: Mouth drying and tight in a nice way. Ripe and fruity with flavours of guava and fruit salad. Medium-bodied, just enough acidity but a bit heavy.
fields.overall: I would prefer a little more acidity but all in all quite nice. Fresh and vibrant but just seems to lack a little elegance and is a bit rich for my taste. A very nice wine for those who like a more opulent style of wine.

fields.name: Blanquette de Limoux Methode Ancestrale
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Fragrant and floral with aromas of ripe bruised apple and pear.
fields.taste: Off-dry, rich, medium-bodied with just enough acidity. Lots of ripe tree fruit flavours with a good length finish.
fields.overall: Not normally a big fan of the off-dry style of wine but this was very pleasant. Refreshing, lots of flavour and aromas and enjoyed it on its own. Good value and I would definitely buy it again.

fields.name: Virgen de la Sierra Cruz de Piedra Macabeo Blanco
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, flowers, lime, apple and ripe banana.
fields.taste: Dry, light and crisp with refreshing acidity. Not a whole lot of flavour, just a subtle banana note and the medium length finish is strange and not very pleasant.
fields.overall: A nice wine, easy-drinking and perfect for a hot day. My only criticism is the odd metallic finish. But for the price this wine delivers and is well worth trying.

fields.name: Famille Bougrier Vin De Pays Du Val De Loire Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Vivid, pale lemon with tinges of green.
fields.aroma: Unripe citrus fruits, grass and melon.
fields.taste: Dry, fresh, crisp, good acidity but not too tart. Not much complexity, just subtle lemony and saline flavours with a nice mineral edge.
fields.overall: Another bargain from one of my favourite wine regions. I really enjoyed this as thankfully it is not as pungent and fruit forward as New World Sauv Blancs. Clean, zesty, crisp and acidic with everything is in moderation, nothing over-powering. Also, a steal at under 6 so I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Mandrarossa Vermentino
fields.colour: Very pale straw with a glint of silver.
fields.aroma: Very floral with sweet fruit aromas of pear, mango and banana.
fields.taste: Dry, light, mouth-watering acidity. Nutty, flowers and lime with a decent length but bitter finish.
fields.overall: Not overly impressed by this, aromas and flavours are just not for me, it just seems more saline than fruity. I can’t knock it as I drank it on its own and perhaps it would be better with food. On a positive note, very good value, crisp and light, a good everyday wine.

fields.name: Victory Hotel Reserve Chardonnay Sémillon
fields.colour: Pale gold with a glint of silver and green.
fields.aroma: Intense, fruit forward and ripe. Aromas of lime, grapefruit, melon and papaya.
fields.taste: Rich and full-bodied, nice texture and good acidity. Tropical fruit flavours that continue on a good length finish.
fields.overall: Not a mind blowing wine but fresh, pleasant and easy drinking. Great value for 5.95 and well worth a try. I would recommend.

fields.name: Percheron Shiraz - Mourvèdre
fields.colour: Dark intense garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Hot and spicy, aromas of raspberries, cherries, liquorice and chocolate.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, good acidity with smooth subtle tannin. A well-balanced wine. Chocolatey, raspberry and cherry flavours. Lots of heat on a decent finish.
fields.overall: Big, bold and rich with lots of flavours and aromas. Price wise this punches way above its weight. Sooo fruity, very moreish and thoroughly enjoyable.

fields.name: Chateau Val De Bridoire
fields.colour: Dark black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Fruit driven, lush red fruits, cherries, aniseed and tobacco leaf with a touch of menthol and spice.
fields.taste: Well-structured, ripe well integrated tannins. Medium-bodied with subtle flavours of cherry and raspberries but the finish is a little disappointing.
fields.overall: Real nice typical Bordeaux. Offers a lot for the price; fruity, easy-drinking and will not disappoint.

fields.name: Vila Real Old Vines in Young Hands
fields.colour: Deep dark ruby red.
fields.aroma: Unripe black fruits, cherry, raspberries, barbecue smoke with a touch of spice. Also quite an off-putting leafy note.
fields.taste: Light-medium body, firm ripe tannins and quite acidic. Flavours of sour cherry and blackcurrants with a medium length finish.
fields.overall: Lacking in body and the fruit seems a bit unripe but all in all not bad. Nice fruit flavour, light and easy-drinking, good on its own and exceptional value. Like a Beaujolais, a good everyday wine well worth trying but don’t expect too much.

fields.name: Sabina Navarra Tempranillo
fields.colour: Black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Dusty, dried herbs, ripe red fruits, smoky/tobacco with a touch of sweet spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied at best, smooth pleasant tannin and nicely acidic. Red fruit flavours with a smoky touch but the finish is a little short.
fields.overall: Young fresh and flavoursome, a really good everyday Tempranillo. Straightforward but well-structured with nice aromas and flavours. Great value so just relax and enjoy.

fields.name: Jacques Depagneux Gamay Vin de France
fields.colour: Bright, light ruby red.
fields.aroma: Mostly raspberries but would also include redcurrant, banana, sour cherry with a nice hint of bubblegum and something earthy.
fields.taste: Light-bodied, very little tannin and good acidity. Raspberries and sour cherries are repeated on the palate but the medium finish is a bit sour.
fields.overall: Not bad but I was left a bit disappointed. Light and fresh and a good fit for a warm summers day but the taste is a bit sharp, lacking the fruitiness of other Gamay wines. Good value but not memorable so don’t expect too much.

fields.name: Sylvain Changarnier Bourgogne Cuvee Soline
fields.colour: Bright carmine red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Violets, liquorice and candy floss with fruit aromas of plums, raspberries and cherries ending with a slight tingle of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-light in body, delicate smooth silky tannin, nothing overwhelming so well-balanced. Flavours of cherry and raspberry with a medium length bubblegum finish.
fields.overall: Really enjoyable, light, fresh, fruity and very easy-drinking, quite similar to Beaujolais. Perhaps it is still a bit young and may benefit if laid down for a couple of years. I would recommend if you are looking for a lively fruity red.

fields.name: Domaine Des Carbonnieres
fields.colour: Intense, opaque black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Rich with good depth, damp forest floor, prunes, liquorice, clay pot and cloves.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, robust, nice grippy tannin and good acidity. Fruit flavours have faded but what remains is a subtle sweet raspberry flavour with a medium-long finish.
fields.overall: A bit past its best but very enjoyable. Big, bold and complex but missing the fruit flavours it probably once had. Worth trying but perhaps a more recent vintage.

fields.name: Fetzer Zinfandel
fields.colour: Dark brick red with an orange rim.
fields.aroma: Herbs and spices; cloves, nutmeg, allspice, sage and black pepper with butterscotch, smoke, charcoal and barbecue.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, nice ripe tannin and still good acidity. Rustic, with flavours of dried fruit cake, barbecue smoke and meats.
fields.overall: Brilliant, won in an auction for a steal. A lighter style of Zinfandel that has aged wonderfully. All earth, oak and savoury flavours and aromas that I really enjoy. Highly recommend if you can find it.

fields.name: Chateau La Roche Gaby
fields.colour: Dark brick red with an orange rim.
fields.aroma: Aged, cedar, pencil shavings, smoke, vanilla, mushrooms and figs.
fields.taste: Rich, medium-bodied, nice ripe tannin, this is well-balanced. Jammy dark berry flavours and a good menthol finish.
fields.overall: This is so good, earthy, savoury, woody and herbal (sage) with a little fruit mixed in. I won this in an auction at a bargain price but would pay a lot more. Highly recommend but I don’t think this vintage will last much longer.

fields.name: Les Nivieres Saumur Cabernet Franc
fields.colour: Crimson red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Blackcurrant, strawberry, raspberry and cola with a good hit of sweet spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, smooth soft tannin and good acidity. Black fruit flavours and a satisfying length.
fields.overall: Really nice, light, lively, juicy, fresh, fruity and so drinkable on a warm evening. Got this on sale so great value and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Peltier Road Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, light straw yellow with silvery tinges.
fields.aroma: Typically pungent, gooseberry, grass, tropical fruits, melon and lemon.
fields.taste: Weighty for a Sauvignon Blanc, nice texture and just enough acidity. Packed full of really ripe fruit flavours followed by a slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Not for me, too fruit forward and heavy for my taste. At the price this is well worth a try if this style of wine suits you. Needs to be well chilled.

fields.name: Almeida Garrett Entre Serras
fields.colour: Dark and inky with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Plummy black fruits and spice dominate with a rustic undertone of earth, leather and tar.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, smooth supple tannin, well-balanced and backed up by black fruits and good acidity on a medium length finish.
fields.overall: A really nice wine, everything in moderation, fruity, smooth and easy drinking. A good everyday wine and well worth the money.

fields.name: The Society’s Rapel ValleyMerlot
fields.colour: Vivid, pale lemon with tinges of green.
fields.aroma: Unripe citrus fruits, grass and melon.
fields.taste: Dry, fresh, crisp, good acidity but not too tart. Not much complexity, just subtle lemony and saline flavours with a nice mineral edge.
fields.overall: Another bargain from one of my favourite wine regions. I really enjoyed this as thankfully it is not as pungent and fruit forward as New World Sauv Blancs. Clean, zesty, crisp and acidic with everything is in moderation, nothing over-powering. Also, a steal at under 6 so I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Cave de Lugny Macon-Villages Chardonnay
fields.colour: Bright, light golden yellow with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Citrusy aromas of melon, lemon peel and grapefruit. Add bruised apple, apricot and mango finishing with a lovely touch of burnt toast.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, smooth, rounded, a nice buttery texture. Refreshing acidity, citrus flavours with a persistent finish.
fields.overall: What a pleasant surprise as I am not the biggest Chardonnay fan but this is so good. Weighty but still zesty, crisp and refreshing and a great long fruity finish. Punches above its weight at 8 and I would definitely buy this again perhaps pairing it with a dish with a creamy sauce.

fields.name: Chateau de Pena Cotes du Roussillon Villages Chapelle De Pena
fields.colour: Very dark black cherry with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Black fruits like blackberries and blackcurrants followed by liquorice, floral notes of violets and new leather or tobacco.
fields.taste: Potent, rich and full-medium bodied but not heavy. Nice smooth tannin, acidic, flavours of raspberries and dried fruit with a long smooth spicy finish.
fields.overall: Very pleasant, nice aroma but lacks a little taste. The soft tannin and acidity make this really easy drinking. Not as weighty or heavy as I was expecting and at less than 6 this is really good value.

fields.name: Senorio de Sarria Rosado
fields.colour: Deep pink with a bright light ruby edge.
fields.aroma: Fresh, ripe, semi-sweet and fruity. All raspberries and red berries with vanilla and a hint of something savoury or herbal.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, fairly rich but still refreshing. Nice and smooth texture, good acidity and red berry flavours on a medium length somewhat spicy finish.
fields.overall: A very enjoyable wine, I am not a big rosé fan but this fuller richer style went down a treat. Flavoursome, fresh, nice easy drinking on a warm summers evening. This will not knock your socks off and needs to be very well chilled but no at the price no complaints and I would recommend.

fields.name: Château Rochecolombe Côtes du Rhône Rouge
fields.colour: Opaque,with a garnet rim. Looks powerful and rich.
fields.aroma: Burnt, olives, sweaty leather in a good way, black-berry jam, something herbal and a bit of spice.
fields.taste: Viscous , full bodied, robust with nice silky smooth tannin. Thick and peppery with savoury jammy flavours followed by a persistent spicy finish.
fields.overall: Big and bold, Needs time to breathe. Drank on its own but probably needs food.

fields.name: Avaniel, Ribera del Duero
fields.colour: Medium intensity garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Perfumed like pot pourri, cherries, blackcurrants, blackberries, dried fruit and a touch of tobacco.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied, lightly tannic and brisk acidity. Subdued strawberry and cherry flavours, very spicy with a nice sweet but short finish.
fields.overall: Personally I would prefer a touch of oak as it just seems to be missing something. Nice fruity aromas but lacks flavour. Young, fresh easy-drinking and good value for money but if you are looking for something with a bit of oomph this is not the wine for you.

fields.name: Ruppertsberger Hoheburg Riesling Kabinett
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Fragrant and floral with aromas of ripe bruised apple and pear.
fields.taste: Off-dry, rich, medium-bodied with just enough acidity. Lots of ripe tree fruit flavours with a good length finish.
fields.overall: Not normally a big fan of the off-dry style of wine but this was very pleasant. Refreshing, lots of flavour and aromas and enjoyed it on its own. Good value and I would definitely buy it again.

fields.name: Villiera Down to Earth Touriga Nacional-Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark ruby red.
fields.aroma: Smoke, tobacco, coffee and burnt toast upfront followed by strawberry, plum and a nice hit of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, very light soft tannin but lots of juicy acidity. Strawberry and sour plum flavours, spicy bitter herbal after-taste that it hard to describe but it does linger for quite a while.
fields.overall: A lot lighter than I was expecting, lovely aromas but the taste was disappointing, lacking body and texture. Don’t want to knock it too much as it is pleasant easy-drinking, good value and finishes really well. Well worth a try.

fields.name: Heréncia Altes Garnatxa Blanca Terra Alta
fields.colour: Clean and bright, pale straw yellow with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Strangely it initially reminds me of 3-in-1 oil, smoke, dried herbs. Very rustic or woody.
fields.taste: Very dry, crisp acidity, medium-bodied with a smooth texture. Although very subdued the earthiness is repeated on the palate with a nutty finish.
fields.overall: I’m not sure if the weird oil aroma is a defect or not but I quite like it. Rich but well balanced by ample acidity. In no way fruity and best served well chilled and I thoroughly enjoyed this on its own. I would recommend for anyone looking for something a little different from the norm.

fields.name: Vecchio Moro Lambrusco Grasparossa Rinaldini
fields.colour: Very dark, almost opaque inky red.
fields.aroma: Jammy ripe black fruits and violets.
fields.taste: Dry, big and bold with flavours of blackberries and cherries. Disappointingly very few bubbles.
fields.overall: Think I got a bad bottle on this occasion. Popped the cork and lost about one third of the wine down the sink. With all the bubbles gone, all I was left with was a heavy flat red wine. This may only be a one-off and other bottles may be fine but I can't give it any more than two and a half stars.

fields.name: Sorso Pinot Nero
fields.colour: Bright ruby red with medium pale intensity.
fields.aroma: Fresh cherry, candy floss and strawberries
fields.taste: Light to medium bodied, very little tannin with balanced acidity. Fresh and vibrant with subtle fruit flavours of cherry and raspberries but the finish is weak.
fields.overall: My first Italian Pinot a what a treat. Such an easy-drinking wine, light, fruity, young, fresh and lively. Nothing complex about it, just a good everyday wine at a good price and I would recommend.

fields.name: KWV Classic Collection Pinotage
fields.colour: Deep red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Savoury, smoked meat, roasted peppers, menthol, hints of raspberries and liquorice and a touch of spicy oak.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, subtle tannin, good acidity. Although understated the flavours are savoury and smoky and the finish is medium-short.
fields.overall: A very typical Pinotage; smoky, sweet spices and savoury. Very enjoyable, easy-drinking, great value and although not perfect it is well worth a try.

fields.name: IONOS Greek Red Wine
fields.colour: Light and fresh, polished garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Raspberry, cherry and cranberry with a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Light-bodied, lots of acidity and low in tannin. Red fruit flavours are reflected on the palate with a medium finish.
fields.overall: So much like a Beaujolais Nouveau; light, fruity, easy-drinking. Simple uncomplicated but so enjoyable. Perfect mid-week wine, good on its own and good value. Personally, this was a good introduction to Greek red wine and I would recommend.

fields.name: A Fistful of Schist Reserve Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, light golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Ripe pungent nose, gooseberries, apples, guava and melon backed up by lots of lemon.
fields.taste: All ripe fruit flavours with just enough acidity to retain a freshness. Quite rich, medium-bodied with a smooth texture and a good persistent finish.
fields.overall: Just ok for my taste. A bit full or heavy for my liking as I prefer more acidity or at least a wine that is better balanced and less fruit forward. However, good value, perfect for those who like fruity, richer, weightier whites. Best served well chilled.

fields.name: 88 Growers Barossa Sémillon
fields.colour: Fresh, light golden hue with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Subtle but what does come through is lemon, grapefruit and sweet papaya.
fields.taste: Light bodied, zesty acidity with a soft waxy texture. Flavours are mild, mainly citrus and a nice hard to describe oily or cream flavoured finish.
fields.overall: Nothing overpowering and personally I love that in a white wine. Just simple, straightforward, easy-drinking but enjoyable. A perfect mid-week wine plus good value. Don’t expect too much, just enjoy it for what it is. Don’t serve over-chilled.

fields.name: Champagne Valbert Brut Réserve
fields.colour: A nice but not spectacular Champagne. Some almond and yeast flavours but the sparkle disappears quickly. Received as a gift and I would not buy it for myself. A good celebratory drink but not memorable.
fields.aroma: A nice but not spectacular Champagne. Some almond and yeast flavours but the sparkle disappears quickly. Received as a gift and I would not buy it for myself. A good celebratory drink but not memorable.
fields.taste: A nice but not spectacular Champagne. Some almond and yeast flavours but the sparkle disappears quickly. Received as a gift and I would not buy it for myself. A good celebratory drink but not memorable.
fields.overall: A nice but not spectacular Champagne. Some almond and yeast flavours but the sparkle disappears quickly. Received as a gift and I would not buy it for myself. A good celebratory drink but not memorable.

fields.name: Pierre Darcys Champagne Brut 2013
fields.colour: For the price this is a really nice Champagne. Aromas of citrus fruits and green apple with nice refined bubbles. Great as a party/celebratory drink when expectations aren't too high.
fields.aroma: For the price this is a really nice Champagne. Aromas of citrus fruits and green apple with nice refined bubbles. Great as a party/celebratory drink when expectations aren't too high.
fields.taste: For the price this is a really nice Champagne. Aromas of citrus fruits and green apple with nice refined bubbles. Great as a party/celebratory drink when expectations aren't too high.
fields.overall: For the price this is a really nice Champagne. Aromas of citrus fruits and green apple with nice refined bubbles. Great as a party/celebratory drink when expectations aren't too high.

fields.name: Allini Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore Extra Dry
fields.colour: No complaints at this price. Nothing spectacular but the yeasty nutty flavours are very nice. Zesty, fresh and crisp. This will not disappoint at any party.
fields.aroma: No complaints at this price. Nothing spectacular but the yeasty nutty flavours are very nice. Zesty, fresh and crisp. This will not disappoint at any party.
fields.taste: No complaints at this price. Nothing spectacular but the yeasty nutty flavours are very nice. Zesty, fresh and crisp. This will not disappoint at any party.
fields.overall: No complaints at this price. Nothing spectacular but the yeasty nutty flavours are very nice. Zesty, fresh and crisp. This will not disappoint at any party.

fields.name: Grifòn Prosecco Vino Frizzante
fields.colour: Very disappointing, bland and fairly tasteless with little in the way of nose or taste. Not much fizz and there at this price there is a lot better out there.
fields.aroma: Very disappointing, bland and fairly tasteless with little in the way of nose or taste. Not much fizz and there at this price there is a lot better out there.
fields.taste: Very disappointing, bland and fairly tasteless with little in the way of nose or taste. Not much fizz and there at this price there is a lot better out there.
fields.overall: Very disappointing, bland and fairly tasteless with little in the way of nose or taste. Not much fizz and there at this price there is a lot better out there.

fields.name: Bottega Gold Rosé
fields.colour: Well worth a try, clean and fresh with a zesty acidity. Nice red fruit flavours of strawberries and cherries followed by a decent length finish.
fields.aroma: Well worth a try, clean and fresh with a zesty acidity. Nice red fruit flavours of strawberries and cherries followed by a decent length finish.
fields.taste: Well worth a try, clean and fresh with a zesty acidity. Nice red fruit flavours of strawberries and cherries followed by a decent length finish.
fields.overall: Well worth a try, clean and fresh with a zesty acidity. Nice red fruit flavours of strawberries and cherries followed by a decent length finish.

fields.name: Hirsch Renner Gruner Veltliner
fields.colour: Wonderful stuff, full-bodied, rich fruit flavours, smooth and creamy texture but maintains a good level of acidity for freshness. More than I normally spend but well worth the price. Paired very well with a vegetarian dish containing asparagus.
fields.aroma: Wonderful stuff, full-bodied, rich fruit flavours, smooth and creamy texture but maintains a good level of acidity for freshness. More than I normally spend but well worth the price. Paired very well with a vegetarian dish containing asparagus.
fields.taste: Wonderful stuff, full-bodied, rich fruit flavours, smooth and creamy texture but maintains a good level of acidity for freshness. More than I normally spend but well worth the price. Paired very well with a vegetarian dish containing asparagus.
fields.overall: Wonderful stuff, full-bodied, rich fruit flavours, smooth and creamy texture but maintains a good level of acidity for freshness. More than I normally spend but well worth the price. Paired very well with a vegetarian dish containing asparagus.

fields.name: The Saviour Cinsault
fields.colour: Looks weak, very light garnet bordering on pink at the rim.
fields.aroma: Strong fruit aromas, raspberries and cherries but also more savoury cranberry and red currrants with a touch of smoky spiciness.
fields.taste: Tannin is soft but seems unripe, good acidity but very light in body. Lasting flavours of raspberries and pomegranate, almost confectionery like.
fields.overall: Reminded me of a Beaujolais Nouveau, very nice aromas and flavours, more than I was expecting but that's as good as it gets. At £5 there are no complaints but this is a bit thin and a little harsh. A midweek wine at best , nice on it's own and probably good with light dishes and sauces. Worth trying and I enjoyed it but don't expect too much.

fields.name: Pélerin Blanc Pays de Caux, Chartreuse de Mougères
fields.colour: Bright, light straw yellow with hints of silver.
fields.aroma: Floral and perfumy. Citrus fruits, peach with lesser notes of melon and apple.
fields.taste: Refreshing crisp acidity with a soft, smooth texture. Peach and citrus aromas are reflected on the palate followed by a slightly bitter decent length finish.
fields.overall: Very pleasant and enjoyable. Lots of flavour and aroma, well-balanced. Good value and if light, fruity and floral is your style then this is well worth a try.

fields.name: Graham Beck Brut NV
fields.colour: Bright, lively persistent bubbles, pale gold with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Upfront, lots of yeast, mushroom, biscuit and bakery aromas. This is backed up by citrus fruits and ripe yellow apple.
fields.taste: Creamy texture, bitter-sweet apple tart flavour, lively acidity with a medium persistent drying finish.
fields.overall: Excellent entry level Graham Beck wine. So enjoyable, mouth-wateringly refreshing with Champagne like yeasty, savoury, bakery aromas. Wonderful Champagne alternative that I got on sale, so a real bargain. No complaints and I would highly recommend if on a budget.

fields.name: Janare Aglianico Sannio
fields.colour: Deep garnet red turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of rich dark fruits, blackberries, black cherries and plums with plenty of white pepper. Also something floral like violets or lavender.
fields.taste: Medium bodied, high herbaceous, vegetal tannin and soft acidity. Not much flavour with a slightly bitter short finish.
fields.overall: My first Aglianico and I was left a little disappointed. Nice aromas but lacking in flavour and just seems unbalanced, a bit harsh. However; it is good value and does marginally improve after decanting but it is in no way memorable.

fields.name: Faustino I Gran Reserva Rioja
fields.colour: Deep, intense garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Dried mouldy fruits, herbal, tobacco, softer hints of red fruits and sweet cherries, spice, wood burner and wet gravel.
fields.taste: Ripe grippy tannin yet smooth, medium-bodied, good acidity, flavours of oak and smoke underpinned by subtle red fruits. A good persistent leather, cedar finish.
fields.overall: Very good typical Rioja, oak is very evident and a little overdone for my taste. But no complaints, concentrated, juicy, fresh, easy-drinking and worth the £15 but quite woody.

fields.name: The Black Stump
fields.colour: Dark inky core with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Cranberry, plums, blackberries, liquorice, raspberries, and spice with just a hint of sweet tobacco.
fields.taste: Rich and full-bodied with a silky smooth texture. Luscious dense fruit flavours of blackberries and cranberries, almost sweet. Good mid-palate length and finish.
fields.overall: So enjoyable and easy-drinking. Big, bold and juicy but the highlight is the velvety texture; tannin, acidity and alcohol are well balanced. If your looking for a powerful, ripe, rich red then this will not disappoint.

fields.name: Cave de Beblenheim Kleinfels Riesling
fields.colour: Bright pale gold with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Ripe fruits; pear, cantaloupe , apple with a streak of lemony freshness. A slight tingling on the nose, floral with a touch of minerality.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, mouth filling, fresh acidity, good depth of flavour (oily/petrol) that lasts across the palate and finish.
fields.overall: For a Riesling a bit heavy, not as racy or minerally as I was expecting and I prefer German examples, However, not bad, nice citrussy aromas, length of flavour and after-taste are very good and ok value. If weightier Rieslings are something you enjoy, worth a try otherwise avoid.

fields.name: Blandy's 10 Years Old Bual Meio Doce Madeira
fields.colour: Dark orangy brown.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and spicy. Raisins, vanilla, caramel, maple syrup, walnuts, butterscotch, roasted nuts, marmalade and varnish.
fields.taste: Rich and luscious, full-bodied, syrupy and mouth-coating but not heavy thanks to the abundant acidity. Semi-sweet wiht a good depth of flavour followed by a nice warming sensation on a long finish.
fields.overall: What a delight, my first Madeira and I loved it. Well balanced and the high alcohol is barely noticeable making this so drinkable. Wonderful intensity in both aroma and flavour I highly highly recommend. More Madeira please.

fields.name: Château de Ricaud Bordeaux
fields.colour: Vivid, light straw yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Lots of citrusy fruits like lemon, gooseberry, grapefruit and quince with vegetal notes of grass and asparagus.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied, bone-dry with zesty acidity. Citrus aromas are reflected on the palate followed by a herbal, bitter decent length finish.
fields.overall: Good Bordeaux Blanc for the price. Plenty of aroma and flavour, crisp and a good finish but my only fault is that it does not seem to be well-balanced, a few rough edges. A great midweek wine and well worth a try.

fields.name: Hortas do Caseirinho Frisante
fields.colour: Pale lemon with a good touch of green.
fields.aroma: Light and fresh, you can almost smell the bubbles. Crisp apples, lemon with a hint of pears.
fields.taste: Delicate, dry, not much sparkle on the tongue. Light in body, very acidic with citrus and apple flavours and a short drying finish.
fields.overall: Lively and refreshing with typical rasping Vinho Verde acidity. On the down side, only semi-sparkling and the bubbles disappear quickly. But at this price this is a really good value and will not disappoint. Serve very well chilled.

fields.name: Warre's Otima 10 Year Old Tawny Port
fields.colour: Beautiful cognac colour, dark burnt orange/red.
fields.aroma: Intense and sweet, sweet tobacco, dried fruits, toffee, caramelised roasted nuts, baking spices, caramel, almonds and raspberry sauce.
fields.taste: Rich, full-bodied, good acidity with a mouth-filling smooth texture. Hot and spicy with flavours of sweet apricot jam, brown sugar, honey and toffee with a long finish.
fields.overall: Rich and luscious, nice level of sweetness. The alcohol is warming but well balanced with acidity and fruit. This was a delight and great value for money. A perfect digestif or winters evening sipper.

fields.name: Domaine Raynier
fields.colour: Deep crimson turning purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Savoury, plums, dark berries, cranberry, liquorice and spice with lesser notes of lavender and raspberry.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, soft light slightly drying tannin. Simple, not much to hold one's attention but there are flavours of plums and blackberries and a nice medium-short finish.
fields.overall: Great value to price ratio, a very good everyday wine. Very nice aromas but lacking a little in depth and length of flavour. However, no complaints, it's juicy, easy drinking and well rounded.

fields.name: Cantoiseau Blanc, Vin de France
fields.colour: Lively and limpid, very pale straw with a silvery streak.
fields.aroma: Fairly intense aromas, floral or hay-like, ripe pineapple, peach and lemon.
fields.taste: Light in body, very dry with crisp lively acidity. Lemon flavoured and very one dimensional but the finish does linger.
fields.overall: Nothing memorable here but at the price it is well worth a try. A very good midweek wine, simple, refreshing, aromatic and best served well-chilled.

fields.name: Taylor's Late Bottled Vintage Port
fields.colour: Opaque with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Powerful and intense, medicinal, iodine, apricot jam, spice, sweet tobacco, toffee and caramel.
fields.taste: Full-bodied and viscous. Smooth and velvety texture plus good acidity. Blackberry and apricot flavoured followed by a persistent finish.
fields.overall: Really good, intense aromas and flavours with a good finish. Sweetness, alcohol and acidity are all well-balanced making for easy drinking. A must try!!!

fields.name: Valminor Albarino
fields.colour: Bright straw yellow with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Intense, herbaceous and minerally. Citrussy; tangerine, grapefruit, orange peel with lesser notes of peach and apple.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied, zesty acidity and fruity yet dry. Flavours are lemony and appley with good length on a slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Not at all heavy, crisp and refreshing, packed with aroma and flavour. Easy drinking and great value for money, this will suit anyone who likes a style that is juicy and aromatic.

fields.name: Pitchfork Margaret River Cabernet-Merlot
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Fresh red berries, cherries, oak, smoke, hints of tobacco and eucalyptus and some spice.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, fine ripe tannin, good acidiy and a plump fruity, oaky finish.
fields.overall: Lovely easy drinking wine. The high alcohol is well-balanced by the fruit, acidity and tannin. The touch of oak is really well integrated and adds a lovely contrast to the fruit. Good value for a Margaret River wine and well worth a try if juicy, smooth reds are your style.

fields.name: Pisano Progreso Tannat
fields.colour: Dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Upfront a strong unpleasant hit of something like varnish or shoe polish but this evolved to farmyard, animal, earthy mushrooms, blackberries, plums and something medicinal.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, brisk acidity and surprisingly soft tannin. Restrained flavours of black fruits, plums and liquorice and the finish is medium-short.
fields.overall: Not bad, initially not that pleasant on the nose and lacked flavour but decanting and time allowed it to improve immensely. Sturdy but well-balanced, no fruit bomb, different, worth a try but not memorable.

fields.name: Green Pepp Weinviertel Grüner Veltliner
fields.colour: Vibrant, pale straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Tangy green apple, citrusy lemon and lime, floral, asparagus and pepper.
fields.taste: Dry and light with vigorous acidity. Crunchy saliva inducing green apple, citrus and mineral flavours with spicy tingly slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Deliciously fresh, aromatic and flavoursome. Lovely telltale pepperiness. Packs a lot in for the price and it was a wonderful surprise.

fields.name: La Gitana Manzanilla
fields.colour: Bright, straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Very nutty, varnish (pleasant), preserved lemons, dried fruits, toffee and caramel.
fields.taste: Crisp and light, really dry with low acidity. Flavours are yeasty, nutty, bready and salty with a smooth texture on a decent bitter finish.
fields.overall: Sherry is not my favourite style of wine but this is not bad. Medium intensity on both the nose and palate, well balanced and good value. Certainly needs to be served well chilled and with food.

fields.name: Saumur ‘Les Plantagenêts' Cabernet Franc
fields.colour: Fairly dark crimson red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strawberries, raspberries, plums, sour cherries, pencil shavings and crushed gravel.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied, soft moderate tannin. Flavour is dominated by sour cherry and a slight spiciness but both mid-palate and finish are short.
fields.overall: I have had better examples of Cab Franc but this is still quite pleasant. Very nice aroma but falls short in weight and length of taste. For the price, no complaints, a nice midweek wine but not memorable.

fields.name: Cockburn's Port Special Reserve
fields.colour: Dense, opapue turning to ruby at the rim.
fields.aroma: Spice ,liquorice, iodine, vanilla, milk chocolate, apricots and honey with a touch of smokiness.
fields.taste: Rich, full-bodied yet fresh with good acidity. Mouth-filling velvety texture, flavours of raisins, apricots and toffee apple followed by a fiery medium length finish.
fields.overall: Very good, not a top quality port but ticks a lot of boxes. Aromatic, sweet, well balanced, good finish and good value so well worth a try. Highly recommend!!

fields.name: Jewel Of Nasik Tempranillo Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark and inky with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Musty like old cardboard but not wholly pleasant, sharp TCP, smoke with lesser notes of dried leaves, dried fig, ripe black fruits.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, quite tannic, a wine with sharp edges, not well-rounded. Aromas are reflected on the palate but does not translate very well. Smoke and TCP is not a good combination and leaves a bitter finish.
fields.overall: The aroma and taste are a bit overpowering. One of the strangest wines I have ever had, my first Indian wine and I can only hope that other examples are of a better quality. If it could just lose that chemical factor the underlying fruitiness may be allowed to show itself.

fields.name: Baron Herzog Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, pale lemon yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Honeyed smokiness, oily, yeasty, baked apple, quince and lemon meringue.
fields.taste: Off-fry but fresh, medium-light bodied with brisk acidity. Peaches, cream, oil and honeydew melon to taste with a nice semi-sweet but clean fresh finish.
fields.overall: Really enjoyable, crisp, lively with wonderful honeyed yeasty aromas and taste. Lacks a little in body and a touch sweet for my liking but otherwise no complaints and definitely worth a try.

fields.name: Syrah du Maroc 'Tandem' Alain Graillot et Thalvin
fields.winery: Alain Graillot - Thalvin - Domaine des Ouled Thaleb
fields.colour: Dark garnet red with a purple to ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Dried herbs, lavender, liquorice, tobacco and cranberries with a touch of smoke.
fields.taste: Medium bodied, fine tannin and good acidity. Savoury flavours of tobacco, olives, sage, peppercorns and dried fruit with a peppery finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, not as jammy or fruity as I was expecting, more Old World Syrah than New World Shiraz. Earthy, warming and spicy with an element of smoke that comes through nicely especially on the finish. A good pairing for red meat and will not disappoint fans of this style of Syrah.

fields.name: Plaisir de Merle
fields.colour: Aged, very dark ruby red with a mahogany rim.
fields.aroma: Raspberries, sugar plum, cherries, spice, cedar and violets with savoury, meaty, underbrush overtones.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, good backbone of grippy but well integrated tannin and really good acidity. Juicy ripe plump sweet tasting raspberries, forest fruits, plums and vanilla with a lingering sweet sour finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, aged wonderfully, just perfect right now (2017). Great balance and the level of oak is just right. Still mouthwateringly refreshing, fruity and such easy drinking. I thoroughly recommend and a great example of agedMerlot.

fields.name: Liberti Marsala Superiore Garibaldi Dolce
fields.colour: Amber, burnt orange brown.
fields.aroma: Brown sugar, walnuts, butterscotch, toffee, caramel, dried apricots, honey and orange zest with lesser notes of leather and liquorice.
fields.taste: Viscous and rich, full-bodied with medium acidity. Mouth-filling hot tingly texture. Flavours of maple syrup, dried fruits and honey with a good long finish.
fields.overall: My first Marsala and no complaints. Wonderful colour, drier than I was expecting, very attractive pronounced aromas and flavours followed by a lingering finish. A half bottle but only £5 so good QPR. Well worth a try.

fields.name: Aranleón Sólo Bobal
fields.colour: Medium intense, cherry plum with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Cherries, stewed prunes, liquorice, green herbs, lavender, smoke, strong coffee, spice and a little farmyardy.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, mellow tannin giving a smooth texture. Brisk acidity, tart cherry, red berry flavours with a decent length bitter finish.
fields.overall: A decent wine, pronounced nose and the oak is not overdone. Taste was a little tart and bitter but still very drinkable. While not perfect nice to try when you want a change from the norm and good value.

fields.name: DUO des Mers Sauvignon - Viognier
fields.colour: Bright and clear, very pale straw with green nuances.
fields.aroma: Pronounced aromas of gooseberry, ginger, passionfruit, lemon, green herbs, green pea and asparagus.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, nice smooth fleshy texture and medium acidity. Flavours of peach, grapefruit, tangerine, mango and gooseberry with a ripe almost semi-sweet decent length finish.
fields.overall: My only complaint is that the Viognier takes away some of the crisp zestiness of the Sauvignon Blanc but that's a personal thing. Aromatic, full of flavour, it's more New World Sauv than Old World and all in all very enjoyable. Great QPR, food friendly, a guaranteed crowd pleaser.

fields.name: Lustau A Blend Of Oloroso Aged 12 Years Medium Dry Sherry
fields.colour: Polished dark orange brown.
fields.aroma: Fresh varnish, earthy and musty, nutty like bitter walnuts or almonds, toffee, caramel, coconut oil, figs and dried fruit.
fields.taste: Rich, viscous and dry with a nice smooth slightly drying texture. Bitter salty nut flavours of hazelnuts and almonds followed by orange zest and raisins with a lasting finish.
fields.overall: Packed with lots of bitter, salty aromas and flavours and I didn't detect any sweetness as the label suggests. Powerful and wholly enjoyable, the finish just lingers and lingers. A great price and well worth a try.

fields.name: Dow's Trademark Finest Reserve Port
fields.colour: Intense and opaque leading to a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Menthol. medicinal, spice, marmalade, apricot jam, raspberries and plums.
fields.taste: Viscous and surprisingly dry but lacking in body. The fruit aromas are reflected on the palate but it is just not well balanced, the alcohol is too dominant.
fields.overall: It's OK but no more than an ordinary port. Lacks the depth and complexity of better ports and well worth spending a few extra pounds for something more special.

fields.name: De Bortoli DB Reserve Botrytis Sémillon
fields.colour: Intense and bright, deep golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Orange zest, marmalade, apricot jam, honey and something delightfully musky.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied and rich, the sweetness is well balanced by abundant acidity giving a fresh chocolate orange flavour on a decent finish.
fields.overall: Delightful, sweet but also crisp and refreshing making a good after dinner treat. Very good QPR and I would recommend.

fields.name: Quetzal Malbec
fields.winery: L.A. Cetto Winery (Blended by Marks & Spencers)
fields.colour: Very dark inky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Plums, blackberries, sage and sweet tobacco underpinned by savoury meaty game and spice.
fields.taste: Medium body, medium but firm tannin with vibrant acidity. Raspberries, cherries and sugar plum flavours with a spicy nose tingling aftertaste albeit disappointingly short.
fields.overall: A real nice surprise from Mexico, a typical simple Malbec but very enjoyable. Fruity nose and lovely ripe fruit flavours. Tannin, acid, fruit and alcohol are well-balanced. Juicy red fruit dominant style that punches above its price weight and I would recommend.

fields.name: The Society's Côtes de Gascogne
fields.colour: Lustrous, very pale straw yellow with highlights of silver.
fields.aroma: Citrusy, tangy gooseberry, passion-fruit, green apple, ginger, something tropical and a slight minerality.
fields.taste: Dry, light in body with just enough acidity to hold it together. Apple and citrus on the palate with a slightly bitter drying finish.
fields.overall: Just ok in my opinion, a midweek wine. Aromatic and fruity but the flavour and aftertaste is a little bitter and may benefit from a touch more acidity. For the price I cannot complain as it is crisp, fresh and very drinkable but no show stopper.

fields.name: Alpha Zeta Rosato Veronese
fields.colour: Pale salmon pink.
fields.aroma: Subtle and understated, pink grapefruit, strawberries, raspberries, cherries and rose petal.
fields.taste: Dry, light-bodied and lean with good acidity. The red fruit flavours are reflected on the palate but the length is hollow and short and the finish brief.
fields.overall: Disappointing, although the aroma and flavour are very nice they are both muted and need to be intensified. Ok this is not an expensive wine but still expected more, not one to impress the guests and I would not recommend.

fields.name: Henriques and Henriques Sercial, 10 years old
fields.colour: Golden brown/amber.
fields.aroma: Profound, walnuts, hazelnuts, burnt caramel, toffee, raisins, maple syrup, orange and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, full-bodied, rich, vital acidity. Tangy, walnut and maple syrup flavours that endures across the palate and finish.
fields.overall: Reminded me of a nutty Sherry but so much better. Elegant, refined and well balanced, the alcohol is not noticeable. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Villa Mare Bianco
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Something waxy and smoky upfront, chalky minerality and fruit aromas of melon, yellow apple and pineapple.
fields.taste: Light-bodied, abundant acidity and a nice creamy texture. Fruit flavours are soft and disappear all too quickly.
fields.overall: Crisp, fresh and zesty, I quite liked it. The initial smoky aroma is really nice and although the flavour and length are subdued and short I prefer this than something overpowering. Simple, a nice light easy-drinking everyday wine that will suit anyone who likes light crisp whites.

fields.name: Le Calleselle Vino Frizzante Treviso Prosecco
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw with green tinges.
fields.aroma: Soft and subdued aromas of lemon and green apple.
fields.taste: Semi sparkling with fine bubbles, dry, light and refreshing with a nice smooth creamy texture. Good acidity but a subtle short green apple flavour and finish.
fields.overall: Just another ordinary Prosecco. Nothing wrong with it as it is cheap, very easy drinking and crisp but everything could just be more pronounced. Will not buy again, a few extra pounds would get something far superior and I would not recommend.

fields.name: Posada del Rey Tinto
fields.colour: Deep, intense garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Dried herbs, dried fruit like figs and raisins, sugar plum and cherries. Add in tobacco, a touch of spice and an earthiness.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, lightly tannic and a brisk acidity. Red and black berry flavours followed by a decent finish.
fields.overall: Better than I expected, fruity, good length and easy drinking. A good typical Spanish red, a price that punches above its' weight and I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a ripe smooth red.

fields.name: W. & J. Grahams Vintage Port
fields.colour: Aged, mahogany red with a brick rim.
fields.aroma: Intense and spicy, iodine, raisins, apricots, sticky raspberry sauce, fig, cinnamon and an old dusty undisturbed room aroma.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, soft velvety tannin, acidic, viscous, sweet mouth filling spicy texture that endures. Caramel, toffee, marmalade and fig flavours followed by a long spice fuelled finish.
fields.overall: A really enjoyable experience. Not a treat I can afford very often and it did not disappoint. My only complaint is that the alcohol, acidity and fruit just don't seem to be at one, a little unbalanced. But what a wonderful texture and finish, my mouth is aglow.

fields.name: Il Papavero Vino Rosso
fields.colour: Light polished cherry red.
fields.aroma: Cherry, cola, plums, raspberries, sweet liquorice, sun-dried tomatoes and sweet tobacco.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, firm smooth tannin and a lively acidity. All the aromas are repeated on the palate plus roasted tomato with a short but endearing finish.
fields.overall: What a surprise, thoroughly enjoyable. A simple charming wine. Mouthwateringly juicy, all-round fruitiness, easy drinking on its own and great value so what's not to like. Great everyday wine and I would definitely recommend.

fields.name: Albarrada Branco
fields.colour: Shiny golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Ripe stone fruit, melon, beeswax and face cream.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied, good acidity. The flavour is bland and neutral, some lemon but quickly dissipates.
fields.overall: Not much going on here sadly. Ordinary at best, nothing positive to say and will not buy it again.

fields.name: The PatriotsMerlot
fields.colour: Good intensity, rich black cherry.
fields.aroma: Rich, fruit punch, blackcurrants, cherries, leather, cedar, spice and a slight oakiness.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, fresh acidity, moderate ripe tannin and nice cherry, raspberry and dried fruit flavours. Some spice and a smokiness on a medium finish
fields.overall: Not much to complain about, this wine has a bit of everything; fruit, weight, tannin and acidity with all well integrated. Opened up nicely after about an hour, this is a rich, ripe smooth red. In addition good QPR so it is sure to please a wide audience.

fields.name: Old Vines in Young Hands Branco
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow. 
fields.aroma: All citrus upfront, grapefruit, lemon and lime. Floral and green with some honeysuckle, saline, mineral and something that reminds me of beeswax polish.
fields.taste: Medium-light in body with a refreshing lively acidity. Slightly bitter citrus flavours on a medium-short finish.
fields.overall: An entry level white but not bad. All round citrus dominates and may benefit from a touch more ripe fruitiness. A pleasant easy drinking everyday wine, very good QPR , a wine rack filler for a quiet evening.

fields.name: Taylor's Chip Dry White Port
fields.colour: Deep golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Fresh, lots of citrus like orange and quince, marmalade, apricot, spice, dried nuts, dried fruit, almonds and beeswax.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, abundant acidity and mouth filling lip tingling alcohol. Semi-sweet flavours of orange, a drying nutty sensation and the oak is evident on a medium finish.
fields.overall: Nice, a pleasant surprise. My first white Port so didn't know what to expect. Nothing is overdone making a good wine to sip and savour. Not a patch on red Port but nice for a change, an excellent aperitif.

fields.name: Domaine Rotier Les Gravels Gaillac
fields.colour: Dark garnet with a lighter cherry rim.
fields.aroma: Rich ripe fruits, blackcurrants, raspberries, liquorice, prune, cherry and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied with smooth fine tannin and good acidity. Flavours are all fruit, cherry and raspberry followed by a lucious fruity finish.
fields.overall: Really good, juicy, fruity, a real crowd pleaser. Another great SW France find, an unusual blend that works. Nicely priced and shouldn't disappoint if you are looking for something fruity and lively.

fields.name: Boplaas Cape Portuguese White Blend
fields.colour: Light straw yellow with silvery tinges.
fields.aroma: Lemon, perfumed aromas of peach, apricots and tropical fruits.
fields.taste: Medium body, brisk acidity with a nice smooth creamy texture. Lemon, pear, tropical fruit flavours with a decent length finish.
fields.overall: An aromatic and fruit forward wine. Not my favourite style and probably better with food but it is pretty easy-drinking, fresh and fairly priced.

fields.name: Orange Grove Chardonnay
fields.colour: Medium intensity yellow-green.
fields.aroma: Lime, tangerine, honeydew melon, pear, apple and lesser tropical fruit like pineapple and mango.
fields.taste: Very dry, fresh, zingy acidity. Good citrus and apple flavours followed by a lemon peel finish. Well-balanced fruit, acidity and alcohol.
fields.overall: Hard to put down, mouth-watering acidity, fruit is subtle and light. Nothing about this wine is overpowering, all well integrated. Personally I really like this style of wine i.e. light, crisp, subtle and lots of acidity so I can only recommend. Great price for what it delivers and should be well-chilled.

fields.name: The Barbarian Bob Berton's Shiraz -Merlot
fields.colour: Very deep rich garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe jammy red and black fruits; raspberries, blackberries, blackcurrants, fig, forest fruits, vanilla, black olives, tobacco and a good hit of spice.
fields.taste: Big and juicy, fine drying tannin, lively acidity. Lots of fruit flavours, mouth-filling cherry, plum, raspberry, liquorice but also a slight savoury touch like bacon fat followed by a good spicy finish.
fields.overall: A rich, bold wine but not heavy, really easy-drinking. Youthful, fruit forward, powerful nose and flavour, very Australian. Enjoyed it on its own, a very good everyday wine and well worth a try if you are looking for something with a bit of oomph ata good price.

fields.name: Farinelli Vino Rosso
fields.colour: Dark ruby red with a lighter red rim.
fields.aroma: Initially very bitter sour cherries, dried herbs, chemical like, not pleasant at all.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, moderate firm grippy tannin and medium acidity. Bland and muted, might as well have a glass of water.
fields.overall: Very disappointing, I don't get any of the aromas or flavours outlined in the wine description, it's just bitter and sour all round. Won't buy again and can't recommend. Much better versions out there even at this low price level. Decanting did not improve it either.

fields.name: La Gioiosa et Amorosa Rosea NV Brut
fields.winery: La Gioiosa SPA, Crocetta Del Montello
fields.colour: Pale salmon pink.
fields.aroma: Floral and fruity, begins citrusy; grapefruit and orange peel followed by apple, cherry, strawberry and pomegranate.
fields.taste: Dry, light and crisp. Abundant acidity, nice lively bubbles with subtle red fruit flavours.
fields.overall: Delicate and simple but a very tasty easy drinking sparkling wine. Nice fruity aromas and taste, a good party wine not to be taken seriously, just enjoy it.

fields.name: Il Papavero Vino Bianco
fields.colour: Pale straw with a silvery streak.
fields.aroma: Singed grass or hay aroma upfront with secondary notes of apple, lime and quince.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied and dry. Fresh acidity, a nice smooth texture, subtle citrus flavours on a short-medium finish.
fields.overall: A decent wine rack filler. Simple but fairly priced offering nice aromas but lacking a little in flavour. Don't expect too much and this wine will deliver if you are looking for a light, fresh, food friendly wine. Serve well chilled.

fields.name: Finca las Rejas Blanco NV
fields.colour: Bright, light straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Sweet lemon, lime, melon and cut grass.
fields.taste: Light in body, crisp lively acidity with a refreshing texture. Subtle lemon and apple flavours and the finish is quite short.
fields.overall: A soft delicate wine. It's quite nice but a little bland, nice nose but everything else seems understated. Not complaining as it is not bad and very drinkable, it's just not memorable, a decent midweeker at a fair price.

fields.name: Paris Street Pinot Grigio
fields.colour: Very light almost limpid lemon yellow with a touch of silver/green.
fields.aroma: Sharp alcohol, slight nuttiness, saline, citrus zest, flowers, coconut and kiwi.
fields.taste: Very dry, crisp, light in body with just enough acidity. Mild citrus flavour with a slightly bitter after-taste.
fields.overall: Very ordinary, it just seems a bit unbalanced. Don't want to knock it too much as it has a nice nose, is easy-drinking and is fairly priced. A midweeker, just not memorable.

fields.name: GinestieresMerlot
fields.colour: Garnet red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Pungent, very herbal, lavender, violets and spice with lesser notes fruity notes of plum, raspberry and blackcurrant.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied with soft subtle lightly drying tannin. Flavours of raspberry and cherry on a medium sharp slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Disappointing, lacked fruitiness, weak and sour that evolved a little with time but not much. Probably better with food, decent value just don't expect too much. Better available at the same price.

fields.name: Pitchfork Margaret River Sémillon Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Very pale straw with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Quite pronounced, citrusy lemon and lime, pear and also something green or herbaceous like asparagus.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied with sharp and zesty mouth-watering acidity. Apple and lemon flavour and a decent mid-length finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, not astounding but fresh and crisp with nice aromas and taste. Fairly priced and will suit anyone looking for something light, tart and plenty of flavour.

fields.name: Cockburn's Late Bottled Vintage Port
fields.colour: Opaque leading to a rich red rim.
fields.aroma: Upfront this is spicy and nose tingling. Stewed black fruit, figs, butterscotch, apricot, orange, marmalade, toffee, brown sugar and an earthiness like mushrooms.
fields.taste: Really viscous, rich and succelent, medium-full bodied, fine tannin with good acidity. Packed with ripe fruit flavours and a good finish.
fields.overall: Absolutely no compliants, lacks the complexity of finer ports but for the money who cares, a bargain. Very well-balanced, lots of alcohol but not noticeable when combined with the fruit, acid and light tannin. Lovely sweet finish and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Don Cayetano Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with a hint of green.
fields.aroma: Clean and sharp with a touch of spice, standard SB gooseberry and grassiness with the addition of melon, lemon, apple and something tropical like kiwi or passion fruit.
fields.taste: Tangy and citrusy on the palate. Light in body but full flavoured and refreshing acidity with a nice green apple and lemon finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, really fresh and crisp. Fruit forward but not as pungent as some NZ Sauv Blanc. A good choice if you are looking for a style that is juicy and aromatic. Great on its own and served well chilled. Not a blockbluster but for the money very good value.

fields.name: Palacio del Conde Gran Reserva
fields.winery: Vinos de la Vina, Anecoop S. Coop.
fields.colour: Deep, intense garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Spice, raspberry, cherry, plum, sweet tobacco, dried rosemary, cedar, vanilla and dried fruit.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, rich and fruit driven. Smooth drying tannin, red fruit flavours are reflected on the palate, oak and hint of spice on the medium finish.
fields.overall: Hard to believe it's a Gran Reserva, very moreish, fruity almost sweet but nicely offset by a touch of wood. After decanting for an hour this will suit anyone looking for a smooth ripe red. Add in a good price and this is a must try.

fields.name: Berton The Barbarian Sémillon Chardonnay Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Bright straw yellow almost gold.
fields.aroma: Upfront, warm bread, honey and some burnt caramel backed up by quince, lemon lime jam, crisp apple and a touch of spiciness.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, good lingering lemony acidity with a buttery smooth texture. Honey, citrus and apple on the palate with a nice finish.
fields.overall: No complaints here, flavoursome and aromatic, rich but refreshing, decent finish, well-balanced. At the price I can only recommend.

fields.name: La Fontana Vecchia Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Very pale lemon yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Lemon, gooseberry, guava, green tea and herbaceous.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, lightly structured with a citrus backbone. Subtle subdued citrus flavour followed by a tangy bitter finish.
fields.overall: A disappointing Sauv Blanc, it just seems to lack that fruity zip of better examples. Ok as a midweek wine but immediately forgettable. At the price there are better options available and I will not be buying this again.

fields.name: Domaine du Bosc, Pays d'Oc, Petit Verdot
fields.region: Languedoc Roussillon, Vin de Pays - IGP
fields.colour: Dark inky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe dense black fruit, blackberries and plum, herbal like lilac, lavender or thyme, liquorice, clove, subtle earthiness of cured meat and quite a kick of spice.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, and rich firm chewy tannin but not too much. Black fruits and liquorice like the nose with a medium finish.
fields.overall: Nice, although nothing about this wine stands out I found it very pleasant on its own. Nice nose, easy-drinking and my only complaints are perhaps the strong herbiness (a personal thing) and it may lack a little in flavour. Well worth the money, give it a try for something different. Decanted for an hour.

fields.name: La Portena Shiraz-Malbec
fields.colour: Garnet with a purple rim. Lighter than I expected.
fields.aroma: Tobacco, wild game, lavender and espresso followed by sour cherry, plum and bramble.
fields.taste: Med-light bodied, very little tannin, brisk acidity but thin and watery. Nice flavours of fruit cake and sweet and sour cherries with a med slightly spicy finish.
fields.overall: Expected something with a bit more oomph. Lacks body, tannin, fruitiness and richness you would expect from such a blend. Can't recommend and better options available for the price.

fields.name: Gambellara Classico
fields.colour: Bright and fresh, pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Delicate, sweet stewed apples, pear, floral, tangerine and brine.
fields.taste: Crisp and fresh, medium-full bodied with a lively acidity. Good tangerine, saline and pear flavoured mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: Liked it, not outstanding but a decent wine. Nice nose, nice flavours and well-balanced. I hate to use the word ordinary but nothing stands out. Good QPR, an easy-drinker, shouldn't disappoint and worth a try.

fields.name: Kaap Plass Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Expressive, lemon, grass, hay, gooseberry, green herbs, asparagus, apple, yeast with lesser notes of tropical fruits like pineapple and passionfruit.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, refreshing, slight tanginess, enough acidity to give the wine a crisp tart backbone. A nice smooth texture but the flavours are not as profround as the aromas, some bitter lemon and saline but all to brief.
fields.overall: Somewhere between Old World and New World but not remarkable. Nice nose but the taste and finish let it down. At the price I can't complain and certainly very drinkable but just not memorable.

fields.name: Tetramythos Black Of Kalavryta
fields.colour: Medium intensity, dark cherry red with a light ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe raspberries, cherries plus more savoury cranberries/redcurrants. Notes of leather, tobacco and something herbal.
fields.taste: Medium-light in body, soft and mellow texture with fine-grained tannin and abundant acidity. Sour cherry and liquorice flavours with a good peppery finish.
fields.overall: A pleasure to drink, so smooth and supple. Fruity, fresh, light and easy-drinking. Lacks a little in body but otherwise no complaints for a wine at this price. A really good find and I would definitely buy it again.

fields.name: AndesterraMerlot
fields.colour: Intense, rich dark cherry.
fields.aroma: Big, ripe and juicy. Black fruits, plum, earth, leather, prunes, figs and baking spices.
fields.taste: Medium bodied, rich, moderately tannic with a smooth texture and mouthwateringly acidity. Jam-like black fruit and chocolate flavours and a decent slightly drying finish.
fields.overall: Hard to put down, so fruity and juicy this wine is delicious and moreish. A simple straightforward wine but outweighs its price and will not disappoint anyone who likes ripe smooth reds.

fields.name: The Society's Cava Reserva Brut NV
fields.colour: Medium golden yellow with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Quite aromatic, sharp tangy green apple, lime, quince, grapefruit, a hint of smoke and buttered toast or honey.
fields.taste: Very dry, clean and crisp, good acidity with large lively bubbles at first but they die quickly. Green apple, citrus and yeast flavours, nice texture with a mildly mouth drying finish.
fields.overall: Very good for the price, notes of yeast and bread are very evident giving it what Prosecco lacks. Bubbles are larger and not as fine as those of Champagne but what do you want at this price. Not perfect but very fragrant, flavoursome, zesty and very much a Champagne styled wine. A crowd pleaser and I would definitely recommend.

fields.name: Château Roumieu-Lacoste Sauternes
fields.colour: Deep golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Apricot, orange peel, marmalade, pear, honey and a nuttiness like hazelnut or almond.
fields.taste: Rich and sweet. Medium-bodied with abundant acidity to balance the sweetness. Long mid-palate that moves from apricots to pineapple to honey and marzipan and a long refreshing finish.
fields.overall: My first Sauternes and what a delight. Sweetness is well balanced, so not syrupy or sickly sweet. Profound nose, fantastic length of flavour and a lingering finish. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Bodegas Murua Aclys Crianza
fields.colour: Medium deep garnet with a terracotta rim.
fields.aroma: Varnish, pine tar, tobacco, cedar, leather, vanilla, dried flowers, dried fruit, hint of coconut and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Medium bodied but quite rich with moderate herbaceous tannin and a velvety texture. Raspberry, cherry and plum flavours with a nice liquorice finish and a sweet aftertaste.
fields.overall: Lots of oak especially on the nose but it is nicely integrated and not overpowering. Fruit comes to the fore in the taste and the wine just seems to leave a nice coating around your mouth. Really enjoyable and I would recommend.

fields.name: Domaine Félines-Jourdan, Picpoul de Pinet
fields.region: Picpoul de Pinet, Languedoc and Roussillon
fields.colour: Bright, light golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Expressive, clean and fresh, lemon, tropical fruit like guava or pineapple, mineral and wet crushed stones.
fields.taste: Medium body, dry, zippy with a refreshing character. Lots of citrus and saline flavours with a lemony slightly bitter good length finish.
fields.overall: A good example of Picpoul de Pinet. I have tried zestier, crisper examples but there is enough acidity to give a fresh easy-drinking wine that has abundant aromas and flavours. No complaints, it's good value, tasty, a crowd pleaser so I can only recommend.

fields.name: ‘Dirt Track' Pinotage by Duncan Savage
fields.colour: Deep red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Unattractive chemical aroma upfront like nail polish remover. Get past that and you may find liquorice, savoury cranberries, redcurrants and just a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, little tannin, soft smooth texture. Flavours vary from subtle raspberry and cherry to more savoury and meaty with a touch of sweetness on the finish.
fields.overall: Disappointing, I was expecting more smokiness and spice. Just seems to be lacking in both flavour and aroma. Can't recommend.

fields.name: Jacob's Creek Orlando Shiraz - Cabernet
fields.colour: Aged, dark reddish brown with a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: Rich and savoury a nice mix of fruit and oak. Leather, cedar, graphite, petrichor, sweet tobacco, sage, ripe black fruits, plum, olive, liqourice and fruitcake.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, very mild light tannin and a silky smooth texture. Savoury on the palate, something like dark chocolate or coffee with a long liquorice laced finish.
