fields.overall: That wonderful smell you only get from an aged wine, complexity, a good balance between fruit, oak and tannin makes this a winner. Thoroughly enjoyed from start to finish. May be hard to come by but well worth seeking out.

fields.name: Luigi Einaudi Dogliani
fields.colour: Good intensity, dark cherry red.
fields.aroma: Ripe sweet red and black fruit, raspberries, blackberries, cherry, liquorice, mocha and a touch of almond.
fields.taste: Delicate and fruity, medium-full bodied, soft tannin giving a velvety texture. Rich red fruit flavours with a medium length finish.
fields.overall: My first Dolcetto and I am very pleased. Fruit forward and rich but not a heavy wine, generous and exuberant this is well worth the money. I would recommend.

fields.name: Kanonkop Kadette Pinotage Rosé
fields.colour: Very pale light onion skin pink.
fields.aroma: Fresh and fruity, crunchy red fruit, apple, tropical fruit, sour cherry, melon, grapefruit and fennel.
fields.taste: Fleshy, fruity but dry, full flavoured with juicy acidity. Well structured, fresh slightly creamy texture with a good spicy finish.
fields.overall: Don't be fooled by the light colour this wine packs quite a punch. Aromatic, lots of flavour and the zesty acidity makes this very easy drinking. I enjoyed on its own and at the price it is hard to find fault. A robust rosé, not a light summers day gulper.

fields.name: Dveri Pax Šipon
fields.colour: Spritzy, very pale limpid gold with a streak of green.
fields.aroma: Distinctive, grassy and floral, lemon, grapefruit, minerals, smoke and something like warm bread or honey.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, very dry, brisk acidity and a smooth texture. Flavours are subtle, some lemon and pear with a medium finish.
fields.overall: More floral/herbal and mineral than fruity. Lacks flavour in my opinion, a bit bland. On a positive note, a nice nose, fresh and acidic making it easy drinking, certainly a change frome the norm. A decent midweek wine, fairly priced just not memorable.

fields.name: Manfredi Nebbiolo d'Alba
fields.colour: Pale cherry with ruby to orange tinges.
fields.aroma: Cherry, raspberry syrup, menthol, liquorice, cinnamon, roses, dried fruit and white pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, firm tight chewy tannin with abundant acidity, a well rounded wine. Cherry and raspberry aromas are repeated on the palate with a drying medium finish.
fields.overall: A crisp aromatic example of Nebbiolo and I really liked it. Well balanced, warming and may benefit from a bit more ageing as it is quite tannic but I personally like that. All in all no complaints and I would recommend as a good alternative to the more expensive Barolo.

fields.name: Grace Lane Riesling
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Intense, concentrated orange squash, fruit punch, petrol, burnt plastic, spicy mulled wine, lychee, honey, buttered toast, honeysuckle and lime.
fields.taste: Medium in body, rich and full flavoured but the vital acidity makes the wine well rounded, nice and easy to drink. Flavours of spicy apple juice, orange and lychee with a good semi-sweet finish.
fields.overall: Nice nose and the touch of petrol is lovely. Lush fruit flavours that make a very drinkable wine but it is missing the steely minerality of some Rieslings. Not a match for a good Mosel but good QPR, nice on its own and well worth a try.

fields.name: W. & J. Graham's Late Bottled Vintage Port
fields.region: Vila Nova de Gaia (The Malvedos - Tua - Vila Velha - Vale de Malhadas and Lages vineyards)
fields.colour: Opaque purple.
fields.aroma: Leads off with a burst of nose tingling mint followed by dried fruit, toffee, espresso, menthol, butterscotch, milk chocolate and vanilla.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, concentrated, rich and rounded, acidic with a smooth velvety texture. Mouth coating flavours of apricot, marmalade and raspberry sauce.
fields.overall: A wonderful port from start to finish, no complaints, at the price this is cracking stuff. Wholly recommend, a warming treat.

fields.name: Mesa Primo Scuro
fields.colour: Lovely colour, bright carmine red with a cherry rim.
fields.aroma: Blackcurrant, crushed red berries, cherry, strawberry, something floral and pepper.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, med acidity, soft well integrated tannin. Candied strawberry, raspberry and cherry flavours with a med length finish.
fields.overall: igh in alcohol but otherwise a light Grenache. Nice nose, flavour and finish. A simple wine but at the price it delivers and well worth a try if you are looking for something ripe and smooth and easy drinking.

fields.name: Robert Denogent Vieilles Vignes Pouilly-Fuissé 'Les Carrons'
fields.colour: Deep golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Intense, honey, bruised/stewed apple, buttered toast, burnt caramel, crushed gravel, musk, toffee, wet wool but in a good way and smoke.
fields.taste: Rich, full and well rounded. Creamy texture with a good streak of acidity to retain a freshness. Aromas are reflected on the palate with the addition of apricot and orange. Long smoky, nutty mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: Blockbuster, aged beautifully, well balanced, packed full of aroma and flavour, reminded me of a Sauternes.

fields.name: Rainha do Mar Tinto
fields.winery: Agricultural Cooperative San Isidro De Pegões - Jaime Quendera (Winemaker)
fields.colour: Medium depth bright cherry red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Juicy red berries, raspberries, cherry, liquorice, a nice savoury damp forest floor note and a good waft of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-light in body, moderate slightly chewy tannin giving a nice gripping texture. Flavors of red berries, liquorice and green herb and a medium mouth drying finish.
fields.overall: A good solid wine. Simple, nothing fancy or complex but nice nose, nice flavour and a decent finish. I find Portuguese wines to be hit and miss but this is a good midweek wine, good value and well worth a try.

fields.name: Blind Spot Montepulciano
fields.colour: Very dark garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Rich, red and black berries, plum, coffee, cola, cloves, tar, herbs and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, soft ripe tannin giving a nice smooth texture. Coffee and berry aromas are reflected on the palate with a very long finish.
fields.overall: What a surprise, a very enjoyable wine. Nose, texture, flavour, balance, it just works. A rare oddity that at the price shouldn't be missed, highly recommend.

fields.name: Blau
fields.colour: Dark ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Savoury at first, cured meat, barbeque smoke, cedar, new leather with notes of black fruits, prunes, spice and a hint of Rosemary.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, brisk acidity and soft tannin giving a round ripe texture. Oak is evident in the taste, similar to the nose with a medium finish.
fields.overall: No complaints here, a good mix of fruit, oak and acidity, a well structured wine. Great value and I would recommend if you are a fan of rich dense reds.

fields.name: Gratien & Meyer The Society's Saumur Brut
fields.colour: Pale onion skin pink.
fields.aroma: Subtle, lemon, grapefruit, raspberry, strawberry, bruised apple and baking spice.
fields.taste: Dry, delicate with good acidity and lively persistent bubbles. Light flavours of grapefruit and red fruit, balanced with a clean fresh finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, light, refreshing, a crowd pleaser. Although the nose and flavour are subtle, they are precise and the acidity makes it very easy drinking. Not perfect, although made in the traditional method it is no Champagne but that is not a criticism, it is great value, very enjoyable, a frivolous fun sparkling wine.

fields.name: Domaine Alain Malet Réserve
fields.colour: Translucent, bright, very pale silver green.
fields.aroma: Fresh cut grass, lime, gooseberry, green melon, lemon grass, apple, bitter green herbs and tinned peas.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, good acidity with subtle but mouth-filling taste with a nice creamy smooth texture. Flavours like the nose are mostly grassy and herbal with a saline decent length finish.
fields.overall: My preferred style of Sauvignon Blanc; nothing over-powering, less-ripe fruit and stony. Only complaint is that it may be a little sharp and bitter but overall a very nice wine and well worth a try if you are looking for something dry, unoaked and aromatic.

fields.name: Signargues, Côtes-du-Rhône Villages, La Font du Vent
fields.colour: Intense, dark garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Rich, black berry fruits, cherry, strawberry, damson, chocolate, smoke, liquorice, eucalyptus and pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied but with a freshness, lively mouthwatering acidity, medium-low in tannin giving a smooth creamy texture. Almost sweet tasting, fruit flavours of strawberry, plum and milk chocolate with matt silky long finish. The high alcohol adds a heat to the finish.
fields.overall: So nice, a truly smooth easy drinking wine that will please a mass audience. Big, warm, juicy, fruity and moreish. Good value for what you get, if rich dense reds are for you then I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Narince Vinkara
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow with a touch of silver.
fields.aroma: Citrus aromas dominate, lemon, grapefruit and orange peel but also stone fruits, pineapple and mango.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, dry with crisp acidity. Citrus aromas are repeated on the palate and it has a slight but pleasant bitterness/nuttiness to a medium length finish.
fields.overall: Not bad, no expectations for something this obscure and no complaints. Fresh and well-balanced making a wine that is pleasant and easy drinking. Nothing outstanding but good value and worth a punt if you want something that's a bit different.

fields.name: Château Ksara Réserve du Couvent
fields.colour: Medium deep garnet with a lighter ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Both red and black fruits, raspberry, cherry, blackberries, plum, cranberry. In addition, coffee, chocolate, leather, wet gravel and vanilla with a nose tingling hit of eucalyptus, menthol and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, moderate tannin with good acidity, giving a somewhat chewy, drying texture. Nice red fruit flavours, mid-palate and finish are both very good
fields.overall: No complaints here, a little bit of everything, fruit, wood, acidity and not overly heavy. Expresses all the characteristics of the grapes in the blend so suitable to a wide audience, well worth a try.

fields.name: Stéphane Aviron, Beaujolais Quincié
fields.colour: Bright, light crimson red.
fields.aroma: Red fruit aromas of sour cherry, raspberry and redcurrant with herbal notes of violets and black tea.
fields.taste: Light in body, low in tannin but abundant fresh acidity and an almost candied sweet flavour of cherry and raspberry. A well structured wine that finishes with a nice succulent lingering sour cherry taste.
fields.overall: Typical Beaujolais, all red fruit, refreshing, exuberant and easy-drinking. Good QPR, not outstanding but a good midweek wine and will please anyone looking for a style that is light, lively and fruity.

fields.name: Los Hermanos Manzanos Viura - Chardonnay
fields.colour: Lustrous, very pale straw yellow with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Young crunchy fruit, citrus aromas of lemon and mandarin orange, subtly bitter and nutty, apple, white peach and creme brulee/butter.
fields.taste: Very dry, refreshing acidity, lots of body with a nice creamy texture. Very subtle flavours, some nuts and bitter lemon but the finish is all to brief.
fields.overall: This wine is more about the nose than the taste. Nice but a little bland and I was expecting a bit more oomph. On a positive, it is crisp and mouth-watering, the fruit and oak is nicely balanced, I like the bitterness and it is a great aperitif on a warm evening. Worth a try but not all that memorable.

fields.name: Saleta Moscatel-Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Clean and vivid, pale straw with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, fresh and floral, like orange blossom. Citrus aromas of lemon and mandarin orange followed by notes of peach and apricot.
fields.taste: Dry, light with sharp acidity.Tangy citrus and apple flavours dominate but the nice drying medium finish brings lychee and apricots.
fields.overall: Nice even if a little unbalanced, acidity seems to overpower the fruit. Well chilled this was welcome on a hot day. A good everyday wine and at the price very good value and well worth picking up.

fields.name: Viña Marichalar Reserva
fields.colour: Medium intensity, garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Mature red fruit, raspberries, cranberries, cherries and plum with sweet tobacco, liquorice, vanilla, leather, dried flowers and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, firm ripe tannin that gives a drying texture. Rich with both sweet and savoury flavours of cherries, chocolate and coffee with a good mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: Still very young, fruit forward with a little of the oak coming through. Not a complaint as this is wholly enjoyable, Good now but time will improve this wine. Recommend.

fields.name: Madfish Great Southern Riesling
fields.colour: Straw yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Intense, lime cordial, pear, honeysuckle, nectarine and pineapple.
fields.taste: Light, brisk acidity, juicy and thirst quenching. Medium depth green apple and citrussy flavours that lead into a dry clean medium length finish. Nice petrol after-taste.
fields.overall: Nice but just didn't grab my attention. Appealing nose but flavours are a little soft and underwhelming. I would have liked more minerality, more steeliness. A good wine for a hot day, nice price but better Rieslings out there.

fields.name: Touraine 'La Croix Angier', Alpha Loire Domaines
fields.colour: Profound crimson red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Sour cherry, raspberry, bramble fruits, coffee, roasted peppers, an earthiness like mushrooms.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, firm tannin with a bit of grip and a fresh acidity. A touch of sweetness to the cherry, raspberry, blueberry, cola and sweet tobacco flavours. Finish is medium and slightly spicy.
fields.overall: A lot more fruit than I was expecting. Not exciting but hard to find fault, nice aroma and flavour, a midweek wine, good value and worth a try.

fields.name: Lornano Chianti Classico
fields.colour: Brilliant, lively carmine red.
fields.aroma: Lots of red fruit, plum, cherry, roasted tomato with clove, espresso, tobacco, a touch herbal and nose tingling pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, fresh, acidic and very tannic giving a mouth puckering texture. Nice cherry and redcurrant flavours, oak is evident but subtle. Medium+ finish.
fields.overall: Oh yes, very nice Chianti, juicy, crisp, and refreshing. Tannic but well structured making easy drinking. Well worth the money and a great match for typical Italian tomato based dishes. Recommend.

fields.name: The Societys Slovenian White
fields.colour: Spritzy, very pale gold with a touch of silver.
fields.aroma: Fresh pronounced aromas, pear, peach, tangy green apple, citrus fruits, floral, wet slate minerality, a touch of smoke and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied with mouthwatering acidity. Flavour is not nearly as forward as the nose, delicate apple and grapefruit with a decent finish.
fields.overall: No complaints here, harmonious with a marked acidity making very easy drinking. An elegant wine, fresh and refined but with a steely mineral backbone. Good value and I would buy this again.

fields.name: Marques de Valdzcasa Carinena Gran Reserva
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: A sweetness, dried black and red fruit, figs, liquorice, raisins and notes of leather, chocolate and sweet spice.
fields.taste: Rich, medium-full bodied, mild mellow tannin giving a velvety texture. Nice combination of fruit, chocolate and tobacco flavours with a medium strawberry sauce finish.
fields.overall: Really nice, my favourite thing is the smooth texture and delicious after-taste. Personally I would like more tannin but that's a minor thing. Worth the money and I would recommend.

fields.name: Thymiopoulos Naoussa Jeunes Vignes
fields.colour: Attractive cherry red.
fields.aroma: A little understated, sour cherry, strawberry and dried herbs with just a hint of pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, ripe, juicy, lots of acidity and the soft fine tannin add structure. Lovely almost sweet flavours of cherry, plum, liquorice and sun-dried tomatoes. Medium- finish.
fields.overall: Elegant probably best describes this wine. Everything in moderation, well-balanced making a light easy-drinking wine. Just enough weight and more about the flavour than the nose but all in all very pleasant and well worth trying.

fields.name: Brancott Estate Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Vibrant and lustrous, pale straw with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: So pungent, immediate gooseberry, passion-fruit and lemon followed by grass/nettle, asparagus, kiwi, pear and a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Dry, firm acidity, crunchy melon, grapefruit and apple flavours with a nice pleasant clean med+ honey finish. The medium body and smooth texture make this wine rounded and well-balanced.
fields.overall: Unmistakable typical in your face NZ Sauv Blanc. Very fruit forward, exuberant, crisp and fresh. Seems quite well made but too much of everything for my taste but will be loved by any fan of this style, a crowd pleaser.

fields.name: Pink Port NV
fields.winery: David Guimaraens (winemaker) bottled by Quinta and Vineyard Bottlers
fields.colour: Pale ruby.
fields.aroma: Rich, cherry, raspberry sauce, strawberry, toffee and apricots with notes of marmalade, butterscotch, caramel and baking spices.
fields.taste: Viscous, full but lifted by good acidity adding a fresh zestiness. Flavours include apricot, marmalade with nuances of honey and grapefruit followed by a hot spicy med- finish.
fields.overall: A little disappointing, certainly more powerful than I was expecting but it lacks the depth and sweetness that a full port brings. Can't complain as it is fresh, lively and easy-drinking. Not for the purist, more of a novelty than a go to wine.

fields.name: Cuvée Royale Brut Crémant de Limoux NV
fields.colour: Medium sized persistent bubbles, pale straw with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Attractive sourdough, yeast, biscuit, apple tart and apricot.
fields.taste: Soft bubbles with bread, yeast and bruised apple flavours. Dry, crisp with lively mouth-watering acidity that gives a drying texture but the after-taste is more rounded and creamy.
fields.overall: No Champagne but a good alternative. Gives that lovely yeasty/dough aroma and flavour but in a more understated way. Good value, fun and frivolous, worth a try.

fields.name: Côtes de Saint-Mont, Les Vignes Retrouvées
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw with a noticeable green tinge.
fields.aroma: Intense, floral and smoky. Grass, green herbs, lemon, grapefruit, ripe tropical fruit and apple.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, soft acidity, ripe creamy mouth-filling texture. Grapefruit flavour but also a toastiness with a strong somewhat bitter after-taste.
fields.overall: Just ok in my opinion. Seems a bit heavy, maybe needs more acidity. I do like the bitter-sweet taste however, certainly different. If you want to try something new this is a good choice, a midweek wine, good value, just not memorable.

fields.name: Château Yon-Figeac Saint-Émilion (Grand Cru Classé)
fields.colour: Aged, mahoghany core with a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: Complex, not fruity, cedar, pencil shavings, musty, smoke, tobacco leaf, mint, leather and something sweet like dried fruit.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, rich and dense, moderately tannic giving a slightly drying grippy texture. Fruit flavours have gone and are replaced by wood, charcoal, damp earth, a savouriness. Long lingering finish.
fields.overall: Perhaps a little past its best but still delightful. I just love those aged aromas. Lacking fruit but still well-structured. A great find and well worth a try for any Bordeaux fan.

fields.name: The Society's Hunter Valley Sémillon
fields.colour: Bright and vibrant, very pale straw with green tinges.
fields.aroma: Med intensity, lemon, green apple, melon and rich apricot.
fields.taste: Dry, light-bodied with a crisp refreshing acidity. Lemon and apple flavours are quite subtle and the finish med- but it leaves a very nice mouth-filling creaminess.
fields.overall: Simple but approachable, brilliantly refreshing on a hot summers evening. Light and zesty, everything about this wine is just nice. Would be interesting to see how it develops. Good QPR, a worthy buy.

fields.name: Pierre Besinet Grenache Blanc
fields.colour: Pale golden green.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, fresh apple, lemon, pear and a sweet floral note of honeysuckle.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, dry, medium acidtiy. This wine has a rounded full texture and a flavour I can only describe as banana mousse. Short finish.
fields.overall: Pleasantly surprised, a subtle, straightforward wine but for the price it delivers. Nice nose, texture and flavour. A great midweek wine, serve well chilled, don't expect too much and enjoy.

fields.name: Finca Las Lomas Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Light almost limpid, pale straw straw with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Initially vegetal and herbaceous, nettle and green pepper followed by gooseberry, kiwi, passionfruit and melon.
fields.taste: Dry, med-light bodied, brisk acidity with a clean decent length finish. Saline quality, lightly structured with a citrus backbone.
fields.overall: Very nice, crisp, refreshing and the mouthwatering acidity makes very easy-drinking. Good value, an entry level SB that will not disappoint any fan of aromatic juicy wines.

fields.name: Nuy Myn Van Oorsprong Muskadel
fields.colour: Rusty orange, thick like maple syrup.
fields.aroma: At first very potent with an overpowering nose tingling spiciness. But this does calm down to reveal aromas of orange, apricot, dried fruit, dense red fruit (cranberries, redcurrant) and black tea.
fields.taste: Viscous, full, rich with abundant acidity giving it a nice balance. Delightful sweet flavours of red berries with a warming long spicy finish.
fields.overall: Absolutely delicious, initially the nose was a little off putting but once that settled down this was delightful. The acidity makes this a winner, unctuous and mouthwatering. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Gruber Röschitz White! Pepp Riesling
fields.colour: Clear and bright, pale straw.
fields.aroma: Ripe apple, honeysuckle, stone fruit, lime, white pepper and just a hint of smoky petrol.
fields.taste: Dry, light with zippy mouthwatering acidity. Delicate citrussy and apricot flavour, a mineral steeliness but the finish is disappointingly short.
fields.overall: It's crisp, refreshing and the acidity makes it hard to put down but unremarkable. Can't find fault, I like the dryness and it went down well on a warm summer evening. Good price, middle of the road Riesling, worth a try.

fields.name: Koyle Don Cande Muscat
fields.colour: Bright and fresh, golden straw.
fields.aroma: Floral and perfumy but not overpowering, musk, honey, grapes, honeydew melon, saline and something like damp wool but in a good way.
fields.taste: Dry, fresh acidity, light-medium bodied with a smooth texture. Orange peel and honeysuckle flavours are a little subdued followed by a medium- salty finish.
fields.overall: An elegant wine, light, fresh and fruity but dry, it all fits together nicely. For me the nose is the best thing. A really good choice at a good price. Serve well-chilled.

fields.name: Bleasdale Langhorne Creek Sparkling Shiraz
fields.colour: Lovely purple mousse, dense dark inky red with a crimson rim.
fields.aroma: Blackberries, blueberries, dried plum, cranberry and liquorice with notes of tobacco and vanilla.
fields.taste: Rich, big and bold, lightly astringent, medium acidity. Flavours of cranberry, raspberry sauce, coffee and choclate with a spicy good length oaky finish.
fields.overall: Profound and very rich, the bubbles dissipate quickly and I found this makes the wine a bit heavy going. A little disappointed, I was hoping for something fresher and livelier. On a plus, nice flavours and good finish but very hard to recommend as better alternatives available.

fields.name: Marisco Vineyards Three Terraces Waihopai Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Very pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Profound and pungent, gooseberry, passionfruit, grapefruit, peach, apricot, grass, asparagus and nettle.
fields.taste: Dry, vibrant tangy acidity, light in body but everything else is full on. Fruit aromas are reflected on the palate with a citrus finish that lasts.
fields.overall: Stereotypical NZ Sauv Blanc, overpowering in all aspects for my taste. Very crisp and refreshing, good on a summer evening. If this juicy and aromatic style is what you like then this is a must try at a fair price.

fields.name: The Society’s Beaujolais-Villages
fields.colour: Deep ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Pleasant and youthful, raspberry, cherry, cranberries, redcurrants, plums, banana and pepper.
fields.taste: Light and fruity, low in tannin and alcohol with brisk acidity. Sour cherry, violets and peppercorn flavours with banana and pepper evident on the nice somewhat succulent finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, juicy, light, fresh and fruity, great drinking on a warm evening. The finish is delicious. For the price this wine delivers, a good Beaujolais, highly recommend.

fields.name: Quinta de Azevedo Vinho Verde
fields.winery: Quinta de Azevedo winery, Sogrape Vinhos
fields.colour: Lively and bright, very pale lemon with a silver/green tinge.
fields.aroma: Youthful and fresh, ripe fruit; lemon, grapefruit and melon. Wax-scented something floral and a mineral note.
fields.taste: Dry, refreshing with zesty acidity. Simple soft grapefruit and stone fruit (nectarine) flavours with a tangy edge and a delicate clean smooth finish.
fields.overall: My favourite style of white, medium-light, crisp, mouthwatering acidity and just what was needed on a warm June evening. Well rounded, subtly fruity, acidic, a bit of body, no element overwhelmed another. A good uncomplicated wine at a great price and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Pietralata Sannio Greco, Janare
fields.colour: Bright, golden straw.
fields.aroma: Delicate, lemon peel, honey, apricot and something like melting wax.
fields.taste: Dry and rich, firm acidity, feels round and full on the palate, balanced. Bitter citrus flavours followed by a med- smooth finish with a tingling spicy after-taste.
fields.overall: A good solid well made wine. Everything about it is nice, a little understated and could do with a bit more oomph but that's not a complaint. Fairly priced and I would buy again. A good choice for those who like fuller more opulent wines.

fields.name: Adega de Pegões Moscatel de Setúbal
fields.colour: Beautiful luminous burnt orange.
fields.aroma: Intense, apricot, marmalade, orange peel, honey, caramel and toffee with a nose tingling spice.
fields.taste: Viscous and full, good acidity but sharp. Flavours are all orange and apricot jam followed by a hot and spicy finish.
fields.overall: Very nice for the price but certainly better out there. There's a spiciness that seems to overwhelm everything else. On the plus side it is pleasant, warming and nice to sip and savour. Nice to try but wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Cruz de Piedra Garnacha
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Succulent jammy raspberry and blackberries, herbal notes of lavender and black tea with liquorice, leather and sweet spice.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, alcohol is evident, abundant firm chewy tannin but tart acidity, unbalanced. Full flavoured, plum, liquorice, and raspberries with a decent slightly spicy finish.
fields.overall: Simple straightforward wine. Nice aroma and flavour, juicy and a nice aftertaste, all at a great price. However, the acidity made this disappointing. Sharp and tart it took away all that is good about the wine. Hard to recommend.

fields.name: Saint Clair The Honourable Dillon Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Very pale almost limpid straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Powerful, herbal, loads of tropical fruit, gooseberry, passionfruit, guava, mango, pineapple and lime with herbal notes of grass/hay, lemongrass, tomato leaf, green tea and asparagus.
fields.taste: Bone dry, flavoursome, grapefruit, orange peel, bitter melon, asparagus palate. Fresh, crisp tart zesty balanced acidity. Very good long clean finish.
fields.overall: Very generous on both the nose and palate, this wine is not shy. Not normally a NZ Sauv Blanc fan but everything seems to work together, well made. Refreshing, depth, easy-drinking, a worthy buy. Recommend.

fields.name: Weirs Lane Parker Estate Limestone Coast Cabernet-Merlot
fields.colour: Carmine red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Intense and fruity, blackcurrants, sweet cherry, plum, aniseed, caramel, tobacco leaf, menthol, eucalyptus and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Full bodied, moderate silky tannin with lovely concentrated ripe black fruit, liquorice, chocolatey flavours with a good peppery finish. Light touch of oak is evident in the aftertaste.
fields.overall: A pleasurable easy-drinking wine. Very New World, rich, ripe fruit and upfront. However, the touch of oak adds structure and balance to the wine. A lot of everything for the price. If you are looking for a rich dense red then I would recommend.

fields.name: Tourrela Bordeaux
fields.colour: Black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Dried forest herbs, violets, bitter chocolate, savoury red fruit like cranberry and redcurrants with slight notes of cherry, plum and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, gentle soft tannin. Bitter chocolate aroma is repeated on the palate with the addition of damson and bramble fruit. Medium length finish with a vegetal, tobacco like aftertaste.
fields.overall: More herbal and floral than fruity. Not a memorable wine and I was a bit disappointed, wine just seems a bit weak and underripe. An average midweek Bordeaux that's OK for the price but I wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Louis Latour Macon-Lugny
fields.colour: Straw yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Delicate, quince, lemon but no sharp or tart, fresh apple, melon with an undertone of honey and apricot.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, moderate acidity with nice creamy texture. Apple dominates the flavour and the smooth medium finish has a nice touch of honey/vanilla.
fields.overall: Fresh simple standard Burgundy, no bells or whistles. Nice but nothing stands out, texture and flavour are best but it lacks body and nose in my opinion. A decent entry level Burgundy but maybe needs a bit of oak. For the money there is better available.

fields.name: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt Niedermenniger Riesling Kabinett
fields.colour: Straw yellow with tinges of green.
fields.aroma: Rich, petrol, oil, wax, smoke, jasmine, honeysuckle and apricot.
fields.taste: Off-dry, fresh acidity with a sweet cherry, marzipan/almond mid-palate. Round creamy texture and the ripe apple and apricot flavours end with a medium finish.
fields.overall: Very pleasant wine, an unmistakable Riesling nose, quite sweet yet light and fresh, very moreish. Maybe a little overripe and lacking a little acidity but minor complaint. Very good value for money and I would recommend.

fields.name: Domaine de l'Arjolle EquilibreMerlot- Cabernet
fields.region: Côtes de Thongue, Languedoc and Roussillon
fields.colour: Polished cherry.
fields.aroma: Plump black and red fruit, blackcurrant, raspberry, plum, liquorice, dark chocolate, menthol, tobacco leaf, clove, vanilla and pepper, alcohol is evident.
fields.taste: Full bodied, rich and succulent all fruit palate and the soft fine grained tannin give a nice texture. Good menthol fuelled finish.
fields.overall: Not memorable but not much to complain about, perhaps a little unbalanced as the alcohol and fruitiness seem to dominate. However it is not heavy and quite easy drinking. Good value and I would recommend if you are looking for something rich and dense.

fields.name: Biferno Rosso Riserva Palladino
fields.colour: Attractive lustrous garnet with a ruby rim
fields.aroma: Herbaceous, woody, iodine, dark fruits like damson, blueberries, black cherry and spiced plum. Peppery with hints of coffee and tar.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, dry, light silky tannin with abundant acidity. Savoury and sour cherry flavours that lead into a warm spicy smooth finish. Oaky after-taste.
fields.overall: Pleasant, approachable and surprisingly light making a very nice easy-drinking wine. Personally, I found it a little thin and the flavour somewhat unpleasant. A good midweek wine and certainly well worth the price.

fields.name: Turkey Flat Rosé
fields.colour: Beautiful, bright, dark rust orange.
fields.aroma: Mature, upfront it's oil, smoke and honey (like Riesling) underpinned by strawberry, peach and herbs.
fields.taste: Light and dry, crisp, firm acidity and lightly tannic. Oil aroma is repeated on the palate mixed with red summer fruits all followed by a long honey, lanolin finish.
fields.overall: So refreshing on a warm evening. Age has been kind to this wine, exuberant, lively, juicy and just delicious, great after-taste. Very aromatic but not as fruit driven as I was expecting but all the better for it. Loved it and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Amaru High Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Very deep lustrous ruby.
fields.aroma: Sweet, savoury and rich; blackberries, blackcurrants, plum, paprika, liquorice, raspberry, cherry, a hint of mushrooms and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Full-bodied with firm mouth drying tannin. Succulent black fruit, vanilla and chocolate flavours but the finish is disappointing.
fields.overall: Very nice, not a complex wine but very pleasant to drink. Tannic but I like that, a nice balance between the fruit and oak and at the price this is very good value. Well worth trying if you are looking for something rich and bold.

fields.name: Grand'Arte Alicante Bouschet
fields.colour: Very dark, almost opaque. Inky red with an aged orange rim.
fields.aroma: More savoury than fruity, smoke, cured meat, gamey, olives and tobacco with lesser notes of ripe sappy blackberries and liqourice.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, soft velvety tannin, med- acidity. Palate is something like smoked sausage/cured meat and raisins with a touch of spice on a decent finish.
fields.overall: Unbeatable at the price. Tertiary flavours and aromas dominate the fruit and seems like it is getting close to the end of its drinking window. My only fault is that the wine is a little dull and flat but all in all rich, dense, well matured, good nose and palate so I would definitely recommend.

fields.name: The Society's Chablis
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow, bright and light.
fields.aroma: Delicate and grassy, lime, melon, ripe bruised apple, quince and honey with a saline mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, refreshing across the palate with zesty tangy acidity. Apple and citrus fruit flavours (esp. orange peel), a nice creamy texture followed by a good length citrusy mouth drying finish.
fields.overall: Riper and not as steely or flinty as I was expecting. Not a big complaint as this was very nice; light, refreshing and flavoursome, great on a hot summers evening. Acidity and after-taste are the highlights but I can't help feeling there is better available even at this price range. Nice but hard to recommend.

fields.name: The Society’s Exhibition Mature Medium Sweet Oloroso Blend
fields.colour: Dark brown leading to a rust orange rim.
fields.aroma: Intense and rich, raisins, wood varnish, baking spices, citrus peel, caramel, toffee, nutty (walnut), apricot and date.
fields.taste: Thick and viscous almost syrupy. Mouth coating spiciness, tangy citrus and nutty flavours abound that lead into a very spicy finish that lasts and lasts.
fields.overall: Love it, a rich opulent wine, attention grabbing. Everything is full-on but the acidity adds great structure making a wonderful easy drinking wine, not at all heavy. Fantastic oxidised nuttiness that lingers. Highly recommend for those looking for a good dessert wine or those who are shy of trying sherry.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Alsace Gewurztraminer
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Fresh and floral, lemon and orange zest, tangerine, bruised banana, tropical mango and pineapple with a touch of honey.
fields.taste: Dry, lots of body, med- acidity, rich but not heavy with a creamy texture. Flavour is quite powerful, apricot and citrus peel, a mouth-filling spiciness and the lingering finish is like orange squash.
fields.overall: Not usually a Gewurz fan but this is not bad. Not as aromatic or heavy as I was expecting. Rich and opulent might describe this best yet easy-drinking. Fairly priced and a good buy for anyone who is a fan of this style.

fields.name: Brouilly 1982 J. Moreau
fields.overall: Well past it's best, now just bland and tasteless. Half mark for still being drinkable.

fields.name: Feudo Arancio Grillo
fields.colour: Golden with a greenish hue.
fields.aroma: Concentrated, floral, ripe mango, lemon, orange, apricot, apple and a hint of salinity.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-full bodied with soft acidity. The ripe aromas are reflected on the palate, a creamy texture finishing with a powerful floral and honey after-taste.
fields.overall: A wine with lots of everything; aroma, flavour, weight, long finish. My only complaint is that it may lack a little acidity making the wine a bit flabby and heavy. Good value for money, pleasant, not perfect but worth a try.

fields.name: Coffele Castel Cerino Soave Classico Organic
fields.colour: Pale straw.
fields.aroma: Soft and very pleasant, lemon, lime, melon, sage, apple, peach, a saline and mineral quality with just a touch of honeysuckle sweetness.
fields.taste: Dry and subtle, med-bodied, fresh, brisk acidity. Wonderfully balanced, citrus and almond/marzipan flavours with a creamy texture, smooth finish and good length after-taste.
fields.overall: So enjoyable, aromatic and flavoursome but in an understated way. Fresh, rounded, easy-drinking. Enjoyed on its own, great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Martini Asti 1863
fields.colour: Pale silver gold with large bubbles that discipate quickly.
fields.aroma: Lightly aromatic, grapes, apple, orange blossom, pear and flowers.
fields.taste: Light and fresh with lively acidity. Citrus, lemon sherbet and candy flavours followed by a rich sweet fruit salad finish.
fields.overall: Not a serious wine by any means but fun and frivolous and great on a hot day. A crowd pleaser, good for a party. Beware, not for those who don't like sweet wines. Good value and best when served extremely well chilled.

fields.name: Vadio Branco
fields.colour: Bright, golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Intense, charred/roasted, honey, apricot, smoke, lanolin, sage and a spiciness hide lesser notes of tangerine and grapefruit.
fields.taste: Dry, medium bodied, fresh, vital acidity and a lovely smooth creamy texture. Baked apple, wax and baking spices flavours with a good roasted nut finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, the secondary and tertiary aromas and flavours dominate the fruit but not necessarily a bad thing.Weighty but fresh and easy-drinking, balanced, somewhere between opulent and elegant. Fairly priced and worth a try.

fields.name: Edelzwicker Special Cuvée
fields.colour: Pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Quite subtle, fresh, lightly floral, lemon, grapes, tropical fruits like lychee, mango and gauva, touch of exotic spices.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-light bodied yet feels quite rounded and smooth on the palate. Flavours are soft, orange blossom and grapefruit with a spiciness on the finish. Not overly acidic but enough to keep the wine balanced and fresh.
fields.overall: A lot more bland than I was expecting with such an array of grapes. Nice texture, very smooth, an easy-drinking wine, nothing stands out but nice on a warm evening, good value, seems well-made and makes a nice change from the norm.

fields.name: Domaine Maby La Fermade Lirac White
fields.colour: Bright and light. Pale gold with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Lemon, orange peel, pear, spice, flint/stone, floral and a saline quality.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-full bodied, lively acidity, tangy spiciness. Flavour leads off with a touch of sweetness, ripe honeyed fruit, orange squash, lemon, with a good length slightly bitter drying finish.
fields.overall: A wine with lots of weight but still retains a freshness making easy-drinking. Well balanced, lovely nose and palate without being overpowering. Very good for the price, no complaints, highly recommend.

fields.name: Sérol Turbullent
fields.colour: Beautiful pink, vigorous bubbles that fade quickly.
fields.aroma: Raspberries, pomegranate, redcurrants and crisp apple.
fields.taste: Dry, light with mouthwatering acidity. Red fruit aromas are repeated on the palate. Med+ lingering finish.
fields.overall: A good pétillant naturel wine, lively and refreshing. Not remarkable but hard to find fault. Very easy-drinking, a crowd pleaser, well worth a try.

fields.name: W. & J. Graham's Crusted Port
fields.colour: Deep dark almost opaque ruby red.
fields.aroma: Initially a big hit of spice, alcohol is evident, followed by apricot, raspberry sauce, citrus zest, chocolate, blueberries and a medicinal/iodine note.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, rich with firm acidity. Flavours of apricot, marmalade and cherry with a good long spicy hot finish.
fields.overall: Not the best port I have had as the heat dominates and it lacks in complexity and flavour but still very good. Opulent, lovely finish are highlights, worth a try at the price.

fields.name: Sendero des Santos Albarino
fields.colour: Straw yellow with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Intense, rich, peach, apple, lemon, lime and citrus blossom. Aroma has a sweet edge to it.
fields.taste: Dry, lemon and honeyed or baked apple flavours but not as fruity as I was expecting even a touch bitter. Medium-bodied, refreshing acidity, med- mid-palate and peachy finish.
fields.overall: The nose is the best thing about this wine. Lacking a little in flavour and depth. On a positive note, it is juicy and aromatic, fresh and easy-drinking. Not outstanding but worth a try.

fields.name: Casal de Ventozela Alvarinho
fields.colour: Rich, bright lemon yellow.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, lemon, lime, pear, apple, nectarine, peach, wax, honey and a delicate floral touch.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, broad, supple, no CO2 and bone-dry. Medium+ acidity, lots of honeyed stone fruit flavours with a mouth-filling creamy texture. Good finish and peach fuelled after-taste.
fields.overall: Best Alvarinho I have had. Aroma, flavour, nice texture, a full wine but still crisp and fresh. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Domaine Bernard Moreau et Fils Bourgogne Chardonnay
fields.colour: Intense deep golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Smoke, hazelnut and bread/toast followed by lemon, peach, apple, ripe exotic fruit and spice.
fields.taste: Full-bodied and opulent with a rich buttery mouth-filling texture. Vital acidity adds a nice balance to the wine. The ripe fruit and tertiary aromas are reflected on the palate with a spicy medium finish.
fields.overall: A very nice well-made Chardonnay. Lovely colour, sturdy and the fruit and oak are well blended. If you want an oaked, smoky, rich and creamy wine then this is a great choice. Well worth the price and seemed best at about 12C.

fields.name: The Wine Society's Exhibition 10 Year Old Tawny Port
fields.colour: Red rust, Australian red clay.
fields.aroma: High alcohol, sweet, walnuts, butterscotch, clove, caramel, baking spices, raspberry sauce, strong coffee, dried apricot, raisins, cherry and a nose tingling spiciness.
fields.taste: Full but mellow with a smooth texture and good brisk acidity. Mouth-coating dried fruit slightly sour cherry and nut flavours. Hot spicy finish and after-taste.
fields.overall: No complaints but I have had better tawnies. Great colour and nose but lacks a little in flavour and depth. Average, better available at this price range.

fields.name: Sol Lucet Koshu
fields.colour: Water white, almost translucent.
fields.aroma: Fragrant and precise, lots of citrus aromas; lemon, lime, tangerine and grapefruit. Stone fruits, a sweet floral note like honeysuckle, elderberry or apple blossom and a mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, clean, vigorous acidity. Light, subtle delicate flavours of apple and lemon with a tart/bitter edge to a medium finish.
fields.overall: What a pleasant surprise. A simple wine but fresh, crisp, good nose with a mouth-watering zestiness. Minor complaint but the acidity is perhaps a bit dominant, masking the fruit. Otherwise, very enjoyable and well worth a try if you are looking for a light crisp style of wine.

fields.name: Tavel Cuvée Prima Donna Rosé
fields.colour: Light scarlet fading to pink.
fields.aroma: Dried herbs, think thyme, sage and lavender. Red fruits, strawberry, cherry, grapefruit, rose petals and orange.
fields.taste: Very dry, medium-full bodied, high alcohol, mildly tannic with vital acidity. The tangy herbal, sour cherry and orange aromas are reflected on the palate with a good long mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: A rosé with power. Full-flavoured, supple, juicy and well-structured (maybe a little too potent). Probably better with food but a fine example that rosé can be a serious wine.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Juliénas
fields.colour: Dark ruby with a crimson rim.
fields.aroma: Vibrant, raspberries, banana, rhubarb, strawberry, sour cherry, plum and mulberry with just a hint of pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, soft tannin, fresh acidity, good structure. Fruity, flavours of sour cherry, ripe banana and boiled sweets with a mildly spicy if somewhat short finish.
fields.overall: A nice Beaujolais, standard banana and boiled sweets aromas and flavours which I like. Not a complex wine but lively, fruity, light and easy-drinking. Good value, not spectacular but well worth a try.

fields.name: Maury Solera 1928 Cask Number 855
fields.colour: Deep dark brown with a rust orange rim.
fields.aroma: Potent and spicy. Nutty like pecan/walnut, brown sugar, orange peel, dried fruit, musty, apricot, maple syrup, vanilla and burnt caramel.
fields.taste: Rich, full and vinous with a wonderful mouth-coating texture. Flavours of caramel, orange, toffee, coffee and almond precede a hot finish that lingers and lingers.
fields.overall: Very similar to an Oloroso sherry with its rich, sticky, nutty unctousness and not as sweet as I was expecting. A real treat and get it while you can.

fields.name: Dr. Bürklin-Wolf Riesling Trocken
fields.colour: Spritzy, pale golden yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Upfront, petrol, smoke and wax underpinned by lime, orange, stone fruits, pear, flowers and spice. Nose has a touch of sweetness.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, fresh with a zesty lively acidity. Ample ripe fruit flavours, apricot, peach, baked apple, a creamy texture. Dry, medium+ finish.
fields.overall: Loved it, the steely acidic backbone, ample fruit and moderate alcohol make this a well-integrated wine. Beautiful if typical Riesling nose, lovely flavour, texture and the mouth-watering acidity makes this a winner in this price range. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Muga Cava Conde de Haro Brut
fields.colour: Pale gold with extremely fine bubbles.
fields.aroma: Sourdough and biscuit, yeasty, apple, unripe pear and citrus fruits.
fields.taste: Bone dry, fresh and lively with zippy acidity. Toast, appley, bitter/nutty mid-palate, nice mouth-coating buttery texture with a med- spicy vanilla finish.
fields.overall: A few rough edges, the secondary fermentation flavours and aromas are too dominant and the bubbles explode in the glass but fade quickly, lacks balance. However, crisp, light, easy-drinking at a good price. Worth a try but not memorable.

fields.name: Villa Oeiras Vinho Generoso
fields.colour: Attractive shiny rust orange.
fields.aroma: Hot and spicy, brown sugar, honey, dried fruits, orange, apricot, toffee apple and caramel.
fields.taste: Full, rich, off-dry, good acidity and viscous. Aromas are reflected on the palate with an additional nutty quality and a good length spicy finish.
fields.overall: Loved it, not as expressive as a Port but with a subtle complexity that makes this shine. I can only recommend, great stuff!

fields.name: Mezzacorona Marzemino Trentino
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Cherry, red berries, grassy, herbal, violets, coffee, bitter chocolate and a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, soft tannin, fresh acidity. Herbaceous, cherry, forest fruit and vanilla flavours with a spicy albeit short mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: Pleasant simple wine. Everything in moderation, good balance, fruity and easy-drinking. A good midweek wine, good value and worth a try.

fields.name: Jülg Weissburgunder Trocken
fields.colour: Pale straw, clear and light.
fields.aroma: Crisp green apple, peach, pear, citrus zest, asparagus and mineral with a spicy note.
fields.taste: Dry, medium bodied, fresh with lively acidity. Flavours of honey, quince and grapefruit with a medium length finish.
fields.overall: A simple and elegant wine. Fruity, juicy, light, everything in moderation, soft and well-balanced. A good summer wine, good price and well worth a try.

fields.name: Semeli Mantinia Nassiakos
fields.colour: Bright and fresh, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Fragrant, floral, exotic fruits, lychee, pear, apricot, grapefruit, orange blossom and a hint of smoke or kerosene.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, crisp, high acidity. Lemon, apricot, lychee flavours with a spiciness on a tangy good length finish. Well rounded.
fields.overall: So so nice, another very good Greek discovery. Fresh, crisp, light, minerally, great on its own. For the money a must try and highly recommend.

fields.name: Crémant de Savoie Extra Brut
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow, lively bubbles that dissipate quickly.
fields.aroma: Sharp, tangy and fresh. Apple, lemon, lime, orange zest, pear and a mineral quality.
fields.taste: There's a creaminess to the bubbles. Dry, soft delicate flavours of apple and lime, saline with a brioche and nut finish.
fields.overall: Just ok in my opinion. Lacks effervescence, aroma and flavour are nice but understated and overly saline. On a positive note, fresh, light, easy-drinking at a fair price. A bit disappointed.

fields.name: Muratie Ben Prins Cape Vintage
fields.colour: Deep purple, almost opaque.
fields.aroma: Intense, chocolate, baking spices, caramel, butterscotch, toffee, aniseed, apricot, raisins, currants, blueberries, cherries and brown sugar.
fields.taste: Rich, unctous, med-full bodied with brisk acidity. Raspberry, apricot, caramel, toffee flavours with a hot spicy finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, delightful variation of Port. Sweet, luscious and packed with flavour and aroma. Hearty, warming, great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Matías Riccitelli Hey Malbec
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Blackberries, blackcurrants, black cherries, plum, vanilla, milk chocolate, herbs and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, rich, medium-full bodied, soft tannin and a drying smooth texture. Dark fruit, liquorice and chocolate flavours followed by a surprisingly sweet good length finish.
fields.overall: Lovely Malbec but may benefit from a bit more ageing. Good depth, fresh, fruity, easy-drinking on its own. Well worth the price and I would recommend.

fields.name: Muscadet Sèvre-et-Maine sur Lie, Comte Leloup du Château de Chasseloir, Cuvée des Ceps Centenaires
fields.colour: Golden yellow, deeper than expected.
fields.aroma: Fresh, lemon, pear, apple, tropical fruits, honey, a mineral quality, brine and yeast.
fields.taste: Bone dry, medium- bodied, a creaminess to the texture, good lemony acidity. Lasting pear, apple and citrus flavours and slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Lovely Muscadet, fuller and rounder than I was expecting, probably from the lees aging. Complexity, succulent ripe fruit, fresh, juicy and very flavoursome. Best served well-chilled, a great choice, good value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Fonseca Extra Dry White Port
fields.colour: Bright, golden yellow with an orange hue.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, spice(cinnamon), orange peel, honey, pear, apricot, almonds, marzipan and oak.
fields.taste: Dry, full and opulent, smooth with refreshing acidity. Citrus, honey and spice flavours followed by a hot alcohol finish.
fields.overall: A nice white Port, good nose and palate but I found the alcohol quite evident and a little overpowering. Also, the tertiary aromas and flavours dominate the fruit so it could be better balanced. Nice for a change but not sure if I would buy it again.

fields.name: McGuigan Sparkling Brut
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow with silver tinges. Steady bubbles.
fields.aroma: Sherbet, tangy apple, pear, peach and lime.
fields.taste: Dry, medium- body, fresh, lively, brisk acidity with a nice creaminess to the bubbles. Subtle flavours dominated by fruit, reflects the nose. Short finish.
fields.overall: Can't complain at the price but not much to get excited about. A standard run of the mill sparkling wine. Lacks depth, flavour and balance. Decent warm evening/summer wine, just don't expect too much.

fields.name: Peter Lehmann The Pastor's Son Shiraz
fields.colour: Rich, dark inky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Blackcurrants, blueberries, plums, black olives, smoke, tar, tobacco, eucalyptus, milk chocolate and vanilla.
fields.taste: Medium body, low silky tannin, fresh acidity and a velvety texture. Sweet and ripe on the palate, raspberry, cherries, chocolate, smoked/cured meat and coffee with a good peppery finish.
fields.overall: Lovely Shiraz, rich, smooth, lots of depth and well balanced. Aromatic, flavoursome, value for money. Would recommend.

fields.name: Janare Colle di Tilio Sannio Fiano
fields.colour: Bright, straw yellow glinting with green.
fields.aroma: Tart and fresh, lemon, melon, apple, pear, honey, green herbs (sage), a stony mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, fresh zippy acidity. Palate is all citrus fruits, a minerality followed by a slight bitter/nutty finish.
fields.overall: Delightful, a supple wine that is soft, lush, rounded and tasty, everything in moderation. The steely acidity is the most redeeming aspect giving a mouthwatering, easy-drinking wine. Great value and I would recommend.

fields.name: Contesa Vigna Corvino Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
fields.colour: Deep carmine with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Bursting with sweet ripe blueberries, blackberries, cranberries, cherries, raspberries, violets, liquorice, tar and pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, ripe fine-grained tannin, vibrant acidity. On the palate, berries, damson, sour cherry and raspberry with a little touch of pepper on the finish.
fields.overall: Ripe, smooth, juicy and well-balanced. Very fruit forward, a great midweek wine, an absolute bargain and I would recommend.

fields.name: McManis Family Petite Sirah
fields.colour: Dark and inky with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Upfront tertiary aromas of smoke, mocha, tobacco, oak, vanilla, black tea and chocolate followed by blackberries, blueberries, plums and blackcurrant jam.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, unctuous and juicy, moderate smooth tannin giving a creamy texture. Savoury, earthy flavours on a sustained mid-palate and a slight touch of spice on the long finish.
fields.overall: Bold, generous, fleshy, rich and dense may best describe this wine. Good depth and complexity with a nice combination of fruit and oak. Very good QPR, no complaints and well worth a try.

fields.name: Ottoventi Zibibbo
fields.colour: Hazy, bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: A ripe sweetness upfront, honeysuckle, lemon, orange blossom and flowers followed by grapes, pear and peach with a nose tingling spiciness.
fields.taste: Dry, medium bodied, fleshy and textured with med++ acidity. Stone fruits, grapes and pears on the palate with a mineral bitterness to a good finish.
fields.overall: No complaints. Generous, ample, juicy and aromatic. Lots of ripe fruit but enough acidity to give balance. Fairly priced, a worthy choice.

fields.name: Lustau Amontillado Sherry
fields.colour: Beautiful tawny rust orange.
fields.aroma: Nuts and wood dominate with pine tar, wood shavings, varnish and hazelnuts but also fig, apricots, dried fruits, orange peel, prunes, brine, toffee, fudge and spice (nutmeg or ginger).
fields.taste: Full, rich, vibrant and very dry. Tangy palate with flavours of brown sugar, tea, salty nuts and a good length bitter walnut finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, bitter, sharp and tangy all in a good way but not for those who have a sweet tooth. This wine has good complexity and depth and the aftertaste really lingers. Great value and well worth trying.

fields.name: Fabre Montmayou Reservado Cabernet Franc
fields.colour: Profound deep crimson with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Upfront lots of ripe berries, strawberries, blackberries, blackcurrants followed by more savoury sweet tobacco, cedar, cola and pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, good acidity, abundant firm grippy tannin that leaves a drying sensation. The strawberry jam, liquorice and blackcurrant flavours are rich with a hint of oak on the tingly satisfying finish.
fields.overall: Sweet and savoury, well integrated, the fruit is most evident but there is a nice undertone of oak. Drinking well now but may benefit from a bit more ageing. Worth the money and worth a try.

fields.name: Vadio Tinto
fields.colour: Medium intense cherry red.
fields.aroma: Cherry, raspberries, blackcurrant, blueberries, herbs, tobacco, slight hint of smoke and tar.
fields.taste: Dry, soft matt tannin, lively acidity but a bit weak and thin. The cherry, mint and tobacco flavours are a little tart followed by a smooth peppery med+ finish.
fields.overall: Subtle and lighter than I expected. Nothing overpowering, nice nose and I do like the nice mix of fruit and oak but it lacks in both body and flavour. A little disappointed at this price and I wouldn't buy it again.

fields.name: Santa Carolina Cellar Selection Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Medium intensity, ruby with a magenta rim.
fields.aroma: Red and black fruit, blackberries, raspberries, bitter chocolate, liquorice, vanilla and just a hint of oak and spice. Something off putting, chemical detergent like.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-minus body, low tannin, abundant acidity. Mild and subtle fruit flavours with a touch of spice on a short finish.
fields.overall: Everything about this wine is just average, lacks intensity of flavour and aroma, body and length. You get what you pay for, forgetful, wouldn't recommend.

fields.name: Siegel San Elias Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Dark ruby red fading to a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe, jammy blackcurrants, blackberries, cherry, vanilla and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-full bodied with firm gripping tannin. Like the nose the palate is fruit driven, ripe and juicy with a pleasant if somewhat short finish.
fields.overall: ot bad, bold, fruity and easy drinking. Not perfect, lacking balance perhaps but good value, decent everyday wine.

fields.name: Siegel San Elias Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Citrusy, melon and gooseberry with a vegetal/grassy note.
fields.taste: Light-medium bodied, good acidity, dry. Ripe citrus and herb flavour but the finish is harsh and bitter.
fields.overall: Simple midweek wine and not one I would buy again. Nice nose but the finish ruined it. Paired nicely with salmon but much better available at this price range.

fields.name: SartoriMerlot
fields.colour: Low intensity, dark cherry fading to red at the rim.
fields.aroma: Cherry, stewed raspberries, red berries with a savoury earthy undertone.
fields.taste: Dry, light and weak in body. Firm drying tannin, medium acidity with the cherry aroma reflected on the palate. Short disappointing finish.
fields.overall: Very average. Simple and one dimensional lacking in body, depth and flavour. A midweek wine at best. Better out there even at this price range.

fields.name: Bosco dei Cirmioli Prosecco
fields.colour: Very pale almost limpid straw. Big but quite persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: Light and airy with notes of green apple, citrus fruits and delicate flowers.
fields.taste: Dry, little density but well textured, good acidity, the palate is light and unchallenging but pleasant. The bubbles are short-lived and the finish is brief.
fields.overall: Easy-drinking, frivolous and simple, lacking depth and finesse. Refreshing, fairly priced but not memorable.

fields.name: Coteaux du Vendômois Le Carillon de Vendôme 'Le Cocagne' Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, lemon yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Young and fresh, lemon, lime, melon, grapefruit, pineapple, jasmine, wet stone and honey.
fields.taste: Very dry, med++ zesty acidity, lovely smooth mid-palate, great crunchy flavours of apple, pear, melon and honey with a nice long finish that has a touch of spice.
fields.overall: Loved it. Balanced, approachable, refreshing, fruity with a mineral edge, flavoursome, good weight and finish. Great value and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Campo Viejo Tempranillo
fields.colour: Sustained pale low intensity ruby.
fields.aroma: Lots of red fruits and berries; raspberries, strawberries, cranberries, cherries and blueberries all underpinned by a savoury earthiness, oak and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, soft, lightly tannic giving a silky smooth texture. Fresh, fruit-driven palate and the finish is med-.
fields.overall: A nice standard Rioja. Everything in moderation with good balance. Simple and easy-drinking but very good for the price and certainly worth a try.

fields.name: Calvet Prestige de Calvet Bordeaux Sémillon - Sauvignon
fields.colour: Medium intense pale gold.
fields.aroma: Citrus and stone fruits but showing nice ageing aromas of vanilla, honey and toast.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, crisp, vibrant acidity with a creamy texture. The developed aromas are repeated on the palate although the finish is quite short.
fields.overall: A simple wine but seems to be at its peak right now. Great QPR, very nice nose and texture, a good midweek wine.

fields.name: Canepa Classico Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Garnet red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Subtle, soft black fruits; blackcurrant, plum and dried fruit with lesser notes of coffee, chocolate and spice.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, soft sweet tannin, juicy acidity but feels a bit thin. Pleasant fruit, liquorice and cocoa flavours with a med- finish.
fields.overall: Straight forward Cab Sauv. Lacks depth and body but that is to be expected at this price range. Pleasant, approachable, quaffable, value, good everyday wine.

fields.name: Pittnauer Red Pitt
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, all fruit aromas; wild berries, sweet raspberries, cherries, cranberries, forest fruits, damsons, cola and violets with a tingle of spice.
fields.taste: Medium- body, abundant firm gripping tannin, vital acidity and moderate alcohol all giving a nice balance. Subtle plum, raspberry and chocolaty flavours followed by a goof length spicy finish.
fields.overall: Hard to find fault, perhaps lacking weight and depth of flavour but all in all, ripe, smooth, open, appealing with a strong tannic backbone. Fairly priced and I would recommend.

fields.name: Torres Floralis Moscatel Oro
fields.colour: Fabulous luminous golden orange.
fields.aroma: Rich and profound, orange peel, concentrated orange juice, honey, mint, ginger, fresh flowers with a very distinct spiciness.
fields.taste: Medium-full bodied, good viscosity, not overly sweet, abundant mouthwatering acidity to balance the sugar. The lychee and orange mid-palate lasts into a good length finish.
fields.overall: Really nice, not overly sweet, refreshing on the palate but still rich and opulent. At this price you will not do better. Definitely recommend.

fields.name: Burebista Feteasca Neagra Shiraz
fields.colour: Bright carmine red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Expressive, forest fruits, red cherry, coffee, black olives, tobacco leaf, dried fruit (raisins, sultanas) and herbs (sage, lavender).
fields.taste: Medium- body, soft dry tannin with abundant acidity adding vibrancy. Flavours of cherry, blackberry and blackcurrant lead into a chocolatey peppery med- finish.
fields.overall: Looks good, nose is good but the palate lets this wine down. A bit thin and weak lacking tannic structure and body. Fairly priced and a good midweek wine to accompany a beef dish.

fields.name: Henri Bourgeois Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, clean and fresh, gold with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Expressive and ripe, lemon, gooseberry, grapefruit, tropical fruits, honeysuckle, grassy, smoke, honey, crème fraîche, tomato leaf and asparagus with a mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, lean but not weak, lively, fresh, nervy with lively acidity. Rich and ripe gooseberry and citrus on the palate with a really good length green, slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Generous, fruity, floral, herbaceous and the lees ageing adds a wonderful extra dimension. A vibrant balanced wine that has a bit of everything. Cracking value, loved it, highly recommend.

fields.name: Anselmann Dornfelder Trocken
fields.colour: Intense deep dark garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Fruity and ripe, cherry, sweet forest fruits, crunchy berries, blackcurrants, vanilla and chocolate with a touch of pepper.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, refreshing acidity, robust chewy tannin, a muscular mouthful. The cherry and chocolate flavours are fleeting at best and although there is a nice peppery finish it is all too brief.
fields.overall: Nice nose but the palate lets it down, subdued and stunted. On a positive it is approachable, juicy, plummy and ripe, a reliable if unremarkable wine that's very good value for money. Decanting helps.

fields.name: Blind Spot Rutherglen Muscat
fields.colour: Dark brown with a toffee rim.
fields.aroma: Potent, spiked Christmas cake, orange peel, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, nutmeg, dried fruit, liquorice.
fields.taste: Thick and viscous, rich and heavy but with a fine freshness from abundant acidity and a long hot spicy finish.
fields.overall: Unctous and delectable probably describe this best. My only fault is that the alcohol is a little too potent but otherwise a pure delight. This is a pure steal at £7.50 and a must try!

fields.name: Christian Moueix Private Reserve Saint-Émilion
fields.colour: Cherry red turning brick orange at the rim. Just showing its age.
fields.aroma: Developed, raspberries, cranberries, eucalyptus, spice, leather, cedar, smoke and something savoury like mushrooms/forest floor.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, smooth mellow slightly drying tannin, round, velvety texture. Cherry, raspberry chocolate and liquorice flavours precede a warm spicy lingering finish.
fields.overall: A wonderful well aged Bordeaux. Fruit, oak and tannin all evident but in harmony. A great find and I would highly recommend if you are a fan of Bordeaux.

fields.name: E. Guigal Côtes-du-Rhône Blanc
fields.colour: Bright and clear, light gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, immediate lemon/lime with orange blossom, flowers, peach, honey and a touch of salinity.
fields.taste: Dry, fleshy, rich and full bodied with med- acidity. The apricot and peach aromas carry through to the palate and the texture is smooth and creamy. A nice touch of pepper on an otherwise disappointing brief finish.
fields.overall: Decent uncomplicated wine. Round, fresh, appealing and approachable but if I was to find fault I think it lacks intensity in both flavour and length. A decent entry level CdR, good value but I was left a little disappointed.

fields.name: André et Michel Quenard Chignin Mondeuse Tradition Savoie
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, sour red fruits; strawberries, cherries, plums, violets, herbaceous, touch of spice with a gamey, leather undertone.
fields.taste: Medium-light bodied, refreshing acidity, smooth integrated tannin but feels thin and watery. The sour cherry aroma continues on the palate but is very subtle and the finish is almost non-existent.
fields.overall: Unremarkable but pleasant. Straight-forward, juicy and balanced but it is just too weak and soft. For the money I would expect more. Decanting helps.

fields.name: Cuvée Aleksandr Cahul Méthode Traditionnelle
fields.colour: Very pale lemon with a silver tinge. Fine lively bubbles.
fields.aroma: Citrus fruits, apple, stone fruits (apricots) and a slight bready/yeastiness.
fields.taste: Dry, fresh, fine bubbles, brisk acidity and mellow mouthfeel. Subtle lemon pith, vanilla and buttered toast flavours followed by a very bitter nutty after-taste.
fields.overall: Some good points, subtle, delicate and refreshing but nothing to get excited about. It lacks depth of flavour and that bitter finish leaves a mark. For the price there is better available and I wouldn't recommend.

fields.name: Chapel Hill Verdelho
fields.colour: Radiant straw yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Intense, ripe almost sweet; lime cordial, pineapple, gooseberry, guava, grassy, honeysuckle, flower blossom and an oiliness.
fields.taste: Dry, light, juicy, vigorous acidity yet quite a smooth texture. Sustained citrus and tropical fruit flavours followed by a tangy nose tingling lemony finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, open and expressive, exotic, good balance, easy drinking and a nice finish. Best served well-chilled. Worth the money and I would recommend.

fields.name: Tomáš Čačík Frankovka
fields.colour: Deep garnet.
fields.aroma: Intense, both savoury and fruity, forest fruits, cherry, iodine, liquorice, cranberry, chocolate, and spice with a hint of tobacco and leather.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, rich, firm well-integrated tannin, med+ acidity. Fleshy and full flavoured, sustained ripe cherry, blackberry jam and raspberry chocolate with spice on the finish. Very good lingering aftertaste.
fields.overall: This is delicious, forward, juicy, concentrated and harmonious. Everything is so well-balanced, making this hard to put down. Needs decanting as some deposit, well worth the money and I would highly recommend.

fields.name: Rex Mundi Cuvée Cathare
fields.colour: Deep inky purple with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Medium-intensity, ripe raisined fruit, blueberries, raspberry, cranberry, liquorice, band-aid, dried herbs and pepper. Reminded me of cough medicine.
fields.taste: Medium bodied, rich bordering on sweet, abundant coarse-grained tannin that leaves a chewy drying sensation. Chocolate, plum and blueberry flavours, good length mid-palate and a med- finish.
fields.overall: Quite enjoyable, lovely nose, structured, not heavy so easy-drinking on it own. A good choice if are looking for a ripe, smooth juicy red.

fields.name: André et Michel Quenard Vieilles Vignes Chignin
fields.colour: Fresh, lustrous light gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, very fresh, lemon, orange blossom, tree fruits (apple, pear) and a saline/mineral quality.
fields.taste: Medium-light body, dry, crisp, refreshing acidic backbone. Supple mouth-filling citrus and ripe apple flavours, moderate mid-palate and finish/aftertaste. A mineral touch. Good balance.
fields.overall: Very pleasant and approachable. A wine that has a little of everything and all comes together very nicely. Juicy, aromatic, a good warm weather wine. Fairly priced and certainly worth a try.

fields.name: Kaapzicht Hanepoot Jerepigo
fields.colour: Rich glimmering topaz yellow.
fields.aroma: Intense, apricot, mandarin orange, spice, dried figs, peach, stale dried fruit (in a good way), spiked Christmas cake and something quite savoury.
fields.taste: Full-bodied and viscous but vital acidity brings freshness and balance. Sustained dried fruit (raisins, sultanas) and apricots flavours with a med+ spicy tingling finish.
fields.overall: Rich, opulent and luscious but the sweetness is nicely balanced by a savoury note. Very nice, a change from the norm, good QPR, worth a try.

fields.name: Bodegas Bernabé Navarro Peligres
fields.colour: Medium garnet with a mahogany rim.
fields.aroma: First impressions of game, oak, cedar, leather, undergrowth, coffee, vanilla, sweet spice, liquorice and rosemary with an undertone of ripe forest fruits and stewed strawberry.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, good acidity, aggressive mouth-puckering tannin giving a fierce drying texture. Candied red fruit, cherry and chocolate flavours with a pleasant strong prolonged finish.
fields.overall: At its peak,excellent drinking at 4 years old. Only for those who like tannin and then some. A little disjointed as oak and tannin dominate the underlying fruit but all in all very enjoyable. Needs food, needs decanting due to deposit.

fields.name: French Tom Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon -MerlotMédoc
fields.colour: Pale ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Fruity and vegetal. Medium-intensity, blackcurrant, bitter chocolate, raspberry, cherry, dried herbs, bell pepper and black pepper.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, dry, abundant acidity, soft tannin. Subtle cherry and raspberry on the palate but both taste and finish are fleeting and disappointing.
fields.overall: A standard Bordeaux at best. Balance is good but all aspects seem a little closed and understated. Don't want to criticise too much as maybe it needs more time.

fields.name: Moraitis Malagousia
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, lemon, grapefruit, tangerine, pear, melon, stone fruits (peach, apricot), floral and a flinty minerality.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, fresh acidity with a pleasingly smooth texture. Palate is ripe, citrussy and herbal with a slightly bitter/saline mid-palate and after-taste.
fields.overall: A real surprise, smooth, full and rich but a freshness that brings good balance. Very nice all-round, well worth the money, I would definitely recommend.

fields.name: Dopff au Moulin Crémant d'Alsace Cuvée Julien Brut
fields.colour: Pale gold with a green tinge and gentle fine bubbles.
fields.aroma: Lemon, apple and pear with a nice touch of smokiness and yeast.
fields.taste: Very dry, med- acidity, the bubbles are fine and creamy giving a very smooth texture. The lemon and apple aromas continue on the palate followed by a medium length zesty finish.
fields.overall: Enjoyable, like a subtle simple Champagne. Lees ageing is evident and beneficial. Makes a good crowd pleasing aperitif, good for the price and worth a try.

fields.name: Saint Pourçain La Ficelle
fields.winery: Cave of the Union Vignerons de Saint-Pourçain
fields.colour: Light, distinctive pale ruby.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, raspberry, rhubarb, red berries, herbaceous, dried grass/hay and green peppercorns.
fields.taste: Light and delicate, lively acidity and low in tannin. Palate is almost sweet with flavours of raspberry and sour cherry with a peppery finish.
fields.overall: Enjoyable, approachable easy-going wine. Simple and straightforward, not a wine to study or mull over. Fruity, refreshing thirst quencher. Great value and well worth a try. Serve slightly chilled.

fields.name: Fodor Orange Wine
fields.colour: Hazy, golden orange.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, distinct, wet wool, rotting wood (in a good way), honey, bruised apple, apricot, tangerine, something like face cream and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, weighty, lightly tannic with vital acidity. Fairly intense flavours of apricot marmalade and orange (a little Sauternes like). Moderate citrussy nutty finish.
fields.overall: That first taste is profound, just completely different. Memorable because of its peculiarity but also really enjoyable, a great change. A bold wine with a lot going on and definitely worth a try.

fields.name: Cabalié
fields.colour: Deep ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Fruity and ripe, blackberry, cherry, damson, forest fruits, lavender, liquorice, dried fruits, spice with a savoury undertone.
fields.taste: Rich and dense, robust firm ripe tannin, grainy drying texture, abundant acidity. Palate is lead by ripe raspberries, stewed strawberries and cherries with mint chocolate followed by a tingling lingering finish.
fields.overall: Really good, so ripe and lush, almost Port like. Dominated by fruit making it a little unbalanced, minor thing and only a personal opinion. Well worth the money, definitely worth a try.

fields.name: Cabalié Cuvée Vieilles Vignes
fields.colour: Dense inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Dried herbs, bramble fruits, raspberry sauce, cherry, spice, with notes of coffee, orange peel and leather.
fields.taste: Full and rich, solid grippy drying tannin giving a chewy texture, vital acidity. Surprising subtle flavours of caramel, sweet cherry and boiled sweets and both mid-palate and finish are hollow and fleeting.
fields.overall: Nice but I preferred its little brother. Good nose but this wine is let down by the lack of depth and length on the palate. Balanced, fruity, juicy and easy-drinking are all pluses but I will stick to the original.

fields.name: Viña Laguna Malvazija Istarska
fields.colour: Bright, clean, lustrous straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Moderate and tangy, lemon, melon, stone fruits, floral, a touch of sweet honeysuckle and a seashell/mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, light, zippy vibrant acidity making the wine juicy and mouthwatering. Subtle citrus, apple and apricot palate followed by a nice bitter finish.
fields.overall: A little bland on the palate but no complaints. Simple yet very pleasant, easy-drinking and refreshing. Good QPR and would certainly recommend if you are looking for something light and crisp.

fields.name: Domaine de Matabrune Bourgueil
fields.winery: La Cave des Producteurs de Bourgueil
fields.colour: Pale ruby red.
fields.aroma: Open, smoky, fruity beginning, cherry, liquorice, blackberries, raspberry and plum but also an undertone of leather, tobacco, smoked paprika and lot of pepper.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, low tannin, lacking solidity and a bit tart. Sour cherry and red berry flavours with a short chalky, drying peppery finish.
fields.overall: A bit thin and watery and needs more oomph on the palate. Good nose but just understated in other areas. A decent midweek wine but not memorable. There are better Cab Francs available at this price range.

fields.name: Teroldego Rotaliano Riserva Castel Firmian
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Aromatic mix of fruit and oak, sweet ripe red berries, blackcurrant, damson, smoke, tobacco, tar, cherry, anise and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med+ body, juicy brisk acidity, fine-grained tannin giving a velvety texture. Cherry, marzipan and chocolate on the palate with a wonderful touch of oak on the finish.
fields.overall: A really nice well rounded wine, oak and fruit in harmony. At the price this wine punches above its weight. Definitely recommend if you are looking for something ripe, juicy and smooth.

fields.name: Three Choirs Silver Jubilee
