fields.colour: Bright and clean, very pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, fresh tangy green and citrus fruits; lemon, grapefruit, peach, passion-friut, honeysuckle, orange blossom and a flinty minerality.
fields.taste: Light but not weak or watery, dry, lively acidity to the point of mouthwatering yet balanced. Sour green fruit flavours with a nice med+ lemony finish.
fields.overall: What a pleasant surprise. Juicy and refreshing with lots of aromas and flavour. Great value and would recommend as an ideal summer wine.

fields.name: Bugey-Cerdon Méthode Ancestrale Demi-Sec Cave Wojtkowiak
fields.colour: Attractive dark pink, onion skin. Fine light bubbles.
fields.aroma: Fresh and slightly tangy. Straightforward, strawberries, raspberries, pomegranate and grapefruit.
fields.taste: Light, medium-sweet but retains that crisp freshness. The fine bubbles bring a smooth creaminess. The fresh fruit aromas are repeated on the palate with a sustained mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: Frivolous and fun. A light delicious simple sparkler with a lovely level of sweetness that makes it hard to put down. Perfect aperitif at a good price. Definitely recommend.

fields.name: I Ciacca Maturano
fields.colour: Bright, golden orange like maple syrup.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, sweet orange like marmalade or orange squash, apricot, ripe bruised apple, beeswax, honey, rhubarb and medicinal herbs.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, soft tannin giving a smooth and drying texture balanced by a juicy acidity. Concentrated exotic fruit flavours of mango and pineapple followed by a nice tangy spicy finish.
fields.overall: Loved it, so different, nose and palate remind me of a Sauternes yet it is dry and sustained in all aspects. Highly recommend, more than worth the money, a great break from the norm.

fields.name: Isla Negra SeashoreMerlot
fields.colour: Rich black cherry.
fields.aroma: Ripe and fruity, cherry, plum, blackberries, dried fruit and chocolate with a hint of smoke and coffee.
fields.taste: Med- body, soft and supple with light matt tannin. Palate is rich and smoky with red fruit flavours, a silky texture and a smooth lightly spiced finish.
fields.overall: A nice very easy-drinking simple crowd pleaser. It may lack solidity and depth but for the price this wine delivers and is well worth trying, a great midweek wine.

fields.name: Bergulé Mavrud Villa Melnik
fields.colour: Attractive medium garnet fading to a pale brick red rim.
fields.aroma: Medium-intensity, strawberry/raspberry jam, wild herbs, game, leather, vanilla and pepper.
fields.taste: Dry and understated, med- body, fresh acidity and very mild tannin adding some texture. Soft subtle cherry and red fruit flavours with a spicy mouthcoating finish.
fields.overall: Mellow or ethereal may describe this best. Everything about this wine seems toned down yet it is very nice and well-balanced, the high alcohol is not evident. My only fault is the depth of flavour and length of mid-palate and finish, all disappointing. Still I am happy with this, good price, recommend.

fields.name: Riversong Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Bright and lustrous, pale straw with silver and green highlights.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and fresh, crisp green fruits (gooseberry, lime, melon), lychee, apple blossom, asparagus, green herbs, grass and minerals.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, very dry, lively acidity bringing a refreshing crispness. Very nice savoury herbs on the palate but the slightly bitter tingly finish is all too fleeting.
fields.overall: More savoury, vegetal and herbal than fruity. Good nose, distinctive flavour and pleasant on its own. Not a wine of finesse or elegance but you get what you pay for. A good midweek wine worth picking up.

fields.name: Tierras de La Fuente Tempranillo Syrah
fields.colour: Medium intensity, dark crimson with a pink rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe red and black fruit, raspberry, blackberry, cherry, dried flowers, liquorice, chocolate and spice.
fields.taste: Med- body, rich and juicy, mild ripe tannin, granular texture. Jammy bramble fruits on the palate, moderate finish.
fields.overall: Young, upfront, fruity and moreish are all positives but negatively it is a little weak, disjointed and there is an odd metallic element on the nose and finish. Good for the price, an everyday wine, not memorable.

fields.name: Yarrunga Field Special Reserve Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark purple with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Savoury and herbal upfront, dried herbs, game, smoke or charred timber and cedar with black fruits, plum, black cherries and a spicy element of clove and cinnamon.
fields.taste: Med+ body, subtle, mildly tannic, smooth texture. Sweet tobacco, cherry and liquorice on the palate followed by a med- spicy finish.
fields.overall: A bit disappointing, needs more tannin, more fruit, more body, it lacks balance. The palate and finish are the highlights but a midweek wine at best. Better Shiraz available in this price range. Decanting for an hour helps.

fields.name: Albastrele Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Clean and bright, light straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic, grass/floral meadow, green herbs, crisp and fresh green fruits (apple, gooseberry), lemon, grapefruit and peach.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied with zesty acidity. Pleasantly sharp, good mid-palate with some weight and a long powerful citrus fuelled finish that tingles the nose.
fields.overall: A lovely surprise, generous nose, full flavoured and juicy with texture and balance. Advertised as being like a NZ Sauv Blanc and can't argue. Good QPR and well worth a try.

fields.name: Château d'Aydie Pacherenc du Vic-Bilh
fields.colour: Bright, luminous gold.
fields.aroma: Over ripe, exotic fruits like papaya and dragon fruit, orange marmalade, apricot, quince, honey, baked apples and brown sugar.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, concentrated, buttery texture, vital acidity adding balance. The sustained orange, lemon and apricot palate are followed by a good persistent finish.
fields.overall: Not what I was expecting, aromas and flavours are super ripe and the aromas and taste are more bruised than sweet. Very good but perhaps a touch more acidity to add a freshness that would counteract the overripe fruit.

fields.name: Monte Plogar Reserva
fields.colour: Dark, deep black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Smoke, leather, mint, vanilla and spice underpinned by red berries, jammy strawberries and raspberries.
fields.taste: Med- body, soft smooth tannin, med+ acidity with a nice gripping texture. The aromas are repeated on the palate with a touch of iodine but the finish is too short.
fields.overall: A simple but enjoyable wine. Lacking in body, flavour and length but there is balance between oak and fruit. For the price this wine is well worth trying, a good midweeker.

fields.name: Cabeza de Toro Bobal
fields.colour: Medium garnet with a crimson rim.
fields.aroma: Average, cherry, blackberry, pomegranate, peppery with a touch of wild herbs and tea.
fields.taste: Weak, med+ acidity, gentle soft tannin, hollow. Subtle herbs and chocolate on the palate ending with a brief spicy finish.
fields.overall: This is poor, no body, structure, flavour or finish. The nose is best aspect of this wine but everything else needs more oomph. Can't recommend as Bobal can be much better than this.

fields.name: Le Grand Chai Réserve Bordeaux Blanc
fields.winery: Le Chai au Quai, Jean-Marc Sauboua
fields.colour: Medium intensity, bright, golden with silver tinges.
fields.aroma: Mature, oak ageing is evident, orange, apricot, beeswax, ginger, buttered toast, lesser notes of gooseberry and grass with a touch of smoke.
fields.taste: Med+ body, med+ alcohol, fresh acidity adding balance. Rounded smooth texture with honeyed citrus and vanilla/honeycomb flavours, good sustained palate and orange laced finish.
fields.overall: Really nice, a good blend of fruit and lees ageing. Creamy, weighty yet fresh and easy drinking. A well-covered wine, worth the price and I would recommend.

fields.name: PS Pétillant Rosé NV
fields.colour: Delicate mousse, pale salmon pink or onion skin.
fields.aroma: Fresh, lots of red fruits, strawberry, raspberries, redcurrants and a floral note of rose petals.
fields.taste: Light and refreshing, the wine is lifted by lively acidity and the gentle bubbles. On the palate it is off-dry with a smooth creamy texture, sherbet flavours and a moderate finish.
fields.overall: Nothing about this wine is shouting loud but it hits the mark. All aspects of the wine are light and subtle but work well together to give a moreish, crisp wholly enjoyable wine. Definitely recommend.

fields.name: Young & Crazy Broadleaf Melnik
fields.region: Harsovo village, Melnik region, Thracian Valley
fields.colour: Cherry red with a ruby rim, medium intensity.
fields.aroma: Spicy and fruity, berries, forest fruits, cherry, rhubarb, dried herbs, vanilla and a hint of undergrowth and smoke.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, dry, robust drying tannin, sinewy texture. The aromas are reflected on the palate with a warming shot of spice on the decent finish
fields.overall: Just ok in my opinion. Nice nose and finish but my biggest fault is the coarse tannin that dominates the palate. For the price it is hard to be too critical, a good midweek wine best served with food.

fields.name: Blue Nun 22K Gold Edition Sparkling NV
fields.colour: Delicate pale lemon yellow with a silver tinge. A lively effervesence that dissipates quickly.
fields.aroma: Subtle and a touch sweet, fresh green apples, pear, melon and molasses.
fields.taste: Light, crisp and fresh, brisk acidity and a creamy texture. The palate is a touch sweet, baked apple and sweet pineapple followed by a short nose tingling finish.
fields.overall: Fun and frivolous, a simple light sparkler. Obviously not a serious wine, cheap, cheerful and easy drinking, enjoy and take it for what it is.

fields.name: De Bortoli Woodfired Heathcote Sparkling Shiraz
fields.colour: Intensely dark and rich, inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Sweet and fruit driven, blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, cranberries, black cherries and spice.
fields.taste: Med bodied, med- acidity, very gentle tannin and the bubbles are soft and delicate. Rich red fruit and chocolate on the palate ending with an all too brief spicy finish.
fields.overall: Not as powerful or full as I was expecting yet it still seems heavy going. Acidity and bubbles need to be turned up a notch. Not worth the money and wouldn't recommend.

fields.name: Cayetano del Pino Palo Cortado Solera
fields.colour: Attractive amber/orange-brown.
fields.aroma: Pungent and saline, brown sugar, walnut, almond, pecan, caramel, toffee, coffee, dates, varnish, rich spiked fruit cake.
fields.taste: Bone-dry, rich yet fresh, abundant acidity, mouth-filling flavours that are nutty, bitter and citrusy with a spicy warming seriously long mellow finish.
fields.overall: Bloody hell, this ticks a lot of boxes i.e. nose, palate, finish, depth, complexity and all at a great price. Small complaint but perhaps the alcohol is a little high but still highly recommend.

fields.name: Renato Ratti Ochetti Nebbiolo
fields.colour: Pale black cherry red.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, pencil lead, something wild and funky, raspberry, cranberry, plum, pine, menthol, black tea, leather and vanilla.
fields.taste: Medium body, fine drying tannin, ample chewy texture. A palate of spice cake, cherry and liquorice with a moderate finish.
fields.overall: Elegant, polished and refined might best describe this wine. Everything (nose, palate and finish) in moderation. The oak is light and well integrated and the high alcohol is not evident. Worth the price and I would recommend.

fields.name: Alessandro Gallici Frizzante NV
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow with a tinge of green. Gentle effervescence.
fields.aroma: Fruity, subtle, a touch of sweetness, crisp green apple, pear, ripe tropical fruits and white flowers.
fields.taste: Light, refreshing acidity, nice creamy texture but the palate and finish are almost unrecognisable, some apple and almonds at best.
fields.overall: Soft, tight, I just feel this could be more generous. Not going to criticise too much as the light bubbles and brisk acidity make very easy-drinking but I just wanted more aroma, more flavour, more lift. A nice summer drink, just not memorable.

fields.name: Áldás Egri Bikaver, St Andrea
fields.colour: Ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Starts ripe, sweet and fruity; cherry, raspberry, blackberry and vanilla underpinned by earthy aromas of mushroom, clay pot and leather.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, sappy, modest tannin and a silky smooth texture. Good mid-palate, core flavour of red berries with a touch of spice on the med- finish.
fields.overall: Very enjoyable, nose and texture stand out. Fruit and oak work well together, good balance, a well made wine. Fairly priced and I would recommend.

fields.name: Abbesse Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, pale lemon yellow.
fields.aroma: Very green, gooseberry, fresh green herbs, grass/hay, lemon and lime with just a hint of passion-fruit and kiwi.
fields.taste: Med- body, zesty acidity, succulent, good length mid-palate with flavours of citrus, peach and gooseberry. The smooth texture is followed by a medium length finish.
fields.overall: Good example of Loire Valley Sauv Blanc. A wine with all aspects present but nothing overdone, balanced. Very good choice if you are looking for something juicy and aromatic but not overpowering. Recommend.

fields.name: Comtesse de Bellefleur Grande Réserve Brut Champagne NV
fields.region: Côte des Blancs and Montagne de Reims, Champagne
fields.colour: Pale lemon yellow with silver tinges. Large lively bubbles
fields.aroma: Delicate, bruised apple, biscuit and yeast with just a hint of citrus (lemon, quince) and stone fruits.
fields.taste: Dry, refreshing acidiy but lacks creaminess, depth and length on the palate. The are some lemon and yeast flavours ending with a nutty element to the med- finish.
fields.overall: Its ok but not worth the money. Nice yeasty quality and persistent bubbles but couldn't call it refined or elegant. Better sparkling wines available at a cheaper rate.

fields.name: Las Piletas Bonarda
fields.colour: Dark and rich, deep ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Open and fruity, blackberries, cherry, damson, plum sauce, violets, tobacco/smoke, graphite.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, light fine-grained tannin, soft on the palate with very subtle black fruit and chocolate flavours that come to the fore on the finish. A nice warming, mouth-coating spicy after-taste.
fields.overall: A very nice surprise. A fruity, lively, juicy wine with the nose and after-taste being the highlights for me. Excellent value, definitely recommend.

fields.name: The Liberator Special Edition ‘Bunny Chow'
fields.colour: Bright and clear, light gold.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, peach, apricot, grapefruit, tangerine and flowers with lesser notes of honeysuckle, pineapple and oil.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, generous alcohol and softly acidic. Full-flavoured with a powerful orange, floral and citrus fuelled finish of enduring length.
fields.overall: Nothing shy here, bursting with flavour and aroma and the after-taste just goes on and on. Alcohol and acid seem a little unbalanced but otherwise no complaints. Fairly priced and worth a try.

fields.name: El Bombero Selección Especial
fields.colour: Very opaque, inky with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Rich and ripe, stewed strawberry, plum, blackcurrants, fig, prune and vanilla with slight notes of orange peel and black tea.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, succulent, well-blended moderate tannin, smooth and rounded. A raspberry chocolate, sweet tobacco and blueberry palate ending with a hot spicy mouth-coating finish.
fields.overall: Not as heavy as I was expecting, with the high alcohol not evident until the hot finish. Youthful, juicy and easy drinking. Perhaps lacking in depth and complexity but still very good value for money and I would recommend.

fields.name: Calvente Guindalera Crianza
fields.colour: Medium intensity, crimson red.
fields.aroma: Concentrated and ripe, blackcurrants, cherry, plum, espresso, smoke, black olives, leather, vanilla and spice.
fields.taste: Rich and round, luscious but fresh, med+ body with moderate but firm tannin. The sustained mid-palate has flavours of cherry, liquorice and chocolate ending with a spicy medium length finish.
fields.overall: Very enjoyable, well-made, the balance between fruit and oak adds depth and complexity. Rich, dense and flavoursome, a wine that covers a lot of bases, highly recommend.

fields.name: San Martin Flor de San Martin Garnacha Blanca
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Medium-intensity, lemon, pear, apple and green herbs (dill, fennel) with an undertone of something sweet and floral.
fields.taste: Dry, light and fresh with crisp acidity and a nice smooth texture. Bruised apple, lemon and bitter almond on the palate with a tangy spicy finish.
fields.overall: Very pleasant, a well-balanced wine with a good nose and lovely rounded finish. Very good value, great midweek wine and one to try if you are looking for something juicy and aromatic.

fields.name: Hacienda de Lluna Moscatel Rosado
fields.colour: Attractive pale pink or onion skin, light bubbles.
fields.aroma: Sweet and strong, lychee!!!, rhubarb, peach, apricot, rose and orange squash.
fields.taste: Sweet with med- acidity and the aromas are repeated on the palate. Decent length after-taste.
fields.overall: Almost like a Turkish Delight, pleasant but very one dimensional. That lychee nose and flavour are very dominant and this is too much like a fruit squash. A poor rosada, you get what you pay for. Avoid unless you have a sweet tooth.

fields.name: Campo Viejo Cava Gran Brut Reserva
fields.colour: Bright, medium lemon yellow, lively persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: Quite intense, smoke, oil, yeast and buttered toast with lesser fruit aromas of pear, apple and pineapple.
fields.taste: Dry, medium-bodied, refreshing zesty acidity. Soft apple, apricot and bread dough on the palate with a somewhat hollow finsh.
fields.overall: Wonderful nose, oak ageing is evident. The palate and finish let it down a little but at this price it's hard to complain. A good cheap alternative to Champagne, well worth a try.

fields.name: Brass Monkey Shiraz
fields.colour: Medium deep black cherry red.
fields.aroma: Adequate, cherry, damson, blackberry, black olive, smoke, leather and tobacco leaf.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, mellow, supple light tannin with vital acidity, balanced. Cherry and smoked black fruits on the palate followed by a good hit of spice on the finish.
fields.overall: Not as big and robust as I was expecting. This wine does not shout loud, it is just pleasant and all round very nice. Good value but lacks that Aussie oomph.

fields.name: Marcelin Cuvée 1907 Chardonnay
fields.colour: Luminous, straw yellow with a green golden tinge.
fields.aroma: Average, ripe tropical fruit, lemon, lime and apple with a touch of oakiness (vanilla/buttered toast).
fields.taste: Med+ body, med- acidity with a fleshy buttery texture. Although quite subtle, the aromas are repeated on the palate but the finish is all too brief.
fields.overall: A pleasant wine greatly helped by a slight touch of oak. Subtle all-round with the texture being a highlight. Not without its faults but good for the price, nice midweek wine well worth trying.

fields.name: Filipa Pato 3B Rosé Extra Bruto
fields.colour: Dark onion skin or pinkish orange, fine delicate bubbles.
fields.aroma: Quite subtle, strawberry, dried cranberries, wild flowers, yeast and an earthy quality.
fields.taste: Very dry, fresh, med- acidity, medium-bodied, smooth texture but not creamy. Flavours of apple, brioche and bread dough but like the nose is understated. Good length mid-palate and a nice yeasty finish.
fields.overall: Just ok in my opinion. Pleasant on all counts but everything just seems played down, lacking the liveliness and creaminess present in other sparkling wines. Good QPR but better out there at this price range.

fields.name: Andresen Fine Ruby Port NV
fields.region: Vila Nova de Gaia, Douro Valley
fields.colour: Medium depth, dark cherry with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Rich, good intensity, sweet black fruits, apricot, raisins, toffee, caramel, butterscotch, menthol, chocolate, citrus peel and spice.
fields.taste: Med body, lightly tannic with spicy acidity. Palate is not as expressive as the nose, flavours of cherry, apricot jam and fruit cake with a fiery lingering finish.
fields.overall: Good standard Port. Nose and finish are the highlights. My only complaint would be a lack of body. Otherwise, good value, well worth trying.

fields.name: Les Portes de Bordeaux
fields.colour: Medium purple with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Youthful, fresh and ripe, fruit driven, cherry, raspberries, plums, red berries, milk chocolate and bay leaf.
fields.taste: Feels weak, smooth tannic structure, juicy vital acidity. Some red fruit and chocolate on the palate, but needs to open up more. Pleasant finish.
fields.overall: Had better, had worse, probably needs more time to develop, still a bit one dimensional. Nice nose but lacking muscle. Expected more at this price, a midweeker.

fields.name: Manzanos 1961
fields.colour: Medium garnet with a brick red rim.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, superb aged aromas of woodsmoke, barnyard, leather, cedar, tobacco, dried leaves/pot pourri, mushroom, dried fruit and figs.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich yet mellow, slightly chewy tannin but still really smooth. Fruit of the forest and coffee on the palate with a touch of spice on a nice lingering finish. Still lots of fruit to balance the oak.
fields.overall: Absolutely wonderful. Refined and elegant, a rare opportunity to have a good vintage wine at a reasonable price. Would buy again but I guess this was a one-off.

fields.name: Léon Beyer Sylvaner
fields.colour: Bright, pale gold with green nuances.
fields.aroma: Subtle, lemon, ripe bruised apple, pear, orange blossom, leafy with a mineral/flinty quality.
fields.taste: Bone-dry, brisk mouthwatering acidity but still feels fleshy and rounded. Citrusy palate and finish albeit very soft, almost hollow.
fields.overall: Very appealing, elegant and piquant might describe this wine best. Soft and gentle on the nose and palate but lifted by the crisp acidity. Perhaps lacking on the palate but well balanced, juicy, fresh and moreish. Very good QPR, serve chilled, recommend.

fields.name: Mionetto Mo Prosecco Treviso (Extra Dry) N.V.
fields.colour: Bright, very pale lemon with a green tinge, short lived lively bubbles.
fields.aroma: Light and airy, green apple, pear, melon, saline, biscuit and some floral notes.
fields.taste: Little density, soft bubbles and a refreshing brisk acidity. The light citrus, apple and almond palate is pleasant with a nice mouth drying but brief finish .
fields.overall: A very typical Prosecco with no frills but still very nice. Soft and gentle but good balance making it quite moreish and very easy-drinking. Fairly priced, worth a try.

fields.name: Black Duck Durif
fields.colour: Dense, dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Rich and jammy, plum, blackcurrant, black tea, lavender, ground coffee and vanilla.
fields.taste: Full and robust, luscious, vital acidity, ripe smooth tannin, balanced. Palate comes across as almost sweet with flavours of blueberry, vanilla, plum and cherry ending with a medium spicy finish.
fields.overall: Very appealing, and although it is a big round red it is hard to put down. Fruity with a nice touch of oak, well priced and I would recommend.

fields.name: Elio Perrone Sourgal Moscato d'Asti
fields.colour: Gently sparkling, very pale lemon yellow.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and sweet, honeysuckle, orange blossom, apricot, sage, stone fruits like peach and lychee.
fields.taste: Light, refreshing with a wonderful creaminess from the soft bubbles. The sweet fruit squash, mandarin orange, grape, lychee and apricot palate is nicely lifted by vital acidity. Good finish.
fields.overall: This is so moreish and appealing, impossible to put down. Sweet but not at all heavy with a lovely long after-taste, balanced. Light, fresh, elegant and refined, a wine to enjoy anytime, this is great value for money, highly recommend.

fields.name: RedHeads Adelais Pinot Noir - Shiraz
fields.colour: Attractive carmine red.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, cherry, raspberry, dried fruits, earthy mushrooms, leather, smoke, cola and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med- body, firm drying tannin, ample acidity. Gamey and savoury combined with raspberry sauce and plum on the palate. Very spicy but brief finish.
fields.overall: Not bad, my biggest complaints are the lack of body (thought the Shiraz would have beefed it up) and the finish. However, nice nose and I like the chewy tannin. Not remarkable but pleasant, drinkable, a change from the norm.

fields.name: Kelly Country Shiraz
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Rich and warming, janmy black fruits, plum, black olives, leather, dried leaves/herbs, strong coffee with notes of tar and tobacco.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, mild gentle tannin, tart acidity, feels a bit loose and lean. Cooked fruit, liquorice and chocolate flavours ending with a peppery finish.
fields.overall: Just ok, the nose promises much but the lack of body and slight bitterness on the palate let it down. More fruit and tannin needed, Expected more, hard to recommend.

fields.name: Spotlight Vermentino
fields.colour: Lustrous, straw yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Expressive, petrol, petrichor, lime, grapefruit, rosemary, sage, saline with lesser notes of apple and pear.
fields.taste: Dry and light, medium acidity, feels a little weak. Nose is repeated on the palate with a good length bitter green herbal after-taste.
fields.overall: What a different but really pleasant surprise. Think chemical/burning plastic but in a good way. Interesting nose, juicy, good length across the palate. I wouldn't think this is for everybody and certainly not perfect but I would recommend as a good midweek wine.

fields.name: Shot In The Dark Cabernet - Shiraz
fields.colour: Dense, dark inky cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Lush ripe red and black bramble fruits, blackcurrant, raspberry, plum, chocolate, menthol, tobacco and baking spices.
fields.taste: Med-full bodied, viscous with a savoury grainy tannic backbone. Subtle liquorice, raspberry chocolate palate ending with a med- spicy finish.
fields.overall: Bold, rich and fruity balanced by a nice touch of oak. A robust wine but not overpowering, very easy-drinking. Let down a little by the palate and finish but minor fault. Good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Moonstruck Chardonnay Marsanne Viognier
fields.colour: Bright, light straw with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, citrus blossom, melon, lychee, yellow apple, almond and pineapple with a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, crisp, lively acidity with a creamy texture. Flavours of buttered toast, apple and apricot followed by a smooth med+ finish.
fields.overall: Its ok, fresh and pleasant but apart from the very nice finish and after-taste nothing stands out. The blend just doesn't seem to work. Fairly priced, decent midweek wine. Don't over chill.

fields.name: 30 Mile Shiraz
fields.colour: Opaque, dense cherry red.
fields.aroma: Expressive, rich and sweet, blueberry, raspberry, blackberry jam, eucalyptus, menthol, dried fruit, chocolate, oak, tobacco and lots of pepper.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, viscous, light silky tannin giving a smooth texture. Melted chocolate and fruit across the palate with a good length finish.
fields.overall: A full-on Aussie Shiraz, will please anyone who likes this style. Luscious, unctous, robust, Port like. I wholly enjoyed this and at the price I am not going to find fault, recommend.

fields.name: The Optimist Old Vine Sémillon
fields.colour: Rich golden yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, beeswax, honey, melted butter, chamomile, lemon, orange, apricot, oil/kerosene, mould but in a godd way.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich and fleshy, med- acidity, smooth texture. More apricot and orange squash on the palate ending with a moderate fruity jammy finish.
fields.overall: A lot to like here, lovely nose, lees ageing is evident and beneficial IMHO. Good balance and texture, flavoursome and all at a good price. Recommend for someone who is looking for something a bit fuller and opulent but not overpowering.

fields.name: Willy Willy Shiraz
fields.colour: Deep, dark purple with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Sharp almost agressive, herbal, savoury red fruits like cranberry and redcurrants, blackberries, liquorice, eucalyptus, menthol and pepper.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, med+ acidity, soft loose-grained tannin, smooth texture. Red and black berries on the palate, med finish.
fields.overall: Not a full throttle Shiraz, nor as fruity as others but still very pleasant. Aromatic, juicy, easy-drinking but lacks balance, it just seems over manufactured. Decent everyday wine, worth a try.

fields.name: Westend Chardonnay No. 1
fields.colour: Bright, straw yellow with a glint of green.
fields.aroma: Ripe and tropical, melon, mango, quince, stone fruits, butter, touch of toffee and an earthiness like mushroom.
fields.taste: Bordering dry and off-dry, med+ body, rich but balanced by a lively lemony acidity with fleshy texture. Buttered toast and citrus palate with a smooth finish.
fields.overall: A good Chardonnay, weighty but retains a crispness so not too heavy. A well-rounded wine, nothing overpowering. Probably best served lightly chilled with food, not profound but good at the price.

fields.name: Ca' Bolani Prosecco Edizione Limitata NV
fields.colour: Light fine bubbles. Very pale straw with a silver/green tinge.
fields.aroma: Apple, pear, sherbet lemon, honeysuckle and floral with lesser notes of apricots, cream and saline.
fields.taste: Light and refreshing, a touch of sweetness, brisk acidity with a nice creamy texture. Lemon, orange and kiwi on the palate with a good sustained after-taste.
fields.overall: A very pleasant surprise, starts off with a nice standard nose but kicks into gear on the palate. Flavoursome, smooth and a lovely finish. May benefit from more bubbles to add a bit of lift and zip but minor complaint. Recommend.

fields.name: McPherson The Full Fifteen
fields.colour: Sustained dark ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Hot and fruity, chocolate, raspberry, strawberry jam, liquorice, paprika, black forest fruits, damson and plum with a touch of tobacco and dried leaves.
fields.taste: Full and rich, mild fine tannin, abundant acidity, soft smooth texture. The intense palate reflects the nose ending with a warming med- finish.
fields.overall: Lots going on, big nose, strong palate, smooth and well balanced (oak is light but evident and the high alcohol does not overpower the rest of the wine). Great value, easy drinking for such a rich dense wine, definitely recommend.

fields.name: Domaine Cauhapé Chant des Vignes Jurançon Sec
fields.colour: Bright, golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic, nose tingling and ripe, orange peel, apricot jam, pineapple, lemon, grapefruit, honey and floral with a grassy note.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, juicy, med acidity, smooth texture. Palate brings orange, apricot, almond and a slight bitterness on the sustained finish.
fields.overall: Nose is almost sweet yet dry on the palate. Ripe fruit, appealing and flavoursome a wine with some depth and a very nice finish. High alcohol is balanced and well-integrated. A lot of wine for the money, definitely recommend.

fields.name: Tornesi Rosso di Montalcino
fields.colour: Medium garnet fading to brick red.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, red fruits, strawberry, cherry, sun-dried tomato, espresso, tobacco, a subtle smokiness, cured meat, vanilla and pepper.
fields.taste: Med- body, med+ acidity, moderate chewy tannin, granular feel on the palate. Good length mid-palate, savoury red fruit and herb flavours with a lingering finish.
fields.overall: Rustic might describe this wine, a few rough edges but on the whole, pleasant and approachable. What it lacks in body it makes up for with a good nose and lingering after-taste. Expected more for the price, hard to recommend.

fields.name: Brotherhood New York Red
fields.colour: Light, pale cherry red.
fields.aroma: Fruity but average, plum, blueberry, cherry, raspberries, dried fruit, herbs and something sour.
fields.taste: Med- body, gentle mild tannin, mellow on the palate with a nice if all too brief sweet and sour cherry flavour and after-taste.
fields.overall: Simple and quite ordinary. Not much going on, subdued and soft, lacking body, flavour and length, it even looks weak. Ok, it is pleasant and easy-drinking but wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: The Hour-Teller Sauvignon Blanc
fields.winery: Imported and bottled for Direct Wines
fields.colour: Luminous, pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Powerful, gooseberry, passion-fruit, asparagus, green herbs, grass, lime, kiwi, lemongrass, juicy green apple, perhaps a touch of pear and ginger.
fields.taste: Dry, light-bodied, refreshing, zesty acidity. Lots of citrus and herbs on the palate ending with a good bitter herbaceous finish.
fields.overall: Unmistakable NZ Sauv Blanc, strong green nose, fresh, easy-drinking but not a wine to get excited about. Straightforward and pleasant, okay for the price, a good midweek wine.

fields.name: Alessandro Gallici Pinot Grigio delle Venezie
fields.colour: Clean and fresh, pale gold.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, citrusy (lime and grapefruit), yellow apple, pear, honeysuckle, orange blossom and a mineral quality like wet stone.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, crisp, piquant acidity with a smooth slightly fleshy texture. More honeysuckle/orange and pear on the palate with a solid sustained finish.
fields.overall: Surprisingly nice, pleasant, approachable and balanced, nothing shouts out, everything in moderation. Worth the price, recommend.

fields.name: Les Pierres Bordes Marsanne-Viognier
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Average, orange blossom, grapefruit, apricot and baked apple with notes of honey, smoke and beeswax.
fields.taste: Dry, med body, crisp acidity, mellow texture. Moderate peach and bitter almonds on the palate followed by a med- finish.
fields.overall: A little disappointing, not as good as the 2015. Weak, lacking intensity on both the nose and palate. Ok for the price but a midweek wine at best and I can't recommend.

fields.name: Bardolino Le Fraghe
fields.region: Affi and Cavaion Veronese, Bardolino, Veneto
fields.colour: Pale ruby red.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, both red and black berry fruits, strawberry, cherry, cola, peppercorn and something floral/green herbs.
fields.taste: Dry, med- bodied, abundant acidity, very soft tannin, lean texture. More cherry, cola and liquorice on the palate with a moderate finish.
fields.overall: Not remarkable but certainly a very pleasant wine. Fruity, refreshing, easy-drinking are all pluses. On the negative it lacks body and complexity but at the price this stands up well making it well worth a try.

fields.name: Lacaze Cabernet Carmenere
fields.colour: Dense purple with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, lots of ripe and jammy fruit, plum, raspberry, blackberry, figs, chocolate, touch of spice.
fields.taste: Med- body, supple light tannin, firm acidity, feels a little weak. Palate is all fruit followed by a med drying finish.
fields.overall: Simple, one-dimensional, a bit disjointed but still pleasant and very easy-drinking. A fairly priced decent midweek wine. Decanting for an hour greatly improves quality.

fields.name: Franck Massard Bellesa Perfecta
fields.colour: Bright, cherry red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med intensity, more herbal and tertiary than fruity, eucalyptus, cured meat, tobacco, dried herbs, strawberry, raspberry, plum, chocolate, liquorice, touch of spice.
fields.taste: Med body, abundant acidity, textured coarse-grained tannin. More chocolate, liquorice and raspberry on the palate but it is not sustained and the peppery finish is all too brief.
fields.overall: The nose promises a lot but that was as good as it gets. I do like the nicely integrated effect of the oak but flavour, body and length let this wine down. Certainly not bad but I do not think it is worth the money.

fields.name: Springfield Estate ‘Miss Lucy'
fields.colour: Very bright, pale gold with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Expressive, gooseberry, grapefruit, passionfruit, grass/hay, green bell pepper, lemongrass, saline with a touch of honeysuckle and ginger.
fields.taste: Med body, crisp and refreshing, zingy acidity, mellow texture. Flavoursome, gooseberry, kiwi and passionfruit across the good length mid-palate followed by a clean citrusy resonant finish.
fields.overall: Delightful, big nose, long palate and a lingering finish. This wine is mouthwateringly acidic but with a lovely smoothness, a good balance. Hard not to be impressed by this, great value, definitely recommend.

fields.name: Dark Corner Durif - Shiraz
fields.colour: Opaque inky red.
fields.aroma: Rich, ripe and spicy. Plum, blueberry, blackcurrant jam, raspberry, cherry, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, cinnamon and nutmeg with just a hint of bbq smoke.
fields.taste: Full, opulent, juicy and just off-dry. Fine-grained to slightly gummy tannin. Cherry, liquorice, chocolate and spice palate, moderate finish.
fields.overall: Young, big, intense and unctuous. Good all-round, ok it hasn't got the elegance and finesse of a classier wine but it's easy-drinking, appealing, good value, well worth a try.

fields.name: Boland Kelder Cabernet Sauvignon - Shiraz
fields.colour: Murky, dense brown with an orange rim.
fields.aroma: Aged and strong, coffee, pencil lead, dried fruit, toffee, leather and cedar.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, heavy, still quite tannic. All aged tertiary flavours, no fruit, a persistent and potent oaky after-taste.
fields.overall: A wine past its best. Sadly most of this went down the sink. Perfect example of ageing a wine is not always a good thing.

fields.name: ContraPosto
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, cherry, black berries, plum, roasted red peppers, mocha, dried flowers and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, med+ acidity, moderate grainy tannin. Cherry, liquorice and raspberry on the palate with a touch of pepper on the good sustained finish.
fields.overall: Young, pleasant and very approachable. Nothing overpowering, all fruit (perhaps missing a touch of oak), juicy and nice on all counts. Fairly priced, recommend.

fields.name: The Huguenot Chenin Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, pale lemon yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, lemony, unripe tree and tropical fruits like peach, juicy green apple, melon and pineapple with a touch of floral blossom.
fields.taste: Med- body, crisp, brisk acidity but not much weight. More lemon, honey and marzipan on a good mid-palate with a med+ finish.
fields.overall: Very pleasant, easy-going and refreshing. For the price this is very good all-round, perhaps a little thin but minor complaint. Well worth a try if you are looking for something light and crisp.

fields.name: Virgile Joly Carthagéne
fields.colour: New copper/Deep salmon pink.
fields.aroma: Rich, good intensity, black tea, raspberry, strawberry, apricot, toffee, caramel, raisins, figs, rose and walnuts.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, viscous, med- acidity. The palate is apricot jam, marzipan and dried fruits ending with a spicy finish.
fields.overall: Rich and unctuous but not balanced, seems a bit sugar heavy, a bit more acidity may help. Certainly pleasant with a nice nose but the palate and after-taste let it down. Wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Portal das Hortas Touriga Nacional Palhete
fields.colour: Beautiful copper red, slight touch of spritz.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, a touch sweet, strawberry, raspberry, grapefruit, sour cherry, violets, mint and lots of pepper.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, light soft tannin, med acidity, smooth texture. Some strawberry and red berries on the palate but a bit hollow. Spicy med- finish.
fields.overall: Nice but a bit one dimensional. Fantastic colour and a nice nose are both highlights but the flavour and finish are quite empty leaving a bad impression. Good for the price but not memorable and wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Le Père Guillot
fields.colour: Bright, light ruby red.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, lots of red fruit, strawberry, pomegranate, rhubarb, cherry, redcurrants and black tea.
fields.taste: Meagre body, lightly tannic, juicy, abundant acidity, stringy texture. Flavours include boiled sweets, cherry, banana and strawberry but both mid-palate and are all too brief.
fields.overall: Average at best, this just feels watered down. I do like the nose and flavour but even by Gamay standards this wine needs more oomph. I wouldn't buy again as better available even at this price range.

fields.name: The Society's Falanghina del Sannio
fields.colour: Luminous, golden yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Open and lasting, orange blossom, lemon, melon, grass, honey, pineapple, a mineral quality with a touch of spicy herbs and musk.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, zesty acidity, feels rounded, a smooth creaminess. Core flavour and finish of orange and lemon, good finish.
fields.overall: Very enjoyable, a good balance between acidity, fullness of flavour and texture. Crisp, juicy and some weight, punches above its weight in this price range, certainly recommend.

fields.name: Domaine Glinavos Paleokerisio
fields.colour: Hazy, lightly sparkling, deep cognac orange.
fields.aroma: Ripe, good intensity, apple tart, stewed apple, apricot, honey, orange peel, cinnamon, vanilla and rich dried fruit.
fields.taste: Off-dry, med body, mildly tannic, light bubbles give a drying smooth texture. Apricots, apple cider and sweet cherries on the palate ending with a nice bitter/sour sustained finish.
fields.overall: Different but wonderful, a good balance between bitter and sweet, acidity and tannin, all lifted by the fine bubbles. Very easy-drinking, great price, well worth seeking out.

fields.name: Le Prince de Courthézon Côtes du Rhône
fields.colour: Deep black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Intense and rich, an instant smokiness (bbq), coffee, tar, band-aid, leather, cured meat, strong black tea, liquorice, lavender and black pepper underpinned by both black and red fruits.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, ripe gripping/drying tannin. Palate seems a bit closed and unexpressive with some subtle liquorice and red fruits, peppery finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, good concentration, generous nose, more secondary aromas than primary which may not suit everyone, a wine for food, good QPR, may need a bit more time but still a good buy.

fields.name: Dinastía Manzanos Oak Aged Rioja
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Expressive, strawberry, sour cherry, blueberries, smoke, dried flowers, anise, bay leaf, smoked meat, new leather and vanilla.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, moderate tannin, med+ acidity, mellow texture. A palate of plum, liquorice and chocolate with a med persistent finish.
fields.overall: Good example of Rioja, fruit and oak in equal measures, juicy, ripe, approachable. Should not disappoint, good value, worth a try.

fields.name: Hardys Nottage HillMerlot
fields.colour: Straightforward, standard AustralianMerlot. Fruit-forward, rich and ripe. Aromas of cherry, strawberries, black berries, chocolate and lots of spice. Full-bodied, very soft tannin, smooth, sweet fruit and oak on the palate with a pleasant finish. Good for the price, easy-drinking, a good midweek wine.
fields.aroma: Straightforward, standard AustralianMerlot. Fruit-forward, rich and ripe. Aromas of cherry, strawberries, black berries, chocolate and lots of spice. Full-bodied, very soft tannin, smooth, sweet fruit and oak on the palate with a pleasant finish. Good for the price, easy-drinking, a good midweek wine.
fields.taste: Straightforward, standard AustralianMerlot. Fruit-forward, rich and ripe. Aromas of cherry, strawberries, black berries, chocolate and lots of spice. Full-bodied, very soft tannin, smooth, sweet fruit and oak on the palate with a pleasant finish. Good for the price, easy-drinking, a good midweek wine.
fields.overall: Straightforward, standard AustralianMerlot. Fruit-forward, rich and ripe. Aromas of cherry, strawberries, black berries, chocolate and lots of spice. Full-bodied, very soft tannin, smooth, sweet fruit and oak on the palate with a pleasant finish. Good for the price, easy-drinking, a good midweek wine.

fields.name: Contarini La Fornarina Prosecco N.V.
fields.colour: Cheap, simple Prosecco. Large non-persistent bubbles, bland, perhaps some tree fruit and citrus on the nose and palate but all rather subtle and fleeting. Not unpleasant but just an unmemorable easy drinking party drink.
fields.aroma: Cheap, simple Prosecco. Large non-persistent bubbles, bland, perhaps some tree fruit and citrus on the nose and palate but all rather subtle and fleeting. Not unpleasant but just an unmemorable easy drinking party drink.
fields.taste: Cheap, simple Prosecco. Large non-persistent bubbles, bland, perhaps some tree fruit and citrus on the nose and palate but all rather subtle and fleeting. Not unpleasant but just an unmemorable easy drinking party drink.
fields.overall: Cheap, simple Prosecco. Large non-persistent bubbles, bland, perhaps some tree fruit and citrus on the nose and palate but all rather subtle and fleeting. Not unpleasant but just an unmemorable easy drinking party drink.

fields.name: Passadouro Passa, Douro Branco
fields.colour: Bright, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and crisp, lemon, orange blossom, tree fruit, green tropical fruits, acacia, honey and a sharp stony mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, refreshing, vibrant acidity balanced by a fleshy smooth texture. More herbal and floral than fruity on the palate with a tart nuttiness to a decent finish.
fields.overall: Not a fruit bomb but still very pleasant. Lots of acidity but the lees ageing adds balance and weight. Probably better suited for food than on its own, don't over chill. Fairly priced, worth a try.

fields.name: Seifried Estate Gewürztraminer
fields.colour: Radiant golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Exotic, fruity and floral, lychee, apricots, peach, orange peel, rose, gingerbread, honey and just a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Med-full body, lush and muscular but mellow and smooth across the palate. Off-dry yet balanced by the vital acidity. Intense flavours of pineapple, orange squash and baking spices ending with a lasting succulent finish.
fields.overall: Wonderful surprise; expressive, rich, full-flavoured and long lasting. Well made, moreish and well worth the price, recommend.

fields.name: Cielo e TerraMerlot
fields.colour: Very disappointing. Tart raspberry, cherry and black berry fruits on the nose. Med+ body but the fruit is overpowered by a harshness from the unripe tannin and a bitter/sour cherry palate that just drowns everything else. Drinkable but wouldn't buy again.
fields.aroma: Very disappointing. Tart raspberry, cherry and black berry fruits on the nose. Med+ body but the fruit is overpowered by a harshness from the unripe tannin and a bitter/sour cherry palate that just drowns everything else. Drinkable but wouldn't buy again.
fields.taste: Very disappointing. Tart raspberry, cherry and black berry fruits on the nose. Med+ body but the fruit is overpowered by a harshness from the unripe tannin and a bitter/sour cherry palate that just drowns everything else. Drinkable but wouldn't buy again.
fields.overall: Very disappointing. Tart raspberry, cherry and black berry fruits on the nose. Med+ body but the fruit is overpowered by a harshness from the unripe tannin and a bitter/sour cherry palate that just drowns everything else. Drinkable but wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Lindeman's Western Cape Cabernet Sauvignon -Merlot
fields.colour: Dark and inky with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Solid, blackcurrant, plum, damson and chocolate with a touch of vanilla and spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, soft tannin, med acidity, smooth texture. Nose is repeated on the palate but the finish is moderate at best.
fields.overall: As you would expect for the money, this is simple and straightforward. Not as fruit forward as some wines in this price range but it is pleasant and approachable. A decent midweek if on a budget.

fields.name: Château Millegrand Minervois
fields.colour: Intense garnet red with ruby nuances.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, blackberry, plum, cherry, forest fruits, lavender, green herbs, pepper and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med+ body, fine ripe tannic backbone, textured and fleshy. Both fruit and oak are evident on the palate with a med- finish.
fields.overall: Very good, a lot of wine for the price. Nice balance between the fruit and oak, good nose and body, well worth picking up.

fields.name: Oxenberry Pedler Creek Shiraz
fields.colour: Deep dark purple with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Rich and intense, raspberry, blackberry, blueberry, plum, dried fruit, chocolate, mint, eucalyptus, sweet tobacco, leather and lots of pepper.
fields.taste: Dry, full and bold, juicy acidity, solid tannic backbone bringing texture. Sapid on the palate with flavours of liquorice, cherry and raspberry chocolate ending with a spicy finish.
fields.overall: A typical robust Aussie Shiraz. Big on everything and wholly enjoyable. Generous on both nose and palate, balance (high alcohol is not evident). It might lack style and finesse but a worthy buy for fans of this style.

fields.name: San Alejandro Pablo Old Vine Garnacha
fields.colour: Dark ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Expressive, both red and black berries, liquorice, cherry, chocolate, black tea, vanilla, smoke and spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, soft tannin, med acidity, rounded. The palate is dominated by fruit with a good sustained finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, a wine with quite a bit going on but still young and may benefit from a bit more time. Good value and food friendly.

fields.name: Campanula Dry Sparkling
fields.colour: Very pale lemon yellow, lively medium sized bubbles that dissipate quickly.
fields.aroma: Open, orange blossom, apple, pear, melon and lychee.
fields.taste: Dry, light, crisp and refreshing, brisk acidity, bubbles give a smooth creamy texture. Flavours of apple and apricot, fruity moderate finish.
fields.overall: Certainly no Champagne, a frivolous uncomplicated sparkling wine. Not a wine to ponder over. Nice nose and creaminess on the palate but even at this price I was a little disappointed, hard to recommend.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Pinotage
fields.colour: Deep dark purple fading to a red rim.
fields.aroma: Profound and rich, blackcurrant, cherry, menthol, an earthiness, mushroom, undergrowth, sweet and sour sauce, tar, smoke, sweet tobacco and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, moderate firm slightly drying tannin, abundant acidity, balanced. Curious mid-palate of raspberry and smoked cured meat ending with a good hot spicy finish.
fields.overall: So enjoyable, great example of the 'love it' or 'hate it' Pinotage. Good nose, good length, all in all a well-rounded wine. Very good value, highly recommend.

fields.name: J. Opi Malbec
fields.colour: Pale ruby with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Med intensity, plum, raspberry, blackberry, liquorice, peppercorn, prune, something floral and sweet tobacco,
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, very little tannin, firm acidity. A palate of tart cherries, raspberries and liquorice, good length mid-palate and a warm peppery finish.
fields.overall: Good entry-level Malbec, not a complex wine, juicy, young, lots of fruit, easy-drinking. Not a fault but personally I would prefer more oak and body. Good midweek wine, good value for money.

fields.name: Côtes du Jura Tradition
fields.colour: Very distinctive orange gold.
fields.aroma: Like sherry, profound, varnish, honey, dried nuts, apricots, bruised apple, preserved lemons, dried fruit/fruitcake and a damp earthiness.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, dense and viscous, vigorous acidity, a stony minerality. Long mid-palate of orange peel, wood and honey with a smooth long nutty after-taste.
fields.overall: My first Jura white and unforgettable. Like a cross of white Port and Sherry, powerful and opulent yet fresh and light thanks to the good acidity. Complex and concentrated, it just leaves you wanting more, delicious. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Diego Fernandez Verdil
fields.colour: Bright, golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Open and overripe, lemon, lime, apricot, bruised apple, something tropical, wax, lanolin with a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, med- acidity, smooth across the palate. More ripe tropical fruits and apple flavours ending with a spiciness to the so-so finish. Bitter after-taste.
fields.overall: Not bad but... Nice nose and good creamy texture, however; in my opinion it lacks acidity, making it a little heavy and that bitterness to the finish is hard to forget, not pleasant. Decent midweek wine but much better available for £11.

fields.name: Romate Don José a Selection of Oloroso Medium Dry
fields.colour: Deep dark orange brown.
fields.aroma: Pungent and rich, baking spices/allspice, fruitcake, dried apricots, dates, bruised apple, citrus peel, caramel, toffee, vanilla and a damp dusty note but in a good way.
fields.taste: Dry, full-bodied, viscous with good brisk acidity. Smooth on the palate with flavours of nuts, marzipan and jammy dried fruits with a persistent long after-taste.
fields.overall: Wholly enjoyable. Complex and long might sum it up best and at a bargain of a price. A must buy for anyone who likes this style of Sherry.

fields.name: Susumaniello Salento Rosso
fields.colour: Bright clear cherry red.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, ripe, lots of jammy red and black fruits, raspberry, cherry, blackberries, leather chocolate, cured meat, a hint of smoke and something floral.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, opulent but not heavy, juicy vibrant acidity, generous palate reflecting the nose with firm grippy tannin giving a drying texture ending with a lovely sustained finish.
fields.overall: Very approachable and easy-drinking. A winner on all counts, good nose, palate and length. Not a complex sophisticated wine but ripe and smooth, ticks a lot of boxes and great value.

fields.name: Rex Mundi Shiraz Grenache
fields.colour: Deep ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, candied cherry, raspberry, stewed strawberries, damson or blackberry jam, liquorice, chocolate and vanilla with an undertone of green herbs, paprika and black tea.
fields.taste: Med body, mouth-watering acidity, just off-dry perhaps with very mild tannin giving a smooth if somewhat stretched palate. Flavours of strawberries and cherries but the finish is a bit brief.
fields.overall: Certainly an easy-drinking wine with its generous nose and tasty palate making it hard to put down. Seems to lack depth of flavour and length but not a bad wine, rich and moreish, fairly priced, worth a try.

fields.name: Sainsbury’s Taste the Difference Beaujolais Supérieur
fields.colour: Crimson with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Vibrant and youthful, raspberry, plum, cherry, banana, bubblegum backed up by a strong herbal note.
fields.taste: Light, refreshing, virtually no tannin, med+ acidity. All red fruit jam on the palate with a med length finish.
fields.overall: Very moreish, you get exactly what you pay for. Nothing complex or sophisticated just a juicy, tasty standard Beaujolais that delivers. Very good for the price.

fields.name: Astobiza Txacoli
fields.colour: Luminous, very pale lemon yellow, almost translucent rim.
fields.aroma: Subtle at first but did open up. Crunchy unripe peach and apple, honeydew melon, lemon, floral, a tropical note, sea breeze salinity.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, fresh and crisp, zingy acidity but with a smooth rich texture. Full palate of apple, lime, grapefruit and tangerine with a slight bitter salinity to a good long finish.
fields.overall: Lovely wine, mouthwateringly juicy, acidic but balanced by some body and abundant fruit flavours. Nose was a bit ordinary but minor fault. Decent QPR, needs to be well-chilled, recommend.

fields.name: Hunter's MiruMiru Marlborough Brut NV
fields.colour: Lively mid-sized bubbles. Bright, pale straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Initially secondary and tertiary aromas of buttered toast, yeast and cream backed up by lemon, apple, peach, apricot and almonds.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, refreshing brisk acidity. Flavoursome palate of burnt toast, preserved lemons and apple but lacks creaminess. Smooth drying finish and the after-taste really lingers.
fields.overall: Very nice, I especially liked the autolytic nose and lovely long finish. A little disappointed by the palate (no mouthful of foam from the bubbles), this is no substitute for Champagne but for the price a good alternative.

fields.name: Château de la Greffière La Roche Vineuse
fields.colour: Pale gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Developed, lemon, quince, orange peel, toffee, stone, cultured cream, butter, honeyed fruit like apricot and yellow apple.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, firm muscular structure, med- acidity, textured. Honey, beeswax and ripe fruit on the palate, med finish.
fields.overall: A well-developed Chardonnay, fruit and lees ageing are well balanced. May lack acidity and a touch bitter on the finish but still a good example of white Burgundy. Fair price and worth a try. Needs food, paired well with monkfish and creamy sauce.

fields.name: Tahbilk The Tower MVR
fields.colour: Attractive bright green gold.
fields.aroma: Expressive, very ripe, oil/paraffin, beeswax, shoe polish with lesser fruit notes of peach, lemon and orange.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, vital acidity, mellow texture. Nice palate of apricot, peach and wet stone/flint but the finish is a little fleeting.
fields.overall: Quite nice, lighter and more refreshing than I was expecting. That paraffin nose is odd yet strangely appealing. A bit disjointed as it seems to lack fruity aromas and the finish is weak, probably best with food and well-chilled, fair price, worth a try.

fields.name: Marks & Spencer Fleurie
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, raspberry, blueberry, ripe banana, cherry and pomegranate with a slight note of clay.
fields.taste: Light, dry, refreshing, vibrant acidity, virtually no tannin. Candied red fruit on the palate ending with a good length finish.
fields.overall: Light but still succulent and rich. Crunchy fruit, juicy and easy-drinking are all positives making a very good example of Beaujolais. Good QPR, a fun uncomplicated go-to wine.

fields.name: Tuercebotas Tempranillo Blanco
fields.region: Aldeanueva de Ebro, La Rioja Baja distric
fields.colour: Bright pale golden yellow with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Crisp and fresh yet with a richness. Tangy lemon, green apple and peaches with a spicy mineral note. Also more ripe fruits like pineapple, bruised banana, honey and wax.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, vital acidity, rounded. Good depth of flavour with a floral/grassy and tropical fruit salad palate and a ripe rich resonant finish.
fields.overall: A real joy and a welcome surprise. Unusual grape that really delivers on all counts. Very generous nose and palate, rich yet fresh, great value for money, wholly recommend.

fields.name: Domaine des Pierres Dorées
fields.colour: Bright pale golden yellow with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Crisp and fresh yet with a richness. Tangy lemon, green apple and peaches with a spicy mineral note. Also more ripe fruits like pineapple, bruised banana, honey and wax.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, vital acidity, rounded. Good depth of flavour with a floral/grassy and tropical fruit salad palate and a ripe rich resonant finish.
fields.overall: A real joy and a welcome surprise. Unusual grape that really delivers on all counts. Very generous nose and palate, rich yet fresh, great value for money, wholly recommend.

fields.name: Cairanne Cru des Côtes du Rhône Réserve Hospitaliers
fields.colour: Intense, deep dark cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Open and spicy, dark chocolate, dried herbs, black olives, blackberry jam, cranberries, raspberry, cherry, leather, cinnamon and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich and round, fresh acidity and ripe tannin adding texture. Full-flavoured, slightly sweet forest fruits, cherry and liquorice with a med- mouth-tingling hot smoky finish.
fields.overall: Lovely CdR, supple, balanced, a wine with a lot to say but not shouty. Very good QPR, needs a little time to open up, highly recommend.

fields.name: Poderi dal Nespoli Pagadebit
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Fresh and tangy, lemon, melon, crisp green apple, tangerine, leafy green herbs, honey and a stony minerality.
fields.taste: Medium-bodied, dry, refreshing zesty acidity, very smooth palate. Concentrated flavours of lemon, orange and apple wih a savouriness ending with a good length peachy finish.
fields.overall: Another wonderful white Italian surprise. Delicious, juicy, ripe yet still crisp and lively. Strong nose and palate, lasting, a wine with a lot to offer, hard to find fault at this price. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Cleto Chiarli Nivola Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro
fields.region: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro DOC, Emilia-Romagna
fields.colour: Brief froth of bubbles that fade quickly. Intense dark carmine red.
fields.aroma: Med intensity, fruity, cherry cola, raspberries, blueberries, rhubarb, ripe banans and violets.
fields.taste: Med+ body, lively acidity, mildly tannic, smooth drying texture, a little disjointed. Sustained mid-palate of sweet candied cherries, bubblegum, raspberries and cough medicine. Moderate fruity after-taste.
fields.overall: A simple wine (reminded me of a Beaujolais Nouveau) but very approachable and appealing. Medium sweet, easy-drinking. A decent midweek wine, worth a try.

fields.name: Litre of The Society’s Medium Dry Amontillado Blend
fields.colour: Bright golden amber brown.
fields.aroma: Intense and complex, apricots, walnut, peanut, coffee, raisins, fruitcake, prunes, orange peel, varnish, tea, caramel and saline.
fields.taste: Full and viscous, vibrant acidity, smooth and long across the palate. Flavours include ginger biscuits, citrus peel, strong tea and apricot with an enduring spicy walnut finish.
fields.overall: A lovely mellow sherry, not as sweet as I was expecting. Nothing overpowering, lovely depth to the palate and well-balanced. Great value for money, highly recommend.

fields.name: Krasno Sauvignon Blanc - Ribolla Gialla
fields.colour: Radiant, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, floral, lemon, grass, green herbs, sage, bell pepper and ripe apple with lesser notes of tropical fruit, gooseberries and pear.
fields.taste: Med- body, dry, crisp, brisk acidity with a citrus mid-palate ending with a moderate tangy green slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Its not bad but lacks muscle, it feels a little weak and lacking in structure. Pleasant nose, more vegetal/floral than fruity. Fairly priced, a decent midweek wine.

fields.name: Mateus Rosé Original
fields.colour: Slight spritz, bright, light cherry pink.
fields.aroma: Average, all red fruit, strawberry, pomegranate, redcurrants, cranberries and sour cherries with a floral note.
fields.taste: Light and fresh, touch of sweetness, good acidity, balanced. Soft subtle palate, some candied red berries and watermelon perhaps. Tangy green finish, like gooseberry.
fields.overall: Better than I was expecting. Uncomplicated, appealing, approachable and easy-drinking. Take this for what it is, a hot summers day wine that's refreshing and simple, not to be mulled over.

fields.name: Château d'Anvichar
fields.winery: Vincent Galineau, Le Chai Au Quai
fields.region: Saint-Genès de Castillon, Côtes de Bordeaux
fields.colour: Black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Expressive and ripe, smoke, tobacco, blackcurrants, black cherry, plum, dried fruit/fruitcake, cedar, violets, vanilla and loads of spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, ripe and round, med acidity, smooth well-integrated tannin. Chocolate and bramble fruits on the palate, good length palate and a hot spicy finish.
fields.overall: Really enjoyable Bordeaux, a lovely balance between fruit and oak. A well made wine with some depth and complexity giving great vfm, highly recommend. Benefits from decanting.

fields.name: La Niña Roja Gran Reserva
fields.colour: Medium crimson with a pink rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, red berry jam, cherry, raspberry, plum, cola, dried flowers, smoke, leather, menthol and spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied (a bit thin), fresh acidity, supple, vey mild tannin. Ripe black and red fruits and vanilla on the palate with a hot spicy average length finish.
fields.overall: This is very enjoyable. OK it does seem to lack structure and depth but can't complain too much at the price, absolutely great value for money, worth an extra half star. Nice nose, flavoursome albeit a little brief, a wine that's not perfect but well worth a try.

fields.name: Verdicchio di Matelica Terravignata, Borgo Paglianetto
fields.colour: Bright and intense, golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and ripe, lemon curd, pear, yellow apple, honey, wax, tropical stone fruits and grass.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, smooth oily texture, crisp acidic backbone, well-rounded. Good citrus and almond mid-palate with a touch of spice and saline to the decent warm finish.
fields.overall: A fleshy structured wine offering a good nose and generous palate. Enjoyed this on its own but probably best with food, good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Angove Bin Ref. H 15 Verdelho
fields.colour: Fresh and bright, pale straw yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Open and ripe, oil/kerosene, honey, pear, pineapple, melon, honeysuckle and a hint of orange blossom.
fields.taste: Dry, light, crisp firm acidity. Palate reflects the nose with a decent mid-palate and a slightly bitter/nutty finish but there is not much texture or after-taste.
fields.overall: Just ok IMHO. Nose is different but nice, it's refreshing and easy-drinking on its own. However, I would like it to have more weight and length, just seems a bit gaunt. Decent midweek wine but can't help feeling it is a little overpriced.

fields.name: Heartland Sposa e Sposa
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Powerful and ripe, alcohol, menthol, liquorice, candied cherry, blackberry, plum, chocolate, green herbs and pepper with lesser notes of smoke and vanilla.
fields.taste: Full, rich and viscous, firm tannic structure. Palate includes smoky chocolate, cherry and raspberry ending with a hot spicy finish.
fields.overall: A full-on wine, big and bold. Strong nose overwhelmed by the alcohol, too much overripe fruit and not enough oak IMHO. A wine to savour, nice depth but lacks balance. Decent if this is your style of wine.

fields.name: Cleanskin Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, lime, lemon, kiwi, grapefruit, passionfruit, grass and gooseberry.
fields.taste: Med- body, light and fresh, med- acidity, soft on the palate. Citrus and peach flavours but all too brief, fleeting after-taste.
fields.overall: Expected so much more. Nose is the highlight. Its ok but needs more of everything, more body, more taste, more acidity etc... At this price there is much better available. Can't recommend.

fields.name: Primus Carmenère
fields.colour: Dense, very dark almost opaque cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Open and fruity, cherry, cola, chocolate, raspberry, sweet tobacco, liquorice, dried fig, cedar, blackberry jam, a herbal note and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich and succulent, good acidity, well-integrated smooth grippy tannin. A slight sweetness to the palate of plums, cherry and chocolate with a warm peppery finish.
fields.overall: Lovely wine, harmonious, nice balance between tannin, fruit and subtle oak. Aromatic, lots of flavour and a good price. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Cleanskin Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Open, dried herbs, forest fruits, liquorice, tobacco leaf, tar, eucalyptus, espresso, smoke, undergrowth and clove.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, good acidity, lightly tannic but lacking solidity. Subtle spicy palate, some red and black berries perhaps but it ends with a nice warming finish.
fields.overall: Not as big, fruity or powerful as I was expecting. The palate and weight are disappointing but the nose and finish are pluses. Ok value and I did enjoy it but if you are looking for a bold, rich, dense Shiraz this is not for you.

fields.name: Hatzidakis Santorini
fields.colour: Bright gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, lemon, lime, beeswax, honeysuckle, pear, hay and apple with hints of passionfruit and petrol and a mineral edge.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, dry, fleshy firm acidity, tingles on the palate with a drying sensation. Citrusy and ripe on the palate with a long petrol finish and after-taste.
fields.overall: A really enjoyable wine. Well-balanced as the mixture of primary and secondary aromas and flavours, weight, acidity and length make for easy drinking. Good value, another good find from Greece. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Wither Hills Chardonnay
fields.colour: Golden yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Med+ intensity, lemon, grapefruit, pineapple, apricot, baked apple, toffee, a smokiness, buttered toast, burnt caramel and mushrooms.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, vital acidity, supple with a creamy smooth texture. Subtle palate and finish that reflects the nose but not nearly as pronounced.
fields.overall: Love the nose, highly influenced by the oak. A well-rounded wine only let down by a lack of flavour and length. Great QPR, a different Chardonnay but in a good way, highly recommend.

fields.name: Rosé de Xinomavro
fields.colour: Attractive, bright, hazy, fire brick/rust red.
fields.aroma: Aromatic,tomato, strawberry, pomegranate, cranberry, black olives, wild herbs, earthy, mushroom, forest floor and barnyard.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, lightly tannic, fresh acidity and a strong palate of red fruits all making a well-balanced wine. Touch of spice on the resonant finish.
fields.overall: Quite a powerful rosé, beautiful colour, generous nose and palate, good all-round. Nicely priced as well so definitely recommend.

fields.name: Collezione di Paolo Chianti
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, cherry, plum, blackberry, sun-dried tomato, dried flowers, a touch of spice and lesser earthy notes of tobacco, leather and woodsmoke.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, soft smooth tannin, brisk acidity. A mix of fruit and tobacco/smoke across the palate ending with a nice spicy finish.
fields.overall: Juicy and savoury might sum this up best. Appealing and easy-drinking, a standard Chianti, not complex but balanced, just a good tasty wine. Well worth a try, good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Susana Balbo Private Edition Blend
fields.colour: Very dark black cherry fading to purple.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and herbal upfront, violets, leather, tar, tobacco leaf, mint and liquorice underpinned by black roasted fruits like plum, blackberry and prunes with a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, very fine loose-grained tannin. A core of black fruit and herbs again on the palate ending with a warm finish a good length after-taste.
fields.overall: Not quite to my liking, a bit too herbal/vegetal but that's not a criticism as it is well made/balanced. Good nose and palate this is probably best served with food. Good price and worth a try if a Bordeaux blend is your thing.

fields.name: Sabar Kéknyelű Komagas
fields.colour: Glimmering, water white, almost translucent.
fields.aroma: Light, lemon, grapefruit, pear, pineapple, apple, ripe banana, floral with a hint of wax.
fields.taste: Dry, medium bodied, good brisk acidity, textured, palate reflects the nose but more powerful. Smooth slightly bitter, spiced med- finish.
fields.overall: Very subtle and understated, not a whole lot going on but I still really enjoyed it. I think the palate and smoothness make up for its faults i.e. weak nose and length; making it very approachable and tasty on a warm evening. Fair price, well worth a try.

fields.name: Reichsrat Von Buhl Riesling Brut Sekt
fields.colour: Golden yellow with lively bubbles that dissipate quite quickly.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, yeasty, toasted almond, buttered toast, marzipan, wet gravel, a nice mustiness, kerosene, baked apples, lemon and apricot.
fields.taste: Dry, smooth creamy texture, med frothiness, zesty acidity. Apple, pear, warm bread and kerosene on the palate with very good length lemony finish.
fields.overall: Very autolytic, juicy and delicious. Ripe yet fresh, supple and generous on all counts. A great value Champagne alternative, highly recommend.

fields.name: W. & J. Graham's Six Grapes Reserve Port
fields.colour: Dense, almost opaque, viscous.
fields.aroma: Potent, hot and fiery, raisins, fruitcake, star anise, apricot, orange zest, raspberry sauce, cherry, vanilla, tobacco leaf, butterscotch and toffee.
fields.taste: Rich and full, well-integrated fine-grained tannin. Like the nose very hot and spicy overpowering the apricot and cherry palate. End is a bit harsh, almost burning.
fields.overall: The high alcohol ruins this. If it wasn't so potent this could be really nice, it just overwhelms everything else. Seemed to calm down when chilled a little but expected better.

fields.name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Weissenkirchen
fields.colour: Bright, very pale yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Fresh, good fruity intensity, lemon, pear, green apple, green herbs, melon, honeysuckle and white flowers.
fields.taste: Dry, light-bodied, fresh with vital acidity. Delicate med- herbal, citrusy, salty palate ending with a brief herbal finish.
fields.overall: Just OK, positively crisp and refreshing but it feels a little thin and weak, the flavour and length do not match the good nose. Decent midweek wine but better available at this price range.

fields.name: Bernhard Ott Am Berg Grüner Veltliner
fields.colour: Pale yellow/green with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Expressive, petrol, wax, honey, crushed gravel, grass, ripe citrus fruits like orange peel, grapefruit and lemon.
fields.taste: Med- body, low-alcohol, vibrant acidity. The palate has a touch of citrus sweetness at first that develops into something more herbal, nice smooth texture with some substance ending with a green herbal after-taste.
fields.overall: Very good GV, fabulous earthy nose which I wasn't expecting. Juicy, aromatic and refreshing, very moreish. A good price and well worth trying. Best served well-chilled.

fields.name: Grace Bridge Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Attractive cherry/ruby red, quite pale.
fields.aroma: Open and fruity, candied cherry, raspberry, cranberries, pomegranate, plum sauce, liquorice, cola, a slight earthiness like fresh herbs or tobacco leaf with some sweet spices.
fields.taste: Med- body, not muscular but good intense sustained flavours of boiled sweets, cherry and red berries. Lightly tannic, good structure, med length.
fields.overall: Very nice, a lively fruity wine that's appealing and very easy-drinking. Ripe fruit bringing a touch of sweetness but still not heavy or sickly. Good QPR, a crowd pleaser worth trying.

fields.name: Hans Igler Classic Blaufränkisch
fields.colour: Ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, very spicy, wild berries/bramble fruits, cherry, raspberry, liquorice and menthol with notes of leather and smoke.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, med+ acidity, ripe firm tannin adding texture. Palate reflects the nose, moderate mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: A very good blend of fruit and oak, making a wholly enjoyable wine. Fairly straightforward/simple but that's not a criticism. A very good midweeker at a good price. Recommend.

fields.name: Château Grimont Cuvée Prestige
fields.colour: Dark cherry red fading to a garnet rim.
fields.aroma: Developed, blackcurrants, raspberries, cherry, plums, menthol, leather, chocolate, black tea, cedar and spice.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, fleshy and rounded, moderate well-blended gripping tannin. A restrained palate of fruit and oak leads into a peppery finish.
fields.overall: A good Bordeaux, nothing shouts loud but everything is well-balanced. 7 years old and drinking perfectly. Good value and a good buy if you like this rich dense style of wine. Decant for an hour.

fields.name: Maison Roche de Bellene Cuvée Réserve Chardonnay
fields.colour: Bright, gold yellow with a silver/green tinge.
fields.aroma: Fruit at first, lemon, quince, pear that develops into more oaky aromas of baking spices, honey, buttered toast, curd and mushrooms.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, tangy acidity, full long mid-palate of apricot, marzipan, citrus fruits and vanilla and a really good sustained finish.
fields.overall: Good balance, weight and length make this wine very appealing. Not at all heavy but quite refreshing, the flavour was the highlight. Very good value, definitely recommend.

fields.name: Cleanskin Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Dark vermillion red.
fields.aroma: Young, sweet and fruity, rhubarb, cherry, strawberry, plum, berry jam, anise, mint, black olives and spice.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich, lightly tannic adding a little texture, med+ acidity, packed full of ripe red and black fruit flavours with a decent peppery finish.
fields.overall: Very New World, rich, ripe and very moreish. A big Aussie red, not complex or sophisticated but a crowd pleaser that's generous and unctous. Just about worth the price, no Bordeaux but decent.

fields.name: Calvente Blanco
fields.colour: Straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Rich and strong, musk, a real earthiness, orange blossom, flowers, honey, fresh grapes, exotic fruits and lychee.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, very ripe, dry, med- acidity, drying texture. Palate reflects the nose (plus lots of apricots) but not as powerful and the finish has a spicy edge but is all too brief.
fields.overall: Not bad, just not for me. Seems a bit over ripe and disjointed. I would like more acidity. Generous nose was the highlight, needed to be well-chilled. Disappointed.

fields.name: Pillastro Primitivo
fields.colour: Intense, dark black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Rich, candied, packed full of red and black fruits, raspberry, cherry, plum sauce, blueberries, pepper, pot-pourri, tea and milk chocolate.
fields.taste: Med+ body, opulent, light soft tannin giving a pleasant texture. Robust fruit driven palate with a peppery textured finish.
fields.overall: A big bold wine, unctous almost sweet, nice but feels a bit manufactured. Very easy drinking, a real crowd pleaser. Worth the money and a good buy if you like dense rich fruity reds.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Marlborough Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Bright red to cherry, quite pale.
