fields.aroma: Average, smoke, cherry, raspberry, plum, tobacco, dried leaves and a good hit of spice.
fields.taste: Med- body, firm tannic backbone, gripping texture, very spicy on the palate backed by subtle sour red fruits/berries but the finish is just hollow.
fields.overall: Average at best, I did like the tannin, but that's it, the palate and finish just seem to fall away and the nose needs more. Expected more, much better available at this price range.

fields.name: Hasandede Winehouse Vinkara
fields.colour: Bright, light gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Medium-intensity, initially a touch of sweetness, honey, apricot, pear, lemon, green apple, floral with a note of honeysuckle.
fields.taste: Med- body, dry, zesty lively acidity. Good depth of flavour with a palate of apricot, citrus fruits, baked apples and a moderate finish that has a nice hit of spice.
fields.overall: A great surprise. Everything in moderation, good balance, fruity, a freshness from the acidity yet something rich. In addition great QPR making this an absolute must try.

fields.name: Le Petit Chambord Cour-Cheverny Cuvée Renaissance
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Ripe and expressive, kerosene, bruised apples, honey, wax, lime, orange and a herbal tone.
fields.taste: Just a touch sweet, med+ body, vibrant acidity with a creamy buttery texture. Long mid-palate packed with flavours of apricot jam and oranges and a strong lasting finish.
fields.overall: Why is this so rare, lovely appealing wine. Although ripe and full the acidity keeps the wine refreshing and light. Very good balance between sweetness and acidity. A wine with depth and at a good price, recommend.

fields.name: Prince Stirbey Novac Sec
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Fruit driven at first, red and black forest fruits, cherry, cola, coconut and chocolate/liquorice sweets that develops more tertiary notes of dried leaves, smoke and tobacco.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, good acidity, fine-grained tannin adding texture. A blend of fruit, smoke and tobacco on the palate, good lingering finish.
fields.overall: A lot to like, the oak, fruit and tannin are nicely balanced, strong palate and finish, like a cru Beaujolais, worth the money, recommend.

fields.name: Ignacio Recabarren CasablancaMerlot
fields.colour: Attractive cherry red.
fields.aroma: Strong, rich, very fruity, sweet cherry, blackcurrant jam/squash, blueberries, plum, boiled sweets and spice with faint notes of leather and sage.
fields.taste: Med+ body, lightly tannic, supple, the palate reflects the nose and has a real sweet touch. Clean average finish.
fields.overall: MoreishMerlot, easy drinking, a crowd pleaser. Fruit-driven but the light use of oak brings balance and added depth. Rich, ripe, smooth, well worth a try, recommend.

fields.name: FRV100 Sparkling Rosé NV
fields.colour: Beautiful dark wild salmon pink. Fine persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: A candied nose of raspberry, strawberry, cherry, huckleberry, cranberries, rose petals.
fields.taste: Nice touch of sweetness, medium-bodied, refreshing acidity, ample palate of red fruits with a lovely creamy texture and moderate finish.
fields.overall: Fresh, fruity, fun and frivolous. A delicious moreish wine, not too sweet, with a good nose and palate but the soda fountain bubbles are the highlight. Great value crowd pleaser, highly recommend.

fields.name: Tamar Ridge Tasmanian Riesling
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow with silver and green highlights.
fields.aroma: Powerful, wonderful typical petroleum upfront with beeswax, lime leaves, apricot, exotic spices and a wet stone mineral quality.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, rich but lifted by the good acidity. An ample palate of orange peel, honeysuckle and petrol ending with a strong, long citrusy note.
fields.overall: Quite a mouthful, a full-on Riesling, big on all aspects but enough acidity to avoid it being heavy. Riper and more lush than an Old World Riesling and personally not for me, a little over the top. Fair price, well made, worth a try.

fields.name: Tenuta Fenice La Fenice Risorge Nero d'Avola
fields.colour: Deep black cherry with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, ripe, blackcurrant, blueberry, damson jam, cherry, menthol, pot-pourri, vanilla, peppery with hints of smoke and tobacco.
fields.taste: Dry, robust, firm ripe grippy tannic backbone, abundant acidity with mid-palate flavours of chocolate, liquorice, cherry and herbs. Medium spicy finish.
fields.overall: A good wine with a bit of everything giving a nice balance. Rich and bold but not heavy, hard to find fault, fair price, worth a try.

fields.name: Le Grand Chai Réserve Blanc
fields.colour: Pale gold with a green edge.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, a richness, lemon, apple, pear, apricot, something funky but really nice, melted butter, chamomile and a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, fleshy but not heavy, med+ acidity, smooth texture. The palate comes across as slightly roasted, bruised apple and crème brûlée with a lemon spiced finish.
fields.overall: Delicious moreish and ripe while retaining its freshness, perhaps even better than the excellent 2015. The extra oak ageing is evident and beneficial. Wholly recommend if you are looking for a generous well-rounded wine that's good on its own or with food.

fields.name: Château Pineau du Rey Sauternes
fields.colour: Developed, deep golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Pronounced, honey, dried apricot, spiced pear, marmalade, pineapple, lemon curd, lime, quince, marzipan, bruised apple, pine resin and wet sawdust.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, luscious and rich, vibrant acidity with a strong mid-palate of mandarin orange, honey, digestive biscuits, honeysuckle and apricot/lime jam. Med+ finish.
fields.overall: Not as sweet and heavy as I was expecting. Opulent yet crisp and fresh. Aged wonderfully and drinking well after 15 years. Very enjoyable, good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Nicosia Fondo Filara Frappato
fields.colour: Pale intensity, light delicate ruby red.
fields.aroma: Lots of dried red and black berries, cranberry, pomegranate, raspberry and white pepper with a note of damp earth and forest floor.
fields.taste: Dry, light, loose-grained well integrated tannin, brisk acidity. Mellow and soft on the palate with more red fruit, liquorice and cherry ending with an abrupt peppery finish.
fields.overall: Everything about this wine is understated but it all works together, balanced. Great summers evening red, light, approachable, appealing and easy-drinking. Simple but that's not a fault, very good value, well worth trying.

fields.name: Pasqua Desire Lush & Zin Primitivo
fields.colour: Dark crimson red fading to purple.
fields.aroma: Rich, plum, black fruit jam, dried fruit, blueberries, damsons, sweet tobacco, new leather, vanilla, dried herbs, smoke and some spice.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, fine ripe smooth tannin, quite supple. A palate of cherry, chocolate raisins and raspberry sauce, good length mid-palate and enduring finish.
fields.overall: Generous on all counts, more fruit than oak whichs makes this a little unbalanced IMHO. A decent buy if you are looking for something young, ripe and lush. Fair price, nice just not memorable.

fields.name: Left Field Albariño
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Good intensity and ripe, lemon, grapefruit, melon, tropical fruits like guava and pineapple, saline, wet stone and a hint of honeysuckle
fields.taste: Dry, crisp and fresh with vigorous acidity and med- body. Lemon and apple flavours with good length on both the mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, mouth-watering Albariño, perfect for summer. The fruit seems ripe but doesn't make the wine heavy or cloying, well-balanced by the acidity and ample flavours. A thirst quencher at a good price, a good attempt at a foreign grape variety.

fields.name: Solear Manzanilla, Barbadillo
fields.colour: Luminous, pale straw.
fields.aroma: Moderate, saline, sea breeze, citrusy, Brazil nuts, walnuts, pine resin, varnish and a hint of caramel.
fields.taste: Very dry, med-bodied, tangy, med acidity, nice velvety texture. The palate is full-flavoured, brine, nuts, yeast and preserved lemons. Long resonant finish.
fields.overall: A good Manzanilla thats got some depth and complexity. Fleshy, generous, very salty, long long finish, very good value for money.

fields.name: Barón de Barbón Oak Aged Rioja
fields.colour: Med-intensity, cherry red.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and fruity, candied black and red fruits, cherry, blackberries, raspberry sauce, chocolate, dried flowers, vanilla, sweet tobacco, roasted bell pepper and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Med-body, lively acidity, very soft tannin adding a little grip and structure. The rich palate reflects the nose and the spicy finish is nice but all too fleeting.
fields.overall: A standard young Rioja, fruity, approachable and easy-drinking. Personally I would prefer more oak but this will appeal to anyone who is looking for a ripe smooth young red. Good midweek wine.

fields.name: Château Vartely Viorica Sec Alb
fields.colour: Bright, very pale silver yellow to water-white.
fields.aroma: Pungent and sweet, apple, lemon, orange peel, honeysuckle, pineapple, fresh flowers and a green herbal note.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, ripe fruit balanced by the zippy acidity. Full-flavoured, citrus, melon, apple and lychee. The good length mid-palate ends with a very smooth spiced finish.
fields.overall: Absolutely great value, a wine punching above its weight. Pluses include the strong appealing nose, length and texture. Very easy-drinking, a wine for those looking for something juicy and aromatic, recommend.

fields.name: Lefebvre Cuvée Réserve Brut Champagne N.V.
fields.colour: Bright, pale golden yellow, medium steady bubbles.
fields.aroma: Medium-intensity, lemon, apple, yeast, biscuit, an earthiness like mushroom or mouldy cheese (in a good way).
fields.taste: Very dry, med-bodied, med acidity, peculiar,drying texture, A mid-palate of nuts, lemon curd, peach, buttered toast and mushroom. Disappointing fleeting finish.
fields.overall: I found this just ok. A straightforward Champagne, seems to lack depth and livelines. Dominated by yeast and bread aromas and flavours. For the price it is good but better available.

fields.name: Changyu Noble Dragon
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe almost sweet, stewed red and black berries, black plum, chocolate, engine oil, old leather with a herbal note and a good hit of spice.
fields.taste: Light, very low tannin, lacks structure. A blend of smoke and jammy fruit (dark berries) on the palate but too much like fruit squash and all too abrupt.
fields.overall: Didn't know what to expect and I hope China has better. It's perfectly drinkable but lacks body, balance and depth. Better available at the price, an ok midweek wine but wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Viña Zorzal Corral de Los Altos Garnacha
fields.colour: Pale ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Medium-intensity, raspberry, blackberries, cherry, figs, cedar, coffee, leather, lavender and sweet spices.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, fine-grained tannin, polished. Palate reflects the nose with lots of cherry and liquorice coming through ending with a decent warming spicy finish.
fields.overall: A big wine but not heavy, mostly fruit but a nice undertone of oak bringing balance and structure. Refined might describe this wine. Good value, needs to decant for an hour.

fields.name: Domaine Alzipratu Fiumesecco Rosé, Ile de Beauté
fields.colour: Bright, clean, very pale onion skin pink.
fields.aroma: Ripe, good intensity, lemon, grapefruit, peach, crunchy red berries (think strawberries and cranberries), melon, yellow apple, wild flowers and pepper.
fields.taste: Dry and light but full-flavoured. Crisp and refreshing, zippy acidity, a good mid-palate of red fruits and mild green herbs with a peppery fragrant finish.
fields.overall: Very enjoyable and a wonderfully refreshing Rosé. Looks weak but packed with aromas and flavour. Great summer wine, a fair price, recommend.

fields.name: Tetramythos Roditis Natur
fields.colour: Bright, pale yellow with a gold tinge.
fields.aroma: Fragrant, upfront it is quite unusual, perhaps hay or compost heap (in a good way) followed by lemon, apple and exotic fruits like guava or dragon fruit.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, vital acidity, fleshy smooth textured mid-palate with a nutty and bitter unripe green fruit flavour. More delicate and subtle than the nose but finishes quite well.
fields.overall: Certainly different and I really liked it but it may not be for everyone. Loved the nose, very earthy/funky. A wine with backbone and balance, good QPR, recommend but not if you are looking for something fruity or sweet.

fields.name: Henriques and Henriques Bual, 15 years old
fields.colour: Deep dark brown/burnt orange.
fields.aroma: Pronounced, coffee, curry spices, caramel, pine resin, very woody, maple syrup, vanilla, hoisin, dried fruit and Christmas cake.
fields.taste: Full, viscous, good depth and concentration. Potent mid-palate, rich spicy smooth texture that is impeccably balanced. The palate includes apricot and citrus peel that lead into a strong spicy warming finish.
fields.overall: Not as sweet as I was expecting but absolutely superb. It just feels so balanced, everything as one. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Ostoros Birtok Válogatás Egri Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Attractive but quite pale cherry red.
fields.aroma: Average, cherry, sweet raspberry, rhubarb, liquorice, brown sugar and vanilla with an underlying earthiness (dried leaves, mushrooms).
fields.taste: Light, vibrant and fruity, very subtle tannin, balanced acidity. Soft palate of cola, cherry and sweet spices, finish is a little short.
fields.overall: Nice, easy-drinking, straightforward wine. Perhaps it could do with more body but for the price this is generous and tasty. Good midweek wine and a good choice if you are looking for something light and fruity.

fields.name: Escudo de Oro Muscat
fields.colour: Pale golden yellow with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Medium-intensity, orange blossom, lemon, mandarin orange, apricot, pineapple and fresh flowers.
fields.taste: Ripe almost off-dry but the zesty acidity keeps it fresh and crisp. Light in body, a flavoursome palate of orange squash and grapes with a tingly acidic med- finish.
fields.overall: Very enjoyable, a touch sweet but this is well-balanced by the acidity. Nose and palate are adequate, leaves a pleasant after-taste. A good everyday summer wine at a good price. Serve well-chilled, recommend.

fields.name: Oriol Rossell Cava Cuvée Especial Brut
fields.colour: Antique gold, lively persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: Leads off with a very distinct kerosene note followed by yeast, brioche, melted butter, orange blossom, lemon and apple.
fields.taste: Dry, light, fresh zippy acidity, creamy texture with a little frothiness, The palate like the nose has a noticeable kerosene note, slightly bitter with a mouth drying finish, good length after-taste.
fields.overall: Refreshing, crisp and easy-drinking. I did like the traditional yeasty autolytic note but that kerosene tinge on both the nose and palate, although not unpleasant, just made it feel a bit manufactured and chemical like. Good for the price but I would think twice about buying again.

fields.name: Cepa Gavilán Crianza
fields.colour: Intense, deep garnet with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Full and perfumed, blackcurrant, vanilla, roasted tomato, plum, cedar, liquorice, marzipan, dried fruit, dried leaves, tobacco, smoke and lots of spice.
fields.taste: Dry, bold, herbaceous tannic backbone aided by med+ acidity. The palate is rich with sour cherry and green herbs, very savoury, with a spicy hot finish that lasts and lasts.
fields.overall: No complaints here, a very good Crianza. Big and powerful, oak more dominant than the fruit but not overdone. Quite tannic but this is balanced by the juicy acidity. Just love the long lingering finish. Good QPR, well worth a try.

fields.name: Groote Kaap Viognier
fields.colour: Medium straw yellow with tinges of silver.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and ripe, apricot, marzipan, orange blossom, lime, tropical fruits, a grassy/herbal influence and a mineral note like crushed stone.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich and ripe, creamy smooth palate, soft acidity. Full-flavoured, a good mid-palate of nectarine, mango and honey ending with a dry slightly bitter spiced med- finish.
fields.overall: A full, opulent wine, personally I prefer more acidity but it does retain a delicacy and freshness so it is not heavy or cloying. The nose and smoothness are the highlights, worth the money, a good midweek wine.

fields.name: Tio Pepe Fino 'En Rama' (2019 bottling)
fields.colour: Golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Pungent, nutty (Brazil nuts, almonds), yeast, sourdough, coconut oil, varnish, bruised apple, saline, citrus peel and dried fruit.
fields.taste: Very dry, refreshing tangy acidity, med+ body, fleshy and smooth on the palate. Flavour is dominated by wood with the addition of orange and black olives. Long warming spiced/hot finish.
fields.overall: A lot going on here, big nose, palate and a long after-taste. A definite step-up from regular Fino and well worth the price. Wood is the dominate tone and this needs food. A wine that leaves an impression, recommended for any Sherry fans.

fields.name: Weingut Gabel Riesling
fields.colour: Clear and bright, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Expressive, petrol, lime, grapefruit, apple, honey, beeswax, flowers and a steely mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, juicy and fresh, racy acidity, textured. A fleshy mid-palate of baked apple, lemon pie and pineapple. Very smooth pleasant tingly finish.
fields.overall: Very typical Riesling, really tasty and easy-drinking. Fresh, young, succulent, a good nose and a citrusy streak throughout are all pluses. Well worth the price, would recommend.

fields.name: RedHeads Pinball Red Blend
fields.colour: Intense dark inky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Powerful and rich, raspberry, blackcurrants, tobacco, cedar, liquorice, coffee, chocolate, a herbal note and a good hit of pepper.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, luscious, fine-grained tannin adding a smooth texture. More jammy red and black berries, tobacco and cedar on a strong mid-palate that carries through on a lingering finish.
fields.overall: A very fruit-forward wine, so ripe it is almost sweet. A wine with a lot of everything but sometimes less is more. It's ok but lacks finesse and complexity. Interesting to see how it develops but for now a bit over-priced, a midweek wine.

fields.name: Trazzera Vermentino
fields.colour: Luminous, pale straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, lemon, grapefruit, green apple, a leafy green note, oil/wax, saline, touch of sweetness like honeysuckle or candied fruits.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, good lemony acidic backbone. The smooth palate has pear, citrus and almond, a little bitter perhaps finishing with a spicy med+ finish.
fields.overall: Immensely drinkable, a wine with some weight but lifted by the abundant acidity. Good nose, length, refreshing, generous, great value, a summer wine, recommend.

fields.name: Louis Sipp Auxerrois
fields.colour: Bright, topaz yellow.
fields.aroma: Average, lemon, mandarin orange, pear, peach, a tropical note and a hint of crushed gravel.
fields.taste: Off-dry, medium-bodied, soft acidity, muscular yet mellow, quite smooth. On the palate more orange, peach and lychee ending with a rich spicy candied sustained finish.
fields.overall: Not a bad wine and can't find fault but not for me. Straightforward, everything is subtle and soft although the finish is quite good. I would prefer something more acidic to balance the sweetness, fair price, worth a try but perhaps won't be for everybody.

fields.name: Black Saint Peter Old Vine Zinfandel
fields.winery: Cellared and bottled by Lionstone International
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Pronounced, smoky-sweet, raspberry jam, cherry, black bramble fruits, plum, liquorice, some leather and green pepper.
fields.taste: Med+ bodied, brisk acidity, moderately tannic, opulent on the palate. Sweet rich fruit flavours of baked raspberries, cherry pie and chocolate followed by a nice savoury touch on a good hot/tingly finish.
fields.overall: Rich, ripe, juicy, mouthwatering and appealing might describe this wine. Fruit dominates and personally I would like more tannin to help balance the sweetness. Decent price and a good buy if you want a rich dense red.

fields.name: Domaine du Mas Ensoleillé Rosé
fields.colour: Pale salmon pink or onion skin.
fields.aroma: Clean and fresh, orange peel, touch of grapefruit, lychee, passionfriut, sweet peach, crunchy red berries, watermelon, celery and green tea.
fields.taste: Dry, fruity, light, mouthwatering acidity but not sharp or harsh, balanced. Richly flavoured with a palate of apple, orange and juicy berries. A good mid-palate with a slightly sour finish, delicious.
fields.overall: Great summer wine. So crisp and refreshing, moreish. Not a complex wine and the finish is too short but a good sweetish nose and lots of tasty fruit flavours. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Albastrele Blanc de Cabernet
fields.colour: Clear, very pale almost water-white with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, green herbs, grass, grapefruit, pear, lemon, pineapple with lesser notes of lychee and honey.
fields.taste: A touch sweet, ripe, med- body, abundant acidity, delicate smooth texture. Subtle on the palate with a mix of herbs and fruit (orange, pineapple, lychee) ending with a spicy/candied fleeting finish.
fields.overall: Nice but just seems understated. Soft, supple, nose is the highlight, palate and finish need more oomph. A midweek wine, for the money expected more, bit of a novelty wine, perhaps Cab Sauv should just be red.

fields.name: Semeli Feast Red
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple/blue rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, fruity, raspberry, cherry, blackberry, plum, liquorice, chocolate, black pepper and dried herbs.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, very soft fine tannin, juciy acidity, feels quite lean. A gentle yielding palate of cherry and raspberry chocolate, disappointing abrupt finish.
fields.overall: For the price this wine is quite good but the lack of depth and body makes it just average. Nice nose but after that it's all downhill. OK if you want something light and fruity but hard to recommend.

fields.name: Bleasdale Adelaide Hills Chardonnay
fields.colour: Bright, clean, straw yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and exotic, citrus, melon, apple, honeysuckle, banana, a mushroom earthiness, something very funky (but divine), a smokiness, warm bread and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ bodied, unctuous creamy smooth texture to balance the refreshing acidity. The palate brings citrus, vanilla and apricot that flows into a tingly ripe finish.
fields.overall: Loved this, such a wonderful integration of fruit and oak. Feels fat but still crisp and juicy. Structure, great nose and a good flavoursome mid-palate. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Domaines Vinsmoselle Cuvée Antoinette Crémant de Luxembourg
fields.colour: Effervescent, medium sized bubbles, bright, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Discreet, apple, pear, lemon, melon and quince with secondary notes of wet gravel, mushroom and chalk.
fields.taste: Dry, fresh crisp acidity, med-bodied, semi-creamy/frothy texture. Palate like the nose is very subtle with some apple, citrus and pear coming through but quite bland, fleeting finish.
fields.overall: Bit disappointed by this. Nothing stands out, nose, palate, finish, all so flat. No depth or autolytic notes that a traditional method Crémant should have. OK for the price but wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Pillastro Selezione d'Oro
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strong, distinctive, farmyardy, dark fruits, plum sauce, blackberries, caramelised sugar, liquorice, leather, tobacco leaf, touch of smoke and spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, good acidity, mild smooth tannin adding a little texture. The palate reflects the nose, rich, luscious fruit well-integrated with the oak. Sustained chocolaty finish.
fields.overall: Very enjoyable, the very funky nose is the highlight IMHO. Rich, rounded, savoury, good value so I can only recommend.

fields.name: Fratelli Martini Barbera d'Alba
fields.colour: Pale ruby red.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, ripe and fruity, cherry, strawberry, blackberry, plum, liquorice, iodine and spice. Earthy tones of cedar, new leather and sweet tobacco.
fields.taste: Rich and ripe, med- body, lightly tannic, firm acidity bringing structure. On the palate this is brisk and spicy with flavours of red and black berries that continue into a generous peppery finish.
fields.overall: Bit of a surprise, rich, supple, rounded, very easy-drinking. OK not a wine of depth and complexity but a great straightforward typically Italian red that delivers that's well worth a try.

fields.name: Turner Road ReserveMerlot
fields.winery: Winemaker: Randy Meyer - Accolade Wines Limited
fields.colour: Attractive, light, bright crimson red.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, a touch confected like a childs cough medicine, cherry, sugar plum, red berries, vanilla and a hint of baking spices.
fields.taste: Med- body, mod acidity, nice grip to the moderate sweet vanilla tannin. More sweet cherry and red fruit on the palate, decent finish.
fields.overall: Straightforward, middle of the road but for a cheap wine this is enjoyable. Positives: easy-drinking, lots of fruit with the touch of oak evident. Negatives: lacks body and depth, sweetness seems manufactured. Not a wine to mull over, take it for what it is and enjoy.

fields.name: Hardys Bankside Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark cherry red with a bright red rim.
fields.aroma: Open, fruit-forward, cherry, raspberry, dried cranberry, plum and menthol with lesser tertiary notes of smoke, cured meat and black pepper.
fields.taste: Med- body, dry, quite acidic, soft tannin, unbalanced. Ripe cherry and raspberry on the palate with a savouriness to the tingling spicy med finish.
fields.overall: Average at best, feels weak, bland and lacks the robustness of a typical Shiraz. Expected more even at this price, wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Calvet Cahors Malbec
fields.colour: Deep cherry red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, ripe and spicy, grape jam, blackberries, dried chillies, paprika, coalshed (what?) with a touch of smoke/tar, very spicy almost hot.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, fine pleasant tannin adds some structure. The palate offers ripe rich red and black bramble fruits that continue into a good finish.
fields.overall: Wasn't expecting much but surprisingly good. Extraordinary nose, so different, fairly robust, nothing overwhelms, balanced in that degree. Not perfect maybe lacking depth, refinement but very good QPR, well worth a try.

fields.name: Langhe Nebbiolo 3 Utin Ciabot Berton
fields.colour: Pale red with an orange rim.
fields.aroma: Rich, savoury and spicy, ripe juicy berries (raspberry, cranberry, cherry), farmyard, liquorice, balsamic, tobacco and cured meat.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, firm tannic backbone adding grip, abundant acidity to match, rounded. Very savoury on the palate, a nice mix of fruit and oak ending with an enduring finish.
fields.overall: No complaints, looks weak but packs a punch. The small amount of oak adds an extra layer of complexity and blends very well with the fruit. Very good QPR, not a Barolo but a good stand-in.

fields.name: Pedra Forca Cuevas de Arom Garnacha-Syrah
fields.colour: Intense deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Slightly tainted but get some red berries, lavender and liquorice.
fields.taste: Rich, full-bodied and bold. Very spicy/hot on the palate but not a lot of flavour. Fine-grained tannin, refreshing acidity, med- finish.
fields.overall: Unfortunately this wine was slightly corked and the wet cardboard smell has probably masked a lot of the flavour and aroma.

fields.name: Domaine Rollin Bourgogne Aligote
fields.colour: Very pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Open and ripe, lemon, pear, bruised apple, white blossom, smoky baked fruit, hazelnut and a saline quality.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, fleshy but freshened by the zingy acidity. Very smooth buttery mid-palate of melon, wax and honey, rich, enduring, tingling mineral finish.
fields.overall: Big and muscular but retains a mouthwatering freshness. A generous wine, very easy-drinking and totally delicious. Fantastic change from Burgundy Chardonnay at a good price, highly recommend.

fields.name: Hidalgo Pastrana Manzanilla Pasada
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Slightly oxidised, varnish, wood glue, delicate nutty tone, fresh cut pine, fennel, lemon peel, caramel, apricot, bruised apple and baking spices.
fields.taste: Dry, smooth mellow texture. Deep palate of coconut oil, black tea, toffee, dried fruit and yeast, quite salty. Powerful finish.
fields.overall: Excellent, great balance and sooo smooth, nothing about this is overpowering, everything just flows nicely and blends together. Depth, complexity and length all at a great price.

fields.name: Warwick Cape Lady Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.winery: Warwick Wine Estate (Imported by John E. Fells & Sons Ltd)
fields.colour: Dark inky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, jammy, cherry, raspberries, cranberries, blackcurrants, chocolate, liquorice, menthol, coffee and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, juicy, a little grip from the moderate ripe velvety tannin. A touch of sweetness to the rich palate of cassis, mocha and chocolate but the finish is too short.
fields.overall: Very nice, lovely smooth palate. More fruit than oak but still quite well balanced. Faults for me include depth, length and lack of body. An excellent midweek wine, tasty, easy-drinking, good value, recommend.

fields.name: The Waxed Bat Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon - Malbec
fields.colour: Intense, dark ruby red.
fields.aroma: Expressive, rich ripe fruit, blackcurrant, plum, black cherry and blueberries blended with earthy notes of leather, clay dust, green herbs and dried leaves.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, juicy, good acidity, the light tannin is silky smooth. Sapid, lush fruit flavours of cherry, damson, blackcurrant jam and vanilla, good finish with a spiced after-taste.
fields.overall: No complaints, rich, dense, nice mix of oak and fruit. For me the highlights are the smooth texture and lovely after-taste. A lot of wine for the price, drinking well after 3 years but no rush and interesting to see how it will develop.

fields.name: Cono Sur Bicicleta Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Clean, bright, pale cherry red.
fields.aroma: Adequate, raspberry, cherry and plum, an earthiness like potting soil or dried leaves, perhaps tobacco leaf and a touch of pepper.
fields.taste: Med- body, crisp, juicy, good acidity adding lift, light tannin adding some texture. The palate like the nose brings lots of red candied fruits but richer and more appealing. Ends with a peppered finish.
fields.overall: For the price this is quite good. An easy-drinking crowd pleaser that's light, fresh, approachable, just simple and straightforward. I like the mix of fruit and earth on the nose and the sapid acidity makes it moreish. Great value, well worth a try.

fields.name: L'Echappée Belle Rosé
fields.colour: Delicate, very pale salmon pink.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, young and subtle, fresh sweet red berries, floral, pear, peaches, grapefruit and watermelon.
fields.taste: Light, clean brisk acidity. The smooth lithe palate reflects the nose with the addition of rhubarb and cherry. Dry medium finish.
fields.overall: Fruit forward, refreshing and crisp making this a very approachable easy-drinking wine. Not a power-house but a nice soft simple rosé. Good price, a summer wine, worth trying.

fields.name: Very Rare Oloroso
fields.colour: Attractive burnt orange/amber.
fields.aroma: Fragrant but not powerful, walnuts, bruised apple, citrus peel, apricot, treacle, vanilla, caramel, toffee, baking spices and a hint of varnish and incense.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, med- acidity, spicy hot with a sinewy texture. Lemon/marmalade, raisins and spiced nuts on the mid-palate with warming alcohol on a moderate finish.
fields.overall: For the price this is very good but my big grumble is the balance, too much alcohol, not enough acidity. It also feels a little weak. It does however have a good nose and a pleasant warm finish. Good entry level Oloroso, worth trying.

fields.name: 19 Crimes Red Blend
fields.colour: Deep ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Lush and ripe, blueberries, blackberry jam, raspberries, plum, vanilla, leather, black tea, bacon fat and sweet lavender.
fields.taste: Full, bold, rich, juicy acidity, little tannic structure. Very sweet fruit, liquorice and chocolate on the palate with a sustained finish.
fields.overall: Big, voluptuous and dense. Packed with aroma and flavour and quite well-balanced but personally I would prefer more tannin and oak influence. If rich and sweet is your thing then this is for you. Good value midweek wine.

fields.name: La Crotta di Vegneron Petite Arvine
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and fruity, lemon, grapefruit, orange/passionfruit squash, honeysuckle, apple, hint of hay and a mineral quality.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, fresh acidity, supple. Lots of apple and rich tropical fruit with a mouth-filling spiciness across the mid-palate but the finish just falls away.
fields.overall: Feels quite opulent and ripe but has enough acidity to lift the wine. The almost sweet nose has a core of citrus fruits and the full-flavoured palate is very appealing but the finish is the big let down. All-in-all fresh, approachable, some complexity, very pleased.

fields.name: Dominio de Los Duques Cava
fields.winery: Pago de Tharsys - Don Vicenté Garcia (winemaker)
fields.colour: Medium lemon yellow with a green tinge. Medium sized persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: Average, a mix of sweet and sour, apple, pear, ripe banana, kerosene, yeast, cut grass and something saline.
fields.taste: Dry, med bodied, lively acidity. The creamy palate brings more yeast, butter and kerosene that carries through to a bitter citrusy drying med- finish.
fields.overall: I found the nose and palate a bit peculiar but not unpleasant, some nice autolytic notes. A standard Cava, needs more fruit to add balance, good for the price but wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: The Red Sedan (Winemaker Selection)
fields.colour: Dense, polished dark cherry red.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, ripe, raspberry, blackberry jam, cherry, tobacco, leather, vanilla, smoke, cedar, dried herbs, liquorice, iodine and a waft of pepper.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich, ample, very soft mellow tannin, brisk acidity, good balance. A red and black berry palate ending with a smooth peppery finish.
fields.overall: A real crowd pleaser, luscious fruit integrated with a touch of oak. Pluses include a generous nose and moreish palate, a good buy if big Aussie reds are your thing.

fields.name: Qupé A Modern Red
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strong, very earthy, mushrooms, old leather, bacon fat, farmyard, black olives, a herbal note, tea, figs and black fruits.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, soft, mildly tannic, good acidity. The palate is fruitier than the nose with raspberry, cherry, liquorice and perhaps a little pencil lead. The finish is warming and mouth-filling.
fields.overall: Delightful. The use of oak in this wine adds an extra layer of complexity giving a wonderful nose that is so different from the norm. Not as bold as I was expecting and the lack of body is my only fault. Otherwise well worth the money, recommend.

fields.name: Contesa Pecorino Abruzzo
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, ripe, lemon, mandarin orange, melon, stone fruits, banana, straw, green herbs, a mineral streak and a nice smoky/nutty/savoury tone. fruit
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, vital acidity, smooth textured. A yielding palate that flows from almond, marzipan, orange and apricot into a sustained tingling finish.
fields.overall: A fairly full wine held together by just enough acidity. A generous nose and palate makes this very appealing and delicious. A wine punching above its weight, definitely recommend.

fields.name: Comm. G.B. Burlotto Verduno Pelaverga
fields.colour: Clean pale vermilion red.
fields.aroma: Young and fresh, sweet fruit, cherry, bubblegum, strawberry with hints of rhubarb, violets and banana.
fields.taste: Light, refreshing, very mild tannin but has a little grip, lively acidity. Palate reflects the nose. Balanced, the high alcohol is only evident on the spicy cherry fuelled after-taste.
fields.overall: Reminded me of Beaujolais, subtle and mild. Approachable, appealing and pleasant. Looks and feels weak but this packs a punch, although the 14.5% abv is barely noticeable. Needs to be served cool, fair price, worth a try.

fields.name: Brazin (B) Old-Vine Zinfandel
fields.colour: Intense, deep garnet fading to a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Profound and oaky, leather, smoke, barbeque meats, sweet tobacco, blackberries, plum sauce, prunes, vanilla and pepper.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, bold, moderate tannin giving a lovely velvety texture. Mouth-coating spiciness on the palate, flavours of oak, chocolate and black fruits. Good length, structured and balanced.
fields.overall: A big wine, generous on all counts, more oak and spice than fruit. Delicious, a great match for beef, good QPR, recommend for anyone looking for a dense, rich red.

fields.name: ‘Moulin Blanc' Blanc de Noirs
fields.colour: Bright, very pale white gold.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, citrusy, lemon, lime, orange, apricot, pear, warm apple, nettle/green herbs and a mineral quality.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, ripe and fresh, good brisk acidity, texture has a little grip. The palate whilst not overstated has more citrus, pear and baked apple ending with a sustained dry lemon backed finish.
fields.overall: A lovely well-balanced wine. This wine is generous but not shouty, think more finesse and elegance. A little rich but still refreshing with mouthfilling flavours. Great QPR, thoroughly enjoyable, recommend.

fields.name: Livadioti Estate Red
fields.colour: Deep ruby red fading to mahogany at the rim.
fields.aroma: Tertiary and aged, cedar, graphite, clove and coffee with some lingering black fruits.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich, fine smooth tannin giving a drying grippy texture. Some dried fruit on the palate but it has mostly evolved into something more oaky, resonant finish.
fields.overall: Drinking beautifully after 7 years, but won't last any longer. Not a fruit bomb, more like an aged Bordeaux so won't be for everybody. Perfect for roast lamb. recommend.

fields.name: Boutari Agiorgitiko
fields.colour: Pale cherry red with a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: Aged, a little unpleasant dried leaves, forest floor, cedar, musty.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, it does have a nice texture but otherwise dull, flat and bland. All the fruit has gone, barely drinkable.
fields.overall: A wine that is past its best, a good example of when not to age a wine.

fields.name: Semeli Oreinos Helios Red
fields.colour: Dark garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Young, fruity and open, cherry, raspberry, plum sauce, liquorice, blackberries and chocolate with lesser notes of leather and tobacco leaf and a good hit of spice.
fields.taste: Med- body, supple, tart acidity, mildly tannic, silky texture. Cherry and raspberry chocolate on the palate. The bitter undertone continues on the spicy med+ finish.
fields.overall: This is nice but no more than that. A simple straightforward wine, fruit-forward and personally I would prefer more oak, found it a bit unbalanced. Approachable, easy-drinking, fair price, a good midweek wine.

fields.name: Fiefs Vendéens Mareuil, Château Marie du Fou
fields.colour: Clean, bright, pale lemon yellow with a touch of green.
fields.aroma: Persistent, med-intensity, lemon, grapefruit, honey, crisp apple, melon, wax/oily, yeast and a wet stone minerality.
fields.taste: Med- body, fresh, taut, zippy acidity, smooth but textured on the palate. A flavour profile that includes lemon curd, marzipan and apricot. A slight bitterness to the med- finish.
fields.overall: Loved it, wonderful touch of oak making a wine with finesse and structure. Mouthwatering, easy-drinking, a bit of everything that all melds together. Great QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: Maison Dominique Piron Beaujolais-Villages
fields.colour: Dark crimsom.
fields.aroma: Fresh, fruity, sour cherry, raspberry, strawberry and plum with lesser notes of cinnamon, rhubarb, tea and pepper.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, refreshing, good acidity, soft tannin givong a smooth texture. Very good length on the rich fruity palate (strawberry jam, liquorice, chocolate) that continues into the finish.
fields.overall: A big Beaujolais, delicious and generous all-round. OK not a sophisticated wine but a sweet crowd-pleaser, well worth the money, recommend.

fields.name: Villiera Pinot Meunier Brut
fields.colour: Golden brown orange, lively fine bubbles.
fields.aroma: Intense, very autolytic, yeast, bread dough, digestive biscuits, mushroom, wet gravel, bruised apple, dried apricot, a hint of citrus and something farmyardy.
fields.taste: Med+ body, soft acidity, grainy drying texture. Palate has some earthy/yeasty notes but a bit bland, med- finish.
fields.overall: Promised so much, amazing colour and wonderful nose but the palate just didn't back it up. No lively creaminess or depth, felt a little flat on the palate. Extra ageing is very evident, different, good for the price, worth a try.

fields.name: Château Thieuley Cuvée Francis Courselle Bordeaux Sec
fields.colour: Pale gold with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Distinctive and intense, buttered toast, nettle, compost, lemon, grapefruit and matue stone fruits.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, moderate acidity. Strong strange mouth-coating palate of honey, beeswax, lemon with a very sour finish.
fields.overall: Found this quite forward on both the nose and palate. Very different, more herbal and oak influenced than fruity. Seems to lack acidity making it a little heavy/cloying. Probably better with food, decent but not for me.

fields.name: Black Tower Smooth Red
fields.colour: Black cherry with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe, sweet oak, raspberry jam, stewed red fruit and rich fruit cake.
fields.taste: Light, thin, sweet, not tannic but does have a slight drying texture. Cherry, cola and rhubarb (oddly) on the palate. Sweet taste does linger, sadly.
fields.overall: Comes in a wine bottle, comes from somewhere, made using fermented grapes apparently, made by a winemaker, yet I'm still not convinced. A one-dimensional juice like wine. Ok, for the price it is perfectly drinkable but best avoided.

fields.name: Trapiche Vineyards Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Pale ruby to cherry red.
fields.aroma: Average, sweet ripe fruit, raspberry, cherry, plum, vanilla and cola with a touch of iodine/spice.
fields.taste: Light, fresh, lively acidity, very low tannin, quite a smooth texture. All red fruit on the palate, med finish.
fields.overall: So-so, just feels a bit manufactured, which at this price it is. Simple and straightforward, a fruit-driven Pinot, easy drinking and nice for the price, a midweek wine at best, wouldn't buy again.

fields.name: Château d'Aydie Odé d'Aydie Madiran
fields.colour: Opaque, dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Hot and spicy, tobacco, blackcurrant, black cherry, plum, liquorice, coffee, vanilla and smoke, all underpinned by a subtle lovely barnyard aroma.
fields.taste: Med+ dody, dry, good acidity, strong coarse-grained tannic structure but remarkably smooth. Chocolate, coffee and black fruits on the palate, sustained juicy finish.
fields.overall: Robust and bold, probably needs more time but this is a well made structured wine that delivers on all counts. Succulent, fleshy, good nose, tasty, well worth the money. Recommend.

fields.name: Tesco Saint-Chinian
fields.colour: Quite pale ruby red.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, ripe, jammy, blackberries, raspberries, cherry, liquorice, cranberry and black olives with undertones of tar, coffee, leather, dry dusty forest floor and a touch of spice.
fields.taste: Med- body, silky fine-grained tannin, juicy acidity. The palate is fresh and crisp, lots of cherry and liquorice, fleeting finish.
fields.overall: A very enjoyable, approachable wine. Good nose, mouthwatering acidity but let down somewhat by the lack of body and the brief finish. Very good value for money, a crowd-pleaser, easy-drinking, well worth a try.

fields.name: Château Bel Air Perponcher Réserve Bordeaux Rosé
fields.colour: Very pale new copper or onion skin.
fields.aroma: Lots of red berries, strawberry, redcurrant, grapefruit, honeydew melon, orange and rose petals.
fields.taste: Dry, light, crisp, brisk acidity. Good intensity of flavour, sour cherry and strawberry to the fore ending with a bitter herbal note.
fields.overall: A nice light Rosé, not remarkable just simple and straightforward. Depth of flavour stands out as the highlight. Personally I would like a little more body but still quite pleased. A lunchtime wine, good value, worth trying.

fields.name: Along Came Jones Lledoner Pelut Hairy Leaf Grenache
fields.colour: Deep ruby with a pink rim.
fields.aroma: Intense, rich and ripe, red and black fruits (blackberries, cherry and stewed strawberries) but also a savoury/umami tone including iodine, chocolate, cedar, new leather, a herbal note and warming spices.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, robust and sumptuous, solid chewy tannin, lively acidity. Mouth-filling flavours that reflect the nose (fruity cough medicine).
fields.overall: Reminded me of a big Aussie Shiraz, so rich and unctous. Not a complex wine but delicious and easy-drinking nonetheless. The tannin, acid and fruit are quite well balanced so all-in-all a good buy, recommend.

fields.name: Anjou 'Poil de Lièvre'
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Odd but upfront I get salted peanuts?, discreet rich fruit, raspberry and redcurrant with a wonderful undertone of something barnyardy and smoked paprika.
fields.taste: Med- body, firm acidity, soft drying tannin, smooth pliant raspberry palate. Fruity but all too brief finish.
fields.overall: Lively and fresh, a decent wine but seems a bit dumb/closed. A good midweek wine at a good price but don't expect too much.

fields.name: Anna's Way Nelson Grüner Veltliner
fields.colour: Pale straw with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Crisp and citrusy upfront leading with lemon and lime followed by peach, apple blossom, grass/nettle, beeswax, perhaps a touch of kerosene and an intense mineral/flint quality.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, refreshing lively acidity. Generous palate of peach and tropical fruits ending with a nice bitter note on a moderate finish.
fields.overall: Wholly enjoyed this, appealing and moreish, a wine that gives a lot for the price. Recommend if you are looking for something juicy, aromatic and flavoursome.

fields.name: Villa Jolanda Prosecco Extra Dry N.V.
fields.colour: Fine lively bubbles, very pale green/silver hue.
fields.aroma: Quite light, some apple and pear with a nice overtone of lees/yeast .
fields.taste: Dry, light in body, crisp acidity, creamy texture. Good mid-palate of tree fruit, yeast and sourdough but the apple finish and after-taste is a little brief.
fields.overall: It's OK but feel a bit disappointed. The yeasty element was a nice surprise and the palate is by far the highlight as the nose and finish are just stunted. Decent for the price, a party fizz but not memorable.

fields.name: Ciello Rosso Nero d'Avola
fields.colour: Black cherry with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, dried herbs, leather, tar, dark chocolate, dried fruit and menthol with notes of blackberries, plum and mulberries.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, firm acidity, fine-grained tannin giving a silky texture. Tasty and sustained chocolate, coffee and raspberry mid-palate that leads into a nice tingling spiciness on the finish.
fields.overall: More herbal than fruity, not as bold as I was expecting. A very pleasant wine, balanced, nothing shouty, everything in moderation and all blended together nicely. Very good for the price, recommend.

fields.name: I Frati Lugana
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a silver hue.
fields.aroma: Upfront it's green herbs, garrigue, floral blossom and wax followed by lemon and overripe orchard fruits.
fields.taste: Bone dry, med+ body, a richness, med acidity, fleshy smooth creamy texture, More waxy lemons and ripe fruit on the palate that flows into a warming bitter enduring finish.
fields.overall: A good well made wine but not for me. Not faults but I find it quite green/bitter and a little heavy, I would prefer more fruit and acidity. A wine with depth and complexity, good value so I would recommend.

fields.name: Scassabarile Marsigliana Nera Rosato
fields.colour: Attractive pinkisk onion skin.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and fruity, strawberry, grapefruit, mandarin orange, apricot, cherry, crunchy red berries, a floral tone and a nice spiciness.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, tender acidity, lithe and flavoursome. Green herbs and strawberries on the palate with a nice grip on the green stalky persistent finish.
fields.overall: Not a spectacular rosé but very pleasant and easy-going. Good depth of colour, nice nose, just enough acidity to retain a freshness. A fairly priced wine, a crowd pleaser, well worth a try.

fields.name: Faustino V Red Reserva
fields.colour: Dark murky brown/orange with a brick red rim.
fields.aroma: Intense tertiary aromas, clove, cedar, tobacco, iodine, petrichor/wet gravel with just a hint a dark fruits.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, well-blended tannin adding a little grip. The palate has evolved into flavours of oak, vanilla, barbecue smoke and spice, all succulent and savoury. Finish complements the palate.
fields.overall: Amazed this wine has survived 28 years (just). All tertiary flavours and aromas but still very pleasant and perfect to pair with a simple roast lamb dish. Loved it and worth a gamble if you can find it.

fields.name: Spice Route Chakalaka
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a cherry rim.
fields.aroma: Profound, wood and spice to the fore, smoke, leather, tobacco leaf, strong black tea, dried herbs, band-aid and bacon fat with undertones of plum and strawberry jam.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, rich and robust, well integrated chalky tannin. Like the nose the palate is dominated by wood with smoke, tobacco, liquorice and raspberry chocolate coming through. Good finish.
fields.overall: Really like this, a lot of wine for the money. So much going on, the nose just keeps giving. I would like more fruit as the oak over dominates but still delicious and recommend for anyone who likes big, rich, dense wines.

fields.name: Vigne del Pareto Gavi
fields.colour: Clear, bright lemon yellow.
fields.aroma: Developed, ripe fruit, pear, apple, lemon, orange, floral and a flinty minerality with notes of candle wax and perhaps a hint of smoke.
fields.taste: Light but doesn't feel weak, zippy acidity bordering on sharp but with a honeyed richness and ripe/sweet fruit that take that edge away. Dry citrus squash fuelled med- finish
fields.overall: Easy-drinking moreish wine. Light but generous, quite a lot going on, seems to lack balance but minor fault. Good QPR, definitely recommend.

fields.name: Castelmaure Corbieres
fields.winery: Société Cooperative Castelmaure Bottled by Vins du Littoral
fields.colour: Dark garnet with a pinkish rim.
fields.aroma: Extremely fruit driven, fruit salad sweets, chocolate, raspberry, plum jam, underlying notes of lavender and herbs with a hit of spice.
fields.taste: Dry with just a touch of sweetness from the ripe fruit, cherries and red berries on the palate but not as pronounced as the nose. Med-bodied, moderate tannin adding some structure, good acidity, med finish.
fields.overall: A simple almost one-dimensional wine but eminently drinkable. Very fruit-forward but the tannin gives some balance. A decent midweek wine at a good price.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Colchagua Carmenere
fields.colour: Rich dark cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, herbaceous and peppery, tobacco, ripe black forest fruits and plums.
fields.taste: Full, bold and unctuous yet feels mellow with fine-grained well-integrated tannin. Smooth chocolate and strong coffee fuelled palate, moderate smoky finish.
fields.overall: Very green/vegetal with the fruit playing only a secondary role. Big, round and harmonious but all in such an understated way as it comes across as soft, savoury and well-structured. Good value and certainly recommend.

fields.name: Jean-Marc Brocard, Chablis Sainte-Claire
fields.colour: Clear and bright, pale golden yellow with a tinge of green.
fields.aroma: Fresh, crisp salinity, crunchy green apples, lemon, lime curd and floral blossom that develop into honey, crème brûlée, butter and mushroom.
fields.taste: Dry, delicate and light but the velvety smooth texture makes it feel fuller and more rounded. Brisk mouthwatering acidity. The palate brings more apple, apricot and pear that lead into a med finish.
fields.overall: Wonderful, what a pleasure. An ever changing nose, balance and an exceptional creamy smoothness. A wine that warms up beautifully in the glass, worth every penny and more, highly recommend.

fields.name: Saint-Péray Brut Les Bulles d'Alain
fields.colour: Straw yellow with vibrant med bubbles.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, upfront quite yeasty, secondary aromas of nuts, toast and butter with lemon, baked apple, pineapple and apricot in the background.
fields.taste: Dry, flat acidity, some frothiness from the bubbles with a drying/gripping texture. The palate brings bitter tangy lemon and apple juice but like the finish is all too brief.
fields.overall: A bit disappointed, nose was promising but didn't continue onto the palate or finish which were just bland. To me it is unbalanced, not enough acidity or fruit to offset the secondary fermentation. It's OK but better available in this price range.

fields.name: Moulin-à-Vent Vieilles Vignes, Cuvée Jean, Dépagneux
fields.colour: Black cherry with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Open and fruit-driven, raspberry, redcurrants, violets and peppercorns with a hint of rhubarb and black tea.
fields.taste: Med- body, rich yet fresh, med+ acidity with the soft gentle tannin adding structure. A succulent savoury palate of cherry and rhubarb ending with a lovely lingering fruity finish.
fields.overall: Not a big complex wine, everything as it should be, well-structured and balanced. Moreish, Gamay with a bit of oomph, great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: St-Joseph Cuvee Prestige
fields.colour: Intense dark ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strong, farmyard, black olives, bacon fat, dried green herbs, coffee, plums and blackberries.
fields.taste: Dry, subtle smooth well-integrated tannin. On the palate more olives, black fruit and dark chocolate. Med- mid-palate and finish.
fields.overall: A big wine but in an understated way, nothing profound just everything blended together really well. Although it does have a silky smoothness and is very drinkable I think this wine has more to give and perhaps needs more time.

fields.name: Moselle ‘Les Gryphées' Blanc
fields.colour: Lustrous golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Rich and developed, both ripe and tangy, peach, apricot, lime, orange blossom, mango, honey, pine and wet stone.
fields.taste: Off-dry, full-bodied with a silky mouth-coating texture lifted by the vigorous acidity. Ample palate of orange/marmalade, peach and tropical fruits, strong fragrant finish and after-taste.
fields.overall: Delicious, like a light version of a Sauternes. An opulent white but the acidity adds a mouth-watering freshness. The blend works wonderfully, great QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Primo Franco Prosecco Superiore Valdobbiadene
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a silver tinge, fine lively short lived bubbles.
fields.aroma: Light, nose tingling freshness, crunchy green apples, quince, lemon, a floral note and cream.
fields.taste: Just a touch of sweetness which is most evident on the all too brief finish. Med-bodied, crisp acidity with a smooth apple and almond palate.
fields.overall: Not as sweet as I was expecting, a well made Prosecco for sure but I found it a little underwhelming, nothing stands out. It is pleasant and easy-drinking but I wanted it to be more generous. At the price it is hard to recommend.

fields.name: San Elias Chardonnay
fields.colour: A fleshy med+ bodied Chardonnay, lots of tropical and orchard fruits, med- acidity. Fairly simple and easy going, decent midweek wine but nothing to shout about.
fields.aroma: A fleshy med+ bodied Chardonnay, lots of tropical and orchard fruits, med- acidity. Fairly simple and easy going, decent midweek wine but nothing to shout about.
fields.taste: A fleshy med+ bodied Chardonnay, lots of tropical and orchard fruits, med- acidity. Fairly simple and easy going, decent midweek wine but nothing to shout about.
fields.overall: A fleshy med+ bodied Chardonnay, lots of tropical and orchard fruits, med- acidity. Fairly simple and easy going, decent midweek wine but nothing to shout about.

fields.name: Moët & Chandon Impérial Brut Champagne N.V.
fields.colour: Med gold with a silver tinge, steady bubbles.
fields.aroma: Not powerful but charming and elegant, fresh apple and citrus fruits, pear, a floral note and a mineral quality. Lesser oaky influence of butter/cream, vanilla and biscuit.
fields.taste: Dry, refreshing creamy texture, zippy acidity but still quite fleshy. Palate reflects the nose with a dry finish lifted by the bubbles.
fields.overall: Lovely Champagne, not as autolytic or austere as some I have tried. Smooth, juicy, refreshing are all pluses. Well worth the money, recommend.

fields.name: Terra de Asorei Albariño
fields.colour: Clean, bright lemon yellow with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Open and ripe, lime, grapefruit, apricot, peach, quite floral/perfumed with a hint of honey or nuts.
fields.taste: ry, med+ body, med- acidity, so somewhat unbalanced. The palate was baked apple and tropical fruits with a decent length finish.
fields.overall: ormally a big fan of Albarino but found this a bit cloying and heavy, perhaps it just needed food. For the money I expected more. Can't win them all I guess.

fields.name: Clos de l'Oratoire des Papes Châteauneuf-du-Pape
fields.colour: Intense, black cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Expressive, earthy, forest floor, leather, coffee, tar, black tea, dark brooding fruits, black plums, blackberries, cherries and spice.
fields.taste: Dry, rich and round, elegant, ripe tannin, refreshing acidity, great balance. A wonderful blend of chocolaty fruit and oak on the palate, smooth sustained finish.
fields.overall: Absolutely loved it, a red with finesse, very well made making it easy-drinking and moreish. Well worth the price, highly recommend.

fields.name: Monte Real Gran Reserva
fields.colour: Deep, opaque ruby with a brick red rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, rich black fruits blended with leather, tar, tobacco and warm spices.
fields.taste: Med+ body, fine integrated tannin giving a smooth texture. The palate like the nose is more earthy/oak driven rather than fruity but none the worse for it. Good length finish.
fields.overall: Just delightful and drinking perfectly well after nine years. Everything is in harmony, structured and balanced, worth every penny, highly recommend.

fields.name: Casillero del Diablo Sauvignon Blanc (Reserva)
fields.colour: Pale lemon with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: More vegetal than fruity, dandelion, nettle and cut grass with lemon, melon and pear with an undertone of honey, vanilla and cream as it warmed up.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, crisp brisk acidic streak adding a freshness to the citrusy, pear palate. Med- finish.
fields.overall: A herbal fresh juicy SB, more Old World than New World which I personally prefer. Not a wine of great depth and complexity but generous for a wine at this price. Good midweeker, well worth a try.

fields.name: Dveri Pax Modra Frankinja
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a tile red rim.
fields.aroma: Open, leads off with lots of pepper and oak, leather, dark chocolate, liquorice, menthol, dried fruit like figs and prunes, forest floor and thick ripe bramble fruits.
fields.taste: Rich and full, structured with the med+ acidity blending seamlessly with the soft silky mouth-coating tannin. Palate is quite earthy with tar, coffee and jammy black fruits ending with a long wood finish.
fields.overall: Beautiful wine drinking perfectly after 7 years. A wonderful amalgamation of fruit and oak. Such a generous wine for the price, juicy, long, complex, highly recommend.

fields.name: Château Musar Hochar (Père et Fils)
fields.colour: Deep garnet fading to cherry red.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, cherry, raspberry, redcurrants, fruitcake, warming spices and iodine with hints of smoke, coffee and tobacco.
fields.taste: Spicy and rich, med+ body, solid tannic structure adding grip to the otherwise velvety texture. Coffee, black tea and sweet black fruits on the palate, med finish.
fields.overall: Different but none the worse for it, structure and balance but in an elegant subtle way, nothing loud, it just delivers. Opens up nicely after decanting (at least 2 hours). Great value and if this is their 2nd wine I can't wait to try its big brother (Château Musar).

fields.name: The Little Prince Cretan White Karavitakis
fields.colour: Bright, clean deep yellow.
fields.aroma: Med intensity, crisp yet rich, lemon, orange, pear, lychee, stone fruits, very floral with a touch of herbs.
fields.taste: Light, dry, medium acidity, a slightly drying smooth texture. Inviting palate of apricots, citrus and ripe apple with a little heat on the finish.
fields.overall: Nothing complex here, but still very appealing and approachable. Although no oak used it develops a more ripe toasty honeyed note as the wine warms up. Unlikely to disappoint at this price, a good midweek wine, I would recommend.

fields.name: Réserve des Seigneurs Cairanne Blanc
fields.colour: Bright, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Open, lots of citrus upfront, lemon and quince with apricot, juicy melon, beeswax, white flowers and a herbal tone.
fields.taste: Dry, textured mid-palate that feels quite full and round. Lifted by vital acidity, pronounced and savoury flavours of herbs and kerosene with some pear and citrus notes. Nice tangy bitter ending.
fields.overall: Really good, a big generous wine that improves as it warms up in the glass becoming more round and fruit-laden, closed and green when chilled. Very pleasing to sip, very good price, I would recommend.

fields.name: Tupun Catú Malbec
fields.colour: Deep ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Young and fruity, raspberry, red plum, blueberries, cherry, vanilla, cola, sweet tobacco, espresso and something herbal.
fields.taste: Dry, med acidity, mildly tannic adding some grip on the finish. The palate reflects the fruity aspects of the nose, all cherries and raspberries, quite sour but not in a bad way.
fields.overall: A simple approachable wine, nose and palate are nice but nothing really stands out. There's no balance, it's a bit all over the place. A midweek wine, fairly priced, worth a try but not memorable.

fields.name: Lustau Limited Edition Vintage Sherry
fields.colour: Dark burnt orange/caramel.
fields.aroma: Intense and warm, baking spices, citrus zest, saline, fruitcake, dates, apricot, bruised apple, fudge and fennel with a touch of wood varnish and nuts.
fields.taste: Thick, viscous, rich mouthful, sweet but the good acidity avoids it being heavy or cloying. The palate is not a powerful as the nose with candied flavours of orange, apricots, caramel and marzipan. Spicy mouthfilling warm satisfying finish.
fields.overall: Delicious Oloroso style sherry. Complexity, depth and balance. Alcohol is noticeable but not obtrusive. Not the cheapest but well worth the money, highly recommend.

fields.name: The Grape Gatsby Shiraz - Ruby Cabernet
fields.colour: Medium purple with a blueish rim.
fields.aroma: Average, fruit-driven, plum, blackcurrants, cherries and violets with a green vegetal/herbal tone (not a positive).
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, med- acidity, very little tannin present, no structure or balance. The palate is one-dimensional, all sour cherries and the finish abrupt.
fields.overall: Very disappointing, expected a much bigger wine from this blend. This is too light and watery for me, lacking on all counts, no concentration or depth. So much better available at this price. Drinkable but not a rebuy.

fields.name: Amoras Tinto
fields.colour: Intense black cherry fading to purple.
fields.aroma: Open, very ripe fruit, blackberries, blueberries, cherry, plum and redcurrant with an undertone of secondary aromas like cured meat, liquorice, leather and spicy vanilla.
fields.taste: Med body, firm acidity, discreet fine sweet tannin. The mid-palate is drying with flavours of cherry, raspberry and chocolate mocha ending with a spicy warm good length finish.
fields.overall: Very tasty and easy-drinking. Not a wine to mull over, mostly fruit-driven and straightforward. Not as robust as expected and the acidity, tannin and fruit is a bit unbalanced. A crowd pleaser and good value if you are looking for something juicy and lively.

fields.name: Triunfo Cariñena
fields.colour: Dark crimson red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, savoury, prune, raspberry, blackberries, dried cranberries, bramble fruits and spice.
fields.taste: Med+ body, good tannic backbone balanced by med+ acidity. The palate is quite rich and hot with iodine, cherry, raisins and baking spices to the fore. Short brief finish.
fields.overall: Not bad, I do like the nose and the gripping texture from the tannin but it is a bit one dimensional, its a lot of dried fruit. A good weekday wine at a fair price. Worth a try, just not one to remember.

fields.name: Klein Constantia Riesling
fields.colour: Lemon yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Profound and appealing, petrol/burnt rubber upfront followed by lemon, lime, fennel, a touch of orange peel, apricot and ripe tropical fruits.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, creamy mouth-coating texture, muscular but the vital acidity avoids it being cloying. The palate reflects the nose ending with a lush, juicy finish.
fields.overall: Delightful, more rounded than I was expecting, lots of body, aroma and flavour. Great wine for the price, generous and oh-so moreish, highly recommend.

fields.name: Hawke's Bay Estate CabernetMerlotMalbec
fields.colour: Dark garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, plum, blackberries, forest berries and liquorice with lesser secondary notes of barnyard, leather, smoke and cedar.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, very little tannin, good acidity, a moderate palate of cherry, black berries and coffee but it feels a bit weak and unbalanced. Medium dry savoury finish.
fields.overall: Just OK, everything about this wine is just moderate, lacking depth and structure, I would prefer more tannin and flavour. A decent midweek wine but better available at the price.

fields.name: Miles From Nowhere Shiraz
fields.winery: Miles from Nowhere vineyard, Franklin Tate
fields.colour: Med-intensity, dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Expressive, blueberries, bramble berries, raspberries, plum, chocolate, olives, black pepper, tar, leather and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med+ body, moreish acidity, rich savoury palate of chocolate, liquorice and cherries. The fine-grained tannin gives a wonderful smooth texture ending with a sustained smoky finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, a good nose but the highlight is the silky smoothness. Not at all heavy, a well-rounded wine. A typical big bold ripe Aussie Shiraz at a good price, recommend.

fields.name: Vinos del Viento Cariñena Rosado
fields.colour: Bright vibrant orange.
fields.aroma: Strong and fruity, strawberry, red berries, crunchy forest fruits and spice with an undertone of paraffin wax and smoke.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, tart acidity, unripe cherry and apple flavours with a puckering dry grip on the palate. A lingering smoky, herbal and spicy finish.
fields.overall: Aroma just leapt from the bottle, but that was as good as it got. It just seems all too green, bitter and unripe. Perhaps it needs food but for the price I expected better, can't recommend.

fields.name: Jacob's Creek Chardonnay Pinot Noir Sparkling Brut
fields.colour: Very pale straw yellow with a silver tinge, steady medium bubbles.y
fields.aroma: Not overly expressive, a touch of sweetness, apple, quince, lime/lemon curd, dried fruit soaked in alcohol (weirdly) with a hint of gooseberry and bread.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, soft but rich, med- acidity, tart apple and citrus on the palate yet texture is quite creamy. Finish is too brief.
fields.overall: Not bad, more enjoyable than Prosecco at the same price, it has more weight and depth although it does feel a bit manufactured, a little sweet and lacking acidity. Decent for the money but not memorable.

fields.name: Freixenet Prosecco
fields.colour: Very pale, almost water white. Small fine bubbles but they dissipate quickly.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, apple, lemon, citrus blossom, acacia, honeysuckle and fruit salad sweets.
fields.taste: Light, refreshing, abundant acidity. The off-dry palate has loads of peach, apple and lemon pith. Not much in the way of texture or length.
fields.overall: Not bad, a crowd pleaser but a bit sickly sweet for my liking. Disappointing bubbles, simple, not something to mull over, a party fizz, just enjoy.

fields.name: Domaine Font de Michelle Châteauneuf-du-Pape
fields.colour: Hauntingly smoky opaque inky red.
fields.aroma: Intense and rich, ripe jammy black fruits, iodine, band-aid, black cardamom, tar, smoke, leather, coffee, anise and baking spices.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, lightly tannic giving some texture to the smooth palate. Very spicy mid-palate that includes liquorice, dark fruit and chocolate. Resonant smoky, fruity finish.
fields.overall: Wonderful, great depth with layers of complexity, the nose itself just keeps giving on every sniff. A big bold wine yet not heavy. Great balance between fruit oak and tannin, well worth the price,highly recommend.

fields.name: Gallardia Old Vine White
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, green/unripe, lemon, melon, orange blossom, a floral/waxy note, touch of honeysuckle, pear and a steely minerality.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, juicy and fresh, light delicate smooth texture. The palate has a bitter edge, lemon, apricots and crunchy tree fruits. Moderately persistent finish.
fields.overall: I like this, refreshing, not overpowering, light/subtle in many ways yet still generous. Very good for less than a tenner, well worth a try.

fields.name: El Bombero Selección Especial
fields.colour: Deep black cherry with a purple edge.
fields.aroma: Lots of red fruit, raspberry, cherry, plum, fruit leather, liquorice, cola, dried figs and sweet vanilla.
fields.taste: Medium-bodird, chalky tannin adding structure and a nice chewy texture. Flavours are quite subtle, raspberry sauce, chocolate and liquorice with a touch of spice on the finish.
fields.overall: Certainly doesn't seem like a wine of 15%. I preferred the 2017 this is not as intense, ripe or generous on nose or palate. Certainly not bad, nice easy-drinking but I would prefer more oak influence. Good value and worth trying.

fields.name: The Grape White Chenin Blanc - Pinot Grigio
fields.colour: Bright, very pale lemon with a silvery-grey tinge.
fields.aroma: Open, lemon, hard green fruit like apple, melon, pear and something herbal or grassy.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, crisp, abundant acidity, loose tangy texture. The palate reflects the nose but is not as pronounced. Brief finish with a bitter after-taste.
fields.overall: You get what you pay for. Simple, sharp and harsh, exactly what you don't want. There is nothing about this wine that stands out, avoid and buy something else or just drink water.

fields.name: Domaine Pichard Madiran Cuvée Auguste Vigneau
fields.colour: Opaque and dark inky red starting to fade to brick red at the rim.
fields.aroma: Average, mostly secondary and tertiary, graphite, tobacco, leather, forest floor, menthol, a touch of brett (but not off putting) and spice yet there is still some fruit, plum, blackcurrant and liquorice.
fields.taste: Big and savoury, firm tannic backbone giving a rich drying chewy texture. Dried fruits on the palate and a warming spicy but all too brief finish.
fields.overall: A wine just at the end of its life but still drinking beautifully at 15 years, but do not wait any longer. Dense, rich and robust, a wine of structure. Great QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: Kumala Fairtrade Pinotage - Shiraz
fields.colour: Bright, clear cherry red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, cherry, raspberry, plum, sweet and sour sauce, savoury herbs and spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, quite juicy from the abundant acidity, discreet fine tannin, a silky texture. The palate is almost sweet, lots of cherry, liquorice and confected fruit. Med- finish.
fields.overall: For the money this is not bad. Tastes a bit false i.e. a manufactured sweetness and lacks any depth or layers of complexity as you would expect. Just a simple everyday quaffer, enjoy it for what it is.

fields.name: Atlántico Sur Reserve Tannat
fields.colour: Luminous, copper/orange or onion skin.
fields.aroma: Initially quite punchy with sweet red fruit, strawberry, cherry and vanilla but underneath lies more earthy/savoury notes of smoky dark fruits and herbs.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, med- acidity, a rounded smooth texture with just a touch of tannin. The generous palate reflects the sweetness of the nose with red fruit to the fore. Sustained slightly tingling finish.
fields.overall: A sturdy rosé, a combination of sweet and savoury, structured but not heavy although perhaps lacking a little acidity. All-in-all very tasty, approachable, good value, best served chilled, worth trying.

fields.name: Mendel Sémillon
fields.colour: Radiant, pale gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Open, lemon, lime, orange peel, green fruits, vanilla and beeswax. There's herbal notes of chamomile and honeysuckle with a hint of honey and warm bread.
fields.taste: Med-bodied with a tangy fresh acidity. The crisp palate reflects the nose but not as pronounced and develops an oily rich element as the wine warms up. Finish however is a bit short.
fields.overall: Quite pleased with this, the touch of oak is evident and well integrated, adding an extra layer of complexity. Not perfect, perhaps lacking a little on flavour and length but well worth the money.

fields.name: Langhorne Crossing Verdelho-Sauvignon
fields.colour: Light straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Fresh and pungent, gooseberry, lemon, grass, asparagus, green herbs (sage), pear, ginger, passion-fruit and a saline element.
fields.taste: Dry, light, fresh and juicy. The zippy acidity is salivating with a good mix of fruit and herbs across the mid-palate although this does disappear on the finish.
fields.overall: Delicious and moreish. A lot going on for a wine of this price, strong nose and flavoursome with lots of acidity making very easy-drinking. Not perfect, perhaps needs more length but can only recommend.

fields.name: Silver Ghost Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple rim, deep intensity.
fields.aroma: Fruity, red berries, blackberry, prunes, plum and bell pepper with some lesser secondary notes of smoke, leather, vanilla and tobacco.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, soft subtle tannin with lots of mouth-watering acidity. Generous fruit driven palate reflecting the nose with a sour yet strangely pleasant med length finish.
fields.overall: A nice simple straightforward Cab Sauv, an approachable easy-drinker. Not a wine to ponder over but good for the price and well worth trying.

fields.name: San Leo Nerello Mascalese Garganega Vino Spumante
fields.colour: Very pale pink, lightly effervescent but this dissipates quickly.
fields.aroma: Average, a touch sweet, peaches, cherry, sour red berries with just a hint of rose petal and green herbs.
fields.taste: Light, dry, subtle mild palate with a mainly peach flavour. Thin sour acidity that's not very appealing and the length is fleeting to say the least.
fields.overall: Even at the sale price this is not worth it. Very plain and one-dimensional, bubbles are disappointing, nose and palate come across as a little sour and flat. It's perfectly drinkable but so much better available in this price range.

fields.name: Rosemount Diamond Selection Shiraz
fields.colour: Youthful dark vibrant cherry red.
fields.aroma: At first the oak is evident, leather, smoke, tar, vanilla and cured meat underpinned by black fruits and warming spices.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich, very mild tannin, lively acidity, Quite smooth on the palate, chocolate and some raspberry perhaps, a touch sweet. Lots of spice coming through on the med finish.
fields.overall: This is not bad at all. Nothing complicated going on just a standard tasty Shiraz. The oak influence was a nice surprise although I would prefer more tannin, weight and length but at the price this is worth a punt.

fields.name: Château d'Orignac Pineau des Charentes
fields.colour: Golden orange/honey.
fields.aroma: Strong Cognac nose, orange, marmalade, apricots, dried fruit, musk, fruit cake and spice.
fields.taste: Rich, thick and viscous. The palate is very luscious and sweet with mouth-filling flavours of caramel, fudge and baking spices nicely lifted by a good streak of acidity. The finish is long, hot, spicy and warming.
fields.overall: Really tasty dessert wine, a wine of substance but not heavy or overpowering. I am not a big fan of Cognac but this is hard to put down. A well made, balanced wine, good QPR, worth a try.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Tasmanian Chardonnay
fields.colour: Pale lemon with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, ripe fruits, lemon, honeysuckle, melon, pineapple, orange peel, green herbs with secondary notes of wax, smoke and buttered toast.
fields.taste: Med-bodied with sharp tangy acidity. The palate is quite smooth and reflects the nose ending with a sustained finish that has a very pleasant bitter tone.
fields.overall: No complaints about this, a very good example of oaked Chardonnay. The balance between fruit and oak is very good, nothing overpowering, everything in moderation. Good value and would highly recommend.

fields.name: Bogle Vineyard Californian Chardonnay
fields.colour: Lustrous golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Open and expressive, lemon, star fruit, mango, pineapple, apricot/marmalade, smoke, butter, toast and mushroom.
