fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, the concentrated palate is complex with a melange of ripe fruit blended with a generous hit of oak but not cloying thanks to the lively acidity. The finish is long and smoke driven.
fields.overall: Loved this, the oak and fruit are at one, opened up and evolved beautifully after warming in the glass. An absolute bargain that paired perfectly with a salmon, smoked haddock and vegetable medley. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Undurraga TH Las Gaviotas San Antonio Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Black cherry fading to a red rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, savoury and earthy, smoke, mushroom, damp soil, forest floor and nettles with lesser fruity tones of raspberry, cherry and plum.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, flat acidity, very little tannin, hollow. The palate like the nose is very earthy but dull. Bitter touch to the decent length finish.
fields.overall: A bit disappointed, very one-dimensional, needs more fruit, acidity and tannin to add robustness, it just lacks solidity and comes across as a bit flat. Drinkable but wanted more for the money.

fields.name: Pouilly-sur-Loire Vieilles Vignes
fields.colour: Pale yellow with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Quite pronounced, ripe, tropical fruits, lemon, pear, apple, floral blossom and something medicinal like.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry with zippy lemony acidity and a pleasant drying texture. The palate brings a tangy minerality, grapefruit, melon and a gentle spiciness that evolves into a sustained piquant finish.
fields.overall: Wholly enjoyable, a mouth-watering appetising wine. Good nose, wonderful texture, balance, lovely finish, hard to put down. A wine with charm if that makes sense, very good value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Andresen 10-year-old White Port
fields.colour: Clear, brilliant amber/orange.
fields.aroma: Expressive, walnuts, honey, citrus peel, toffee, caramel, raisins, Christmas cake, marzipan and butterscotch.
fields.taste: Rich, full-bodied, viscous with refreshing acidity keeping it nice and light. Tingling mouth-filling flavours of apricot, dates, marmalade and honey leading into a complete honeyed finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, no complaints. A big concentrated wine but not heavy or cloying. 20% abv but carries it well, balanced. Great for the price, a crowd pleaser, recommend.

fields.name: Cabalié
fields.colour: Very dark ruby with a lighter red rim.
fields.aroma: Open and fruit driven, almost sweet, raspberry, plum, blackberries, chocolate, vanilla and liquorice with a spiciness like black tea or black pepper.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich, intensely flavoured with chocolate, strawberry jam and cherries but it has enough acidity to avoid it being overbearing. Virtually no tannin, strong mouth-coating mid-palate with a finish to match.
fields.overall: This is ever so tasty, not a wine of depth or complexity, just a sweet ripe fruit crowd pleaser. A great midweek wine at a good price but if you want something with depth and complexity this is not for you.

fields.name: Bullfrog
fields.colour: Dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Open, all jammy fruit, plum, damson, blackcurrants, cherry and cranberries with a touch of green herbs and sweet tobacco.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich on the palate and like the nose it's all ripe fruit. Very light tannin, brisk acidity and a good length drying finish.
fields.overall: A very fruit-driven wine and the lack of tannin leaves me wanting more solidity/structure. Nice, easy-drinking for sure but a bit one-dimensional. Will please anyone looking for big succulent sapid red with lots of flavour at a good price.

fields.name: Dom des Côteaux de Font Curé Beaujolais Villages Blanc
fields.colour: Radiant, clean pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Fresh, lively, lemon, melon, apricot, orchard fruits (apple, pear), an appetizing steely minerality and something earthy like smoke or warm butter.
fields.taste: Fairly light in body, fresh, juicy citrus backed acidity. The palate brings tropical and honeyed fruits with a lick of orange squash on the med+ finish.
fields.overall: Light but still quite a bit going on with the nose and finish being the highlights. Nothing full-on, just a good typical but very appealing and approachable Chardonnay. Very good value, I thoroughly enjoyed this.

fields.name: Château de Lacarelle Beaujolais-Villages Rouge
fields.colour: Dark ruby fading to purple.
fields.aroma: Dense and ripe, raspberry, cranberry, black tea, rhubarb and dandelion with a good hit of pepper.
fields.taste: Med- body, fresh juicy acidity, light but obvious tannin adding texture and balance. The palate is dominated by a pleasant sour cherry note with a similar good sustained finish.
fields.overall: Whoa, what a surprise, this has a lot going on. A lot bolder and richer than I was expecting. Not a complex wine but impressive nose, palate and length for this price range. Highly recommend as it matches the quality of many a cru Beaujolais.

fields.name: Con Carne Malbec Bonarda
fields.colour: Intense and dark, inky red with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe and fruity, black forest fruits, plum, raspberry and cherry with some chocolate, mocha and lots of pepper.
fields.taste: Med- body, mild bitter tannin and a weak thin mouthfeel. There is some red fruit flavours on the palate but these are overwhelmed by a bitter/sour note with a similar finish.
fields.overall: Very average, any aroma and taste is surpassed by the sour off-putting unpleasant element. A poor representation of Malbec and much better available in this price range.

fields.name: Château Coufran
fields.colour: Medium garnet red fading to a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, mainly tertiary aromas, mushroom, damp forest floor, cedar, graphite, leather, smoke, bay leaf, a spiciness like star anise and still some fruit, raisins, plum and blackberry.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, chalky drying tannin that evolves into a smooth soft mid-palate. Subtle flavours that reflect the nose leading into a mellow and developed finish.
fields.overall: Beautiful wine, how Bordeaux should be. Not a big shouty wine but everything comes together wonderfully, harmonious and refined. Great value, drinking perfectly at 19 years, needs decanting, highly recommend.

fields.name: Château de la Grave ‘Grains Fins'
fields.colour: Lustrous golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Open, honey, lanolin, lime, melon, orange rind, tropical fruit (figs), hay and a very evident overtone of oak (almonds/marzipan).
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, firm acidity, rich full palate of lime pie and cream, lemon curd and nuts with a long mouth-filling refreshing saline finish and aftertaste. Balanced.
fields.overall: Different but all the better for it. Delicious, a good mix of fruit and oak. Deep and concentrated but backed by a good streak of acidity, so not at all heavy. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Opulence Private Reserve
fields.colour: Deep ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, rich, blackberries, plum, bbq sauce, smoke, menthol, pepper and an earthiness like dried leaves or roasted meat.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, soft subtle mild tannin giving a smooth texture. Juicy lively acidity and that smoked fruit aroma is repeated on the palate. The med finish is tingly and spicy .
fields.overall: Very good for the price, a juicy succulent wine, generous, good depth of aroma and flavour that's a bit dominated by a smoky overtone but that's my only fault. Good everyday wine, recommend.

fields.name: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Grappolo d'Oro
fields.colour: Intense, dark inky opaque purple. Lightly effervescent.
fields.aroma: Average, strawberry, raspberry, cherry, blueberry and something like berry sauce or rhubarb.
fields.taste: Med+ body, quite rich and lively, textured with a drying grip from the noticeable tannin. The palate is off-dry with flavours of cherry and cough medicine but the finish is disappointingly short.
fields.overall: Not bad, simple and straightforward, bigger and bolder than I was expecting. Would have liked more bubbles and length and not the best value but worth a try if you want something solid but not overwhelming.

fields.name: Stones & Bones
fields.colour: Dark black cherry fading to purple.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, rich dark fruits (blackberry jam, blueberries, damsons), cured meat, roasted tomato, dried flowers, smoke and leather with a touch of menthol and eucalyptus.
fields.taste: Med+ body, peppery across the mid-palate, not much depth of flavour, some cherry or chocolate perhaps, fine-grained tannin that's very smooth, med- finish.
fields.overall: A big wine, pluses include a good nose, silky texture and easy-drinking for a bold wine. However I think it is let down by the palate and finish but minor fault. Good value and well worth trying.

fields.name: Tomáš Čačík Rulandské Bílé
fields.colour: Bright golden topaz yellow.
fields.aroma: Intense and rich, honey, apricot, baked apple, lemon, orange marmalade, almond/marzipan, a smokiness and a steely flintiness.
fields.taste: Med+ body, fleshy with med- acidity. The lemon and apricot palate has an appealing yeasty bitterness that flows into a citrus mouth-filling tingly finish.
fields.overall: Unlike a typical Pinot Blanc this is developed and quite a full-on wine. I found it delicious and inviting with warming aromas and flavours, loved it, well worth the price, highly recommend.

fields.name: Karp-Schreiber Brauneberger Kabinett Riesling
fields.colour: Clear and bright pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, kerosene, smoke and flint upfront with beeswax, a delicate floral note and underlying fruits like crunchy apple, pineapple, peach and apricot.
fields.taste: Light, off-dry, smooth slightly drying texture and crisp acidity. The mid-palate is subtle with flavours of honeysuckle, lime squash and orange but that leads into a much richer sustained fragrant finish.
fields.overall: Lovely light Riesling, nothing overpowering here, pluses include, nose and finish but personally I would have liked more acidity and a stronger mid-palate but minor faults, recommend.

fields.name: Réserve des Tuguets
fields.colour: Opaque, dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Intense, rich and jammy, cherry, plum, blackcurrants, blueberries, anise, leather and sweet spices.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, firm tannic backbone giving a drying coarse-grained texture. More berries, cherry and liquorice on the palate with a nice bitter twist on the med- finish.
fields.overall: A fairly big robust wine, tannic but not overly so. Good nose and ok perhaps it lacks a little body and depth of flavour but at the price very good value and well worth a try.

fields.name: Baía de Tróia Castelão
fields.colour: Inky but bright, good viscosity, purple to ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Strong, a little sweet, plum, raspberry, blackberry, smoke, cured meat, mocha, leather, menthol and spicy vanilla.
fields.taste: Med+ body, abundant acidity, ripe, juicy and succulent across the mid-palate, lots of chocolate, raspberry and liquorice. Smooth but enough tannin to add a filmy texture. Resonant warming mouth-coating finish.
fields.overall: Super ripe, big delicious wine that carries its 15.5% abv very well. A good balance between the oak and fruit adds complexity. Great buy if you are looking for something rich and dense.

fields.name: Martin Waßmer Schlatter Maltesergarten Gutedel
fields.colour: Very pale silver yellow.
fields.aroma: Ripe yet fresh, lemon, apple, melon, a floral/green herb note and a nice hit of smoke.
fields.taste: Dry, vital acidity, subtle but charming palate that reflects the nose but also a touch of buttered toast. Pleasant tingle on the smooth creamy finish.
fields.overall: A nice approachable pleasing wine, nothing really stands out but nothing offensive either. Fruity and floral but a definite tertiary undertone and quite well balanced. Nice on its own, not a knockout but worth a try.

fields.name: W. & J. Graham's 10 Year Old Tawny Port N.V.
fields.colour: Dark amber fading to a rusty orange rim.
fields.aroma: Strong and warm, orange zest, apricots, figs, caramel, toffee, butterscotch, walnuts, honey, raisins and Christmas cake.
fields.taste: Full, rich and luscious which is balanced by firm acidity. Smooth sweet jam, lemon and cloves on the palate that leads into a mouth-filling fiery finish.
fields.overall: Great value port, my only fault is the high alcohol that overshadows everything else. Otherwise, generous, appealing and lasting. Great buy, recommend.

fields.name: Barkan Classic Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Deep ruby red.
fields.aroma: Open, blackcurrant, plum, sour cherry, bell pepper, cedar, some leather and charcoal, quite spicy (vanilla, nutmeg).
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, very mild tannin, feels weak and thin. Pleasant flavours of coffee, wood and liquorice ending with a med bitter finish.
fields.overall: Just ok, nose is a bit sour, lacks body and needs more tannin for structure and balance but otherwise a decent midweek wine. So-so QPR, not a re-buy. Perhaps the mevushal process didn't help this wine.

fields.name: Lagrein Alto Adige Hofstatter
fields.colour: Opaque almost black fading to a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, lots of spice, red forest fruits, sour cherry, sun-dried tomatoes and iodine with lesser notes of chocolate, smoke.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, sapid, juicy acidity, smooth mild well-integrated tannin, pleasing glossy texture. The palate is cherry fuelled with some nutty chocolate ending with a spicy med- finish.
fields.overall: Very enjoyable, easy-drinking thanks to the mouth-watering acidity. This has a bitterness but in a good way, perhaps needs a little more tannic structure but otherwise a good buy at a fair price. Would recommend.

fields.name: Fortazzo Appassite
fields.colour: Clear, attractive carmine red.
fields.aroma: Ripe dense black fruit, black plum, damson, blackberries and cherry, also a savoury earthy tone, tar, cured/grilled meat and wood smoke.
fields.taste: Med body, med+ acidity, discreet light chalky tannin, silky smooth texture. Good intensity and depth of flavour (raspberry, chocolate and menthol). Some warming alcohol on the all too brief finish.
fields.overall: Really good, I did think it would be a bit more robust and heavy but it is lifted by the abundant acidity. A generous wine with a bit of everything but nothing overdone, just well-balanced. The finish was my only fault. Recommend.

fields.name: Chateau Ste Michelle Columbia Valley Riesling
fields.colour: Bright and clear, pale yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, concentrated and ripe, lime cordial, green apple, juicy orange, grilled pineapple, honeysuckle, sweet raisins, a steeliness and diesel.
fields.taste: Off-dry, med body, rich across the palate lifted by vibrant mouth-watering acidity. Flavours include refreshing citrus, stone fruit and petrol. The finish is deliciously sweet with a sustained resonant finish.
fields.overall: Wonderful, utterly moreish, best Riesling I have had. Rich nose and palate but still so piquant, great balance. An absolute steal at under a tenner. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Domaine Bouché Crémant de Limoux Blanc NV
fields.colour: Straw yellow, lively medium persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: Open, upfront almond, toast, cultured cream and wet gravel underpinned by a floral note, green apple, lemon and pear.
fields.taste: Med+ body, touch of sweetness, tangy acidity, fleshy and frothy with a buttery texture. The palate like the nose is more tertiary than fruity ending with a mouth-coating lithe finish.
fields.overall: Very good Crémant, very Champagne-esque. The tertiary aspect of this wine stands out but all-in-all good balance, no complaints, a great value Champagne alternative.

fields.name: Cabalié Cuvée Vieilles Vignes
fields.colour: Dense ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Intense and fruit-driven, stewed raspberry, cherry, plum, chocolate, black tea, liquorice, sweet tobacco, vanilla and something meaty.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich, a touch sweet, the dusty tannin and ample acidity adds structure and balance. The palate mirrors the nose, warming spicy finish.
fields.overall: Needs a little time to open but oh so tasty. Big and broad but approachable and easy-drinking. Better than the 2017, good value, recommend.

fields.name: Suserano Selecção Tinto
fields.colour: Med intensity, viscous, dark cherry fading to ruby.
fields.aroma: Adequate, a mix of fruit and oak, plum, blackberries, violets, a hint of mint and savoury tobacco and cured meat.
fields.taste: Med-full bodied, very dry, rich juicy med+ acidity. Tannin present but well-integrated, very silky texture. Succulent savoury palate ending with a medium chalky finish.
fields.overall: A lovely wine, quite discreet in a lot of ways but a pleasure to drink., the balance is excellent. Wears the 14.5% abv well. Drinking perfectly at 6 six years, recommend.

fields.name: Albourne Estate Selection
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Expressive and ripe, peach, apple, pear, melon, mango, crushed gravel, a floral note and something nutty.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, soft lacklustre acidity, smooth creamy texture. Palate is more subtle than the nose, citrus and orchard fruits, a touch of pepper on the mellow if slightly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Good nose, weight and texture but something missing. Maybe needs a lift from more acidity or greater depth of flavour. I did enjoy it but not a re-buy.

fields.name: Patrimonio Rouge Clos Alivu
fields.colour: Dark cherry red fading to a garnet rim.
fields.aroma: Subtle and savoury, earthy, roasted meat, black olives, mushrooms, roasted tomatoes, black fruits (plum, berries), dried flowers and a little spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, juicy and ripe, gripping tannic backbone supported by brisk acidity. The palate offers bitter red berries, espresso and tobacco ending with a drying cherry fuelled finish.
fields.overall: Wonderful, a wine at its peak. Age is taking over, so more tertiary than fruity with a bitter twist. 5 years and needs drinking now, recommend.

fields.name: Rosso di Montalcino Canalicchio di Sopra
fields.colour: Black cherry with a garnet rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, strawberry, plum, cherry, forest fruits, grilled tomato, tobacco, balsamic and a good hit of pepper.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, good acidity, herbaceous firm tannin yet the texture has a silkiness. Fruity palate of cherry, liquorice and figs but also that tell-tale Italian bitter herbal note. Spicy sustained decent finish.
fields.overall: Still young but so nice, Structured and balanced, a generous wine, more fruit than oak. Maybe needs a bit more time, good QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: RedHeads R’dotto Royale
fields.colour: Pale ruby fading to a medium garnet almost orange rim.
fields.aroma: Strong and oaky upfront, tar, leather, smoke, pine, cola, menthol and roses backed up by lesser fruity notes of cherry and raspberry.
fields.taste: Med bodied, the abundant acidity and discreet tannin are balanced and give a fine-grained texture. The palate is quite mild, some red fruits, menthol/cough medicine or espresso perhaps. Nice peppery tingle on the med finish.
fields.overall: No complaints here, juicy, appealing, a good hit of oak but not overdone allowing the red fruit to come through. An unusual blend of grapes but it works, certainly recommend.

fields.name: Vescovado Guardavalle Calabria Bianco
fields.colour: Bright clear golden yellow with green tinge.
fields.aroma: Dense and mature, lemon pith, apricot, honey, wax/oil, fruit blossom and tropical fruits with a touch of smoke, green herbs and roasted nuts.
fields.taste: Dry, fleshy and rounded, acidity is quite soft, smooth palate. Not the depth of flavour that the nose promised, concentrated orange, a leafy/herbal note. Good tenacious slightly spicy finish.
fields.overall: A structured wine, muscular in ways, almost chewy, acidity seems low but doesn't make the wine heavy. Good nose and finish, appealing, good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Altamana Méthode Traditionnelle Chardonnay Extra Brut Itata
fields.colour: Bright, straw yellow, lively large bubbles.
fields.aroma: Medium intensity, yeasty upfront, buttered toast, biscuit and roasted nuts underpinned by apples, quince and apricot but also something off-putting like sour bitter cherries.
fields.taste: Light, very dry, med- acidity, not frothy or creamy, dull chalky texture. Palate like the nose is more tertiary than fruity, med finish.
fields.overall: Just so-so IMO. More acidity and fruit needed to balance the lees ageing. Not worth the money, can't recommend.

fields.name: Joseph Cattin Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Pale, translucent carmine red.
fields.aroma: Average and sweetish, cherry, strawberry, red forest berries, plum sauce, potpourri and a herbal note.
fields.taste: Light, abundant acidity, very mild tannin adding some texture but still feels a bit thin. A fruit-driven palate of cherry and plum leading into the very peppery but fleeting finish.
fields.overall: Fairly simple and straightforward, more fruity than earthy. Soft and mellow might describe this best, personally I would prefer something with more age and oak. Ok for the price but not a re-buy.

fields.name: Château de Valflaunes Espérance
fields.colour: Pale ruby fading to tile-red.
fields.aroma: Strong, quite earthy/herbal upfront, fennel, black tea, cured meat, fresh asphalt, leather and band-aid underpinned by cherry, plum and blackcurrant.
fields.taste: Med+ body, lots of acidity, mild fine-grained tannin. The palate is smooth and spicy, dark fruit, coffee and chocolate flavoured. Med+ finish.
fields.overall: A full-on wine but not heavy as it is lifted nicely by the good acidity. High alcohol but nothing sweet or overripe about this wine. Structured and balanced, good value, recommend.

fields.name: Faldeos Nevados Torrontes
fields.colour: Bright, pale lemon with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Pronounced, lemon, grapefruit, peach, passionfruit, pineapple, honeysuckle, floral blossom, fresh-but grass and a stony or briny note.
fields.taste: Med+ body, vital acidity adding some lift and although not as profound the palate reflects the nose. A strange drying texture with a bitter twist on the decent finish.
fields.overall: A robust wine, fleshy and with high alcohol but this is well-integrated and not obtrusive. The acidity adds just enough to avoid the wine being flabby. All-in-all a well-made tasty wine at a great price, recommend.

fields.name: Stift Klosterneuberg St Laurent
fields.colour: Medium intense ruby with a purple/blue rim.
fields.aroma: Open, a mix of fruit and earth, cherry, raspberry, forest fruits, bitter green herbs, mushroom, potpourri and baking spices.
fields.taste: Dry, med-body, juicy, fresh lively acidity. Very mild soft tannin with a velvety texture. Palate is more subtle than the nose but the finish is very peppery.
fields.overall: My first St. Laurent and I'm not disappointed. A spicy/peppery wine with plenty of fruit and just a touch of oak. Not complex, just an easy-drinking midweeker at a good price.

fields.name: Torres Coronas Tempranillo
fields.colour: Deep cherry red fading to pale purple.
fields.aroma: Developed and savoury, cherry, cranberry, pomegranate, figs, roasted tomato, leather, tobacco, bay leaf and black pepper.
fields.taste: Med- body, abundant acidity, nice fine loose-grained tannic grip. Mellow and smooth on the palate with cherry and pepper at the fore on the decent finish.
fields.overall: A nice light Tempranillo drinking well at 4 years. Inviting and moreish, a good balance between fruit and oak. Perhaps lacking a little body but minor fault. Good price, well worth a try.

fields.name: Bin #003 Ribolla Gialla
fields.colour: Bright and clear, pale lemon.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, peach, citrus, gooseberry, apricot, baked apple, chamomile, a very grassy/herbal note and a fresh mineral/stony element.
fields.taste: Dry, med-light body, surprisingly rich, juicy zesty acidity with a smooth creamy texture. Palate is all orange and herbs followed by a slightly bitter appetizing finish.
fields.overall: Very different from the norm but in a good way. A succulent juicy wine, more herbal than fruity with that typical pleasant Italian bitterness. A lovely wine at a great price, highly recommend.

fields.name: Terra Nostra Corse Rouge
fields.winery: Union des Vignerons Associés du Levant (UVAL)
fields.colour: Pale ruby red with med-light intensity.
fields.aroma: Strong, blackberry, cherry, plum, balsamic, sun-dried tomatoes, dried flowers, coffee and black pepper.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, vigorous acidity, gripping firm tannic backbone giving a drying texture. The palate and sustained finish is all sour cherry and coffee.
fields.overall: More savoury than fruity, a mouthwatering appealing wine. Very tannic but the high acidity adds balance and structure. Probably better with food and not a wine to ponder over but at the price no complaints.

fields.name: Abadengo Crianza Arribes
fields.region: D.O. Arribes, Salamanca, Castilla y Leon
fields.colour: Attractive vivid vermillion red.
fields.aroma: Rich and mature, cured meats, leather, smoke, tar, iodine, vanilla and something medicinal with stewed black fruits like plum and blackberry.
fields.taste: Med+ body, juicy med+ acidity, soft polished well-integrated tannin. Like the nose the palate is oak influenced but not heavy with a little spice on the enduring finish.
fields.overall: This is just delightful, so well-balanced, it is almost melt-in-your-mouth. 8 years old and seems to be at its peak. Why is this grape so rare, great value,highly recommend.

fields.name: Campanula Pinot Noir Rosé
fields.colour: Bright, wild salmon pink/onion skin.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, a fresh mineral quality, raspberries, strawberries, meadow flowers and something like dried green herbs.
fields.taste: Light, fresh and juicy with brisk acidity. The palate is like the nose but wilder yet quite subtle. There's a bitter twist to the dry satisfying finish.
fields.overall: A crowd pleasing summer wine. Light, juicy, crisp, easy-going, nothing to ponder over, just enjoy. Good value and a good choice if you like a dry not too fruity rosé.

fields.name: M. Chapoutier La Clairette de Die
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a silver tinge. Lively medium bubbles.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and sweetish, orange blossom, pear, pink lady apples, grapes, apricot and lychee.
fields.taste: Off-dry but balanced by the zingy acidity. Fresh and light across the mid-palate with subdued flavours of apple and citrus ending with a nice but brief finish.
fields.overall: The palate does not deliver what the nose promised but still a crisp refreshing wine. Not too sweet, the bubbles, low-alcohol and acidity make this very easy-drinking. Great for the price, highly recommend.

fields.name: Te Mata Gamay Noir
fields.colour: Bright, light ruby red.
fields.aroma: Fruity and confected, cherry, raspberry, bubblegum, sour cherry, peppercorns and rhubarb.
fields.taste: Dry, light, virtually no tannin but lots of acidity so feels unbalanced. The spicy raspberry and cherry palate ends with a medium bitter finish.
fields.overall: Reminds me of a Beaujolais Nouveau, sweet fruit on the nose but acidic and very bitter palate. Feels weak, no depth or structure. Not for me, a lot better out there in this price range.

fields.name: Volcanes Carménère
fields.colour: Rich dark cherry with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strong and savoury, green pepper, cured meat, smoke, tar, olives, stewed black fruits, figs, prunes, cherry and chocolate.
fields.taste: Med+ body, abundant acidity, well-blended tannin, nicely rounded and smooth. The palate offers chocolate and cherry with a little heat on the finish.
fields.overall: A good example of Carménère, rich and ripe, quite a big bold wine, only 13.5% abv but feels heavier. More savoury than fruity, the high acidity adds vital lift, all-in-all well-balanced. Great for the price, recommend.

fields.name: Belle Côte
fields.winery: Vinovalie - Winemakers (Serge Dubois and Francis Terral)
fields.colour: Pale lustrous straw with a silver green tinge.
fields.aroma: Fresh, good intensity, a little saline, orange blossom, crunchy stone fruits, melon and apricot/marzipan.
fields.taste: Light-med bodied, soft acidity with a creamy texture. Palate is like unripe tropical fruits, something green and tangy followed by a long bitter orangy after-taste.
fields.overall: Simple, average everyday wine. Good nose but palate less so, not enough acidity for my liking and the after-taste was a little sharp. Midweek wine at best, better available in this price range.

fields.name: Santo Isidro NV
fields.winery: Cooperativa Agricola Santo Isidro de Pegões
fields.colour: Deep golden yellow. Lively medium bubbles that fade quickly.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, pear, apple, grapefruit, orange and wild flowers with a biscuit and toasty yeasty note.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, meagre acidity, feels a bit dull and flat. The nutty orange palate is quite mild, not much depth or length.
fields.overall: Disappointing, lacks acidity and length, not balanced. No bite or lift from the bubbles making it a little heavy. Nose is not bad and OK well-chilled. You get what you pay for. Too cheap to be good, not a Champagne alternative.

fields.name: Château Mayne Guyon
fields.colour: Bright ruby red with medium intensity.
fields.aroma: A mix of fruit and savoury, blackberries, blueberries, cola, plum, violets, new leather, herbs (bay leaf, sage) and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, med+ acidity, good tannic structure giving a mouth-filling granular texture. Black fruit, liquorice and chocolate on the palate with a smoky wave on the good finish.
fields.overall: Lovely Bordeaux, elegant, supple and round. Drinking beautifully at 5 years, this wine has a bit of everything, worth every penny, highly recommend.

fields.name: Mitravelas Red on Black
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple/blue rim.
fields.aroma: Open, upfront quite fruity, raspberry, cherry, plum, a medicinal/iodine note with a definite undertone of oak, smoke and warm spices.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich but not sweet, good acidity and the smooth fine-grained tannin adds balance. A luscious palate of cherries and red berries with a med+ peppery finish.
fields.overall: For the price this wine punches above its weight. A good blend of fruit and oak, nothing is overpowering, very easy-drinking. Well worth trying, definitely recommend if you are looking for something rich and juicy.

fields.name: Regaleali Bianco Tasca d'Almerita
fields.colour: Very pale lemon with silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, tangy, tangerine, grapefruit, pear, bruised apple, honey, compost (in a good way), white pepper and a stony minerality.
fields.taste: Med+ body, med- acidity, smooth almost opulent mouth-coating texture. Very flavoursome, the palate and finish very much reflect the nose with good length on the finish.
fields.overall: Unusual, a mix of fruit, veg and herbs, no oak but still very full and rich. Lacks acidity IMO making it a little cloying. Decent, good for the price, worth a try.

fields.name: Atlantico Sur Garzon Vineyard Maldonado Marselan
fields.colour: Intense dark ruby red.
fields.aroma: Strong farmyard tone upfront, musty mushroom, pungent cheese and coffee with underlying black fruit, bell peppers and a hint of spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, softly tannic, abundant acidity, well-structured. Palate and finish are bitter, long and reflects the nose, quite unpleasant, like disinfectant.
fields.overall: Horrible, so strange. Not like any wine I have had before. My first Marselan and would have to have another one before passing judgement because maybe this is just 'off'.

fields.name: Domaine Seguin Pouilly Fumé
fields.colour: Pale straw with silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Aromatic with a fresh stone minerality yet the fruit is rich, passionfruit, gooseberry, lemon, melon, grapefruit, crisp apple, grass and floral blossom.
fields.taste: Light, very dry, tangy mouth-watering acidity, rich rounded palate of citrus and herbs with a bitterness to the clean med+ finish.
fields.overall: Delightful SB, typical Loire Valley, not as full-on as the New World. A mix of herbs, fruit and minerals, zingy yet rich, smooth and good length. Can only recommend.

fields.name: Royal Tokaji Late Harvest
fields.colour: Attractive bright topaz yellow.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, lots of citrus fruits, orange, quince, apricot, marmalade, marzipan, honey and a wild tangy musky undertone.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, sweet but very well balanced by the abundant piquant acidity. Palate reflects the nose, like a citrusy squash that leads into a delightfully long finish and after-taste.
fields.overall: Lovely, nothing overpowering here, rich but surprisingly light, crisp and Juicy, quite refined. Great value and well worth a try.

fields.name: Geyerhof StockWerk Zweigelt
fields.colour: Light translucent cherry red.
fields.aroma: Very fruity, almost confected, wild red berries, cherry, iodine, liquorice and a good hit of spice.
fields.taste: Med- bodied, crisp acidity with little to no tannin, feels a little thin. Lots of cherry on the palate with a spicy hot finish.
fields.overall: This is ok but a bit one-dimensional and unbalanced. Needs more weight and tannin to balance the fruit and acidity IMO. If you are looking for a simple, light, easy-drinking red then this is for you.

fields.name: H J. Fabre Reserva Cabernet Franc
fields.colour: Profound dark crimson red fading to purple.
fields.aroma: Intense, dark fruit (blackberries, blueberries) and very earthy, cocoa, paprika, dried leaves, old leather, oak and sweet vanilla.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich palate of chocolate, liquorice and raspberry but this is nicely balanced by the good acidiy and moderate well-blended tannin. The finish is quite peppery.
fields.overall: A bold Cab Franc, needs an hour in the decanter. No complaints, the light oak, tannin and fruit all work well together, a wine to sip and savour. Well worth the money, recommend.

fields.name: Adega de Pegoes Colheita Seleccionada Setubal
fields.colour: Clean, bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Jumped out of the bottle, orange blossom, lemon, peach, apricot, ripe tropical fruits and clove with an earthiness like smoky butter, curd and honey.
fields.taste: Dry, ample body, fleshy even, smooth creamy palate but flabby acidity. Flavours are consistent with the nose with a spicy bitter sustained finish.
fields.overall: A lot of wine for the money, quite opulent. A little heavy and would benefit from more acidity IMO but great for the price, recommend.

fields.name: Graham's Natura Reserve Port
fields.colour: Deep, viscous dark purple.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, medicinal upfront, raspberry or apricot jam, blackberries, sour cherry, toffee apple, vanilla, raisins and star anise.
fields.taste: Full rich body, med acidity, good tannic structure yet mellow and smooth. Hot and spicy across the mid-palate and into the finish with flavours of chocolate, red berries and vanilla.
fields.overall: A wholly enjoyable Port, not as profound or intense as some, maybe balanced, suave or refined might describe it best. A little fiery perhaps but minor complaint, great value, recommend.

fields.name: Melnik 55 Logodaj
fields.colour: Clear crimson red.
fields.aroma: Adequate, cherry, plum, blackurrants, liquorice, dried fruit and rhubarb all underpinned by lesser notes of smoke, tobacco and a hit of oaky spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, good acidity, strong well-blended tannic backbone giving a sinewy texture. The palate reflects the nose, peppery with lots of sour cherry and a touch of oak. Medium finish.
fields.overall: I like this, fruity but with a nice touch of oak, tannic and acidic but not overly so. Balance is not perfect, feels a little light for 14% abv. For the price, this ticks a lot of boxes, a good midweek wine.

fields.name: Devils Corner Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Very pale, like a watered down ruby red.
fields.aroma: Initially very funky secondary/tertiary aromas, farmyard, meat, smoke and dried leaves with faint cherry and red berries coming through.
fields.taste: Light in body, acidic, very little tannin, yet it doesn't feel too weak. The palate does not deliver what the nose promised, similar but much milder and the finish is all too brief.
fields.overall: I find PN to be very hit and miss but this is quite nice. Looks weak, nose is obscure (I like it), it's light and doesn't carry on the palate but this is still very moreish (perhaps it's the juicy acidity). Not a re-buy but well worth a try.

fields.name: Bulgarian Heritage Dimyat Orange Wine
fields.colour: Attractive, clean, clear rust orange.
fields.aroma: Concentrated, dried fruits such as jackfruit, apricot, apple and orange with honey, nuts, vanilla and buttered toast.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, lively acidity and the skin contact has given a nice grip to the texture. More apricot and raisins on the palate. Spicy tingle and a bitter lemon twist on the sustained finish.
fields.overall: Really nice, concentrated fruit on both the nose and palate, good length, acidity and weight. Well made/balanced, great value. Probably not for everybody but I would recommend.

fields.name: Freixenet Cordón Negro Gran Seleccion cava N.V.
fields.colour: Pale straw, lively effervescence and very fine bubbles.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, lime, lemon, ripe apple, yeast/bread, butter and cream with a touch of pear and cinnamon.
fields.taste: Light-med bodied, dry, brisk acidity and a lovely creamy texture. Citrus, pear and apple on the palate with a decent sour grapefruit and saline finish.
fields.overall: A nice Cava but not special. Quite straightforward but for the price this is a crisp, refreshing, easy-going wine and that creamy texture does stand out. Worth a try but...

fields.name: Rocksand Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark inky red.
fields.aroma: Rich and intense, blackberries , plum, damson, cranberries, wood smoke, aged meat, chocolate, vanilla and black pepper.
fields.taste: Med+ body, lively juicy acidity, soft mild tannin and a smooth opulent texture. A big fruity palate, almost sweet, lots of ripe juicy berries, rich chocolate and smoke. Persistent finish.
fields.overall: A big sapid moreish Shiraz. Fruit-driven and acidic with a slight oakiness to add balance. A crowd pleaser at a good price. Hard to find fault, recommend.

fields.name: Esporão Reserva Branco
fields.colour: Bright, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Rich, more oak than fruit, beeswax, oil, hazelnut and lavender underpinned by lemon, grapefruit, orange blossom, mango and a green herb/grassy note.
fields.taste: Med+ body, structured and broad but not cloying, lifted by the abundant acidity. Buttery texture, smoky citrusy palate and a long grapefruit finish.
fields.overall: Loved it, a big white, well made and balanced. Nose and finish stand out, opens up nicely in the glass. Great value and highly recommend.

fields.name: Monbazillac Château Pech La Calevie
fields.colour: Deep golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Quite pungent, botrytis is evident, musky/mouldy (in a good way), peach, apricot, lemon, orange peel, quince and lychee with a spicy note.
fields.taste: Full and rich but not overly sweet, med acidity with marzipan, apricot jam, ripe papaya and a touch of spice on the palate. Delicious sour twist on the resonant finish.
fields.overall: Succulent and moreish, I love how the noble rot stands out, adds an extra layer to the wine. Perhaps lacking a little acidity but very minor fault, highly recommend at this price.

fields.name: Foresco Barberani
fields.colour: Polished cherry red.
fields.aroma: Open, quite sharp like alcohol soaked fruit, cherry, plum, balsamic, dried flowers, sun-dried tomatoes, tobacco and cinnamon.
fields.taste: Med body, biting sour appetising acidity with solid robust drying tannin. More cherries and red berries on the palate and the med finish.
fields.overall: A very typical Italian herby acidic wine, a wine that needs food. Nose is a little off-putting but other than that a perfect midweek wine. Worth the money, recommend.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Zinfandel
fields.colour: Deep garnet fading to purple.
fields.aroma: Big and pronounced, rooibos tea, barbequed meats, smoke, leather, plum, blackberries, sweet tobacco, green pepper, vanilla and a zingy spiciness.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich dense palate of smoky-sweet fruit but loads of acidity to balance it out. Tannin is quite discreet ending with a juicy, succulent, fruity finish.
fields.overall: A big jammy red, spicy, generous, roasted and all comes together nicely. My only complaint is the lack of tannin, personal thing, otherwise a lovely wine, highly recommend.

fields.name: Villemarin Picpoul de Pinet
fields.colour: Bright and clear, pale lemon yellow with a silver rim.
fields.aroma: Crisp and refreshing, lemon, citrus blossom, melon, a saline stony minerality, crunchy apple, green herbs and grass.
fields.taste: Med- body, green piquant acidity yet surprisingly creamy on the palate. Biting sour citrus and apple flavours that continue into the nice lithe finish.
fields.overall: More body and weight than I was expecting. Well-rounded I would say, the high acidity is well-balanced by the unusual weight I would associate with this grape. Not complicated but still delicious and appetising. Good price, recommend.

fields.name: Barbeito Rainwater Reserve
fields.colour: Clean, bright, light orange rust.
fields.aroma: Intense and delicate, plum sauce, apricot, burnt caramel, raisins, orange peel, curry spices, peanut shell, pecan, saline and maple syrup.
fields.taste: Med+ body, firm acidity and the tasting brings lots of citrus and fruitcake flavours that flows into a long spiced fuelled finish leaving a smooth texture across the palate.
fields.overall: At this price Madeira will not get better. Good depth and length, the nose and palate deliver but the finish trumps all. Highly recommend if on a budget.

fields.name: Graham Beck Brut Rosé NV
fields.colour: Pale salmon pink, lively persistent medium sized bubbles.
fields.aroma: Average, a distinctive shellfish odour, (not bad just different), followed by some strawberry, grapefruit and crushed rocks.
fields.taste: Med- body, dry, crisp and acidic across the palate. Red berries dominate the flavour and the moderate finish.
fields.overall: Love the vibrancy of the bubbles but otherwise this is just average. Crisp, juicy and fresh, yes, but missing the depth and creaminess I had hoped for. OK but no Champagne substitute.

fields.name: Fairview Cinsault Old Paarl Bushvines
fields.colour: Lightly tinted, cherry red.
fields.aroma: Strong, sour cherry, raspberry, plum, violets, black tea and loads of spice.
fields.taste: Med- body, feels quite light, vibrant acidity, very light tannin adding a little grip. Palate and good finish are all red fruit (especially sour cherries) and pepper.
fields.overall: Lovely wine, Beaujolais like, light, juicy, fresh, very moreish. A simple wine but very generous on all counts. Good price, highly recommend if you are looking for a fruity light red.

fields.name: Clos de Los Siete (by Michel Rolland)
fields.colour: Dense dark ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, warm, savoury and spicy. Bramble fruits, plum, damson, smoke, espresso, chocolate, graphite and dried flowers.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body, tannin is soft and silky, good acidity adding a freshness and lift. The palate and good finish is a divine mix of chocolate and berry that's oh so tasty.
fields.overall: No complaints here, a delightful blend of Bordeaux grapes that all work together to make a powerful yet refined wine. Rich and fleshy but not at all heavy. High alcohol is not noticeable. Well worth the price, recommend.

fields.name: Jechtinger Weissburgunder Bercher
fields.colour: Very pale straw, clear and light.
fields.aroma: Good intensity and fruity, peach, lemon, apple, a hint of lychee, something nutty and a crushed stone/flinty minerality.
fields.taste: Med- body, freshly acidic, dry, smooth texture. A mouthwatering juicy steely stone fruit and grapefruit palate/finish.
fields.overall: Not a complex wine but very crisp and refreshing with a nice tanginess that's balanced by the weight and alcohol. Easy-drinking, perfect for a warm summers evening and at a good price. Recommend.

fields.name: Valpolicella Ripasso Superiore
fields.colour: Bright ruby red.
fields.aroma: Intense, hot and spicy (vanilla, nutmeg), cherry, cough medicine, red and black berries, liquorice, sweet tobacco and flowers.
fields.taste: Med body, solid sweet tannic structure, abundant acidity. The palate brings more cherry and red berries with a decent finish.
fields.overall: Dry but a real sweetness from the fruit. This wine has a bit of everything, tannin, acidity, fruit and lots of spice, not perfectly balanced but minor complaint. A fruity lively red, price about right, worth a try.

fields.name: Vinha do Fava
fields.colour: Deep intense ruby, quite opaque.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and dry, blackcurrants, herbs, mint, sour plum, dark chocolate, smoke, leather and black tea.
fields.taste: Rich and juicy, full-bodied and fine silky tannin. The palate is unusual, like a sweet smokey sauce, very pleasant. Medium herbal finish.
fields.overall: I really liked this, appealing, a real mix of sweet and sour. Big, bold but balanced and lifted by the vibrant acidity. Very good QPR, definitely recommend.

fields.name: Lison Classico Pramaggiore Mazzolada
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Open, lots of citrus upfront (lemon, grapefruit), a green herbal note, a mineral quality like wet stone or petrochoir, melon and strangely ripe kiwi and banana.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, nervy acidity with substantial body and a yielding mellow texture, almost rich.  A palate of grapefruit, honey and brine, a touch bitter. So-so finish.
fields.overall: Very nice, nothing fruity or sweet here, but still an appealing nose and palate. I would like more acidity and length but for the price this is generous and pleasing. Well worth a try, recommend.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Sauternes
fields.colour: Rich bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, a touch of the funky noble rot upfront followed by apricot, quince, marmalade, honey, pineapple, figs, marzipan and spiced pear.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich but not overly sweet, oily texture but balanced by the marked acidity. Lemon curd, sultanas, apricot and honey on the palate with a decent sustained finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, very Sauternes, it has got that funkiness that only botrytis can bring. A sweet wine but not cloying or heavy. Great entry wine for this region at a great price, highly recommend.

fields.name: Boscwood Petit Verdot Shiraz
fields.colour: Dark crimson red.
fields.aroma: Med-intense savoury fruity mix, tobacco leaf, bacon fat, lavender, green herbs, dark bramble fruits, sour cherry, plum, blueberries and spice.
fields.taste: Med+ body, juicy, very little tannin, supple fine-grained texture. A palate of liquorice, mocha, dark chocolate and vanilla with a nice acidic tingle on the finish.
fields.overall: Not as big and bold as I was expecting, a little restrained and all the better for it. The vibrant acidity makes it appealing and easy-drinking. Nothing deep or complex but a nice well priced wine.

fields.name: Kolonics Pincészet Somlói Furmint
fields.colour: Attractive luminous topaz.
fields.aroma: Mature and strong, honey, baked apple, lemon, grapefruit, warm bread/buttered toast, an ashy smokiness, yeast, waxy pine resin and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, dense and creamy lifted by the abundant acidity.  Packed full of flavours reflecting the palate with an enduring honeyed after-taste.
fields.overall: This is brilliant, big nose, length, depth and carries its weight well. Only 3 years old but very mature and drinking perfectly. Great for the price and I can only recommend.

fields.name: Sánchez Romate Oloroso Encontrado 1/5
fields.colour: Bright, clean, mahogany fading to amber.
fields.aroma: Intense and very nutty, brine, preserved lemons, orange zest, apricot, fruit cake, raisins, varnish and caramel.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, very dry with loads of zesty mouth-watering acidity. Very smooth across the palate and the mouth-filling flavours which echo the nose just last and last.
fields.overall: A delicious pungent Sherry, delivers on all counts, strong in so many ways yet mellow and appealing, great balance. Well worth the money, highly recommend.

fields.name: Puy de Dôme
fields.colour: Bright, light ruby red.
fields.aroma: Initially very funky, a little unpleasant like a babies nappy. This disappeared after a while to reveal cherry, raspberry, cola, plum, an earthiness (mushroom, tobacco, dry soil) and a little spice.
fields.taste: Med-light, lively acidity with a little tannin adding some grip to the texture. An appealing sweetness to the cherry fuelled palate, moderate finish.
fields.overall: Started badly but improved with a little time. Only average IMO, nothing deep or complex going on here, a little bland and it feels a bit weak. Not a re-buy and can't recommend.

fields.name: Dragon Langhe Bianco Luigi Baudana
fields.colour: Bright gold with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Alcohol is evident upfront, orange, lemon, apricot, blooming flowers, butter\curd, crème brûlée, baking spices(allspice, cloves) and a slight stony minerality.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, firmly acidic. A palate of ripe or even stewed orchard fruits that's fleshy but not overly rich. Good finish but again more alcohol on the warming nose tingling finish.
fields.overall: A good nose of contrasting elements, This wine has weight but lifted by the acidity. My only fault is that alcohol level, a little too high for my taste. Otherwise this is lovely, generous, appetising, great value.

fields.name: Rivesaltes Ambré
fields.colour: Intense, dark, viscous, rust orange. Like a tawny port.
fields.aroma: Strong and concentrated, orange peel, apricot, toffee, burnt caramel, raisins, preserved lemon, jackfruit and Brazil nuts with a notes leather and spice.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, rich but not overly sweet, juicy, zingy acidity. Oak infused citrus and balsamic flavours that end in a long spicy but oh so mellow finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, this is great. Structured and balanced, a powerful wine yet so refined, elegant and mellow. Worth every penny, highly recommend.

fields.name: Château Péricou
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a pink rim.
fields.aroma: Strong, savoury and ripe, plum, cherry, red and black berries, coffee, anise, bay leaf, new leather, mushroom and tobacco.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, nice tart acidity, structured by the coarse-grained chalky tannin. The persistent palate and finish are reminiscent of chocolate, liquorice and red fruit syrup.
fields.overall: Very good, a powerful wine but too soon to drink IMO, the tannin should mellow given more time. Otherwise, good all-round, ripe but not sweet, a wine to spend a bit of time over. Good value, worth a try but let it age a bit.

fields.name: The King's Legacy Chardonnay
fields.colour: Bright, shiny pale straw with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Secondary aromas upfront, curd, butter, wild mushroom, roasted nuts and farmyard all underpinned by ripe stone fruit, lemon, apple and pineapple.
fields.taste: Med+ body, muscular but boosted by abundant acidity. Dry, rich and round, the creamy palate has a little grip. An intriguing mix of oak (heavy) and fruit on the palate with refreshing length.
fields.overall: The lees ageing is very evident, strong nose and palate, certainly oak dominated. The good acidity saves this wine, the heavy oak may not be for everyone but I like it. Worth the money, recommend.

fields.name: Dr. Loosen Blue Slate Riesling Beerenauslese
fields.colour: Deep old gold with an orange hue.
fields.aroma: Intense and rich, dried apricot, citrus fruits (lemon, lime, grapefruit), ripe apple, plum, pineapple and honey with a touch of stone and petrol.
fields.taste: Med+ body, off-dry but the sweetness is off-set by the juicy acidity. The lush and oh so smooth palate has a smoky apricot and honey flavour with an ethereal finish.
fields.overall: Just delicious, concentrated and rich yet fresh, elegant and light. Great balance and the lithe finish is just amazing. Well worth the money.

fields.name: Chronic Spritz and Giggles
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, peach, melon, pear, apple, grapefruit, orange squash, something tropical and a nice buttery creamy note.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, moderate acidity but lacks life and zip. Palate is like the nose but not as forward. Disappointing abrupt finish.
fields.overall: Very average, nothing complicated here, just a simple manufactured wine. Sparkling but lacking spark. It is pleasant, easy-drinking and OK for the money but better available.

fields.name: Marcillac Lo Sang del Pais Domaine du Cros
fields.colour: Sustained medium purple.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, a tart sharpness, sour cherries, bell pepper, tomato leaf, rhubarb, cola, black berries and pepper.
fields.taste: Light, dry, lightly tannic adding some structure to counteract the bitter acidity. Like the nose, the palate and finish are both unripe with a sour twist.
fields.overall: I like this, similar to a cross between a young Beaujolais and Chianti, very sour yet the high acidity makes it juicy, fresh and appealing. A good simple midweek wine at a good price, recommend.

fields.name: Quinta Sardonia Sardon
fields.colour: Intense, deep purple.
fields.aroma: Powerful, sweet raspberry, blueberries, sugar plum, green herbs and savoury notes of coffee, tobacco, chocolate, vanilla and a little mint.
fields.taste: Robust, dry, with loose-grained rich tannin and med+ acidity. The palate while not as big as the nose is pleasant with a smoky fruit and liquorice flavour. Finish is quite fiery.
fields.overall: A solid red, a bit of everything going on. Heady but not very noticeable as it is well-built. A generous wine with some depth and complexity, at a good price.

fields.name: Moët & Chandon Impérial Brut Champagne
fields.overall: Expired

fields.name: Haardt Scheurebe Muller Catoir
fields.colour: Bright, clear, almost water white.
fields.aroma: Expressive, loads of peach with citrus pith, lychee, blackcurrant, a wet stone minerality and a touch of oil and smoke.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, brisk acidity with a smooth waxy texture. Gooseberry, vegetal (sage) and saline across the palate with a  peppery tingle on the bitter med finish.
fields.overall: An unusual wine, fresh and juicy with a richness, I can see why it is compared to SB, a definite herbal tone. Balance is good but I need to try more Scheurebe, give it a go.

fields.name: Marks & Spencer Vintage Port
fields.colour: Dense, opaque with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Open with an intense spiciness upfront (5-spice, cinnamon) with underlying apricot jam, raspberry, black berries, fudge and tobacco.
fields.taste: Med-full, not overly sweet, firm acidity, well-blended tannin. The palate brings cherry, chocolate, raspberry and toffee apple but the finish is a quite disappointing.
fields.overall: It's just missing something, doesn't have the power or intensity that you would expect from a vintage port. Saying that it is very enjoyable and a good price. Perhaps I should have let it lie a few more years.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition St Aubin
fields.region: St. Aubin, Cote de Beaune, Burgundy
fields.colour: Clear bright cherry red.
fields.aroma: Emphasis is on the savoury, mushroom, forest floor, potpourri, tobacco, clove and brown sugar with an undertone of cherry, cranberry and plum.
fields.taste: Light in body, very little tannin with fresh lively acidity. Palate is all red fruit, not as strong as the nose but does end with a mouthwatering  delicate sustained finish.
fields.overall: The lack of body and tannin takes away from this wine, a bit thin and light for me. However, appealing nose and palate, a wine with a little charm. Good PN for the price and should not disappoint.

fields.name: Domaine de la Rochette Mont Sard Mâcon-Bussières
fields.colour: Bright straw yellow.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, lemon, tree fruit ( apricot, soft yellow apple, pear), vanilla, a sweet floral note and nice secondary aromas of curd and butter.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied vital acidity. The palate is like the nose but introduces a nice rich creamy fudge like element that ends with a very good really smooth finish.
fields.overall: This is a delight, all the elements just flow seamlessly, rich and smooth yet very light and elegant, just so well balanced,. Great value and highly recommend.

fields.name: Clos Villemaurine Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
fields.colour: Deep garnet fading to a mahogany rim.
fields.aroma: Mature, smoke, leather, cedar, vanilla, baking spices, menthol/anise and damp soil with lesser fruit aromas of bramble berries and cherries.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry, soft acidity, herbaceous velvety tannin. The palate is very oaky and this extends into the sustained finish.
fields.overall: Very nice well matured Bordeaux. Perhaps a little thin and needs more fruit on the palate but these are minor faults. Probably at its best right now, better than the average Bordeaux, recommend.

fields.name: August Eser Vom Löss Riesling Trocken
fields.colour: Bright, clear, straw yellow with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Quite rich and tertiary, stone, diesel, honey, beeswax, a sweet floral note with fruity undertones of lemon, apple, tropical fruits and melon.
fields.taste: Dry with a touch of sweetness, med-bodied with zippy acidity and a strong palate of stale bread and ripe fruit like orange squash or pineapple. Good rich long finish that just echoes around the back of your mouth.
fields.overall: Fuller than I was expecting but the acidity brings lift and a nice sharpness to the palate. Really enjoyable, feels big on the nose and finish yet easy-drinking and fresh. Good value, recommend.

fields.name: The Liberator 'The Good, The Bad and The Sangiovese'
fields.colour: Pale garnet with a mahogany rim.
fields.aroma: Mature and spicy, tobacco, leather, tomato leaf, dried flowers, vanilla, lots of pepper and stewed fruit (plum, cranberries).
fields.taste: Med- body, still very tannic with loads of juicy acidity. Cherry, raspberry, balsamic palate that leads into a coarse mouth gripping finish.
fields.overall: This is a delight for those who like mature wines. Typical Italian grape acidity and strong tannin structure this wine. Drink now as it won't improve, certainly not perfect but worth a try.

fields.name: Gere Kékfrankos
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strong, heady, blackberries, plum, black olives, cherry, spicy dried fruit and something floral like lavender or violets.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, good acidity and mild soft tannin. A nice chocolate, liquorice and raspberry palate with a scented moderate finish. Feels somewhat weak.
fields.overall: Fresh, fruity and a nice nose and palate but this is still only OK to me. Lacks structure and body IMO, so-so vfm, a good midweek wine, not outstanding but worth a try.

fields.name: Antoine Arena Bianco Gentile
fields.colour: Clear, lustrous pale gold.
fields.aroma: Rich but not profound, lots of secondary aromas, honey, burnt sugar, chamomile, straw, brioche and nutty cheese with lemon, ripe peach and apple.
fields.taste: Feels full, almost fat, vital acidity to balance. Very dry, citrus and perfumed face cream (can't think of another comparison) on the palate that ends with a good long savoury nut finish.
fields.overall: Really good, different and a pleasant change. Succulent and rich but not "in your face". Worth the money IMO, drinking well now (5 years), recommend.

fields.name: Crémant de Limoux Domaine de Mouscaillo Brut Nature
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow with small fine bubbles.
fields.aroma: Expressive, yeast, sourdough, buttered toast, unripe crunchy green apple, pear, crisp citrusy notes, grassy and herbs with a mineral quality.
fields.taste: Bone dry, light-med bodied, sharp zesty acidity yet the texture is very smooth and creamy. The palate reflects the nose, lots of yeast and bread, good length and a sappy appetising finish.
fields.overall: Not bad at all, lots of secondary characteristics, dry as the desert but still mouth-watering, balance is not perfect but overall a good Crémant, ok vfm, worth a try.

fields.name: Nebbiolo d'Alba Drago Poderi Colla
fields.colour: Clear cherry red.
fields.aroma: Strong and nose tingling, cherry, plum, black berries, sun-dried tomatoes, black tea, tobacco, balsamic, lots of spice with a hint of smoke and pine.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, bitter acidity, abundant solid tannic structure adding grip to the cherry, vanilla, green herbs driven palate. Good enduring finish.
fields.overall: Really enjoyed this, lots of spice, herbs and that oh so typical Italian sourness. Not as bold as I was expecting but overall balance is good, priced accordingly, recommend.

fields.name: Jim Barry 'The Lodge Hill' Shiraz
fields.colour: Dense inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Pronounced, blackberries, plum, black olives, incense, tobacco smoke, spices, cured meat, lavender and an earthy herbal note.
fields.taste: Big, bold and juicy, very fine well-integrated tannin adding texture. A rich palate of chocolate, raspberries and liquorice, tasty moderate finish.
fields.overall: A big smooth red, lots on the nose and palate, ripe and succulent, a nice touch of oak so all-in-all a well rounded wine. Worth the price, good Aussie Shiraz, recommend.

fields.name: Camel Valley Bacchus
fields.colour: Very pale, almost water white.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, fresh, gooseberry, lemon, melon, juicy crunchy orchard fruits (apple, pear), saline and a grassy/floral/green herbs note, like a meadow.
fields.taste: Very dry, crisp zesty acidity, med- body. Quite a pronounced palate, similar to the nose with a very good sustained finish.
fields.overall: Surprised by this, delightful, proof the UK is on the rise. Light, brisk, tangy and generous, there's balance and complexity. Good QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: Chapel Down Bacchus Sparkling
fields.colour: Clear, limpid, lively small fine bubbles.
fields.aroma: Aromatic, grapefruit, melon, orchard fruits, passion fruit, a sweet floral note like honeysuckle with just a hint of grass and gooseberry.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, med- acidity, smooth airy texture. The palate is all peach with an echo of those sweet flowers. Strong enduring finish.
fields.overall: Young, fresh, brisk are all pluses but a little too sweet tasting for me (not a criticism). Very peachy and floral, a crisp easy-drinking sparkler, very different from all others. Recommend if you like something with a little sweetness.

fields.name: Glenelly Glass Collection Cabernet Franc
fields.colour: Sustained dark cherry red.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and ripe, blackberries, cherry, menthol, vanilla, red bell pepper, leather, dried leaves, roasted meat and something very spicy, like smoked paprika.
fields.taste: Med+ body, dry, med+ acidity, structured by a moderate well-built tannic grip. Across the palate there's cherry, chocolate and savoury balsamic with a good smoky finish.
fields.overall: Very good CF, bigger bolder and riper than it's French counterparts. Generous nose and palate, savoury and quite heavy. Very good QPR, well worth a try.

fields.name: Ammazza Bianco Spumante
fields.colour: Pale straw, med bubbles that fade quickly.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, a sharp freshness upfront, apple, pear, fruit salad, a floral note and perhaps a little honey.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry with crisp acidity. Very smooth across the palate. Palate like the nose but not as intense, decent finish.
fields.overall: Surprised by this, more to the nose and palate than I was expecting. Nothing complex but a nice simple sparkler, easy-drinking. The nose and creamy texture are the highlights. Good QPR, well worth a try.

fields.name: Kraal Bay Pinotage
fields.colour: Clear bright cherry red.
fields.aroma: Average at first but opens up to cherry, plum, blackberry, savoury herbs, roasted pepper and sweet and sour sauce.
fields.taste: Light-med bodied, juicy, light supple tannin giving a soft palate of sour cherry and plum. Simple and not much length across the palate or finish.
fields.overall: An average Pinotage, all fruit and lacks a touch of oak IMO. Nose is OK but palate, length and finish are all underwhelming. A lot better available in this price range, not a re-buy.

fields.name: Un Vent de Folie
fields.colour: Dark ruby red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strong and spicy, lots of green herbs, new leather, thick black fruit ( blackberry,plum) and something very odd, almost chemical or glue like.
fields.taste: Full, dry and rich with moderate chalky tannin. A textured appealing palate of raspberry sauce, plum, liquorice and smoked meat but the finish is somewhat brief.
fields.overall: Only one complaint from me, that peculiar glue like aroma that just seems to overwhelm everything else. Otherwise a well made wine, a nice mix of oak and fruit, high alcohol is not noticeable and a fair price.

fields.name: Split Rock Sauvignon Blanc
fields.colour: Bright and clear, very pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Pungent fresh green fruit and herbs, gooseberry, grass, grapefruit, lemongrass, fruit blossom and a perfumed oil element.
fields.taste: Med-bodied with zingy sharp acidity. A full-on tropical palate of passion fruit, kiwi and guava which has a smooth richness. Clean long finish.
fields.overall: Not usually the biggest fan of NZ SB but this is very appetising and moreish. Crisp and acidic, balanced by the ripeness of the fruit. Good QPR and a must for those who like this style of wine.

fields.name: Louis Jadot Bourgogne Pinot Noir Les Pierres Rouges
fields.colour: Pale transparent cherry red.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity and fruity, sour cherry, raspberry and plum, with a nose tingling spice like clove. Lesser notes of tobacco and something floral.
fields.taste: Light, firm acidity, the slight tannin adds a little grip to the texture. The palate and med finish are all sour cherry, very one-dimensional.
fields.overall: Overly bitter, too light, hollow, just doesn't say quality. A good example that red Burgundy is over priced. Much better available, wouldn't recommend.

fields.name: Etna Rosso Fondo Filara
fields.colour: Pale limpid carmine red.
fields.aroma: Potent and heady, cherry, strawberry, cranberry, sweet potpourri, lots of warm spice with hints of smoke, leather and tobacco.
fields.taste: Dry, light, med+ acidity, smooth on the palate with discreet yet noticeable tannin adding some grip. Flavours reflect the nose, lots of red fruit but the finish is all too brief.
fields.overall: 24 months in oak, hard to find it. Not a complaint as this is very appealing and easy-drinking. The nose is quite potent but this does not carry over to the palate. Not remarkable but certainly enjoyable, a good midweeker, worth the money.

fields.name: Maruxa Godello
fields.colour: Bright pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Aromatic and ripe, lemon, grapefruit, quince and very tropical with notes of orchard fruits, lanolin and brine.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, oily, med- acidity. The peachy and lemon palate are appetisingly bitter with a refreshing mineral bite to the finish.
fields.overall: A wine that feels fat/oily and ripe but is lifted by a juicy salinity. Lots on the nose, subdued yet appealing on the palate. Perhaps not for everybody and maybe best with food but IMO, pleasant, good price and worth a try.

fields.name: La Battistina 'Metodo Classico' DOCG Gavi Brut
fields.colour: Pale straw yellow with a hint of green, lively persistent med-sized bubbles.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, quite subdued, apple, lemon, pear, sweet honeysuckle and a crisp salinity.
fields.taste: Light, just a touch sweet, brisk acidity. The mid-palate has a silky smooth creamy texture with an intense yeast and bread dominant taste that rolls into the finish.
fields.overall: So nice, nose and palate are worlds apart, one is all fruit and flowers, the other all yeast and lees ageing, I just loved the palate. Worth the money, great alternative sparkling wine.

fields.name: Domaine Jean Marc Burgaud Regnie Vallieres
fields.colour: Clear, sustained vermilion red.
fields.aroma: Youthful and fruity, sour cherry, strawberry, plum, cassis, cocoa, boiled sweets, peppercorns and potpourri.
fields.taste: Med-light bodied, vigorous acidity supported by a moderate dry chalky tannic structure. Core flavours of juicy red and black fruits ending with an enduring finish.
fields.overall: A generous Beaujolais, reflecting its cru status. Good nose, vibrant, refreshing and oh-so easy-drinking. A must try for those who like fruity lively reds, good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Sterling Vintners Collection Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Deep dark ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Rich and succulent, jammy fruit,  blackcurrants, plum, cherry, smoke, cedar, chocolate, bell peppers and baking spices.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, the palate is ripe almost sweet with flavours of mint chocolate, tobacco and vanilla. This however is balanced by the med acidity and the fine well-integrated smooth tannin, moderate finish.
fields.overall: This is full-on, big on everything yet not heavy, in fact very easy-drinking. Juicy and appealing, a nice combination of fruit and oak. Fairly priced, worth a try.

fields.name: Birgit Braunstein Pinot Blanc
fields.colour: Very pale straw, clear and light.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, peach, apple, lemon, sharp flint/crushed gravel, some green veg and a slight ageing note of nutty biscuit.
fields.taste: Dry, juicy refreshing acidity yet the palate feels quite full and rich, lots of green fruits, grapefruit and herbs with a bitter nuttiness to the med finish.
fields.overall: There's a lot of good things to say about this wine, good nose, some complexity and length yet it just doesn't seem to all come together, lacks elegance. Certainly worth a try at the price.

fields.name: De Bortoli Florence Broadhurst Botrytis Semillon
fields.colour: Beautiful clean lustrous rust orange.
fields.aroma: Very rich, mandarin orange, Key lime pie, apricot jam, peach, beeswax, chamomile and a tangy salinity.
fields.taste: Full-bodied and viscous but a stern acidic backbone adds balance. Unlike the nose the palate is quite discreet, some orange and apricot but all to short and the finish is fleeting at best.
fields.overall: Started off great, colour, nose, weight and acidity but then let down by the length and depth of flavour. On the whole enjoyable and easy-drinking, generous for the price, worth a try.

fields.name: Bononia Estate Gomotartzi Gamza
fields.colour: Transparent anaemic ruby red.
fields.aroma: Clear-cut red fruit, nothing sweet, red bramble berries, pomegranate and redcurrants with savoury herbs and a nose tingling spiciness.
fields.taste: Light, dry, crisp vibrant acidity, no tannin. The palate is all sour raspberries and cherries that continues into the spicy med finish, recommend.
fields.overall: Something so moreish here, a perfect summer red, cool, refreshing and so approachable, hard to put down. Nothing complex but it works, a straightforward fruity lively wine at a great price.

fields.name: Paul Ginglinger Crémant d'Alsace - Brut Prestige
fields.colour: Fine lively effervescence, pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: The aroma just jumped out of the bottle. fresh crunchy apple, pear, citrus and wet stone all underpinned by a lovely autolytic yeasty, sourdough tone.
fields.taste: Dry, vigorous acidity, creamy smooth palate of citrus fruits and roasted nuts adds weight. Good enduring finish.
fields.overall: Just brilliant, this Crémant has it all, nose, concentrated palate, length, texture and depth. Great value Champagne alternative, highly recommend, best Crémant I have ever had.

fields.name: Catena Cabernet Sauvignon Special Selection for The Wine Society
fields.colour: Intense dark garnet fading to red.
fields.aroma: Generous, savoury fruit, blackcurrant, plum, cranberries and damson with an earthiness in the way of cedar, pencil lead, coffee, smoke, farmyard and all dusted with baking spices.
fields.taste: Med+ body, ripe chalky tannin, textured. Good length and depth of flavour across the mid-palate (vanilla, menthol, liquorice) and a little spicy heat on the strong finish.
fields.overall: Delicious, a wine in its prime, a melange of fruit and oak that is structured by the ample tannin and vital acidity. Great value and can only recommend.

fields.name: Zaha Marsanne
fields.colour: Radiant, attractive gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Upfront started out like a floral floor cleaner, but settles down to show subtle orange, melon, white tree fruit, a sweet floral/herbal note and a little ginger spice.
fields.taste: Dry, med+ body with a melted butter smoothness, med acidity to balance. The palate like the nose is discreet, grilled sweet tropical fruits and citrus with a finish to match.
fields.overall: Very surprised, expected a big wine but nose and palate are so subdued albeit very nice. The brilliant texture, weight and balance makes up for any deficiencies. I really like this, a bit over-priced but still worth a try.

fields.name: Yarrunga Field Special Reserve Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Med-intensity, cherry-plum.
fields.aroma: Strong, an overwhelming barnyard nose at first. Given time it develops savoury red berries, cherry, new leather, gun smoke, dried flowers and spice.
fields.taste: Med- body, very little tannin buts loaded acidity. The palate is quite sharp and bitter, like sour cherries mixed with dark chocolate. Ok finish but sadly it echoes the palate.
fields.overall: Another disappointing Pinot, I do like the nose but after that it went downhill. Course and angular might describe it best. Not for me, better available at the price..

fields.name: The Liberator Special Edition Napoleon Bona Part Three
fields.colour: Dark amber with an orange rim.
fields.aroma: Open, quite woody at first, like varnish but evolves into apricot, orange, toffee, caramel, pecan, raisins, pine resin, honey and vanilla.
fields.taste: Full thick body, sweet but not cloying, tempered by the still lively acidity. A mint orange (oddly) palate with a superb long resonant finish.
fields.overall: Delicious and syrupy, not a sign of age. Nothing overpowering or complex here, the highlights include, balance, a good nose and an excellent echoing finish. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Blind Spot Frankland River Cabernet Franc
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Strong, fruity and very peppery, sour raspberries, dried berries, tobacco, roasted red peppers, paprika and clay pot.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, dry, concentrated/chewy texture, med- acidity and moderate loose-grained tannin. The palate is very herbaceous backed up by some red and black berries, short finish.
fields.overall: A New World take on Cab Franc, big and ripe but retaining the raspberry and leafy characteristics of the grape. Not perfect, to me it's not balanced, lacks acidity and length but otherwise a decent midweek wine at a fair price.

fields.name: Les Lys Vouvray Sec
fields.colour: Clear and bright, pale lemon yellow.
fields.aroma: Rich, initially there's yeast, butter and a stony minerality followed by lemon curd, orange blossom/squash, pear and stewed apple.
fields.taste: Dry, softly acidic, ample body adding a little weight. More citrus, pear and marzipan on the palate with a tingle on the finish, both a bit short and fleeting.
fields.overall: I enjoyed this, especially the nose, ripe and secondary. IMO it lacks acidity and length but not very noticeable. Ripe, nicely balanced, not a complex wine but worth the money and merits a try.

fields.name: Little Farm Mulberry Tree Vineyard Similkameen Valley Riesling
fields.colour: Radiant golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Powerful, kerosene, beeswax and very floral underpinned by pear, lime, apple, a wet stone minerality and a spiciness like ginger.
fields.taste: Dry, light-med bodied with racy acidity yet quite smooth. The palate reflects the nose (orange, kerosene) with a drying texture. Saline, spicy enduring finish.
fields.overall: That petrol influence is overpowering at first but this settles down and evolves into a very juicy, fresh, moreish wine. Seems a little out of balance, however; it is easy-drinking but not sure it's worth the money.

fields.name: Full Moon Victoria Shiraz Zweigelt
fields.colour: Bright clear cherry, paler than I was expecting.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, lots of pepper, cherry, stewed black fruits (blackcurrant, plum, black olives), dried green herbs, leather, tobacco and chocolate.
fields.taste: Med+ body, tart firm acidity, very discreet tannin adding some balance. The palate echoes the nose with loads of mouth-filling pepper to finish.
fields.overall: What value, a delicious piquant wine. The lighter Zweigelt really seems to influence the Shiraz, resulting in a fresh lighter than usual Aussie red. A great midweeker, straightforward, tasty wine, recommend.

fields.name: Château La Favière Bordeaux Supérieur
fields.colour: Attractive black cherry fading to smokey red.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, more tertiary than fruity, sage, tobacco leaf, menthol and vanilla underpinned by plum and red/black bramble berries.
fields.taste: Med+ body, juicy fresh acidity with fine well-integrated tannin. More smoke, cedar and sweet liquorice on the palate with a slight drying texture. Smooth chocolatey finish.
fields.overall: An elegant wine might describe this best. Powerful but in a quiet understated way. Everything in balance with a wonderful touch of oak, very evident but not overdone. Highly recommend for any Bordeaux fans.

fields.name: Royal Tokaji Dry Furmint Special Reserve
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Pronounced, strong fungi (in a good way), wet wool, candle wax, oil, lanolin and sourdough with underlying melon, citrus and bruised apple.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, soft/flat acidity. The palate is like the nose, strong and secondary. Resonant finish to match.
fields.overall: Comes across as judiciously oaked which is not a bad thing but this IMO lacks acidity and is somewhat heavy. Not a disaster but disappointing, better out there in this price range.

fields.name: La Font del Bosc
fields.colour: Dark amber with a cherry rim.
fields.aroma: Ripe and sweet yet fresh, cherry, raspberry, rich Christmas cake, marzipan, savoury dried fruits (raisins, figs, prunes), vanilla and clove with a touch of leather and cedar.
fields.taste: Ample and rich, juicy acidity, mellow fine tannin. Lots of heat/tingle across the mid-palate from the alcohol, moderately sweet, spicy warming finish.
fields.overall: Bargain, delicious moreish Vin Doux Naturel. Not as dark or heavy as I was expecting, it retains a freshness throughout. Perhaps lacking body and the alcohol is a bit intrusive on palate and finish but not too much so. Well worth a try.

fields.name: Definition Prosecco Brut
fields.colour: Bright pale yellow with a silver tinge. Fine bubbles but they fade quickly.
fields.aroma: Expressive and fresh, peach, peach, peach!!! with apple, honeysuckle, fruit salad and pineapple.
