fields.taste: Dry, light and crisp, vibrant acidity, nice smooth creamy palate. Flavour echoes the nose, dominated by Turkish Delight with a good sustained finish.
fields.overall: Really good, generally find Prosecco to be very bland but this was a surprise. Nothing complex, the nose and palate are mostly all tasty ripe peach but very moreish and easy-drinking. Well worth a try.

fields.name: Belleruche Côtes-du-Rhône
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, all ripe fruit and spice upfront, cherry, raspberry, plum, rhubarb, black tea and clove with lesser earthy notes of leather, tobacco leaf and roasted meat.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, juicy and fresh across the palate. The chalky tannin and firm acidity provide structure. All subtle red fruit flavours and finish.
fields.overall: A nice wine but just lacks intensity IMO. I would prefer everything ramped up a little i.e. more tannin and weight. Carries the high alcohol well and the acidity makes this very easy-drinking. A fair price, worth a try.

fields.name: Koyle El Peuco Alto Colchagua Tempranillo-Mourvèdre
fields.colour: Rich dark cherry fading to red. No sign of age.
fields.aroma: Lots of oak at first, cedar, dried leaves/herbs, potpourri, sweet vanilla and woodsmoke with a touch of black fruits and coconut coming through at the end.
fields.taste: Med+ body, the mellow well-integrated tannin adds some texture which helps to balance the abundant acidity. The palate is again oak dominated but has a lovely sweet spice finish.
fields.overall: Not a powerful wine by any means, has a bit of everything but it is all subdued and low-key. Not a bad thing as this is very easy-drinking and quite moreish. More oak than fruit so may not suit everyone but good for the price and would recommend.

fields.name: Bleasdale ‘The Wise One’ Grand Tawny
fields.colour: Viscous, dark amber fading to a rusty rim.
fields.aroma: Heady and hot, baking spices, raisins, marzipan, toffee apple, caramel, butterscotch, milk chocolate and vanilla with a nice saline element adding lift.
fields.taste: Full, sharp biting acidity. The palate reflects the nose, all oak/tertiary flavours with a fiery hot reverberating finish. When the burn disappears it is quite smooth.
fields.overall: This would be a delight only for the high alcohol that overpowers the nose, palate and finish. At the price this is very good and punches above it weight but be prepared, it has a WHACK!!

fields.name: Strofilia White Dot
fields.colour: Very pale, almost water white.
fields.aroma: Average, crunchy orchard fruits (peach, apple), lemon, grapefruit, melon, grass and a perfumed floral note.
fields.taste: Bone dry, slender, sour acidic attack at first, followed by a mild lychee and peach flavour but there's a bitter bite to the finish.
fields.overall: This is just OK, perfectly drinkable, nose is the highlight but just nothing to get excited about. Angular may describe it best, simple, subtle and sadly forgettable. Can't recommend, much better available in this price range.

fields.name: Ellercombe English Sparkling NV
fields.colour: Pale golden yellow with lively fine persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, baked apple, bread dough, cream, digestive biscuit, lemon, grapefruit and just a hint of mushroom and wet gravel.
fields.taste: Dry, med- body, zippy acidity and lots more baked apple and brioche on the palate. Despite the acidity there's some weight adding a creaminess to the palate and sustained finish.
fields.overall: Wholly enjoyed this, lovely autolytic notes all-round with a lemony acidity to balance. Nose and finish stand out for me, Champagne like but without the price tag, recommend.

fields.name: Cune (CVNE) Reserva
fields.winery: Compañía Vinícola del Norte de España (CVNE)
fields.colour: Medium ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Big spicy nose, black pepper, dense black fruit, plum, blackberry jam, sour cherry, dried flowers, smoke and an underlying barnyard note.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, dry and fresh with soft tannin. A sweetish tingling mid-palate sensation with flavours of cherry, blueberry and figs. Good savoury balsamic finish.
fields.overall: Very good, smooth, fruity with just a touch of oak. The ripe fruit is lifted by the acidity so not heavy or cloying. Worth the money, a good midweek wine, recommend.

fields.name: McLaren Vale Limited Release Cabernet - Shiraz
fields.winery: Imported and bottled by Direct Wines Limited
fields.colour: Viscous, inky dark cherry with a smokey red rim.
fields.aroma: Warm, fruity and spicy, blackcurrant jam, plum sauce, black olives, sweet cherry or raspberry, leather, cured meat, sweet tobacco and vanilla.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, rich, bold and succulent on the palate, almost sweet. Chocolate, raspberry, liquorice to taste, very mild silky tannin and enough acidity to help balance the weight. Good finish.
fields.overall: Not for the faint-hearted, this is a beast.  Lovely colour and everything about this wine is generous and opulent. More fruit forward but the influence of oak is evident and it carries the high alcohol well. Recommend but watch that abv.

fields.name: Lenton Brae Chardonnay Campanology
fields.colour: Bright clear pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Open, both fruit and oak, lemon, peach, melon and pineapple with secondary butter, mushrooms and a touch of salinity.
fields.taste: Med- body, dry, texture has grip but the finish is smooth and enduring with a nice bite of acidity. Delicious palate of honeysuckle, lemon curd and vanilla.
fields.overall: Lovely Chardonnay, not a big as you might expect from MR but good weight, depth of flavour and a streak of acidity to balance. Inviting and at its peak at 3 years. Both fruit and oak shine through, great price, highly recommend.

fields.name: Vieilles Vignes Domaine du Cros
fields.colour: Dense ruby fading to a cherry red rim.
fields.aroma: Expressive, sour cherry, blackberries, cranberries, figs, violets, tobacco and a good waft of spice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, piquant acidity, very fine silky tannin that flows into a good long bitter finish. Sour cherry and dark rustic brambly fruits on the palate, very appetising.
fields.overall: This wine is just so supple and inviting. Nothing big, just a good balance of mellow fruit, oak, tannin and juicy acidity. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Chapel Hill The Prophet Shiraz
fields.colour: Rich intense dark inky red.
fields.aroma: Funky and pungent, barnyard, leather, blueberry, plum, bacon fat and sweet nose tingling spice.
fields.taste: The full-body is lifted by the med+ acidity and very soft tannin. Palate is yielding with typical Shiraz chocolate, red fruit and liquorice flavours. Nice warming long finish.
fields.overall: Very different from an average Shiraz and all the better for it. A big wine but not at all heavy, quite easy-drinking. A great nose, good depth and length, well-balanced. Probably best Aussie Shiraz I have had.

fields.name: Roussette du Bugey Montagnieu Altesse Domaine Peillot
fields.colour: Clean sustained golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Developed, fruity and floral; peach, honey, buttered toast, baked apple, blossom, pineapple and lime with a nice ginger spicy tingle.
fields.taste: Med+ body, vibrant acidity, fleshy textured palate with generous flavours that reflect the nose and a brilliant long resonant finish.
fields.overall: This is great, depth, length, complexity, just delicious. No oak used but a little ageing has developed this into a mouth-filling, rich wine. Very good QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: Erta e China Rosso
fields.colour: As black as night.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, black fruit (blueberry, blackberry, damson), cherry, tomato leaf, leather, balsamic, smoke and loads of black pepper.
fields.taste: Med bodied, robust tannin overridden by the sharp acidity, not unpleasant but tangy. The palate consists of cherry, liquorice and coffee that lasts into a good long finish.
fields.overall: Wasn't expecting so much, big all round, tannin and acidity are a bit intrusive but settle down with time. An appetising wine probably best with food. Worth a punt at the price.

fields.name: Château Lyonnat classic cuvée
fields.colour: Dull dense medium garnet with a brick red rim.
fields.aroma: Evolved, secondary and tertiary; earthy, potting soil, mushroom, cedar, bay leaf and vanilla with an underlying layer of black fruit.
fields.taste: Medium bodied, mellow integrated tannin, surprisingly brisk acidity. Palate is all mocha, tobacco and flat cola that continues into a good length finish.
fields.overall: A wine at the end of its drinking window. Mature and has lost a lot of its fruit, not a bad thing but will not suit everyone. A well made balanced Bordeaux, personally I have had better but it justifies the price, drink up.

fields.name: Fondo Filara Etna Bianco
fields.colour: Luminous topaz yellow.
fields.aroma: Open, long and concentrated, honey, something nutty, buttered toast and ripe banana with lemon, grapefruit, mint, peach and a stony minerality.
fields.taste: Med+ body, refreshing acidity, polished mouth-filling citrus, honey and spice flavours with a good nose tingling finish.
fields.overall: This is really good, only 2 years old but smells and tastes mature, from the lees ageing I guess. Ripe and rich but the acidity brings it to life. A lot of complexity for the price, hard to put down, highly recommend.

fields.name: Dr. Hermann Erdener Treppchen Kabinett Riesling
fields.colour: Pale golden yellow with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Expressive, petrol and a stony minerality upfront, honey, ginger, fresh green apples and tropical (pineapple, mango) with a little spice.
fields.taste: Light, somewhere between off-dry and sweet, surprising tender acidity. A soft palate packed with flavours of peach and apricot that echo into the long finish.
fields.overall: Expected a more acidic sharp wine but this is just a delight. So balanced, there's a sweetness that is held in check by just enough acidity, an ethereal mouth-feel and length. Great QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: Beronia Rioja Reserva
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a terracotta rim.
fields.aroma: Profound and strong, farmyard, cedar, vanilla, smoke, tobacco, dried green herbs, cherry, black fruit (blackberries, plum, figs) and roasted tomatoes.
fields.taste: Ample body, tannin is discreet but consistent and velvety, med+ acidity. A spicy mid-palate with sweet vanilla, plum, cherry and chocolate flavours. Med length finish.
fields.overall: I could wax lyrical about the nose of this wine, it just jumped out of the bottle, very complex. A well-covered wine, sweet oak, fruit and nice integrated tannin. 7 years old, drinking well but no rush, recommend.

fields.name: Blind Spot King Valley Garganega
fields.colour: Clean, very pale straw with a silver tinge.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and ripe, lemon, melon, apple, orange rind, pineapple, peach, a touch of hay and a fresh briny sharpness.
fields.taste: Med-light bodied, dry, juicy cutting acidity. Palate not as prominent as, but reminiscent of the nose, pure and ripe fruit that ends with a good drying saline finish.
fields.overall: Not bad, the nose is very good and I like how the saline element adds a freshness and lift to the ripe fruit. Not complex but appealing and appetising. A good midweeker at a good price, worth a try.

fields.name: Tikveš Classsic Vranec - Merlot
fields.colour: Deep intense ruby.
fields.aroma: Average, sour cherry, raspberry, blackberries, blackcurrants and plum with just a hint of spice but there is a sharpness like a hygienic cleaner or strong green pepper.
fields.taste: Med+ body, pointed sour acidity, meagre tannin adds a stringy texture. Palate is rich, sour cherry and savoury red berries, med finish.
fields.overall: Not for me, sharp, sour, no balance. Just comes across as a wine that is industrial and not well-made. So much better available even at this price, can't recommend.

fields.name: Momo Vendimia Seleccionada Ribera del Duero
fields.colour: Deep garnet with a red rim, great intensity.
fields.aroma: Strong alcohol upfront, tobacco, cocoa powder, coconut, chocolate, dark fruit (plum, blackberries), roasted tomatoes and perfumed dried flowers.
fields.taste: Dry, med acidity, tannin is silky, like it has melted into the wine. Good mid-palate of cherry, smoke and treacle. Lasting fragrant finish.
fields.overall:
Well this is different, don't know if I love it or hate it. Starts out badly (even after a long decant) , the nose is odd to say the least. However, it shines through on the palate, so smooth and tasty. I can only say try this for yourself.

Edit: Developed beautifully after a couple of days. The now jammy fruits have melded into the savoury oak and adding this to the already mentioned wonderful smooth tannin makes this a wonderful glassful.

fields.name: Cantarutti Pinot Grigio
fields.colour: Clean, bright pale lemon with an unusual orange hue.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and ripe, lime, melon, grapefruit, peach, orange blossom, tropical fruit squash with just a touch of minerality.
fields.taste: Med-bodied and smooth but the acidity is disappointingly flabby. The palate has lots of orange and bruised apple and whilst dry there's a sweet element to the decent finish.
fields.overall: Has a lot going for it but needs lift, it's like the grapes were overripe, not enough acidity and too much RS. Good at the price but not memorable and can't recommend.

fields.name: Tomáš Čačík Svatovavřinecké
fields.colour: Deep intense black cherry.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and packed with fruit (cherry, raspberry, blackberry, damson), violets, loads of vanilla spice and a savoury undertone of cured smoked meat.
fields.taste: Med- body, abundant sour acidity, polished tannin, satin smooth. Palate echoes the nose with a spiced cherry sustained finish.
fields.overall: This is just lovely, looks big but is light, fruity and sour with a little oak and has good depth of flavour. Good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Heinrich Spindler Forster Riesling
fields.colour: Clear, lustrous, pale straw yellow with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Crikey, petrol, petrol, petrol, green apple, lime, beeswax, basil, gun smoke and a crisp slaty minerality.
fields.taste: Med- body, firm green acidity, taut and dry on the palate. Long finish of apple, lime and more petrol.
fields.overall:
Overwhelming at first, a rush of petroleum, but this calms down as the wine opens up. Crisp, juicy and easy-drinking but lacks depth IMO, that petroleum is just to dominant overall. OK at the price but not a re-buy.
Edit: Benefitted from a few days in the fridge. This allowed the fruit to shine through and kill off the petrol aroma. This wine should probably not be drank so young, lots of ageing potential

fields.name: Xanadu Fusion Chardonnay
fields.colour: Radiant pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Average, unripe fruit, melon, green apple and pear with a fresh minerality and a mild mushroom, curd and butter undertone.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, zippy acidity, supple mid-palate of crunchy orchard fruits with a crisp, focused taut finish.
fields.overall: A combination of sharpness on both nose and palate that's paired with a lovely touch of oak. Not a complex wine and lacks depth and length IMO but  a good solid midweeker. Worth the price(?), but certainly worth a try.

fields.name: Brezza del Drago Spumante Rosato NV
fields.winery: RAM - Fossalta di Piave (winemaker Marco Flacco)
fields.colour: Lightly effervescent, fine bubbles, pale pink/watermelon.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, fresh, all red fruit, raspberry, strawberry, rhubarb and melon with a nice touch of rose petal and green tea.
fields.taste: Light, dry across the palate with an appley, rhubarb and citrus taste. Packed full of acidity, very good sustained finish.
fields.overall: No surprises here but this is a thoroughly satisfying wine, light, easy-going and moreish. Better than many Prosecco's I have had in this price range. If want a simple no-brainer this is it.

fields.name: Don Mendo Gran Reserva Tinto
fields.colour: Deep garnet fading to pale ruby.
fields.aroma: Warm, mix of fruit and oak, strawberry sauce, plum, cherry, chocolate, tobacco, smoke, sweet vanilla and dried flowers.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, piquant acidity, very discreet almost unperceivable tannin, dry but the palate is rich with flavours of cherry, coconut and vanilla. Good peppery almost hot finish.
fields.overall: This is amazingly mellow and well-blended. Everything about this wine stands out but nothing shouts out loud. A rich smooth autumnal wine. Great QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: Bambera de Barbadillo Blanco
fields.region: Andalucía, Vino de la Tierra de Cádiz
fields.colour: Bright, clear golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Pungent, salty and citrusy, wet stone, jasmine, honey, lanolin with an  undertone of bruised apple, jackfruit and pear.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, acidity is too soft making for a heavy palate. Like the nose there is a saline flavour but with an oddly bitter finish.
fields.overall: Not for me, IMO it's all over the place, no balance. Overripe fruit without the vital acidity for freshness. Nose is strong but like the palate is not all that pleasant. Not a re-buy, can't recommend.

fields.name: Sumarroca Cava Brut Nature Gran Reserva
fields.colour: Lustrous golden yellow with fine persistent bubbles.
fields.aroma: An attack that is tangy and sharp at first, green apple, pear, lemon, quince, a sea air minerality but settles down to reveal buttered toast and sourdough yeast.
fields.taste: Bone dry, med-light body, fresh, juicy vigorous acidity with a lean taut texture. Apple, apricot, citrus palate ending with a medium mouth-drying finish.
fields.overall: Not as big as I was expecting from a wine that spent time on it's lees but nevertheless this is a really nice Cava. Appealing and moreish, good balance and refreshing. Great QPR, recommend.

fields.name: The Society's Exhibition Haut-Medoc
fields.colour: Deep garnet fading to a red/orange rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, lots of warm black fruit (blackcurrant, blueberries and roasted plum). A good swirl reveals an earthy, mushroom, forest floor aroma with leather, tobacco and a spicy menthol note.
fields.taste: Med-bodied with silky integrated tannin. Full dark fruit, oak and tertiary flavours (mocha, chocolate) that meld together very well. Good enduring smoky finish.
fields.overall: This is great, generous, balanced, smooth and IMO at its peak at 6 years. Worth the money and more, highly recommend.

fields.name: Mitravelas White on Grey Moschofiler
fields.colour: Clear, almost transparent watery straw yellow with a silver tone.
fields.aroma: Expressive ripe fruit, stone fruits (peach, apricot), apple, melon, grapefruit and a floral blossom of some kind.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, ripe on the palate but with a vital streak of juicy acidity. The palate is quite citrusy with apple and a touch of salinity adding a little bite to the finish.
fields.overall: For the money this punches well above its weight. Nothing complex but the balance is good, a tasty, appealing wine. Can only recommend.

fields.name: Bóhorquez Reserva
fields.colour: Just showing its age, deep garnet with a mahogany rim.
fields.aroma: Initially a touch of farmyard, tertiary, sweaty saddle, tobacco, graphite, vanilla and spicy cured meat but with an obvious cherry, plum and dried herbs note.
fields.taste: Med+ bodied, rich but the acidity and matt tannin add an oh so velvety smooth texture. The lush palate echoes the nose ending with a spicy mouth-coating finish.
fields.overall: Elegance personified, this is magic, mature, mellow, smooth, a luscious mouthful. Probably won't get any better after 11 years, highly recommend.

fields.name: Barbera d'Alba Nadia Curto
fields.colour: Clear sustained medium ruby with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Lots of red fruits, strawberry, raspberry, sour cherry and tomato with a little spice and green herbs.
fields.taste: Day one: Dry, tart piquant acidity, moderate tannin adding a nice gripping texture. Palate is all cherry and liquorice that lasts into a long finish. Day 5: Evolved to a ripe jammy fruited wine, the sharpness has gone and melted into the tannin, just delicious.
fields.overall: Beaujolais Nouveau like, young, fruity, nothing spectacular, an appetising wine, probably best with food. The long finish stands out, good for the price, a midweek wine. Worth a try.

fields.name: Curatola Arini Marsala Secco
fields.colour: Viscous, deep amber with an attractive orange rim.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, stewed apricot/plum, fruitcake, caramel, walnut, brown sugar and orange zest with a nose tingling sharp saline tone.
fields.taste: Good medium weight dry gummy texture, hot but not overwhelming. Palate is like a melange of orange, brown sugar and dried fruit (raw fruitcake mix if you like). Good sustained finish.
fields.overall: Little experience of Marsala so no complaints but this is missing something. Good nose, appealing palate, but... .  I think it is the lack of sweetness and tacky texture that lets it down. Not for me, maybe Marsala Fine is just meant for cooking.

fields.name: Beaujolais Nouveau Project Artist
fields.colour: Light ruby with a purple/blue rim.
fields.aroma: Very typical, all sweet ripe fruit, raspberry, cherry, rhubarb, banana, bubblegum and a nuanced dandelion/hibiscus note.
fields.taste: Light, fresh, juicy acidity, virtually no tannin so texture is weak. Palate reflects the nose but there is a nice surprising spiciness to the good finish.
fields.overall: Fun in a bottle, sweetish simple easy-drinking that takes no thinking. A real crowd-pleaser, just take it for what it is, recommend.

fields.name: Pigassou Blanc
fields.winery: Winemaker Sylvain Delabre, Bottled by Cellier Lauran Cabaret
fields.colour: Luminous pale gold with a silver streak.
fields.aroma: Ripe but subtle; honey, orange, grapefruit, quince, yellow plum, dry toast and something very floral but not sweet.
fields.taste: Med+ body, softly acidic, fleshy, ample texture. Ripe stone fruit, honey and grilled pineapple palate with a surprising tangy finish.
fields.overall: Quite a full broad wine, lots of everything except the nose. Body, heavy ripe flavours and some length. Just not for me, nose is too discreet and lacks acidity. Decent for the money, maybe better with food. Served well-chilled.

fields.name: Château Trillol Rouge
fields.colour: Deep dark ruby fading to a pink rim.
fields.aroma: Strong farmyard, lots of spice, leather, bacon fat, band aid (in a good way), dried herbs (lavender, rosemary), damp forest floor and dark bramble fruits.
fields.taste: Med+ body, rich and dense, the ripe fruit (cherry, blueberries, raspberries) and chocolate adds a sweet touch. Long warming spiced finish with loads of acidity to balance.
fields.overall: This is great, punches well above it weight. An attack on the senses that just delights. Sometimes cheap and cheerful just hits the spot. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Antakari Syrah
fields.colour: Med intensity, black cherry with a pink rim.
fields.aroma: Profound and frank, barnyard, smoke, leather, bacon fat and sage underpinned by burnt roasted fruits (plum, cherry, blueberries).
fields.taste: Med-bodied, juicy acidity with a soft tannic touch, quite pleasant. Palate is more smoky tar and some fruit but less severe than the nose with a lasting finish to match.
fields.overall:
Nope, secondary aromas are just too much, no balance. All nose which is a little unpleasant that persists into the taste and finish. Perhaps a longer decant would help, otherwise avoid.

Edit: Gave this 5 days in the fridge and what a difference it made. The strong barnyard has blown off and the fruit has become more ripe and rich. Still only average but shows patience does pay-off.

fields.name: De Bortoli Deen Vat Series All Rounder Sémillon
fields.colour: Fabulous bright amber with a gold tinge.
fields.aroma: Intense, smoke, oily, burning rubber, marmalade, dried fruit, honey, apricot, something tropical and a nice touch of musky botrytis.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich, just a touch sweet lifted by a lively orange zest spiciness across the mid-palate. Palate not as pronounce as the nose, lots of marmalade, kerosene and lanolin that echo on the strong finish.
fields.overall: I like this, certainly different, big on nose, flavour and length yet not heavy, a little unbalanced perhaps but it's a lot of wine at this price, certainly worth a try.

fields.name: Prosecco Brut I Duecento
fields.colour: Very pale, almost water white. Fine bubbles but they die quickly.
fields.aroma: Sharp and tangy, green apple, pear and melon with lesser honeysuckle and fruit cup.
fields.taste: Light, a little sweet, good depth of flavour that echo the nose. The zippy acidity brings balance ending with an exotic fruit finish.
fields.overall: So-so, run-of-the-mill Prosecco. I like the palate and finish but otherwise you get what you pay for. Much better available in the same price range. A party wine, can't recommend.

fields.name: Nelson Bay Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Clear, very pale ruby with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Savoury fruit, cranberry, black cherry, pomegranate and plum sauce, floral (rose or potpourri) underpinned by a nice mushroom, farmyard, musty unaired room note.
fields.taste: Light, brisk cutting acidity with a little tannin that adds some needed texture. Palate is a bit stunted and mellow, mainly cherry and red berries with a touch of spice on the med finish.
fields.overall: Hard to complain but just another OK Pinot Noir. Nice nose, but after that it fades away, too weak, acidity and oak are unbalanced, it's like the winemaker was in a rush. Not worth the price.

fields.name: Villa Antinori Rosso
fields.colour: Dense, almost opaque ruby fading to a garnet rim.
fields.aroma: Odd upfront (dirty nappy), heavy ripe fruit (plum, blackberry, redcurrants), tobacco, touch of spice, dried fruit (raisins, prunes) and tomato.
fields.taste: Med+ body, warming mouth-coating unctuous mellow tannin, rich but freshly acidic. Good depth of flavour with a cherry, spice fuelled finish.
fields.overall: This is just lovely right now. Complexity and the balance is spot-on. A big wine but not cloying, a wine to savour and ponder over. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Doelas Albarino
fields.region: Val do Salnés, Rías Baixas, Galicia
fields.colour: Deep straw almost gold with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Intense, ripe, lemon/quinine, grapefruit pith, tree fruits (apple, pear), mango, flint and a saline quality.
fields.taste: Dry, med-bodied, sharp biting acidity that doesn't overwhelm, balanced by the ripe punchy citrusy and tropical palate. Mouth-coating tingling long finish.
fields.overall: Another great example of one of my favourite grapes. More unctuous than I was expecting but that's not a bad thing. Good intensity and depth all-round. Great value, highly recommend.

fields.name: Alambrado Malbec - Tempranillo
fields.colour: Dark and inky fading to violet rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, plum, raspberry and bramble fruits mixing well with earthy espresso, cocoa powder and clay pot. A big dollop of spicy liquorice.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, discreet but evident tannin that marries well with the alcohol and juicy acidity. Rich and full-flavoured, lots of chocolate and red fruit jam that runs into good sustained finish.
fields.overall: A lovely blend, I think the Tempranillo tames the Malbec beautifully. Smooth but with a bite and zestiness. A fruity wine lovers delight. Good QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Seven Falls Wahluke Slope Washington Cabernet Sauvignon
fields.colour: Dark garnet with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Open, spiced fruit, heavy jammy blackberries, plum and blueberries, smoke, tobacco, leather, baking spices, coffee and cedar.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, rich, almost sweet, the crisp acidity and robust tannic backbone give a silky texture. Palate like the nose is more tertiary than fruity, good finish.
fields.overall: Sitting on the fence with this one. A strange sweetness paired with oak, nice but just a few rough edges. Nice but not a re-buy.

fields.name: Yellow Tail Bubbles Rosé
fields.colour: Light salmon/onion skin, a lively large bubbled effervescence that fades quickly.
fields.aroma: Fairly bland, red berries, grapefruit and ripe tree fruits (apple, plum).
fields.taste: Med-light bodied, abundant acidity but the heavy sugary makes it a bit cloying. Palate reflects the nose, all bruised ripe fruit with a touch of spice on the finish.
fields.overall: Well at least the colour is attractive, otherwise just a sugary imitation of a sparkling wine. With the good acidity and when served well-chilled this is drinkable... just. Avoid, have a glass of water.

fields.name: Co-operative Prosecco Special Cuvée Brut
fields.colour: Pale lemon with silver highlights. Good effervescence, med bubbles.
fields.aroma: Tangy green apple, pear, melon, herbal (honeysuckle, acacia) and something tropical.
fields.taste: Bone dry, rasping acidity, tangy on the palate but that does mellow a bit. Flavours echo the nose but more bitter and herbaceous, OK finish.
fields.overall: A little surprised, more than I was expecting for cheap off the shelf wine. Nothing complex but interesting, a good party wine.

fields.name: Sobon Estate Rocky Top Amador Zinfandel
fields.colour: Deep dark cherry fading to a bluish violet rim.
fields.aroma: Concentrated, smoke, leather, hickory, dill, rooibos tea, plum sauce, red and black berry preserves and lashings of black pepper.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, rich, bold fruit flavours that are overwhelmed by the coarsely tannic backbone that is drying my whole mouth. Nice acidity though and the finish is long even if it is a little hot.
fields.overall: Would like to try an older vintage as this is far too young. A big and opulent wine that needs time to mellow. It will give a lot of pleasure but be patient.

fields.name: Cuvée Prestige Gewürztraminer Bollenberg
fields.colour: Bright golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Very aromatic and rich, lychee, rose, peach, honey, candied ginger, mango and exotic spices.
fields.taste: Med-full bodied, dry but a little RS adds a sweet touch, softly acidic. Slight nose-tingling complete finish that follows a Turkish Delight and orange palate.
fields.overall: This is nice wine, not my favourite style but seems well-made and balanced. Opulent and concentrated with a big nose, strong palate and length. Very good value and well worth a try.

fields.name: Morandé Reserva One to One
fields.colour: Pale almost watery cherry red with a pink rim.
fields.aroma: Upfront this has a very distinctive farmyard, compost note. This settles revealing lots of red fruit, strawberry, rhubarb, roasted tomatoes, peppercorns and orange.
fields.taste: Light, virtually no tannin, med acidity. Feels flat and hollow on the palate with a hint of red fruit flavours at best and the finish non-existent.
fields.overall: This is poor, strange nose, no weight, palate or length, a weak gaunt wannabe Beaujolais that should be avoided.

fields.name: Chapelle de Potensac
fields.colour: Sustained deep crimson, no sign of ageing.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, herbal (Bay leaf, sage), violets, tobacco, cedar, leather, ripe plum, cassis and blackberries.
fields.taste: Full-med bodied, well-built sweet tannic structure adding grip to the soft plush fruity and herbal palate. My only criticism is the acidic all-too-brief finish.
fields.overall: This is very good, ready for drinking now but no rush. A lot going on but in an elegant discreet way, all elements are well-integrated and subtle. Great QPR, highly recommend.

fields.name: Peter Lehmann Margaret Barossa Semillon
fields.colour: Clean, bright gold with a green tinge.
fields.aroma: Profound, secondary at first, beeswax, oily, wet wool, lanolin and honey with fig, apricot, peach, citrus (orange, lime curd, grapefruit) and a briny note.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, rich and structured, sinewy texture. A bitter nutty, buttered palate with a long finish lifted by the zesty acidity.
fields.overall: This is a complex aged wine with lots of life left in it. Nose is outstanding, weight and palate are not as strong but a wine of substance, balanced and appealing. Hits all the senses, lovely and would recommend.

fields.name: La Canoa Palo Cortado Sherry
fields.colour: Dark amber but radiant and opalescent.
fields.aroma: Powerful, tangy, fruit cake, varnish, walnuts, caramel, molasses, treacle, saline, preserved lemon, orange zest and fennel.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, zingy acidity, texture is smooth but has a little drying grip. The palate is hot and spicy and like the nose is wood-driven. A mouth-coating and warming sustained finish.
fields.overall: This is quite good, my biggest complaints are the alcohol dominates and there's a heavy wood influence, so no balance. Volume, nose and length are pluses but have had better at the price, for me not a re-buy.

fields.name: Le Clos du Château l’Oiselinière de la Ramée
fields.colour: Radiant and clean, pale golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Good intensity, a fresh saline quality, unripe fruit, green apple, pineapple, lemon, orange blossom and a lovely lager/yeast note
fields.taste: Bone-dry, light in body, sharp acidity that almost overwhelms the creamy albeit chewy texture. More apple, pear and citrus on the palate with a tingling mouth drying finish.
fields.overall: This is great, biting acidity, juicy and fresh. The lees ageing is evident but not as heavy as I was expecting, not complaining though. If you like this style and good value this is a must.

fields.name: Öküzgözü-Boğazkere, Vinkara
fields.colour: Dark cherry red fading to a purple edge.
fields.aroma: Meaty, earthy at first, mushroom, leather and farmyard that leads into sour raspberry, plum, blackberry and a spicy/herbal note.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, the soft acidity and discreet tannin give a a mellow texture. Palate is like the nose, sour red fruit nicely underpinned by the earthiness but the length is very disappointing.
fields.overall: I really like this, very Pinot Noir like, a savoury fruity mix. Nice nose and palate, nothing heavy, just an easy-drinking appealing wine at a great price. Recommend.

fields.name: Nebbiolo d'Alba Vigna Valmaggiore
fields.colour: Translucent cherry red with a brick orange rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, cherry syrup, strawberry, cranberry and prune with lesser notes of cured meat, flat cola/vanilla and something floral.
fields.taste: Dry, briskly acidic, firm tannic structure adding a drying gummy texture. The palate is very subtle, all red fruits/berries. A little spice on the mediocre finish.
fields.overall: This is so understated, wasn't expecting this at all. A weak Nebbiolo with none of the typical characteristics. If it wasn't for the tannin and acidity holding it together this would be a flop. Can't recommend.

fields.name: Villard Le Chardonnay Grand Vin
fields.colour: Rich, golden yellow with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Strong, mature and ripe, butter, mushroom, soggy pie crust, lemon, apple, stone fruits (peach, apricots), pineapple and something nutty.
fields.taste: Med+ body, softly acidic, mellow on the palate but with a wonderful mouth-coating spiced nut expression. A very good toffee, earthy finish.
fields.overall: This is a full-on wine, big nose, concentrated palate and lasting finish. Oak is very evident but blended in well. Easily the best Chilean wine I have had, great QPR, recommend.

fields.name: Spatburgunder Markgraflerland Martin Wassmer
fields.colour: Smoky pale ruby with a pink rim.
fields.aroma: A funky compost upfront which blows away given a little time. Sour cherry, cranberries and raspberries with mushroom, potting soil, game and smoked paprika.
fields.taste: Med- body, piquant acidity, delightful chalky chewy tannin. More sour red fruits/berries on the palate with a good peppery finish.
fields.overall: Love it, finally a PN I like. Nose, texture, flavour and length, everything you want and in good measures. Not a powerful wine but juicy, mouth-watering and easy-drinking. Highly recommend at the price.

fields.name: Surani Costarossa Primitivo di Manduria
fields.colour: Deep almost opaque inky red.
fields.aroma: Average, musty, ash, dry tobacco, savoury red fruit (redcurrant, cranberries, plum), hoisin, prune, raisin and something meaty.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, very fine velvety tannin, abundant acidity. Palate like the nose is savoury red fruit with a baking spice that ends with a nice slightly drying finish.
fields.overall: Good, not a smash hit but a worthy wine. A bit of everything and all well balanced, testament to the winemaker. Oaked but not very evident. Fairly priced and well worth a try.

fields.name: Le Ralle Greco Basilicata
fields.winery: Alovini Società Agricola a r. l.
fields.colour: Bright sustained orange gold.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and ripe, tree fruits (pear, peach, apricot), lime, tropical squash, orange blossom, a tingling stone/saline tone and a little honey.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, good full flavours of citrus and concentrated fruit squash . The average acidity adds just enough lift to the rounded palate ending with a sustained fragrant finish.
fields.overall: Fully developed, overripe but wholly enjoyable. Packed full of aroma and flavour. Great QPR, needs drinking sooner as it seems to lack acidity and freshness but all-in-all worth a try.

fields.name: Le XV du Président Réserve
fields.colour: Deep inky red with purple rim.
fields.aroma: Rich and concentrated, stewed raspberry, strawberries, liquorice, plum, lavender and a little vanilla with a peppery smokiness.
fields.taste: Full and viscous, so opulent it is almost sweet. Moderate ripe lacy tannin with a juicy red fruit palate, moderate finish.
fields.overall: A big bold wine that carries its high alcohol well. Very fruity but the acidity, tannin and slight savoury undertow add balance. Not complex, just an easy-drinking appealing wine that has a kick. Good QPR.

fields.name: Kuhlmann-Platz Cuvée Prestige Pinot Gris
fields.colour: Bright translucent pale gold.
fields.aroma: Rich and very fruit forward, lemon, melon, pineapple, kiwi, peach, honey, floral, quinine with a touch of minerality.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, med green tangy acidity, a contrasting lithe palate of sharp lemon and ripe bruised apple. Good zesty finish.
fields.overall: Lighter than I was expecting, the acidity makes this refreshing and easy-drinking. Good nose and length of flavour. No complaints at this price point. Not a complex wine to mull over, a good midweeker, recommend.

fields.name: Zuccardi Apelación La Consulta
fields.colour: Intense medium ruby with a red rim.
fields.aroma: Mature farmyard upfront, deep dark brooding black fruit (blackcurrant, plum, black cherry) with vanilla and baking spices all wrapped in a veil of smoke and leather.
fields.taste: Med+ bodied, dry, mellow tannin giving a creamy smooth texture. Savoury/umami almost chewy on the palate yet not heavy. Consistent finish.
fields.overall: Highlights of this wine are the nose and texture. IMO drinking perfectly after 5 years but will continue to improve. Decanted for two hours. Highly recommend.

fields.name: Lafazanis Geometria Malagouzia
fields.colour: Vivid bright topaz with green highlights.
fields.aroma: Good-intensity, rich and ripe, lemon, grapefruit, tropical fruits, honey, cream,  wet stone and a vegetal note like grass/compost.
fields.taste: Med+ body, vital acidity adding lift and bite across the palate. Flavour like the nose is rich (honey drizzled citrus and tropical fruit). Good mouth-filling finish with enduring length.
fields.overall: Like this, would like it a little fresher as it is a bit heavy for my liking but maybe should be drank sooner. A lot going on for this price range, I would recommend.

fields.name: Vendanges d'Octobre, Coteau Saint Giraud
fields.colour: Shiny amber orange.
fields.aroma: Average, tangerine, peach, honeysuckle, apricot and a touch of Allspice.
fields.taste: Just off-sweet if that makes sense, light but the zesty acidity adds a juicy mouth-watering orange/citrus fuelled flavour with a decent finish.
fields.overall: Not a blockbuster by any means but fresh and juicy for sure, a bit one-dimensional (a lot of orange) but still very enjoyable. Worth a try.

fields.name: Schloss Gobelsburg Cuvée Bertrand
fields.colour: Dark med ruby fading to red.
fields.aroma: Powerful barnyard right off, smoke, mushroom, old leather, potpourri, cola and some underlying red fruit like raspberries, cranberries and sour cherries.
fields.taste: Light bodied, fresh juicy acidity, tannin is virtually unperceivable , no weight. More smoky red fruits on the palate, good fragrant finish.
fields.overall: Needs time to breath, barrel aged but oak only shows on the nose, weak to taste is my big fault but otherwise this is lovely, nose is amazing. If you like PN then this is for you.

fields.name: Anthony Road Pinot Gris
fields.colour: Bright, clean pale gold with a green hue.
fields.aroma: Concentrated and ripe, pineapple, bruised apple, stone fruits, melon, grapefruit, orange zest and something sweetly floral.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, filmy texture, the residual sugar makes this a touch sweet and adds an opulence to the tropical fruit, cream and pear palate but sacrifices acidity. Surprising sharp bitter twist on the finish.
fields.overall: Decent but comes across as manufactured, an overworked wine. It's easy-drinking albeit needs more lift. Over-priced IMO and not a re-buy.

fields.name: Château Picard Cru Bourgeois Saint-Estèphe
fields.colour: Intense deep garnet, no sign of age.
fields.aroma: Mellow and mature, smoke, tar, leather, dark red fruits (black cherry, prunes, raisins, roasted plums), oaky (black pepper, vanilla, incense).
fields.taste: Med-bodied, abundant almost biting acidity with a fine-grained tannin, structured. Earthy subdued savoury aged palate with a good sustained finish.
fields.overall: This is just a delight, right in its drinking window at 11 years. The high acidity adds backbone and lift to the overall earthiness. Bordeaux as I like it, highly recommend.

fields.name: Langhe Riesling Poderi Colla
fields.colour: Pale almost translucent core, pale straw with green/silver highlights.
fields.aroma: Good-intensity, leads off with smoke, kerosene, beeswax and a sweet floral note all backed by lime, grapefruit, pear, melon and a tangy salinity.
fields.taste: Med- body, briskly acidic and the smokey, citrusy palate is riper than the nose adding a richness. Long if somewhat odd mouth-drying finish.
fields.overall: A bit weightier than an average Riesling, probably due to the lees ageing which takes away from this wine IMO, just lacking freshness. Good for the price but not a re-buy for me.

fields.name: Zephyr Pinot Noir
fields.colour: Very pale transparent cherry red, almost pink at the rim.
fields.aroma: Fruity and spicy, sour cherries, plum, cranberries, pomegranate, blood orange, dried flowers and an earthy undertow of mushroom and potting soil.
fields.taste: Light, vigorous, fiery acidity, discreet but almost imperceptible tannin, body has no weight. Palate is more oak than fruit, vanilla and coconut with a spicy hot finish.
fields.overall: Another disappointing PN, all over the place, acidic but not enough tannin, palate is one-dimensional and that finish leaves a mark. Not worth the money, can't recommend.

fields.name: Wirra Wirra Church Block Cabernet Sauvignon - Shiraz - Merlot
fields.colour: Dense, inky dark cherry with a ruby rim.
fields.aroma: Powerful, stewed red and black fruits (redcurrants, plum, prune, berry jam), a herbal note of menthol and fennel but also an off-putting leafiness. Lots of spicy vanilla and sweet cedar.
fields.taste: Med-full body, fresh thanks to the abundant acidity, palate is more subtle than the nose, some cherry, vanilla but that's it. Very little tannin but there is a kick to the warm mouth-filling medium finish.
fields.overall: Was expecting something bigger and bolder. Nose is the highlight, but the rest (palate, acidity, tannin, finish) is not balanced. It's ok, needs a good decant, worth a try.

fields.name: Kutjevo Graševina
fields.colour: Deep golden yellow with an orange tinge.
fields.aroma: Concentrated, orange squash, pear syrup, baked sweet apples and rhubarb underpinned by more earthy kerosene and wet wool. Refreshing touch of minerality.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, zippy acidity balanced by a smooth palate. Rich robust flavours that reflect the nose and last into an echoing finish.
fields.overall: Nice surprise, big nose, palate and length. Almost opulent but with vital acidity for lift. A lot of wine for the price, recommend.

fields.name: A by Arras Premium Cuvée N.V.
fields.colour: Lively vibrant bubbles. Bright, pale gold with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Just jumped out of the bottle. Yeast, bread dough, digestive biscuit and mature cheese with lesser fruit notes of apple, apricot and some red fruit.
fields.taste: Very dry, med-bodied, med- acidity, smooth on the palate but finishes with a slight chewy texture. Smoky and nutty (hazelnuts) med mid-palate, sustained finish.
fields.overall: The ageing of this wine is very evident, all secondary and tertiary nose and palate. Fruit takes a back seat but that is not a bad thing, balanced, mature with some depth, no complaints, recommend.

fields.name: De Lucca Tannat Reserve
fields.colour: Dense and opaque, purple at the rim.
fields.aroma: Odd at first, wet mossy wood or burnt rubber. Also smoke, plum, savoury red fruits (cranberries, damson, redcurrants) and Indian spices.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, mouth-coating granular tannin, astringent but not imposing. The palate and finish are very muted with little to offer.
fields.overall: I did decant for 2 hours but maybe this is too young and just needs more time. Everything about this wine is a let down, that strange nose is hard to get past. Either avoid or give it more time.

fields.name: La Combe Pilate Collines Rhodaniennes Chapoutier
fields.colour: Bright and clear, golden yellow.
fields.aroma: Pronounced and ripe, orange, apricot, peach, mango and savoury nuts, butter and beeswax.
fields.taste: Strong bitter attack, overwhelming, masking any other flavours. Med+ body,  med acidity, rich and smooth across the palate, good finish.
fields.overall:
Like a wine that is past its best, lacking freshness and fruit, so no balance. The palate ruined it for me. Expected more from this winemaker, disappointed. Not for me, perhaps better with food.
I may have been too quick to judge, given a little time to open and develop this evolves into a wonderful tasty pleasant wine, last glass a treat.

fields.name: Moric Hausmarke Rot
fields.colour: Deep dark ruby red.
fields.aroma: Intense, barnyard, smoke, sour cherry, plum, raspberry, pepper, a green herbal note, earthy roasted tomato, tobacco leaf and vanilla.
fields.taste: Med- body, dry, moreish acidity and just a touch of fine smooth tannin to balance. More cherry, bitter red berries and herbs on the palate with a moderate finish.
fields.overall: I like this, light and easy-going, not a wine to ponder over. Juicy, fresh and appetising, it's more bitter than sweet but in a nice way. Worth the money, certainly recommend.

fields.name: Chakana Nuna Vineyard Organic Syrah
fields.colour: Viscous, very dark inky red with a purple rim.
fields.aroma: Med-intensity, nose tingling pepper to start, with dense black fruits (blackberry, plum, black olives), chocolate, leather, smoke, tobacco and raw meat.
fields.taste: Med+ body, med acidity, well-integrated silky tannin. Savoury cherry and dark chocolate on tasting but the alcohol is noticeable and this continues on the moderate spiked finish.
fields.overall: My only fault  is the high alcohol, not intrusive but takes away from what is otherwise a well-balanced wine that has a bit of everything in moderation. Great for the price, recommend.

fields.name: Mathilde Lafleur Chablis
fields.colour: Bright, pale straw with a silver edge.
fields.aroma: Expressive, ripe with a light mineral touch. Floral, think honeysuckle, lime, grapefruit, curd, mushroom, flint and butter.
fields.taste: Med-bodied, heavy ripe fruit on the palate (contrasting lush pineapple and bitter green herbs) saved by the ample acidity. Good length but the finish is sharp and tangy.
fields.overall: Not what I expect from a Chablis, too rich, there is lots of acidity but it's overwhelmed by the heavy fruit and bitter aftertaste. A lot better available in this price IMO. Can't recommend.

fields.name: RedHeads Dan'Jango
fields.colour: Black cherry fading to a lighter crimson.
fields.aroma: Strong, game, cured meat, leather, sage and a big hit of sweet spice with lesser savoury fruit notes of plum, dried fruit (raisins, sultanas) and black olives.
fields.taste: Full-bodied, only mildly tannic but works well with the juicy acidity. Palate is not as intense as the nose but has a nice smoky tar and black fruit mix. Hot tingling finish.
fields.overall: Big bold Aussie Shiraz that's well put together, high alcohol only noticeable on the finish. Nose is the highlight, fairly priced, certainly worth a try.
